hotel_name: Park Terrace Hotel on Bryant Park
review_body: We booked the Park Terrace for both its location and excellent reviews and it did not disappoint. We arrived just as NY restaurants and bars closing due to coronavirus. The staff were amazing, particularly Craig. They made sure we were well fed and extended they're breakfast for most of the day. Our check out was extended at no extra cost. Will definitely be back.

hotel_name: Park Terrace Hotel on Bryant Park
review_body: This hotel is so convenient to everything I love about New York. Walking distance to everything mid-town, Times Square, Central Park. Diamond district 5th Avenue shopping, all within minutes walks. The 6th floor bar, lounge was always accommodating and the staff was very friendly and helpful! Will go back

hotel_name: Park Terrace Hotel on Bryant Park
review_body: I can say that this hotel is the best place to stay in NYC. A spacious room, comfortable bed and complimentary breakfast for guests! I was so impressed by their complimentary fresh and high quality breakfast. Good location, very friendly staff, clean and well organized facilities. Nothing to complain. It was an absolute pleasure to stay here. The atmosphere did warm up and the staff were attentive from start to finish.

hotel_name: Park Terrace Hotel on Bryant Park
review_body: Excellent hotel. Fantastic location. The staff are an asset to this hotel. Always a friendly smile from all. Modern hotel. Complimentary upgrade for birthday celebration and yummy cupcakes on arrival, beautiful and lovely touch. Complimentary breakfast also a bonus. Breakfast presented well and great choice. I would not hesitate to recommend this hotel to others and it will be my 1st choice for future trips.

hotel_name: Park Terrace Hotel on Bryant Park
review_body: We stayed for five days and couldn’t fault a thing! The service from the staff towards us was brilliant and made us feel at home! Everyone from reception , concierge to the restaurant were great! Thank you for making our trip to New York that much better ! Will definitely return !

hotel_name: Park Terrace Hotel on Bryant Park
review_body: I was in a delux room but it is small! 2 Luggage is to much for the room.. nice simple design hotel good for a short trip, but if you are kind of person spend time in room than I dont think it is a right hotel! break feast room had not a enough sitting area while I was there and food was limited.. hanging facilities etc just not convenient in the room ... Not a bad hotel but just need to be aware of these to avoid disappointment.. who ever took the room photos I think he was a very good photographer :-)

hotel_name: Park Terrace Hotel on Bryant Park
review_body: Fantastic stay. Everyone was so nice and friendly. Service was top notch. Amenities were awesome - beds and pillows great, quiet rooms - could not hear any street traffic, breakfast was amazing, fresh and delicious. The outdoor terrace was very cool and heaters kept us comfortable. Location was perfect, too.

hotel_name: Park Terrace Hotel on Bryant Park
review_body: I really have only good things to say about this hotel. The staff is fantastic. They serve an excellent breakfast. The rooms are on the small side (typical for NYC) but very comfortable. The gym is small but well equipped. They also have a laundry room. The location of the hotel is great as well as it is right near the theater district and across from Bryant Park. this hotel is a 10.

hotel_name: Park Terrace Hotel on Bryant Park
review_body: I booked the hotel for boyfriend birthday and put a note during the booking. They end up preparing a birthday amenity for him ( I ♡ the card ), super sweet! The hotel is right next to Bryant park, room is clean and staff is attentive! Definitely would come back again.

hotel_name: Park Terrace Hotel on Bryant Park
review_body: Everything about the stay was fabulous. The room was huge for New York standards. Not only did we get some complimentary goodies to snack on, the concierge team brought us pastries to help celebrate my moms birthday. Included breakfast was great (although could be crowded at times). Room was clean, comfortable, quiet. Every hotel employee we came across was friendly and welcoming. Terrace was beautiful and location was perfect.

hotel_name: Park Terrace Hotel on Bryant Park
review_body: Hotel is perfectly.located near times square at Bryant Park. Staff was friendly and our Deluxe Room well maintained and sufficient in terms of size.One of two elevators was not working for several days. This was kind of annoying cause you had to wait a long time getting to the top floors. Anyhow, I guess this was a one time problem We liked the free water service on the floor and the option that we could get mail delivered to the hotel. What we didn't like too much was the breakfast system.They only offer very limited seating - so every day the room was so crowded that we either took a breakfast box to the room or had to wait a long time for a table. As there was no order in who gets a table people were literally fighting for places.As well they don't offer a typical breakfast menuEveryrhing is good - but not what your used to.No fried or scrambled egg but rather bagless with cream cheese. Several sausages, boiled egg and fruits. We would have rather had a classical buffet incl pancakes and French toast / baked beans. Nevertheless it was good and we can recommend the hotel!!!

hotel_name: Park Terrace Hotel on Bryant Park
review_body: Starting off at the front desk the staff was beyond friendly and super informative. Getting up to my room i was pleasantly surprised at how well the room was laid out and how new everything felt. Was a little smaller than expect for a deluxe room but still great. The complementary snack and soda in the room was a nice touch and the bed was super comfortable. Then on top of that the Terrace Bar was Fantastic! Fantastic service and Fantastic drinks. Menu could use some beefing up as its rather limited in regards to food but the view from the Terrace was phenomenal and with heated lamps was perfect. Will defiantly stay there again.
user_name:
quickrunaz
Washington DC, District of Columbia

hotel_name: Park Terrace Hotel on Bryant Park
review_body: The hotel is a new one, designed to modern standard and very much well located on 40 street, overlooking Pyrant park and New York public library. Virtually in the middle of Manhattan attractions. Room, breakfast, terrace lounge and cleanliness are all extraordinary. The most gorgeous of all was staff and service. I would definitely recommend.

hotel_name: Park Terrace Hotel on Bryant Park
review_body: Stayed at the Park Terrace hotel with by boy friend for 5 nights to do some sight seeing in NY and the hotel was absolutely perfect for us! The location is brilliant. Close to everything you could want, a subway station at the end of the street to get anything that isn't close and still quite at night. Room was small-ish (average by NY standards) but was very well laid out so we had plenty of space. The rooms were very modern and the facilities were quite good. The water bottle refill station on each floor was a great touch too, very convenient. Breakfast was very nice too.

hotel_name: Park Terrace Hotel on Bryant Park
review_body: The rooms are really nice, clean, and just what you need. The staff is very friendly and anticipatory of your needs. The breakfast awesome. Lots of healthy options and fantastic donuts and pastries. Great cocktails too. I’d stay here again for sure.

hotel_name: Park Terrace Hotel on Bryant Park
review_body: This is the only place I will stay when I come into town and now I was lucky enough to share it with my daughter. I have never seen better service in my life. The best breakfast, the best view, the best of the best! Thank you❤️

hotel_name: Park Terrace Hotel on Bryant Park
review_body: Our recent stay at Park Terrace was excellent in every way.The rooms are super clean and very comfortable. The location is very convenient and easy to get around with metro station close by and easy walking distance to everything.The staff was friendly,always helpful and made us feel welcome and at home.A shout out to Noah and Jenna at the front desk for going the extra mile for us, very professional and accomplished at their positions.Highly recommend this hotel ❤️

hotel_name: Park Terrace Hotel on Bryant Park
review_body: First time staying here, found it on booking.com. Really good find. Located on Bryant Park, great service, high quality breakfast buffet with local foods, Nespresso machines. This is on my personal preferred list now

hotel_name: Park Terrace Hotel on Bryant Park
review_body: Start your day with a delicious breakfast highlighting local pastries, cheeses and meats. Fresh juices ( ginger carrot is my favorite), yogurt, fresh fruit and a barista to make you a specialty coffee. Sit in the large open outdoor patio or the comfortable dining room. Rooms are comfortable And modern with locally made soaps and shampoos. Bottled water filling station and Espresso in your room. Excellent service. Gym is open 24/7. Best of all, it’s only 30 steps to Bryant park where you can sit and enjoy the changing seasons. My go-to hotel for trips to NYC.

hotel_name: Park Terrace Hotel on Bryant Park
review_body: Excellent service, clean, modern rooms, breakfast living area cosy and warm, well prepared snacks . Perfectly located next to Bryan Park. They gym is also excellentElevators need to improve though they are slow and would need outside signs to at least know in which floor the lift is

hotel_name: Park Terrace Hotel on Bryant Park
review_body: Richard JPark terrace is a fantastically located hotel. We had a Deluxe High room (8th floor) with a partial view of the New York Public Library. The initial disappointment of the view was soon forgotten as we didn't spend our trip gazing out of the window - we were busy in one heck of a city. So what did we need from the room - great bed, room size more than adequate for two adults travelling for 1 week. Bathroom good with a great shower. Amenities exceptional (big TV, bluetooth speaker, water stations, amenity cupboard, air con, in room Nespresso all were great) but the ABSOLUTE best was the breakfast - bagels, breads, toppings, cereals, juice, tea and coffee - delicious and a great way to start each days adventures - stayed for 6 nights and was well above what we needed for a very reasonable price.

hotel_name: Park Terrace Hotel on Bryant Park
review_body: Great location on W41st and 5th Avenue for shops and sightseeing. Rooms super clean with a super comfy bed. Nice touch in offering a water bottle on arrival and finding popcorn and a fizzy orange in the room as on the house. During the morning period the 2 lifts are very busy, you can spend 10 minutes waiting for the lift to arrive.

hotel_name: Park Terrace Hotel on Bryant Park
review_body: Clean rooms, great location, very welcoming and warm staff. They cater to any particulars of your visit, and they have a great attitude, none of the pretentious stuff.Wait till you have the breakfast!

hotel_name: Park Terrace Hotel on Bryant Park
review_body: Lovely hotel in a great area! Across the street from Bryant Park and NYC Public Library. Within walking distance of Rockefeller Plaza, St. Patricks Cathedral, etc. Clean, comfortable, delicious breakfast, helpful and nice staff. Would recommend and would definitely stay again!

hotel_name: Park Terrace Hotel on Bryant Park
review_body: I've stayed in many beautiful places around the world and my hands-down favorite hotel is the Park Terrace Hotel. The people who work there treat you like family. The room is stylish, clean and has all the amenities that I love. I was visiting New York to celebrate my 50th birthday with my oldest, dearest friends and the hotel had a fabulous cheesecake and birthday card waiting for me in my room following a day of adventures. I'm thrilled to be returning for Spring Break with him family this month. I know they are going to love the Park Terrace as much as I do. And don't get me started on the breakfast!! Can't wait to return for more delicious food in a beautiful place. Can't recommend this place enough!

hotel_name: Park Terrace Hotel on Bryant Park
review_body: What can I say, a superb hotel from the moment we arrived. There is ample temporary parking space outside the door so there’s no long walk from a taxi. The rooms are generously appointed and most comfortable. The bathrooms are superbly laid out. The breakfasts are marvellous and the staff are unfailingly friendly and helpful. A superb hotel

hotel_name: Park Terrace Hotel on Bryant Park
review_body: Fantastic location, beautiful view of the park, easy access, caring staff, everything that needs to be there is there and nothing excessive which makes this hotel operate at high value for money.. easy among my top 3 choices in Manhattan

hotel_name: Park Terrace Hotel on Bryant Park
review_body: My wife and I stayed here for four nights and it was wonderful. Rooms were great - very quite even though the location is close to Time Square. Staff were truly wonderful. They wert out of their way no matter what the request. I am not kidding when I say this was the best service I have ever received.We will be back!

hotel_name: Park Terrace Hotel on Bryant Park
review_body: This is the 2nd time I m coming to this hotel and it is always a pleasure to stay at Park Terrace Hotel. The location is really perfect, Rooms are modern and clean and teh breakfast is the one you ever dream of !

hotel_name: Park Terrace Hotel on Bryant Park
review_body: Great location in front of the public library, next to Bryant Park. Clean, looks recently renovated. Front desk very friendly and helpful. WiFi signal is perfect. Only 1 elevator working and frequently used for internal hotel service, so long waiting times, that’s the only blemish.

hotel_name: Park Terrace Hotel on Bryant Park
review_body: From the excellent amenities, comfort level, staff friendliness, and consideration, I LOVED the Park Terrace and it will be my "go to" hotel whenever I visit. Location is very convenient, close to shopping, restaurants, transportation, etc. From my arrival through departure, I have nothing but high praise for the experience, especially willingness of staff to above and beyond. GREAT!!!

hotel_name: Park Terrace Hotel on Bryant Park
review_body: We stayed here last week for 3 nights. We arrived ridiculously early (9am) and they had a room ready for us already which was amazing after an overnight flight. The service was impeccable from every member of staff we encountered. Breakfast was delicious, if a little busy so get there early! Location was perfect, walking distance to lots of tourist hot spots but in a lovely, quiet spot with ample cafes and restaurants nearby. Only two niggles; need more hooks in the bathroom for towels and please put tea making facilities in the room. We absolutely will be back!

hotel_name: Park Terrace Hotel on Bryant Park
review_body: The Park Terrace Hotel on Bryant Park was a wonderful hotel close to Times Square, but with a nice distance. The staff were exceptional! Particularly, Charlie and Larissa who staff the front desk. They were especially helpful in guiding us on our first time in NYC! They mapped directions, suggested restaurants, and gave great suggestions for places to visit. They went above and beyond to assist!

hotel_name: Park Terrace Hotel on Bryant Park
review_body: We stayed at this beautiful hotel for 6 nights on our first Trip to NYC recently and were extremely happy with our stay. The location of this hotel is perfect, it is opposite Bryant Park, close to Grand Central Station, short walk to Times Square, short walk to 5th Avenue and the grand Public Library is directly opposite. The staff were friendly and helpful, the breakfast each day was amazing and the bed was the most comfortable bed i have ever slept in. We highly recommend this hotel for a comfortable stay. If i return to NYC i will definitely stay here again.

hotel_name: Park Terrace Hotel on Bryant Park
review_body: Really friendly and helpfull staff. Clean rooms, which were taking care off everyday. Good breakfast. Good Subway connection in the corner of the street to basically anywhere in the city. Excellent choice!
user_name:
ellubee
Washington DC, District of Columbia

hotel_name: Park Terrace Hotel on Bryant Park
review_body: Awesome and very professional staff, great location , very modern rooms , we truly enjoyed our stay at Park terrace hotel , highly recommend.We will definitely be using park terrace hotel on our next trip.

hotel_name: Park Terrace Hotel on Bryant Park
review_body: This place Makes you feel as though you are “home”. The staff were so cheery, helpful and kind. The room was clean and nicely decorated and equipped. Everything was far beyond our expectations. Can’t wait to go back.

hotel_name: Park Terrace Hotel on Bryant Park
review_body: I was looking for a reasonably priced (for Manhattan) hotel a short break to celebrate my wifes 40th. Settled on Park Terrace as a result of trip Advisor reviews. We arrived the Sunday before presidents day for 3 nights. The staff were excellent throughout. Really welcoming and friendly. The room was immaculate and the bed extremely comfortable. The hotel is in a great location and is within a 5-10 minute walk of Empire State Building and Times Square, and even closer to 5th Ave and Grand Central Station. We spent very little time in the hotel as we were out the whole time, but I would happily return. We did have a few drinks in the bar one late afternoon. Atmosphere was lovely with a gas fire. There's also a terrace with igloos. If I could say anything negative at all, it would just be that breakfast can be really busy. We had to wait for a table every morning, only for a few minutes, but it did mean that I almost felt rushed to leave as I could see other people waiting for a table. The lifts also seemed to take a particularly long time. With that being said, these are really minor points and did not detract from what was an amazing 3 days in NYC, I would happily reccomend to anyone, and would have no reservations about staying again.

hotel_name: Park Terrace Hotel on Bryant Park
review_body: Stayed here for 4 nights with my partner to celebrate my birthday and Valentine’s Day. Check in process was welcoming, quick and effortless. Our room was absolutely spot on, we had the suite so we had a huge bed which has to be the comfiest bee I have ever slept on, bathroom was spacious and light and the shower was super powerful. The hotel give out expensive hand wash etc but I can’t remember the brand. In the suite you also get tons of snacks and drinks, huge tv, sofa, dining table, Bose sound system and two balcony’s over looking Bryant Park. If you stay here you have to try the breakfast it’s not like your normal hotel breakfast everything is sourced locally and it’s like your traditional New York breakfast so plenty of good coffee, bagels, hams, cheeses, nuts, fruits etc plus they have igloos outside on the terrace if you fancy it. Only thing I will say about the breakfast is try and go early as at busy times there can be a big queue. Overall the hotel was a bit more pricier than the other almost 1000 hotels to pick from in New York but when you had a faultless experience and hotel was perfect it makes it worth it.

hotel_name: Park Terrace Hotel on Bryant Park
review_body: Myself and my husband stayed here for a long weekend.As you enter the hotel the aroma catches your breath it is so divine. It’s a small reception area which makes it feel very personal.The room itself overlooked Bryant Park and the ice skating rink , which at night looked particularly pretty. The bed is so comfortable after spending hours exploring the city on our feet. The facilities are all complementary.The breakfast in the morning covered everyone’s taste but there is not enough tables and can get extremely busy (very few hotels in New York offer a complimentary breakfast ) . Bagels, pastries, toast, yoghurt, fruit , muffins , cold meats and cheeses . Fresh juices and hot drinks too.There is an outside terrace which looks out onto Bryant Park one side and the Empire State Building the other with winter cosy igloos .There is a sauna and a fitness suite but we didn’t find the time to use this unfortunately.The location of this hotel couldn’t be any better in the centre of Manhattan making it that you can walk to any tourist attraction which makes sightseeing easy .I would thoroughly recommend thisHotel and would 100% return ❤️

hotel_name: Park Terrace Hotel on Bryant Park
review_body: Excellent service! Centrally located Clean. Only thing is we weren't told to call ahead for our car which we had valeted for 70$ a night and had to wait 45 minutes in lobby. Otherwise, had a great stay!

hotel_name: Park Terrace Hotel on Bryant Park
review_body: Amazing location, really you cannot get more central. The breakfast is a nice addition however every morning they ran out...fast of food. They have to go boxes, which were amazing, however people would clean house for (what I would believe to be) a second or thrived meal later and even if you showed up in the begging of breakfast the food would quickly be gone.The bar a night was a great treat..and truly one of the best views of the Empire State Building.

hotel_name: Park Terrace Hotel on Bryant Park
review_body: We had a 14th floor studio room with great views of Bryant park and the terrace on the 6th floor has a stunning view of the Empire state Bldg framed by other buildings. The room had all the amenities you need, the staff were friendly and attentive, A few minor quibbles, the 2 lifts can take ages to arrive at busy times and the breakfast room gets very crowded with queues to get to the food / find a table at busy times. We also had a bit of trouble with the TV signal on one night. Other than that its an ideal spot from which to explore New York.

hotel_name: Park Terrace Hotel on Bryant Park
review_body: Very small hotel for what you pay for. We dont travel a lot so would have been appreciative of staff informing us of fees on bill. Make sure room is not next to maid linen closet because they are not quiet. Doors slamming shut late at night and very early in the morning. Was told by one staff member breakfast ends 1030am but next morning it actually ended at 10am.

hotel_name: Park Terrace Hotel on Bryant Park
review_body: The hotel is directly across from Bryant Park and the New York City Public Library. There are three subway stations within a 5 minute walk, and numerous bus stops near by. It is far enough off of Times Square to not be in the middle of the crowds, but close enough to walk there in 6 or 7 minutes. The hotel room and bathroom were comfortable, clean, and modern. The complementary breakfast is superb, however, it is so good that everyone in the hotel wants to take advantage, so it can be a bit crowded, especially between 9:00 and 10:00 a.m. I can't complement the staff enough...they are the best. I would especially like to recognize and thank Gabriella and Charlie for their constant smiles and their willingness to regularly go above and beyond what one could expect.

hotel_name: Park Terrace Hotel on Bryant Park
review_body: Stayed for work just in walking distance of corporate offices at One Bryant Park. So glad I opted for here than a chain, the room was so very comfortable without being too lavish (expensive), with thoughtful touches and conveniences. Breakfast was phenomenal. Would have just one suggestion: maybe a small stash of hypoallergenic alternatives to the in-room toiletries? I'm more than a little allergic to cilantro, which was in the shampoo (to its benefit, clearly labeled). Fortunately I found a Duane Reade to get my own before I needed it.

hotel_name: Park Terrace Hotel on Bryant Park
review_body: The Park Terrace was the perfect hotel for a 4 night stay in Manhattan. Check in was efficient and took only a couple of minutes. We had a beautiful room on the 3rd floor that overlooked Bryant Park in a Deluxe Queen room which was perfect for a couple. The complimentary popcorn on arrival was very much appreciated! The room was extremely clean and well thought out, with a gorgeous bathroom and a bed that was so comfy, we didn’t want to get out of it. Just to note that there was no mini fridge in the room but there is a cold filtered water dispenser on every floor with an ice machine. The hotel is located a few minutes walk away from the subway and you can be downtown in 20 minutes. It was also great being so close to Times Square. I’ve stayed in numerous hotels across New York over the years and this was hands down my favourite and I would highly recommend it to anyone else.

hotel_name: Park Terrace Hotel on Bryant Park
review_body: We loved our stay at Park Terrace. As people from out of town, we found this to be a great location to catch the subway and walk to many places as well. The hotel was very clean and the rooms were well maintained. The staff there was also very helpful and friendly to us. The breakfast there too was DELICIOUS. Its worth getting it if you're staying there. We recommended this hotel.

hotel_name: Park Terrace Hotel on Bryant Park
review_body: Love This hotel , stay here every time I’m in NY , Recommend Everyone too stay , excellent staff , great environment, great ppl.. I was there for work and birthday, you might recieve a gift , stay more then once

hotel_name: Park Terrace Hotel on Bryant Park
review_body: Park Terrace Hotel has a phenomenal staff, eager to anticipate and meet your needs. The rooms are perfectly laid out and maximize the space as well as any hotel I've stayed in. And the beds are awesome! Combine all of that with their location, directly across from Bryant Park and the New York City Library, and you have an outstanding hotel. Whether you're visiting NY for business or pleasure, Park Terrace will fulfill your needs.

hotel_name: Park Terrace Hotel on Bryant Park
review_body: Really nice hotel! Clean, modern, terrific service and an amazing location! Right across the street from Bryant Park and within walking distance of Time Square and theatre district. Amazing rooftop bar with heated igloos and view of the Empire State Building. Couldn’t have asked for a better stay.

hotel_name: Park Terrace Hotel on Bryant Park
review_body: We stayed for one night, and everything was perfect. Check-in was very easy and friendly. Had a room on the 6th floor, which we liked because the breakfast place is on the same floor.It didn’t bother us that we didn’t have a room with a view - the upside of it is, it is very quite :)Outstanding was the staff and the breakfast. Especially for american standards, the breakfast was of great quality. You could see that it’s made with love and they put some thoughts in it.The staff is super friendly and helpful! Thanks to them, we had the easiest and fastest way to JFK airport and they even offered us breakfast boxes to go.The room is not big, but totally fine. Super clean and stylish. The bed was very comfy, as well.I totally recommend this hotel!

hotel_name: Park Terrace Hotel on Bryant Park
review_body: We’ll for sure come back to this wonderful hotel!Everything from the nice and clean rooms, to the great location and service-minded staff was fantastic! We really enjoyed the breakfast in the comfy lounge by the fireplace and the beds was really comfortable! We have visited New York several times before and have found out that there’s so few hotels that check so many boxes of greatness like Park Terrace. Thank you for having us!

hotel_name: Park Terrace Hotel on Bryant Park
review_body: Very comfortable sleek room (perfect for one, possible for two) in incredibly quiet hotel. Minimal city noise, remarkably! Great breakfasts. Perfect location for 5th Avenue, Theater, Empire State Building, NY public library and much more.

hotel_name: Park Terrace Hotel on Bryant Park
review_body: Wonderful surprise. Everything about this place is terrific. Modern, well designed. Exceptional welcoming staff.Perfect location. Breakfast Included. No pretense. Good shower. Everything you want. The perfect choice.

hotel_name: Park Terrace Hotel on Bryant Park
review_body: The hotel is nice, clean, modern and convenient. However the standard room is tiny and the corridors are extremely claustrophobic. The materials in the room felt a little cheap and plasticky. Lack of water in the room was annoying although they have reusable plastic bottles and a tap on each floor - it felt like I was in a hostel.

hotel_name: Park Terrace Hotel on Bryant Park
review_body: Stayed as 2A for 4 nights. The concierge was well staffed and well presented. Always smiling and happy to answer the multitude of questions we threw at them. Minimalist but no fuss. The location is excellent. Easy access to many of NY’s sights and sounds. A short walk to the metro. We had a room with a view towards the library and Bryant Park with its ice rink. There was also a small Juliet balcony which was great as it meant we could occasionally let in some crisp fresh air. The room is a reasonable size by NY standards and was exceptionally clean and well maintained. The bed was comfortable and we slept well. Complementary filtered water with reusable bottles and self serve ice was available in the lift area.As noted in other reviews, the lifts can be slow, but we just used the stairs (make sure you get into the correct stairwell to exit to the foyer). This was definitely easier during breakfast hours and to get to and from the breakfast level. At check in, would it make sense to make people aware of the stairs to give them an alternative to the lifts, if they wished to use them?The continental breakfast has a wide selection of different items which would cover most needs. A particular positive here is that there are takeaway boxes for you to stash away something for a morning snack. The fact that this was clearly pointed out as an acceptable thing to do on our first entry to breakfast was refreshing. Subsequently, we would take a bagel (which were superb) and doughnut away with us for an on-the-go treat. The breakfast is the same each morning. It would be an even better experience if there was some variation each day for those staying longer than one or two nights. On a downside, the layout of the breakfast space meant a constant choke point causing a relatively long queue for one end of the breakfast bar. There is also not enough tables and chairs for all to be easily accommodated. The space would benefit from a reworking of the way in which breakfast is served. Main issue though is that a decent coffee is an additional charge which just feels a bit greedy. I did order a barista coffee on the first day and it appeared as though what I asked for got lost in translation so didn’t bother again.The breakfast counter doubles as the drinks bar in the evening. We briefly visited the bar on our first night but there was a private function using a quarter of the space and it felt a bit awkward to come in and sit and relax. There are some heated igloos out on the rooftop but we did not get time to use them but they looked like a bit of fun.Interestingly, we got an email along the lines of “How is your stay, would you like to review?” My wife completed the review including a response to a question indication a small fridge in the room would be nice. Literally, immediately after hitting the submit button the phone in our room rang with someone advising they do have small fridges available would we like one brought up to the room!”. You could view this as either exceptional service or a bit creepy. Either way, lucky we had a great time or our response could have been a bit awkward. Incidentally, five minutes later a small fridge did appear which, for us, falls into the great service category .Overall, 4 bubbles is a bit harsh. Issues highlighted did not really impact on our stay. Would definitely be 5 bubbles if resolved. We really enjoyed our stay and will be likely to stay here again when we visit NY again.

hotel_name: Park Terrace Hotel on Bryant Park
review_body: Stayed two nights. Every single person to a tee, was smiling, helpful, personable, and went out of their way to assist this newcomer to the Big Apple. Nothing short of an amazing experience and I'll be back again soon.

hotel_name: Park Terrace Hotel on Bryant Park
review_body: My wife and I stayed at the Park Terrace for a week away in the big city. It was fantastic. The room was clean and modern, with a comfortable bed. There is a nice lounge in the hotel which doubles as a breakfast room, and that is maybe the best single thing. The lounge is bright with high ceilings and looks out over Bryant Park. And the breakfast is amazing. They catered very well to our dietary preferences, and the food is DELICIOUS. We would have a wonderful breakfast each day and then not need another meal until dinner. Great value. Don't hesitate to book here.

hotel_name: Park Terrace Hotel on Bryant Park
review_body: As always service is great, room clean and ideal location. I have not found other hotels in NY to offer such a great value. I make a point to stay at the Park Terrace Hotel on all trips to NY. Perfect for business or pleasure.

hotel_name: Park Terrace Hotel on Bryant Park
review_body: Fantastic location, room more than comfortable (I enjoyed the Nespresso machine), very high quality breakfast, last but not least the personnel, always kind. I would easily come back.Nothing to complain, except the elevators, which are not enough.

hotel_name: Park Terrace Hotel on Bryant Park
review_body: I recently stayed at Park Terrace Hotel and I can officially say I have found my new favorite hotel in NYC! The location of this newly constructed hotel is perfect -- the hotel overlooks Bryant Park and is within an easy walking distance to several major sites (Times Square, Grand Central, Rockefeller Center, Madison Square Garden, Empire State Building, etc). While nestled in the middle of the city that never sleeps, I was surprised to find my room was very quiet as it overlooked the park. Compared to other hotel rooms I've experienced in NYC, my room at Park Terrace was spacious enough for my mother and me to both comfortably recharge after a busy day of working and sightseeing. The room was very clean and the staff was exceptionally hospitable and welcoming from the moment we stepped through the door. Now for my favorite part -- the breakfast buffet!!! This was by far the nicest breakfast buffet I've had in the city. It was so good that my mother and I canceled our brunch plans and ate at the hotel both mornings of our stay! While you can get coffee at the breakfast buffet, my mother wanted me to mention in my review that the room has a nice Nespresso coffee maker (I'm not a coffee drinker, but apparently Nespressos are the real deal!) Whether you're in NYC for business or pleasure (my stay was both), I highly recommend staying at Park Terrace Hotel if you value hospitality, comfort and cleanliness! PS - the restaurant is still under construction but from what I hear, La Pecora Bianca will be opening soon! La Pecora Bianca is one of my favorite Italian spots in the city!
user_name:
AVGnyc
New York City, New York

hotel_name: Park Terrace Hotel on Bryant Park
review_body: This is a new hotel. I booked it for one night but put in reservations the wrong night. The front desk staff heroically got me a room anyway. They were so nice and I was never afraid I would not be taken care of. The room are small but luxurious. I liked the excellent coffee, no weak bag drip-brew. The outside noise was low, quiet, there is a close door that you can hear, the cleaning people come and go in the morning but sleeping there was quiet and comfortable.

hotel_name: Park Terrace Hotel on Bryant Park
review_body: My 2 week stay in New York was made so much better by staying at the Park Terrace Hotel! From their friendly and helpful staff, top-notch complimentary breakfast spread and wonderful gym/sauna amenities- I couldn’t have asked for a better place to stay!

hotel_name: Park Terrace Hotel on Bryant Park
review_body: My husband and I visited NY city in January. We had a truly excellent time and the hotel was a great base for us to explore the city. Our room 911 was fabulous with wonderful views over Bryant Park and New York library. Staff were friendly and helpful and the hotel was clean. A good variety of options at breakfast although the bar in the evening was a little expensive.

hotel_name: Park Terrace Hotel on Bryant Park
review_body: This is my hotel of choice for business travel. I love the location, the staff, and the breakfast. I also enjoy getting great sleep while on the road. It is easy to make it a desirable destination every time I am in NY for business.

hotel_name: Park Terrace Hotel on Bryant Park
review_body: The hotel was in a fantastic location in midtown Manhattan. Bang on Bryant Park and only a couple of blocks from Times Sq. It was my wife’s birthday celebration and aside from the complementary cupcakes to celebrate we were also upgraded to a suite which was lovely. NY hotel rooms are generally pretty small but we had plenty of space and the room was immaculate. It was evident the hotel had recently been refurbished. We had a Nespresso in the room, choice of pillows and I was impressed with the eco-friendly water cooler and bottle recycling. Staff throughout the hotel were happy and eager to please. Nothing was too much trouble. I had only one gripe, I wish I’d realised breakfast was cold buffet only. Some mornings we really wanted cooked eggs and bacon and on at least one occasion we went out for breakfast instead. This isn’t to say the cold breakfast wasn’t good, ingredients were of a high standard, but to achieve a five rating from me there has to be a decent cooked breakfast! This said, will definitely be back.

hotel_name: Park Terrace Hotel on Bryant Park
review_body: The Park Terrace was a lovely hotel for our recent stay in NYC. The location fit all of our needs. We loved the breakfast which included among other things, delicious fresh fruit, bagels, meats and cheeses. The room size was very nice and sparkling clean. All of the staff were kind and helpful. We had a great stay and will definitely book the Park Terrace again.

hotel_name: Park Terrace Hotel on Bryant Park
review_body: Great location, great stay! Although I thought the room was very small at first, I realized it was very efficient. It had everything that i needed, and loved the free breakfast on floor 6. Would definitely stay here again!

hotel_name: Park Terrace Hotel on Bryant Park
review_body: Tried to give this new hotel a try but it was a disaster before I even set foot on their premises.I called to book two rooms. First attempt was transferred to reservations and waited 10 mins so I hung up. Second attempt was an hour later and it took 45 mins with the girl to make two reservations because she put me on hold for 5 mins to find out how big the rooms were. So after 45 mins she assured me she would send two separate emails. I received one but did not receive the second one. So after an hour I emailed Hotel to remind them I am still waiting for the 2nd confirmation.The first email response was it was sent. I explained I only have one not two confirmations.The second email response was that there's only one reservation to which I explained for the second time that there should be two!!!The third email response from them was to call them to which I responded I am not going to call and indicated already that they should be calling me (as I am NOT wasting my dime on LD charges when I already wasted 45 mins in LD charges). At which time I simply asked them to cancel reservations as this experience from booking to now the customer experience was terrible.Of course, my last email asking for confirmation that my reservation is cancelled and confirmation that they only have one and that I will not be charged for any reservations goes unanswered. If this is any indication of how this hotel's customer service is then its certainly not a hotel others should consider.

hotel_name: Park Terrace Hotel on Bryant Park
review_body: The location was perfect! The room and staff were great! My only complaint is with Frankie the bartender in the hotel bar who was rude to my sister on her birthday. His answer to her question of a particular wine was “It’s a grape.”Totally unnecessary... but we didn’t let him spoil our great time!!

hotel_name: Park Terrace Hotel on Bryant Park
review_body: This hotel always amazes me, the staff , the amenities , the breakfast!, the rooms , all top notch. Harrison. Craig, Charley, Jose, and Lubsong were fantastic. I always stay here when I come to New York !

hotel_name: Park Terrace Hotel on Bryant Park
review_body: We loved the rooms, the 6th floor breakfast, the terrace for a late night drink! The view of Bryant Park and the Empire State building was a nice touch from the terrace. A lovely hotel in NYC and the staff was so kind and helpful.

hotel_name: Park Terrace Hotel on Bryant Park
review_body: I had a great trip while staying at the Park Terrace Hotel. The staff there was welcoming and friendly. The housekeeping staff was also dependable and accommodating. I wasn't ready to leave until late morning most days, and the staff always came back and made sure my room was tidy. My only knocks on the place was that the "Lobby" of the hotel was a bit underwhelming. I thought I was walking into a high end apartment building upon first entering. I also wish they had more breakfast options, and a broader menu in general. Those things aside, the room is incredibly efficient with space, and the bed was very comfortable. The lounge area on the 5th floor exceeded my expectations. It was very cozy, and a perfect spot to get some work done if you want to get out of your room and get some peace and quiet! I would definitely stay here again!

hotel_name: Park Terrace Hotel on Bryant Park
review_body: Great location and property. Breakfast is included and high quality. Can’t thank the staff enough - great service and very friendly. Especially my friends in the Terrazzo lounge. Highly recommend and would return. #1102

hotel_name: Park Terrace Hotel on Bryant Park
review_body: Cannot recommend this place enough. Spotless, lovely breakfast. Perfect location. Most comfortable bed ever!! Staff were so lovely, genuinely seem to enjoy their job. Overlooked Bryant Park, we had a gorgeous view of the ice rink. Will definitely be back

hotel_name: Park Terrace Hotel on Bryant Park
review_body: This hotel is a true gem just off the beaten path that is Times Square theater district and Fifth Avenue shopping. A perfect location that's an oasis from the hubbub. The staff are friendly, attentive and accommodating. The place itself is superbly appointed and maintained, and truly out of the ordinary. Throughout your visit, I guarantee, you will already be talking about and planning your next visit. We came through a respected personal recommendation and now understand why we are doing the same with friends and and family...and fellow travelers.

hotel_name: Park Terrace Hotel on Bryant Park
review_body: This was a good choice. Convenient to rest of the city, clean, good staff, and nice little restaurant. Check out the igloos on a cold night!!! Nice cozy place to have drinks with friends and chat the night away.

hotel_name: Park Terrace Hotel on Bryant Park
review_body: A lovely, clean, modern, warm and welcoming hotel and staff. Great service, great location, great price. I highly recommend this hotel for fun or business. The complimentary breakfast is amazing. Stay here!

hotel_name: Park Terrace Hotel on Bryant Park
review_body: The staff are incredibly helpful, courteous & friendly. The rooms are very clean, quiet & comfortable. The complementary breakfast was top notch local fare (and I really appreciate that they donate any leftovers to a local shelter). Looking forward to staying again!

hotel_name: Park Terrace Hotel on Bryant Park
review_body: This is a great place to stay. The hotel has a great modern Decour and has a fun vibe. Lots of international folks.The breakfast and lounge room on six or really wonderful nice views of Bryant Park. I’d love to come back when the weathers better and sit at the outside terrace. A very nice breakfast by the way, which is included in the price. No grand lobby and the rooms are a bit small but overall I would stay here again in a heartbeat.

hotel_name: Park Terrace Hotel on Bryant Park
review_body: Hotel located in a excellent location, close to the subways. Rooms are large for NY and clean but bed could be bigger. Feels smaller than a standard double. Requested a room with view but was assigned a room facing alley, staff informed can change to a room with better view later but the request was in fact not related to the staff shift to follow. Water was out for a few hours on the second day but was quickly fixed. On the plus, Early check in with breakfast was provided after early flight arrival.

hotel_name: Park Terrace Hotel on Bryant Park
review_body: 5 night stay in this lovely hotel. The hotel was very clean and the bed was the comfiest I have ever slept in. The reception staff were very helpful and check in and out was very quick. Only down side is the breakfast arrangement. There is limited room to sit so lots of people were taking breakfast back to their room

hotel_name: Park Terrace Hotel on Bryant Park
review_body: The location is wonderful, across the street from Bryant Park and the city library. Reservation staff and front-desk staff are so helpful and for a tiny bit extra, the room was very large for a Manhattan hotel room. On the sixth floor is a beautiful bar where are you also get a wonderful breakfast included each morning - exceptional local baked goods, charcuterie platter, lots of fresh fruit, juice, coffee, etc. From the bar you can see ice-skaters at Bryant Park, and there are a couple of clear geodesic “igloos” if you want to eat and drink outside in the snow. I gave the hotel five stars because I can’t think of a negative thing to say about it.

hotel_name: Park Terrace Hotel on Bryant Park
review_body: From the moment we arrived our expectations were surpassed. Very smooth and efficient check in. Our room was pristine, and calm, with all the space we needed - no city view but then again we didn’t pay for one. Nespresso machine was excellent! Bathroom is nicer than the one we have at home! The 6th floor lounge with its great view of Bryant Park its gas fireplace and lovely decor had me wishing I had work to do so I could enjoy the space more. We got some breakfast there on our one morning, but ended up taking it back to our room bc we went at rush hour for breakfast and all the tables were full. All interactions with staff were pleasant and professional. We would definitely return. Highly recommend.
user_name:
Jill20009
Washington DC, District of Columbia

hotel_name: Park Terrace Hotel on Bryant Park
review_body: We just visited for a 4 night NYC stay and will definitely stay in the park terrace again if we return to NYC. We arrived an hour early and were able to check in straight away which was great after a long day of travelling. Room was clean and modern with a great bathroom (and good powerful shower). Breakfast was included but we were going to see what it was like on the first morning to see if we ventured elsewhere for something more substantial on the other mornings. We ended up having breakfast at the hotel every morning we were there as it was so good. Fresh bagels, croissants, cured meats, boiled eggs, fruits, tea, coffee, donuts to name but a few. Location was perfect. Bryant park is a lovely area. Really close to Times Square but not too close so it’s a little quieter at night. Right by a subway station and in the centre of the island. You couldn’t get a better base I don’t think for doing the main attractions that NYC has to offer. Service was great from the staff. A pretty good gym (for a hotel gym) if you are up early with a bit of jet lag like I was. All in all a great hotel. We will be back

hotel_name: Park Terrace Hotel on Bryant Park
review_body: We traveled into the City from New Jersey for a party and stayed one night. The hotel is great but parking can be challenging. Parking garage is several blocks away. Overall, good stay and we would return.

hotel_name: Park Terrace Hotel on Bryant Park
review_body: As I often visit new York for business every year, this is not my first hotel in Manhattan. I can strongly reccomend this hotel to any business person that value breakfast included and a Terrace overlooking Bryant Park where buisness partners can be invited for a drink in the evening. It is a completely new hotel with a friendly staff, ready to help you with any need, quickly and always with a smile. My room was big for being Midtown Manhattan. It was completely quiet. Beautiful and modern bathroom. i was just missing a restaurant, but was told that it will open in February. Again the terrace and its breakfast was really fantastic. Fresh fruit, blueberries, excellent bread, fresh youghurt, fresh cheese, camamber, nuts and italian ham and sausages, strong black coffee. Also possible to take away. Lovely!

hotel_name: Park Terrace Hotel on Bryant Park
review_body: My hubby and I stayed at Park Terrace for 1 night. It was very reasonably priced for a NYC Hotel and the LOCATION cannot be beat. Directly across the street is beautiful Bryant Park. And just blocks away is Times Square and other major attractions. The rooms are new, clean and spacious for NYC. Service was incredible—greeted with a smiling hello and good morning at every turn. Other fun amenities at the hotel, are their outdoor “igloos” on their rooftop which are heated and enclosed sitting areas in a clear doom to enjoy being outside with feeling the cold. Also, included in our room cost was a complementary breakfast served in their pretty communal dining area on the 6th floor. We will def be back again!

hotel_name: Park Terrace Hotel on Bryant Park
review_body: This is the best hotel I've stayed in so far, not only in NYC but in general. Clean and modern rooms, very kind personnel, delicious breakfast, Unforgettable experience all around. Will go back as soon as possible!

hotel_name: Park Terrace Hotel on Bryant Park
review_body: So glad we stayed here. It's a short walk to the action of Broadway, but on a quiet side street across from Bryant Park. Rooms are modern and comfortable. The queen premier room was a nice size by NYC standards and a good value. Note that the room didn't have a desk - not sure if that's the case with all rooms. But it was fine for a weekend trip. Breakfast is quite good but very crowded at peak times on the weekend. All in all a wonderful stay. We will definitely return.

hotel_name: Park Terrace Hotel on Bryant Park
review_body: To be fair, the hotel is rather new, the room are decent size for NYC and therefore overall quite ‘ok’. Problem is that the beautiful staff members are too busy with themselves, therefor service level is not great. Breakfast is nice if you’re staying for a night or two, as it’s quite limited in options and every days the same. But nothing to complain about. Check in was quick, check out as well as there’s no interest whatsoever to ask how the experience was .... again: too busy with themselves. The rooms are clean, but rather not noisy and cold. You basically hear everything what’s happening on the floor and doors slamming at night from others coming home.... which is quite annoying. The door doesn’t close firmly as there’s a huge gap between floor and door, so all the cold air comes in, and the noise as well. Further the ‘deluxe high floor room’ I booked was on the 7th - our of 14 floors. So not sure if that’s what someone would expect. Overall ok, but nothing special. There’s better options in NYC to be discovered.

hotel_name: Park Terrace Hotel on Bryant Park
review_body: This is a gem of a hotel. It feels almost European. The rooms are not large but very bright and comfortable and clean with a great bed. Wonderful bar with an outdoor patio. Prefect location-right in midtown.
user_name:
rowe161
New York City, New York

hotel_name: Park Terrace Hotel on Bryant Park
review_body: I travel to NYC several times per year, and usually stay at the Palace. They were booked so we ended up at the Park Terrace, and really glad we did. It has a great location across from Bryant Park, close to restaurants, shopping, tourist attractions, and the subway. Our room overlooked the iconic NY Public Library. Very comfortable bed and high quality linens for a great night's sleep. Loved the complimentary continental breakfast each morning. Pastries were yummy. It can get busy on the weekends but worth the wait. But what made this hotel so memorable was the staff. The front desk staff in particular was extremely friendly and accommodating. They seemed to really enjoy their jobs and being able to help out. Offering restaurant recommendations, directions, calling cabs, etc. They even remembered your name when you were coming and going. Nothing pretentious about them at all. Not to mention their hip and stylish uniforms - I think someone said they were designed by Zac Posen. This is my new go-to hotel while in NY.

hotel_name: Park Terrace Hotel on Bryant Park
review_body: This hotel is simply lovely. It has everything you could possibly need, and it's so comfortable I called to inquire as to whether the bedding was available for purchase. The staff were so cheery, helpful and kind. Simply wonderful, would stay here again in a heartbeat.

hotel_name: Park Terrace Hotel on Bryant Park
review_body: What a fantastic time we had there. Skating rink and food /drink stalls at the doorstep, comfy bed and pillows, great breakfast. Ticks all the boxes. Staff was extra helpful, especially Larissa. We had to go see doctor, change flight, etc. All went well with the help of front desk personnel.

hotel_name: Park Terrace Hotel on Bryant Park
review_body: first time to this recent hotel...and it works really well; very nice bedrooms, super friendly staff, great location...elevators are a problem and i assume they are working on it as it is part of almost every review...the breakfast is just ok as there is zero hot food options.. finally a good ration quality/price

hotel_name: Park Terrace Hotel on Bryant Park
review_body: Being used to hotels in Asia, this hotel had its pros and cons.There is no one opening the door at the entrance (and it's a double, heavy, swinging door... they shall consider automated doors at least).The check in was smooth and the staff was kind enough to change the room upon check in, since it was located at the third floor, facing the street (i.e. very noisy!).The new room was on a higher floor, facing the inner corner: very quiet, silent, clean and pretty spartan, same with the bathroom. The bed was comfortable, and you can get free water from the corridor's dispenser (still, i would have expected at least one bootle already in the room). The lifts are very slow to operate, and there are only two of them.The breakfast is located at the 6th floor, ad the space is pretty tiny for the hotel capacity: people were in line just to find a seating spot! I was given the alternative to sit outside, in a non properly heated terrace... with 3 degrees Celsius! Eventually I managed to find a tiny table where to have breakfast.As for the food, quite a major disappointment: besides a boiled egg, there is no egg option (benedict, scrambled, omelette... nothing). There is the choice of rye, toast and croissant bread, and the muffins. One type of cereal and muesli, and plain yogurt. Some fruits, and only filtered coffee, which didn't taste good. If you would like to order an espresso or a cappuccino, they charge you... however the staff seemed not able to make a decent cappuccino.I would suggest the hotel to expand their breakfast area to accommodate guests properly, and to offer coffee for free (espresso, latte, cappuccino), besides adding the eggs option too.

hotel_name: Park Terrace Hotel on Bryant Park
review_body: Sweet, boutique hotel right behind New York Public Library. The one w the lions out front. Great, comfortable, brand new furnishings room. Nice fit and finish. Great breakfast room on 4th floor, w view of ice skating at Bryant Park. Igloos on outside deck w faux furs to wrap up in while having bfast.

hotel_name: Park Terrace Hotel on Bryant Park
review_body: The breakfast is very good, rooms in new condition, quiet room (no noise), the attendant Gabriella is a very educated and efficient person.In my next trip to NY, absolutely sure to return to Park Terrace.

hotel_name: Park Terrace Hotel on Bryant Park
review_body: I was in NYC for a trade show this week and stayed at Park Terrace for the first time. What an amazing place! The hotel was beautifully decorated and extremely clean. The complimentary breakfast each morning was wonderful, with all of the baked goods coming from local bakeries. My favorite part of my stay was enjoying a bottle of wine on the outdoor roof top terrace in a toasty warm igloo with views of the empire state building. Staff was polite and efficient. I can't wait to stay here again. I stay in NYC usually once a month for business and I can honestly say, this is the nicest hotel i have stayed at in a long time. I will definitely be back soon!

hotel_name: Park Terrace Hotel on Bryant Park
review_body: We stayed here for 3 nights the room was nice and clean, nice bathroom. Gym had everything you need and there are free water refill stations throughout the hotel. The complimentary breakfast was beautiful! Great doughnuts and coffee and lovely lounge area. I would always recommend this hotel staff were so helpful and the hotel just added to a such wonderful trip to NYC.

hotel_name: Park Terrace Hotel on Bryant Park
review_body: I took my girlfriend to New York for her 21st birthday present, and I wanted to stay at a hotel in central Manhattan that was not too far from all the attractions and shops; the hotel was a perfect location, it was close enough to all the hustle but you were far away from Times Square that if you didn’t want to be in a big crowd you didn’t have to be, there are lots of great places to eat all around the hotel, we even stopped in the hotel a couple of times for a quick break and dropped shopping bags off to then go back out again, the rooms were always clean and the beds and pillows were amazing, I am trying to buy the pillows that were in there for my bed at home they were that good, rooms are modern and a great bathroom! If anyone asks me where should I stay when visiting New York, I would 100% tell them to stay here, it made our magical trip perfect!We will be back when we come to New York again

hotel_name: Park Terrace Hotel on Bryant Park
review_body: I very much love staying at this hotel for the comfort, the amenities, the views, and more. There is so much to love. It is, however, a pretty big drawback for me that there is not a real restaurant at the hotel with room service options. Otherwise, I would be giving a full 5-star rating. I particularly love the lighting in the hotel rooms with all lights being fully dimmable / adjustable. I also really love the free water bottle refill station. This saves me tons of money & helps reduce environmental waste. The Terazzo bar has quality light bites and drinks and an excellent free breakfast. All in all a great hotel at a great value in a great location. One last small critique is the entrance. For a hotel entrance, it is not very user friendly for guests traveling with suitcases -- which is all of us, right? The doors do not automatically open and are quite heavy. There is usually not a door person to get the door for you. If that weren't a bit difficult as it were, also the entryway has a floor that is not conducive to rolling luggage, so trying to manage the door while bringing your luggage in at the same time can be a bit challenging.

hotel_name: Park Terrace Hotel on Bryant Park
review_body: My first trip to New York stayed between Chris and came home after New Year, could not of picked a better hotel for location, hospitality, cleanliness and the breakfasts are just fab (and I am very fussy) The hotel is right in the heart of New York looking over Byrant Park and New York Library on 5th Ave we done over half the sights by foot the rest by bus tour and river boat. Can’t wait to go back and would hesitate to stay at Park Terrace again thank you for having us.

hotel_name: Park Terrace Hotel on Bryant Park
review_body: FYI: We are ex-New Yorkers (20 years+) visiting the city (living in Tokyo) so we are not an expert of staying at hotels in the city....! After 2 hours of agonizing ride in a cab from JFK ( yes, the last month snow storm passing through the city all of sudden that evening), we finally arrived at Park Terrace Hotel on Bryant Park. This was the first time staying at this hotel. We like a small boutique type of hotel. But it was a bit sad since there was no doorman or anyone welcoming us at a door. Well, it's a small hotel so we understand this short staff situation. We walked right in. We originally booked a premier high floor room and were told that our room was on the 7th floor. The 7th is a high floor, really??? (The highest floor is the 15th). When you try to book a room, either via the hotel's app. or write directly to them about your room preference way advance. They take those requests seriously. Since we did not write our room request in specific, we were assigned to the room on the 7th floor ( category of high floor starts from the 7th) facing to very REAR side of the hotel. When I walked in to the room, I almost cried. This room reminded me of my endless quest of a perfect apartment in the city when I was much younger! No view at all. Just a massive brick wall to stare at. As a someone with a New York's assertive attitude, we ran back to the front desk and asked for an another room. Miraculously, Rm1509 just became available. We paid the upgrade fee but it was worth the money! The room was studio with 2 big windows facing Bryant Park. The twinkle lights from the windows made us feel we were home.....! Breakfast was great. Elevators are slow. Free refillable water available at a closet in the hallway. Minimal yet sufficient service during our stay. Subway station is around the corner7 & BDFQM). Do we recommend this hotel to anyone? Maybe, not for anyone but someone who enjoys simplicity in life? We definitely come back here but for the next time, we will be mention our room requests in details! Thank you for reading!

hotel_name: Park Terrace Hotel on Bryant Park
review_body: Fabulous position, very central to everything and a beautifully appointed room which was plush, clean and manner with a lovely reception team and with a beautifully simply breakfast lounge with a view of the park, book go and enjoy

hotel_name: Park Terrace Hotel on Bryant Park
review_body: My girlfriend and I spent three nights at the park terrace hotel. The hotel has many small things that make it amazing such as cinnamon smelling towels, a high tech lighting system, easily controllable aircon, and very nice smelling shampoos and products. The place is very modern. The location is perfect, short walk to time square. I would highly recommend!

hotel_name: Park Terrace Hotel on Bryant Park
review_body: Park Terrace proved to be even better than the reviews I read on trip advisor. Check in was efficient and all staff are genuinely friendly. the room is large enough to be comfortable, and so well designed that it feels much larger. Bathrooms are bright, with a clean look and feel. Extra touches like the Nespresso machine, luxurious robe and yoga mat were wonderful. The breakfast is outstanding with great breads and bagels, a selection of breakfast meats and cheese, and fresh fruit. To top it off, the hotel has refillable waterbottles and a filtered water station on each floor. We will definitely stay here on our next visit!!
user_name:
lindadavrath2020
New York City, New York

hotel_name: Park Terrace Hotel on Bryant Park
review_body: We stayed at the hotel over Christmas and my birthday na Dec 27th 2019. The staff was exceptionally helpful and kind. Charlie took very good care of us. The hotel has a nice home feeling to it. The location is also very good, all essential landmarks are close to visit my foot or taxi. We have the Studio View Room and it was very nice and spacious. Comfortable beds.

hotel_name: Park Terrace Hotel on Bryant Park
review_body: It was a very good quality for the cost of the hotel! A lot of attractions and restaurants in NY are close, very clean rooms and with all the commodities that you need in NY City. I totally recommend it.

hotel_name: Park Terrace Hotel on Bryant Park
review_body: - Great central location- The room feels a little like a ship's cabin- Shower feels really good- Acoustic is very poor - all doors slam hard, no cushions on the frame, elevators even are noisy- Intimacy note: door to the bathroom is a cute sliding glass door. It does not shut really.- No slippers provided- Nice rooms, a little overrated but it all depends on what you compare it to- Don't count on a view. Higher floor room is a higher price but don't bother, there is no view unless your room is on the park side- Overcrowded elevators- Overcrowded breakfast lounge in the morning - but also, it may depend on the time you get there or the time of the year- Cold breakfast (no eggs other than hard boiled)- Awesome staff at the reception counter- Very chill and helpful staff in the breakfast lounge, trying to compensate for the major crowd- All in all a good experience

hotel_name: Park Terrace Hotel on Bryant Park
review_body: My stay in NYC was wonderful despite a few hiccups. I loved Park Terrace’s proximity to Bryant Park and the subway. It made getting around the city super convenient. However, the hotel staff failed to place me in a hypoallergenic room despite my prior notification and their confirmation of my request. Because of this, I woke up each subsequent morning worse off than I was the night before. By my 2nd or 3rd morning, I awoke red faced and unable to breath. I had hives on my cheek and chin and red splotches covered by body. I knew exactly what was happening as I’ve known I had an allergy to down feathers since my diagnosis at age 3. Which is why I always request hypoallergenic bedding wherever I stay. A very common request too! After covering up my beet red face with makeup, I went down to the front desk only to be confronted with skepticism. I stood there about 5 minutes before the concierge confirmed that I did, in fact, give notice about my allergy. I was offered free drinks at the hotel bar for the inconvenience and told my room would be hypoallergenic upon my return at the end of the day. However, once I returned to my room later on, there were still down throw pillows in the room. Either the hotel staff is completely ignorant of a very common medical condition or they just do not care about their patrons well-being. I believe it is the latter, and for that reason I will never return. In addition to this issue, I was also dissatisfied with the room in general. During my booking, I paid for a “High Floor Deluxe Room w/ a View” but was given an 8th floor room with a view of absolutely nothing. The hotel’s top floor is 16, I believe. A better advertisement for my room would have been “Mid-Level Deluxe Room w/ a View of Our Neighbor’s and the Alley”. There are many options for hotel accommodations in NYC, so keep looking otherwise you might be dissatisfied with your stay like I was.

hotel_name: Park Terrace Hotel on Bryant Park
review_body: This is a great hotel located across from the New York Public Library (which is beautiful), and Bryant Park (which is often referred to as NYC’s town square). The hotel is ideally located for those wanting to be in the center of Midtown, but who do not want to be on top of Times Square. The rooms are well appointed with a comfortable bed and large windows. This is NYC, however, and the rooms are smallish so if you are looking for a spacious room, or need a room where you can spread out, this may not necessarily be the hotel for you. That being said, it was the hotel for us, and we loved every second. Oh, and the morning breakfast was outstanding. I recommend getting to it early to get seating.

hotel_name: Park Terrace Hotel on Bryant Park
review_body: We found a great deal online. Breakfast was excellent. Nice buffet with many options. Room was clean and a nice size including complimentary popcorn and soda. Coffee machine in the room. Location on Bryant Park was excellent.

hotel_name: Park Terrace Hotel on Bryant Park
review_body: Great location. I was there for work and then spent the weekend. It is closes to everything and the subway is just a block away. The room was comfortable, clean and quiet. There is water stations on every floor so you can refill or grab a bottle.

hotel_name: Park Terrace Hotel on Bryant Park
review_body: The location was great, right on Bryant Park. Walking distance to Empire State Building, Grand Central Station, Rockefeller Center, Chrysler Building, and Central Park....and close to the subway if you need it. My main interest was getting a clean room in a "newer" building, and this hotel was very clean. Bathroom was very modern and clean as well. Very quiet. I would definitely stay here again.

hotel_name: Park Terrace Hotel on Bryant Park
review_body: Enjoyed the hotel. We stayed in one of the suites on the top floor, and our view of Bryant Park and The NY Public Library was extraordinary. To see the ice skaters and the skyscrapers together, made for a view meant for a city holiday. Loved the room, and especially the breakfast and the ambience of the dining area, modern, yet warm, and the staff was amazing. Look forward to when the restaurant opens. Will have room service then, and will add to the experience.

hotel_name: Park Terrace Hotel on Bryant Park
review_body: We very much enjoyed our week at the Park Terrace Hotel on Bryant Park. Great location, fantastic customer service and very comfortable beds. The breakfast selection is small but adequate and tea making facilities in the rooms by default would be good, though they are immediately provided if asked for and I appreciate that America is not England. No points deducted.The stand out feature is the staff, who are pleasant and polite at all times.

hotel_name: Park Terrace Hotel on Bryant Park
review_body: This boutique hotel was perfect in so many ways! The staff and service were impecable, location was prime (by Bryant park and library), and included a quality and delicious continental breakfast sourced from local artisans (donuts, granola, bagels, cheeses). This is our new go to hotel in NYC.

hotel_name: Park Terrace Hotel on Bryant Park
review_body: Hotel was close to a lot of restaurants, just a couple minute walk to see the ball drop!They were friendly, valet parking was great, the beds were super comfy (those pillows!), complimentary little snack when we checked in was very nice, the fitness center was clean, breakfast could have been better but there are two cute cafes right outside the door. We had already booked tickets to a separate NYE party at the Skylark - but the receptionist let us know that they were doing a little something at the hotel as well. We didn’t go to it but it’s nice to know for future.

hotel_name: Park Terrace Hotel on Bryant Park
review_body: We booked a return trip to the Park Terrace after we had a pleasant stay in 2018. The location was one reason but we also enjoyed the ultra modern amenities. The bed, the HD TV with good selection of channels, comfy chairs, nice bathroom and the view of Bryant Park. The drawbacks are a super small lobby, no room service or restaurant and the beer selection in the bar is paltry and terrible.

hotel_name: Park Terrace Hotel on Bryant Park
review_body: Just got back from a weeks stay at the Park Terrace Hotel . We had 2 rooms, one which was a studio corner room which had lots of space and great views of of the winter village at Bryant park. Lots of breakfast choices just next to the hotel if you don’t fancy the hotel breakfast everyday which was great. Would like to thank the staff, especially Charlie and Larissa whom where always so friendly and happy to book our venues for us. Overall a great stay would highly recommend.

hotel_name: Park Terrace Hotel on Bryant Park
review_body: Besides the excellent location, Park Terrace is a very quiet and comfortable hotel that is decorated in posh minimal style. Very clean. The breakfast served on 6th floor terrace room is lovely. Some of the options include bagels, cream cheese, o.j., donuts, fresh fruit, prosciutto and Brie. The staff are friendly.

hotel_name: Park Terrace Hotel on Bryant Park
review_body: We had a great night stay at Park Terrace. The staff at the front desk was so kind to my toddler daughter and I, the room was a decent size and well designed. Loved the bath products, and also we had a great view of Bryant Park skating rink. The breakfast was amazing, and we enjoyed sitting in the "igloo" for a few minutes too. All in all was great and would recommend.

hotel_name: Park Terrace Hotel on Bryant Park
review_body: Park Terrace has a lot of offer with great amenities. The staff is extremely friendly and helpful; delicious breakfast buffet is offered free in the mornings and there are water stations on each floor, which I love - saves me money and the planet. There's also a gym which I sadly didn't realize when I booked. However, I made use of the streaming exercise "class" on the TV. Rooms are large and beds comfortable. It was a perfect stay in a good location, right next to Bryant Park. One thing to note, the hotel does not offer room service.

hotel_name: Park Terrace Hotel on Bryant Park
review_body: Perfect gem of a hotel across from Bryant Park.Close by Grand Central Station, Rockefeller Center, the Empire State Building and many other classic NYC spots that we love and cherish.And special bonus of being able to enjoy the Holiday Market in Bryant Park at Christmas.

hotel_name: Park Terrace Hotel on Bryant Park
review_body: Very friendly staff, great location, very nice and very clean room. We came with our dog and had no worries. Only small problem ... the breakfast room ... it really lacks space compared to the number of customers.

hotel_name: Park Terrace Hotel on Bryant Park
review_body: Our room overlooked Bryant Park & the skating rink- great views! Very convenient location. Superb service. Friendly & most helpful staff. Quiet & well appointed rooms. Very restful sleep. Will stay again!

hotel_name: Park Terrace Hotel on Bryant Park
review_body: The beautiful night view from my hotel room is still vivid in my mind. There was a harmony of light and place that I had never seen before. This hotel was New York city itself to me. First of all, the complimentary breakfast included fresh fruit that I enjoyed tasting and it helped me digest well all day. Secondly, the complimentary water kept me hydrated. So I was able to drink enough water in New York city unlike in other city I’ve ever traveled to. Thirdly, the clean bathroom relieved myself of the fatigue of a long day. If you press the ‘select’ button, a small fountain show will be presented right behind your eyes. But, most importantly of all, this hotel has ‘Charlie’ and ‘Woodrow’. ‘Charlie’ always waved a friendly greeting along with a smile. His “Hi, there!” is still ringing in my ears. And he even asked me if I had an umbrella on a rainy day. I was so moved by him. ‘Woodrow’ took a picture for me while serving and even took me the view of Empire state of building outside the breakfast bar. I asked his name so that I could remember him. Of course, there were some drawbacks as well. A slow elevator, a move to another room by broken heating switch... But, I think that the advantages outweighed the disadvantages. Thank you so much. I can’t thank you enough.

hotel_name: Park Terrace Hotel on Bryant Park
review_body: I spent 10 nights in this wonderful hotel for my solo trip in NYC! Hotel mgmt was nice enough to upgrade my room with a park view and NY library view:) comfortable room that comes with a coffee machine and takeaway cups so you can bring your coffee out on your NY walking trip:) appreciate that there’s a water station right outside my room and bottles available for use. Location is amazing as well! I walked from the hotel to most places in Manhattan for 8 days before I bought my first metro card (I’m going Brooklyn!) walkable distance (15mins approx) to Bus terminal, Times Square(less than 5mins), walked to Soho, Central Park, MOMA... I will advise you to walk if you have the time, there’s a lot to see, I knew I didn’t need the metro card (yet) on my second day....Hotel service was good, breakfast was quite a spread with a view of the beautiful Bryant Park. Definitely coming back, thank you for making my solo trip safe, comfortable and pleasant. You will be my go-to hotel whenever I’m in NYC:)

hotel_name: Park Terrace Hotel on Bryant Park
review_body: By far an outstanding hotel! Only 1 year old so everything is modern and up to date. Great restaurant for breakfast and bar at night including an igloo on the outdoor terrace.The staff is very attentive and friendly and accommodating.Can’t wait to visit again!!

hotel_name: Park Terrace Hotel on Bryant Park
review_body: We booked 6 rooms for my daughter’s wedding. Could not have asked for a more helpful staff. The arranged for a few rooms to be ready early so bride could get ready. They even had a bottle of wine and cupcakes from Magnolia Bakery place in the room for the newlyweds. The rooms were very comfortable, the complementary breakfast was fenominal. I can’t say enough about this hotel. Would recommend you try it for yourself.

hotel_name: Park Terrace Hotel on Bryant Park
review_body: Overall excellent. Long weekend with family of 4. King Suite w/full size pull out couch was perfect. Breakfast could have had a few more items, but was good enough to start the day. Location is perfect!

hotel_name: Park Terrace Hotel on Bryant Park
review_body: The hotel is wonderfull, the room, lobby, employees...perfect!Verry happy to choosed this hotel.I stayed in the Studio View room, verry modern, charming with a good view.The infrascture its aweasome as well, with a lot of things!I recomended!

hotel_name: Park Terrace Hotel on Bryant Park
review_body: I enjoyed my stay here. The rooms were very clean, the bed was so comfortable. All the staff were incredibly friendly. The terrace was pretty and breakfast was good! I also loved the hydration stations!

hotel_name: Park Terrace Hotel on Bryant Park
review_body: Hotel is just over a year old. Rooms are modern and images on the website closely resemble the actual size. The breakfast (included) was varied and ample, though staff wasn't able to keep up with cleaning tables fast enough for volume. Service is just average. Do not expect staff to assist you with luggage from car to lobby. We waited 30 minutes for luggage to be delivered to room, called again, waited more, and then went back to bring the luggage upstairs ourselves. The terrace, with views of Bryant Park, was lovely.
