There is no concierge and front desk staff are less than sophistacted with restaurant recommendations.

hotel_name: Park Terrace Hotel on Bryant Park
review_body: We spent 3 wonderful nights at the Terrace. The new hotel is beautiful. Our room overlooked Bryant Park. The 6th floor terrace/lounge was amazing. A great place to begin our day with breakfast and end our day in a heated igloo looking at the Empire State Building.During our next stay, I will record the names of the many staff who made our stay extraordinary. Thank you for the manner in which you treated us every day.

hotel_name: Park Terrace Hotel on Bryant Park
review_body: Lovely Hotel! Great Staff. They allow dogs! No fee, just a refundable security deposit (I do understand) They offer dog bowls and a bed. Our girl loves to sleep on the bathroom tile, so didn’t need the bed - this was a HUGE bathroom with with beautiful tile. Very nice breakfast included. They offer valet or self park. Which takes the worry out of what to do with the car. Would definitely stay again! So would our dog!

hotel_name: Park Terrace Hotel on Bryant Park
review_body: Love this intimate boutique hotel. Welcoming and accommodating staff. Immaculate common areas and room Wonderful view of Bryant Park. .Delicious fresh breakfast . Lovely outdoor area to sit and have a glass of wine. Super location- easy to get uptown or downtown via walking, bus or subway..Close to theater. Felt very safe.
user_name:
Erica L
Little Falls, New Jersey

hotel_name: Park Terrace Hotel on Bryant Park
review_body: Special thanks to Gabriella at the Front Desk. She was welcoming, classy, and gave personal attention to make our stay the best it could be. We loved our stay and this is our go to hotel in Manhattan. Best described as a large boutique hotel that is offers classic decor with all the modern in-room amenities. Bed was very comfortable. Bathroom had acceptable counter space. The rainhead shower had excellent pressure. The room was spacious enough with cool accent lighting and a big screen TV. The Terrazzo bar/lounge put on a great breakfast and was wonderful for relaxing by the fireplace. A fantastic location that's less touristy than Times Square but central enough to get anywhere you want to go. Quiet and good for business travelers or a romantic couples stay. Bryant Park was charming with it's Winter Festival. Highly recommend and will return again. We also appreciated the Green amenities like the refillable water bottles. Only wish they had in-room tea available as an alternative to coffee.

hotel_name: Park Terrace Hotel on Bryant Park
review_body: This is a terrific place to stay in midtown Manhattan. Beautiful rooms with every amenity. Breakfast is great but crowded. Stop by early. Personnel take extra care and attention with guests. Housekeeping staff was helpful.

hotel_name: Park Terrace Hotel on Bryant Park
review_body: Well all I can say about this Hotel is WOW.... WOW.......WOW and WOW. From check in to check out outstanding. I’ve never felt safer in a hotel and I have been around the world. Breakfast simple,stylish and tasty. Other reviews say the Terrace gets busy........ my response is ‘remember it’s breakfast and for me that’s between 6 - 8’ The staff can not genuinely do enough. The stunning young lady who serves the cappuccino in the morning deserves a special mention. Hotel reception, Larissa is a fountain of knowledge. Would I recommend this hotel, definitely. I’ve already rebooked for St Patrick’s day and 2020 Christmas. The hotel is central to everything from Rockefeller, Ground Zero, Empire to the Statue of Liberty and Ellis Island. Absolutely recommend for children. Brilliant experience

hotel_name: Park Terrace Hotel on Bryant Park
review_body: Small room but cozy and comfortable. Loved all the windows in the room and the full sized toiletries in shower.Great location to bakeries, restaurants, and shopping. We will definitely stay here again.

hotel_name: Park Terrace Hotel on Bryant Park
review_body: The staff were amazing. Very friendly and helpful. The hotel room was spacious, modern and clean. The location was brilliant; just off from5th Ave and there is a subway station across the road in the park. The breakfast are a good addition. The choice was great, plenty, fresh, and good quality.

hotel_name: Park Terrace Hotel on Bryant Park
review_body: Park Terrace is a quaint boutique hotel right in Bryant Park. The location is perfect and the staff is super friendly and helpful. Awesome breakfast every morning included in your stay with the best donuts and bagels.

hotel_name: Park Terrace Hotel on Bryant Park
review_body: My family and i had a superb time at this hotel.From the moment we arrived we were welcomed friendly reception staff.We felt very comfortable because all the staff were kind and friendly. The hotel is well located and the room was a very decent size for New York standards.

hotel_name: Park Terrace Hotel on Bryant Park
review_body: Stayed at this superb hotel for a few nights and was genuinely impressed by the customer service and amenities. I travel a lot every year and have stayed in hotels all over the world and am happy to say I now have a new favourite go to place in New York. Now, I never review the hotels I stay in but here a special acknowledgement must be made and a heartfelt thank you sent to the wonderful Mr. Lobsang from Guest Services, who I had asked about a worrying message I received from UPS regarding a package I had ordered and was to be delivered before my departure but seemed it might not make it... I found this a little stressful as it was a Christmas present I had wanted to take home with me and I was already packing my bags when there was a gentle knock on my door... There, a smiling Mr. Lobsang stood, holding my package! He had decided to run to the nearest UPS sorting centre and see if he might find it. Just like that. And he did find it. I am beyond grateful and impressed and just plain happy... and I´m at a hotel, on Christmas Eve. Thankfully it´s Park Terrace Hotel. Merry Christmas!

hotel_name: Park Terrace Hotel on Bryant Park
review_body: Loved the hotel and lounge overlooking the park. The rooms were small but very clean and nice. This was my first trip to NY so I'm not familiar with room cost but seemed like a good value because of the wonderful location. The service was good and staff was friendly.

hotel_name: Park Terrace Hotel on Bryant Park
review_body: Overall the hotel is not bad. Very clean and great location in Manhattan. Our room was on the 5th floor right across from public bathrooms. We got very little sleep as we could hear people coming and going at all hours of the day and especially night. Breakfast spread is nice but every time we went there was never enough seating so we would take our breakfast back to the room.

hotel_name: Park Terrace Hotel on Bryant Park
review_body: Having just got back from a 4 night stay at the hotel:Good Points:Lovely room- felt large, modern, comfortable, light and airy. Coffee machine and bose sound system in room were a plus! Nice shampoos/ conditioners! Friendly staff- everyone, and I mean everyone, was so friendly and helpful throughout our stay! Gym- great gym! Plus sauna (ask for it to be turned on if you want to use it)Breakfast- great buffet breakfast- great selection of bagels, cold meats, cheese, donuts, fresh fruit, yogurt. The standard of food was amazing. I believe they get it in fresh from a bakery across from the hotel. You could also take breakfast away in handy take-away boxes. Great location! Metro or walking distance to all tourist attractions. Bad points:Breakfast seating- The only one, which was really quite annoying, was that it was hard to get a seat at breakfast without having to cram onto a table or wait after 0815. It meant we felt pressured to get to breakfast early enough to get a table I.e 0800 (maybe not always the case but could do with more seating/tables to enjoy the amazing buffet) Overall: Great hotel, thoroughly recommend and would stay again.

hotel_name: Park Terrace Hotel on Bryant Park
review_body: Good little hotel in a great location, good for a short stay, clean and comfortable room, helpful staff, good simple breakfast, room to noise but only from the door facing to the corridors, slowly elevators.

hotel_name: Park Terrace Hotel on Bryant Park
review_body: Park Terrace is located convenient to most attractions, complimentary breakfast was excellent staff was very attentive to all our needs. Wish the restaurant was fully functioning and ready for guests to use

hotel_name: Park Terrace Hotel on Bryant Park
review_body: Really enjoyed all the staff at the front desk of hotel as they were all attentive, kind and helpful but Charlie R. really stood out. From the moment we checked in, to the realization that I left my luggage at the hotel (when we returned home) Charlie was exemplary! His friendly and professional attitude throughout our stay and his “get the job done” manner in which he facilitated getting my luggage returned to me as quickly as possible like it was the most important job he had to do made me really happy with our decision to stay here. Will definitely be staying at The Park Terrace Hotel when we come back to NYC each time we visit our children there!

hotel_name: Park Terrace Hotel on Bryant Park
review_body: We found the Hotel clean and comfortable. Good location and a very nice staff. The breakfast in the morning was very good and lots of variety. Room Service was prompt. I would definitely stay here again on our next visit to New York. Thanks

hotel_name: Park Terrace Hotel on Bryant Park
review_body: NYC PERFECTION! We have stayed at hotels all over the world and country, you guys truly got it Right! Highly Recommend if your staying in NYC.Professional Staff,Rooms,Ameneties,Location,Price= 5STAR Thank you RJS

hotel_name: Park Terrace Hotel on Bryant Park
review_body: First off, the hotel itself is quite attractive.... It's in a really great location with a lot going for it.... HOWEVER..... and this really doesn't apply to everyone.... if you do not love a really really soft bed, then this place isn't for you. I am in NYC about once a month and I like trying different nice hotels and i've never had trouble sleeping like i did at this hotel. I tossed and turned all 3 nights, because the mattress had no support to it. Another HUGE problem I had, is that one night the hotel was throwing it's annual employee Christmas party in their 6th floor bar (i was on the 5th floor) and it was so loud that my room was shaking. I was up taking meetings at 5am and had to be up again at 5am, so this is an unacceptable negative for me, especially when the location of the party is in the middle of a bunch of guest rooms. I did really enjoy the breakfast and the chilled out bar atmosphere at night was nice.

hotel_name: Park Terrace Hotel on Bryant Park
review_body: As soon as me and my family arrived, we instantly loved it! Quick check in and welcoming staff. The room was bright, clean and spacious and we had great views of Bryant Park. Near the lift was a hydration area with empty bottles, ice and water which was useful and a nice added feature. The breakfast was lovely and there was a variety to eat like fruit, bagels and cheese. One morning we went outside in one of the igloos which were really cosy. Would definitely return again!!

hotel_name: Park Terrace Hotel on Bryant Park
review_body: NYC ❤️ Park Terrace Hotel I agree breakfast and location and cleanliness , near Time Square and 5th Avenue 6th Avenue and winter Village Brayant Park . The view of my window on brayant park ice rink fantastic ❤️

hotel_name: Park Terrace Hotel on Bryant Park
review_body: Stayed for 3 nights in December and found this was the best NYC hotel I’ve stayed in. We stayed in a corner studio room (2nd floor from top) which had the most magnificent view over Bryant Park. The layout of the room was brilliant – feels very large and light. It had all the bells and whistles, was meticulously clean, and the bathroom was beautiful – a practical shower and benchspace and the glass sliding door was very good for privacy (even though you’d initially think not). Beds were comfortable and well positioned and we also had the sofabed rolled out and that was a double bed and very comfortable too. The bathroom products on offer were lovely (and it is good to see they clearly point out that they are saving money by not providing little travel sizes but if you take the residential size of there products you pay – so it is nice and clear). The wardrobe is very small – takes only a couple of shirts and coats but there are enough spots to place your bag in the room. The front desk staff could not be more helpful and they delivered on every request required. They were also very quick. The breakfast room was good but very busy and you’ll need to watch your table as we got up to get another bagel but lost the table as the dirty plate was removed and someone else swooped. Somehow that needs to be sorted out. The only thing I would suggest for improvements is for some cutlery in the room – there is a wonderful pastry shop next door but if you forget a plastic knife or fork then you get to your room and you have no plate or cutlery, just the coffee cup saucer, which involves co-ordination skills. There is a bar fridge but no mini-bar.Location was ideal – Bryant park is centrally located.5 star rating and like others, this would be my ‘go to’ in NYC (and didn’t get any special prices or deals so can justify the standard price for the room).

hotel_name: Park Terrace Hotel on Bryant Park
review_body: Staff was friendly and helpful, room was modern and clean, and the breakfast was excellent. Bryant Park location was fantastic at Christmas time with the rink and market all a glow for the holidays. Conveniently located for easy walking to any of the major attractions and excellent restaurants.

hotel_name: Park Terrace Hotel on Bryant Park
review_body: great service from the staff, rooms are updated and very clean, great location across from Bryant Park. Free breakfast was very good and the same spot is open for dinner and drinks later in the evening. Prices was very competitive. I would definitely stay there again.

hotel_name: Park Terrace Hotel on Bryant Park
review_body: The room was small, to be expected, but the queen bed was too small for two. The deciding factor for your hotel was the breakfast buffet. Was impressed, but the staff was FAR FROM FRIENDLY, especially if you asked for something. On a saturday they ran out of donuts and said "ya, sorry, it was busier than expected" and didnt replenish any and this was at 9am. They are VERY quick to disassemble the buffet at the instant the clock struck 10 (10:30 on wkend) even though there were MANY dirty tables and nowhere to sit for people just walking in, I witnessed this 4 days. Being from Orlando FL, a hospitality state, You all could learn a little something about hospitality and being hospitable to your guests..even though buffet was filling snd I appreciated the togo' boxes set out..the cheapskate attitude from the staff was VERY offputting, especially since we paid $2500 for our stay.Im no cheapskate but believe in getting my monies worthnot a great holiday stay w/u

hotel_name: Park Terrace Hotel on Bryant Park
review_body: Amazing customer service throughout our entire stay. We had a clean room, extremely comfortable bed and linens, delicious breakfast, and easy check in and out. The location is perfect, quiet and safe and close to attractions. We will be back!

hotel_name: Park Terrace Hotel on Bryant Park
review_body: Excellent location, service and cleaning.We occupied a deluxe room and we missed a little bit more of space, at least for our european standards. Regarding wardrobe capacity it was not enough for two people for one week, which is what we were there.All the people there were very kind and helpful.

hotel_name: Park Terrace Hotel on Bryant Park
review_body: We had a wonderful visit at your Lovely Hotel... Everything was just perfect! I have shared with my friends about our stay and they want to come and visit you to.. We will be back in Dec of 2020 to stay agin with you. Thank you so much, Ali and Greg Kennedy

hotel_name: Park Terrace Hotel on Bryant Park
review_body: Really friendly staff, quick check in and got our room early. Not a great view but difnt care because the view for us was went out and about. Good breakfast. Comfy bed, clean rooms with daily fresh towels. Hot shower. Central to almost everything. Only down side was the lifts

hotel_name: Park Terrace Hotel on Bryant Park
review_body: We had a great time and the Park Terrace was a great hotel. The location is perfect right across the street from Bryant Park and the hotel was super clean and so comforatble. The staff was amazing. The 6th floor terrace bar with igloos was so adorable. So much fun. Great hotel to stay at while visiting NYC. we will be back.

hotel_name: Park Terrace Hotel on Bryant Park
review_body: Very nice hotel. Stayed there for the first time and would probably return. The breakfast was very nice - just not enough seats to accommodate everyone.Only negative was that we requested that our 2 rooms be in close proximity of one another - but that didn’t happen- not even close. Our rooms were on two different floors!!! I had called the evening before our arrival to check our reservation request and the person assured me that it would not be a problem. Well it was.

hotel_name: Park Terrace Hotel on Bryant Park
review_body: Very Good location. I would say that the nightly rates of the rooms are quite expensive. Not 100% value for money. But OK it's New York. I would recommend it for it's location but if this is not a your priority i would say that you can stay somewhere cheaper and save some money for other activities that you'll definitely need.

hotel_name: Park Terrace Hotel on Bryant Park
review_body: Right across the street from Bryant Park on 40th between 6th and 5th,is a great location. Lots of food options nearby, incl a Whole Foods around the corner on 6th. Hotel rooms are appointed very nicely, staff is helpful, free breakfast is delicious and varied. Ask for a room with a Park view or you'll be staring at a big brown wall.

hotel_name: Park Terrace Hotel on Bryant Park
review_body: I recently traveled to NYC for Xmas. Before coming I did extensive research to find the perfect hotel. Upon arrival on a busy Thursday afternoon there was one person working at the desk, and one elevator in service. The check in process was expedited due to the fact that I’d already checked in online, but waiting 15-20 for an elevator to get to my room was painful. There was no bell man to help with my bags or even open the front door when I arrived. Once I FINALLY made it to my room, I was disappointed with the layout and the view. The tv stand was in the middle of the room, which made the room seem much smaller, and the view was of the office building across the street not of Bryant Park as the website had said. The bed was not very comfortable either. Thankfully we didn’t spend much time in the room. I was also disappointed in the fact there was no room service. There is a restaurant on site, but no way to order food or drinks to the room. I even used Uber to order food one morning. The food was delivered to the front desk, but the front desk never brought it to my room or called to let me know it was available. Also, the rooftop bar is small with only 2 igloos available. Overall my experience at this hotel was awful, and I would not recommend anyone booking their stay here.

hotel_name: Park Terrace Hotel on Bryant Park
review_body: Unfortunate our stay was not better. Great location for the hotel looking out over Bryant park but more info on when elevator was to be fixed and without asking, compensation for this issue should have been offered, even it was just a drink on the 6th floor.

hotel_name: Park Terrace Hotel on Bryant Park
review_body: I was really excited to book this hotel based on the glowing reviews. We actually cancelled another reservation to book here. Upon arrival, we checked in to our deluxe room and it was ready early- that was a huge plus. However, we then waited over 10 minutes (no exaggeration) for the elevator. There are 2 elevators servicing the entire hotel and we weren't sure if 1 was out of order. We had somewhere to be and simply needed to change our shoes in the room and drop our luggage and we were almost late in getting out because of the elevators. Needless to say the rest of the weekend we took the stairs only. Luckily we were on the 3rd floor so it was easy to just go up and down via the stairs. The room was fairly small and the mattress was horrible. We barely slept the entire night because of how uncomfortable we were. Also, queen size mattresses, really? I think for over $600/night there should be a king mattress. The bathroom was well appointed, and I liked the lay out. Great lighting on the mirrors and the toiletries were very nice. The in room Nespresso machine was also a nice touch. Sunday morning we walked up to the 6th floor to check out the breakfast. The breakfast is a good option if you want to eat 2,000 calories and feel sick after. Hardly any choices for someone eating healthy. Croissants, bagels, donuts, babka, cookies and the list goes on. There were hard boiled eggs, out of season fruit and some yogurt at the end. I can't eat dairy so really I was left with a hard boiled egg. Also, the line was insane (at around 815am) and there were no tables whatsoever. We grabbed a coffee and went back to the room. I am glad it was free and we did not pay extra for it. Take a walk outside and you'll find tons of amazing healthy breakfast/brunch options. We went to check out at the normal time (12pm) and had to wait for the elevators because of our luggage. Again, a 10 minute wait time and then when it got to the 3rd floor, it was 100% completely packed in like sardines. I literally squeezed in our luggage to the brim of the elevator and then my partner & I took the stairs and met the elevator down in the lobby to get our luggage out of it. Really strange elevator situation for such a large hotel going with 16 floors. I don't mind waiting a few minutes, but over 10 minutes is unacceptable. The real problem here though was that they charged me twice and still have yet to rectify the situation. When I checked out, I told them that I was already charged on my credit card. It was not a hold- it was an actual charge which I showed them on my Chase credit card statement. She said that I would be charged again for a different amount (slightly lower) and that the other charge never went through. Obviously that was not the case. We already had a pending $650 "hold" plus a charge for our room stay. Then she was trying to charge me again. Of course, she was incorrect and I was charged twice for the same room. So essentially the hotel charged me over $1,500 between duplicating the room charge plus the hold. I am still waiting on my refund. I called 4 days after and the woman told me the manager will "hopefully" get to it that day. I demanded he take care of it immediately as this was unacceptable to be charged $1,500 for a 1 night stay that should have been under $600. If my refund isn't processed by tomorrow, I will be calling Chase and reporting them as fraudulent. A real headache of a situation that could have been completely avoided had the front desk staff been competent. Needless to say, we will not be back. We'll stick with the Loews Regency near Central Park which is always our go to and we never have any issues with.

hotel_name: Park Terrace Hotel on Bryant Park
review_body: Very nice hotel with all the amenities you may need. The room was very clean and updated. This was the biggest room I have had at any hotel in New York thus far. Short walk to Rockefeller center, Times Square, ect.

hotel_name: Park Terrace Hotel on Bryant Park
review_body: A stay in this hotel very well located just 40th and corner 5th Avenue.. People are nice, the hotel is clean and offers a lot of special plus. We enjoy every minutes. The hotel is safe as we need the key tu use the elevator.

hotel_name: Park Terrace Hotel on Bryant Park
review_body: Our great experience at this hotel began at check-in. The young woman behind the desk with long brown hair who lives in NJ - I wish I could recall her name - was efficient and professional while being warm and friendly. She made us feel welcomed and appreciated. Our room on the 11th floor was immaculate and nicely appointed. With soothing colors and a modern decor, as well as floor-to-ceiling windows and a higher ceiling, the room felt light and airy as well as comforting and cozy... a private nest in the middle of the metropolis. We didn't get a chance to use the in-room Keurig, but I loved the "hydration station" by the elevator, offering refillable plastic bottles and a water dispenser. I filled one bottle four times. Free and smart amenity. And in the room we enjoyed a complimentary bottle of orange soda and a bag of slightly sweet and cripsy kettle corn. The bed was comfortable and the bedding was higher end. We slept soundly and the room was quiet. The next morning we enjoyed the breakfast buffet that's included with the room. We noshed on high-quality continental breakfast foods. I especially liked the carrot juice with ginger option. The location was perfect. Across the street from Bryant Park with its Winter Village, next to the NYC Public Library, just a few blocks walk to Rockefeller Center, and short walk to Grand Central.In sum. we were completely delighted with our experience at Park Terrace Hotel and will definitely stay there again.

hotel_name: Park Terrace Hotel on Bryant Park
review_body: The location of the hotel is great. I loved the rooms. Good size for Manhattan and the area. Liked the app and anticipated checkin through the app. Did not have time for the breakfast, but great it was included. Nexpresso machines in the room, so do not forget your pods is you like a special brew. Great complementary popcorn and an orange soda. Liked it very much.

hotel_name: Park Terrace Hotel on Bryant Park
review_body: Friendly, helpful staff, ideal location with a lovely bar/breakfast bar overlooking Bryant Park with cute igloos on the terrace. Rooms reasonable size for NYC and snacks in the room on arrival. Some nice touches that made our stay very enjoyable.

hotel_name: Park Terrace Hotel on Bryant Park
review_body: Very nice hotel located just above Bryant Park.Rooms are quite big, very clean.Bathroom is suuper clean.Very good breakfast was available at the bar.Bar can has an outside terrace with igloo that can be used also in the winter time.

hotel_name: Park Terrace Hotel on Bryant Park
review_body: I was so excited to stay at the Park Terrace Hotel. The concierge staff was welcoming and accommodating, but the room support was awful. I am still waiting for someone to come and pull out my sofa bed. Bathroom tile was cracked and caused me a big scar on my leg.

hotel_name: Park Terrace Hotel on Bryant Park
review_body: A very good hotel to stay. Location is ideal for Manhatan lovers. Very clean room. Very helpfull team. Good breakfast. (No tomatos. The reception gave us option for late check out (Shana!). But they added 50 $ without tell us. It took 10 days to correct the mistaken acount: much too long. It did not spoil the very good impression of the stay!.

hotel_name: Park Terrace Hotel on Bryant Park
review_body: We had a well-appointed room that was spacious for Manhattan and had a nice angled view of Bryant Park. The complimentary breakfast was very nice and the staff were attentive. This was a great spot for business in midtown.

hotel_name: Park Terrace Hotel on Bryant Park
review_body: My wife and I travel to NYC quite often, and were excited to book Park Terrace for her 50th birthday. We booked three rooms total and paid for our adult kids to join us for a weekend celebration. On balance, the price was decent, the continental breakfast is nice (but seating is limited), and the location cannot be beaten. The downside? It has two elevators and one was down all weekend. I use a wheelchair, which meant waiting times of 15 minutes or longer, or having to catch the lift on its way up before it filled up going down...and then being stuck in a crowded elevator that stops on every floor. It was not a good experience, and with multiple other hotel options at the same price point around the area, I am not sure we would consider this hotel again. That's unfortunate, because in general it was not a bad experience, but you don't want to waste 30 minutes every day - as a business traveler or tourist - dealing with a broken lift, or going up 6 flights of stairs or more.

hotel_name: Park Terrace Hotel on Bryant Park
review_body: Advertised as a “refuge at a luxury address”. FALSEOne of two elevators not working so the wait time for one was ridiculously long. Walked up 14 flights of steps a few times because the elevator never came or because the line for the one elevator was out into the lobby. The staff showed us another set of elevators to use but using them also required using a few flights of stairs.The breakfast area was very chaotic. There is not enough room for everyone to sit down and eat. If you do get lucky to sit and eat it is with other travelers. I paid a premium for three rooms for my family and would have liked to have shared breakfast with them. I’m pretty sure the beds were a full size and not queen. Very small.Shower leaked out into bathroom. The bathrooms are very small so the water was everywhere.All of these frustrations were relayed to the front desk and all I received was “ We are very sorry”Won’t be back. Sorry doesn’t cut it for the amount of money spent to stay there.

hotel_name: Park Terrace Hotel on Bryant Park
review_body: Great location, wonderful breakfast and bar (although it'd be nice if it were open later), helpful and friendly staff. Clean, tiny room. Closed the curtains to hide the view into office building windows. Alas, the elevator conked out on our second night. Had to climb 7 flights. Hope that gets fixed.

hotel_name: Park Terrace Hotel on Bryant Park
review_body: It is a small and simple hotel but in a great location. Breakfasts are American style (bread, jam, cheese, jelly) but high quality!! Various exquisites!! And you can take it with your pet!! The only thing I didn't like was they say and promote that they have La Colombe Coffee, which is from a very good coffee shop, but they charge you extra if you want one... It would be more courteous if it is include in the room price. On the other hand, the mattress is not Queen, it is full size, a litter small for a couple.

hotel_name: Park Terrace Hotel on Bryant Park
review_body: Terrible hotel - one of the worst stays in memory from a regular business traveler. To begin with, on one of the busiest weekends of the year, one of the two elevators was out of service the entire weekend. Totally inexcusable. Second, there is no lobby and no restaurant/room service. They do offer a complementary continental breakfast but there are not enough seats, let alone tables, to accommodate the guests. Very poor. The rooms are quite small - perhaps the smallest room I've ever stayed in, and the bed is NOT a Queen as advertised. At best it's a Full. Complete rip-off.

hotel_name: Park Terrace Hotel on Bryant Park
review_body: I think this is a very good hotel, and it's convenient to the Theaters and Grand Central. My room was clean, comfortable ,and modern. The price was very reasonable. At the time I stayed there, the hotel quoted an all inclusive price - no added, disguised "resort fee" lumped in with the taxes. The included breakfast buffet was the best I've seen as a freebie; and you can eat in very pleasant surroundings inside and, weather permitting, out.

hotel_name: Park Terrace Hotel on Bryant Park
review_body: We had a great time at the hotel over the weekend and only a few minor things stood out as strange to us: The hotel had only 1 elevator in operation on Saturday and Sunday that made for long wait times and very crowded conditions. I would have thought this repair would be something VERY fast given its holiday time in NYC. Only other suggestion would be for an in-room small fridge.

hotel_name: Park Terrace Hotel on Bryant Park
review_body: The good: Very clean, staff are nice and accommodating. Location, location, locationThe average: size of rooms are what you would expect in NYC, elevator speedThe bad: Piped in scent in the lobby, unless you get to breakfast at 8am, chances are you won't get a seat, coffee is burnt hot, breakfast set up needs to be changed due to high volume of peopleOverall for us it's about it being clean and you can't beat the location.

hotel_name: Park Terrace Hotel on Bryant Park
review_body: Across street from Bryant Park on 40th between 5th and 6th. Staff is well trained and friendly. Room and bathroom is new and large for the City standards. Good, free breakfast and free snacks in the room

hotel_name: Park Terrace Hotel on Bryant Park
review_body: Certainly very impressed with the service. A staff of excellence and super grateful for the kindness of all . Great location , modern and very clean . New and clean rooms . Good quality of amenities .

hotel_name: Park Terrace Hotel on Bryant Park
review_body: Perfect location for shows, shopping, Emoire State. Breakfast is delicious and service was great. They even had Magnolia bakery cupcakes waiting in our room for my daughters birthday. Would definitely stay here again!

hotel_name: Park Terrace Hotel on Bryant Park
review_body: Park Terrace Hotel on Bryant Park turned out to be a very pleasant surprise. For NYC, the room was very spacious, had a GREAT bathroom and even provided a space to relax with a small couch and table. The staff was incredible - remembering names and room numbers for guests. Additionally, hotel staff with some printing that I required for an event.

hotel_name: Park Terrace Hotel on Bryant Park
review_body: Super friendly staff, perfect central location just off 5th avenue, rooms nice and clean. Breakfast is good but not the best layout for being able to sit and eat which is the only downside to this hotel

hotel_name: Park Terrace Hotel on Bryant Park
review_body: Only two elevators and one of them out of action made for long waits. Breakfast area was very crowded. On the positive side staff were excellent and even on the third floor street noise was not an issue. Location at Bryant Square and close to 5th Avenue is a big plus - the former for getting to the hotel from JFK (F train) and for shopping.

hotel_name: Park Terrace Hotel on Bryant Park
review_body: We enjoyed our stay at the Park Terrace. our room was a Deluxe High Floor on the 8th , facing West 40th with views of Bryant Park. The singular defining quality of the Park Terrace would be the quality and professionalism of the staff, especially reception.The hotel itself is of a reasonable quality, the rooms are on the smallish side, but reasonably well appointed. The bed was luxurious and cosy , the room however does need a bar fridge. I think too much room is wasted on the sofa and table.A nice big flat screen TV with WIFI that was fantastically fast and FREE. Showers and hot water were also very good.The hotels location is excellent, close to everything and the 42nd st subway. I was sceptical about the breakfast, but while only a continental breakfast it had a wide choice of food and drink, all of which were delicious.The rooms are well soundproofed with very little if any intra room noise. Noise in the hallways does however easily enter, but there is little traffic so it’s not a nuisance. A word of caution though, Our room was facing onto Bryant Park, the Bryant Park Restaurant had a band playing on our final night... very noisy, but they stopped playing at 9pm.... very little if any street noise entered the room.What we liked about the staff was that they we’re unfailingly polite and nothing was too much of a problem. Their professionalism was on par with the Four Seasons in Hong Kong which we visited a few months ago.The hotel is expensive, but most N.Y. hotels are, and not having been in NY for a very long time its difficult to compare apples with apples, however we did stay at the Nadler , Covent Garden the week before. Both hotels are very similar, with the Nadler having slightly larger rooms. My conclusion is that the Park Terrace is good value for New York. It is in a very good location if your a tourist. It is very clean , has exceptional staff, good management and great technology.The big negative from our perspective was that one lift was out of action for the majority of our stay, which was irritating and meant that I rated the hotel a 4 rather than a 5.

hotel_name: Park Terrace Hotel on Bryant Park
review_body: I’m so glad we found this hotel! First, the location is great! Second, the bathrooms have AMAZING lighting. The standard rooms are pretty small, but standard sized for nyc. They left complementary gourmet popcorn and orange soda which was a nice touch. Another thing that was awesome were these water stations that they had outside of the elevators. You grab one of the bottles and just refill it whenever you want. The gym is ok, but they have a sauna which is awesome, and all rooms have yoga mats and they offer classes as well. Complimentary breakfast is a great touch. There’s also a SUPER COOL bar upstairs that has transparent igloos on the terrace with amazing views of The Empire State Building and Bryant Park! Will definitely stay here again!

hotel_name: Park Terrace Hotel on Bryant Park
review_body: The staff was excellent, the location is perfect, the breakfast was delicious and the cafe was gorgeous, my room was clean, my sheets were super soft, the bed was very comfortable, and the workout facility was exactly what I needed. Will definitely stay here again!

hotel_name: Park Terrace Hotel on Bryant Park
review_body: My flight got delayed and I landed at 2 a.m ... someone was waiting reservation intact and room on the ready. Great room ...small but super well designed and great staff. Great location opposite Bryant Park ...Totally repeatable
user_name:
rajivchan
New York City, New York

hotel_name: Park Terrace Hotel on Bryant Park
review_body: We enjoy going to NYC 2-3 times year for food, shows and shopping. This has become our favorite spot. You walk across the street to Bryant Park and avoid the chaos of being near Times Square. The staff is always friendly and efficient. They just added little igloos so you can sit outside and have a drink in the winter. Highly recommend!

hotel_name: Park Terrace Hotel on Bryant Park
review_body: I usually stay at a hotel to get hotel points... I loved this Boutique hotel! Loved the staff! Bryant Park location is magical during the holidays,. I will definitely stay here on my next trip to New York City..

hotel_name: Park Terrace Hotel on Bryant Park
review_body: Great location close to subway lines, Bryant Park, Times Square, Grand Central and UN. Rooms were totally clean with comfortable beds. Staff was amazingly helpful and friendly. The only minor negative was that I was on the top floor so the elevator would be slow at times. But a small price to pay for such a great place and great people.

hotel_name: Park Terrace Hotel on Bryant Park
review_body: Excellent location opposite to Bryant park and near timesquare and 5th avenue.Excellent Staff and service , wish to have a hot breakfast menu , i asked and according to them it will be available in February 2020. Moreover, they don't provide slippers.

hotel_name: Park Terrace Hotel on Bryant Park
review_body: Great location (close to everywhere. Walking distance to most of places) + fantastic breakfast (very nice NYC style including bagels, donuts, fresh fruites etc). All staffs are very friendly. Room was not that big, but ok.

hotel_name: Park Terrace Hotel on Bryant Park
review_body: Shout out to Jose and Jenna at the evening front desk; also all of the breakfast staff are terrific.Comfy, quiet room, as expected in size and amenities. We were in a classic for five nights. Note re the sauna: you have to call down to the front desk first to have it turned on. (But it does heat up pretty quickly.)For management: thank you for recycling. Please provide opt-out options for the daily (daily!) linen changes; totally not necessary. Ditto re bath linens. Towel bars and/or hooks would help a LOT. Otw, congrats on a great place and staff.

hotel_name: Park Terrace Hotel on Bryant Park
review_body: Very nice location, hotel cleanliness very nice, service very good, small rooms, breakfast area very small with difficulty of finding free area. poor variety of foods in breakfast and cannot find additional food when is over

hotel_name: Park Terrace Hotel on Bryant Park
review_body: The hotel is centrally located. The subway is located on the corner of 6th Avenue, very close to the hotel. Room was very accommodating and clean. Staff were very helpful. Near many attractions and directly across from Bryant Park.

hotel_name: Park Terrace Hotel on Bryant Park
review_body: This is the only place to stay. It's perfect in every way. The sheets, the amenities, the gym, the breakfast, the staff, the location. I love it so much that I have stayed there four previous times and have another trip planned there for January.

hotel_name: Park Terrace Hotel on Bryant Park
review_body: I'm a little selfish in that I don't want to share the wealth with the knowledge of this hotel. The Park Terrace Hotel , located across the street from Bryant Park/The NY Public Library, subtracted the anxiety and worry from my NYC trip. As soon as you walk in, the smell of pine trees and hits your nose and all the noise from the street disappears. Everyone was incredibly friendly and helpful. My check-in was easy even though a guest in front of me was giving a lot of crap to the girl about not having a direct view of Bryant Park... get over yourself dude, you only get a direct view of Bryant Park when you're in Bryant Park. I spent a lot of time in lounge for work and everyone was accommodating and attentive! My server was Diana and she even took the time to ask me about where I was coming from and how long I would be staying. It felt almost like being around family. Again, I could go on and on but I won't. The Park Terrace Hotel is the best hotel I've stayed at in a very long time. Bravo.

hotel_name: Park Terrace Hotel on Bryant Park
review_body: Booked a high floor deluxe room which ended up facing an ugly offce building.I am freezong in the room as I am writing this, as the air conditioning is just blowing cold air although it was set at heat over 24C all night. All we got was loud sound of the fan an occassionally zzzzz sound going on and of with some pipe hitting wierd sound from the duct. I am now using the blow dryer to warm-up!The bathroom looks clean, but not in details! The hand cream and shampoo bottles are large and obviously are being refilled and reused, with dirt on the pumping corners.No fridge! no safe! no tea, no extra blankets.I will see if this improves, but so far, terrible first night!

hotel_name: Park Terrace Hotel on Bryant Park
review_body: The good things: Great location, nice and sophisticated rooms.The bad things:1. Some of the staff are not attentive: We asked in the morning for turndown service. The result was that when we got back to the hotel at 6 PM the room was not cleaned from the day before. In addition to getting just new towels after 60 minutes wait, the fron desk did not understand what is a turndown service is and blamed us of the all mishapp instead of just apologizing. 2. The Breakfast place is too small3. Lastly: The hotel charges for storing packages.

hotel_name: Park Terrace Hotel on Bryant Park
review_body: Very nice hotel, located in front of Public Library. Very bright and clean room. Nice breakfast and very helpful and kind reception desk staff. They helped us very kindly with everything we needeed. We go two or three times a year to New York and we would come again to Park Terrace Hotel. Thank you

hotel_name: Park Terrace Hotel on Bryant Park
review_body: Great central location close to subway stations and Grand Central station, pleasant and modern architecture and design, generous breakfast included, very friendly and helpful staff (ticket reservation)

hotel_name: Park Terrace Hotel on Bryant Park
review_body: A great boutique hotel! Right across from beautiful Bryant Park! The only negative was that there were NOT enough seats for breakfast .... very frustrating for many of us. Breakfast bar was delicious and is worth it! We waited.

hotel_name: Park Terrace Hotel on Bryant Park
review_body: I come to New York regularly for business and always stay in Midtown. The Park Terrace immediately eliminated the rotation of usual suspects I'd been staying at for 20 years (Palace, Plaza, W, St Regis, Park Hyatt, Intercontinental, Waldorf back in the day, etc.) The rooms are very comfortable and provide enough room to not feel cramped (e.g. W), and the amenities are outstanding - in room nespresso and a terrific breakfast buffet are huge. The value is excellent without compromising on quality, and the service is top notch. The staff is friendly and accommodating, and were greeting me by name on my third trip. Can't say enough good things!

hotel_name: Park Terrace Hotel on Bryant Park
review_body: I have stayed at the park terrace hotel several times and simply love the location. In addition, the hotel itself, the level of service and the amenities are comparable to what you find at a New York hotel at a much higher price point. I will be back

hotel_name: Park Terrace Hotel on Bryant Park
review_body: unfortunately not even one hour late check out was possible, although the room category was available and they offered me to stay for half the price of the official rate till 5 pm. The bathroom has no heater and nothing to hang the towel.

hotel_name: Park Terrace Hotel on Bryant Park
review_body: I would highly recommend this hotel. The location cant be beat. Directly across from Bryant Park and the Library and accessible to all NYC has to offer. Service was outstanding and the amenities were great. Our new go to hotel in NYC.

hotel_name: Park Terrace Hotel on Bryant Park
review_body: Our recent stay at the Park Terrace reinforced our opinion formed during a previous stay at the hotel; basically we love it. The hotel staff is very welcoming and helpful, our room was small but well appointed. The hotel provides a simple breakfast (with very good bagels, etc.) which does get a bit crowded at times. The location, across from Bryant Park, is wonderful and the hotel is an easy walk to NY theaters. This is our favorite hotel for midtown.

hotel_name: Park Terrace Hotel on Bryant Park
review_body: Stayed there for 6 nights in last week of October to early November 2019. Location: Good access to most touristy spots. Right across Bryant Park & NY library, close to Times Square, Empire State Bldg. A convenient hotel at midtown. There is a Newark Express Shuttle across the other side of Byrant Park so easy to get to the hotel for guests taking public shuttle. (See my other review on the shuttle service)Room&Bathroom: Stayed at Premier Room but still kinda small. The premier room has a long walkaway so you can leave your shoes and bags there. Very clean. My room was on 3/F, looking at the sideway of NY library. Little view and some noises in the morning in which I found it acceptable. No bathtub, just a shower area with curtain and sometimes water might overflow. Shower water is strong and hot. There is a foldable wooden bench inside shower in case for people who need to sit down or elderly worrying the floor being slippery. Toilette belongs to Italian brand Malin+Goetz. Didnt know this brand before. I looked at the ingredients and they are of good qualities without those harsh chemicals. No razor or toothbrush. There is a filtered machine at elevator lobby on every floor and empty plastic bottles are provided for guests to refill water. Breakfast: Its on 6/F every morning. Has freshly squeezed carrot juice, supermarket quality OJ, standard coffee and some tea bags. Bagels and cream cheese come from Zucker’s. Has some cold cut, parma ham, cold hard boiled eggs, and a few types of salad veggies. Fruits include blueberries, mango, orange slices. No hot dishes. They all taste good. Has paper boxes and cups to take away if you’re in a hurry. The drawback is that there are always too many people and hard to find seats. Need to share table for most days.Front desk: Friendly, always greet guests coming back. Reliable service. I expected an important mail coming in and the front desk delievered it to my room once it arrived. The only thing I found a bit confusing was the final bill. They gave me a bill listing the breakdown of all the fees. At first I thought I got overcharged but once I calculated the total, it was the same price as listed at Agoda where I booked my room.

hotel_name: Park Terrace Hotel on Bryant Park
review_body: The hotel is clean and conveniently located. The staff are helpful and friendly. The bottled water for the rooms is a great concept. The suggestions for improvement are: offer a King Size bed option (the premium rooms was big enough for one), consistent turn down service (it only occurred 1 out of the 4 nights), pillow options, more towel racks in the bathroom (will reduce towel washing), and check the elevator programming (they are too slow to arrive).

hotel_name: Park Terrace Hotel on Bryant Park
review_body: Great overall experience. Nice restaurant and wonderful outdoor patio area.The rooms were clean and quiet. The beds were extremely comfortable. The bathroom had sleek conemporary fixtures and a well designed modern flair.The convenient location to Bryant Park, Times Square and Midtown in general is hard to beat.Simply an outstanding facility.

hotel_name: Park Terrace Hotel on Bryant Park
review_body: Brand new hotel with great service. Clean and even the basic level room was plenty of space for one person. Lighting was good. Breakfast came with room and was lovely. Also liked fitness center. Not tthe least expensive hotel around but made for an enjoyable and convenient stay.

hotel_name: Park Terrace Hotel on Bryant Park
review_body: Great boutique hotel for a couple of nights. Staff was extremely friendly, helpful, and attentive.The breakfast was nice and the patio was even nicer. The location was perfect.Would definitely recommend.

hotel_name: Park Terrace Hotel on Bryant Park
review_body: This was our first stay at the Park Terrace. Staff was very friendly and helpful from check-in to check-out. Room was small but nicely appointed. Would prefer a regular coffee maker over the Nespresso machine although we generally just got our coffee at breakfast. Nice variety of items at the breakfast buffet. I'm sure the overcrowding at breakfast eases in warmer months - it was challenge finding a place to sit down most mornings. Great location for us - we generally used the subway entrance at the end of the block.

hotel_name: Park Terrace Hotel on Bryant Park
review_body: Clean, contemporary, breakfast included (get there early), accessible to theaters, restaurants and museums. Across from bryant park , near fifth avenue so out of theater congestion . Easy walking to many venues

hotel_name: Park Terrace Hotel on Bryant Park
review_body: The hotel located in Front of Bryant park , across the street from the public library. We stayed at premier high floor room, which was nice and clean, not very big. The beds were comfortable. The highlight of the hotel is their breakfast, in a big room with warm ambiance. During our visit the breakfast room was usually full and one should need to wait in order to have place to eat. Staff were helpful and very service oriented. We order a taxi batting the airport from the front desk, it was very expensive.

hotel_name: Park Terrace Hotel on Bryant Park
review_body: I love the Park Terrace. It still has the new clean feel about it, and the staff is young and international and very helpful. The rooms are small, but I'm not in NY to spend a lot of time in my room, and it's perfectly equipped, including with a yoga mat and a nice robe. The upstairs lounge/breakfast room is great, as is the breakfast buffet, which could really fill you up for the day if you were on a budget. Really, it's just a great place if you want to be in midtown.

hotel_name: Park Terrace Hotel on Bryant Park
review_body: We had an excellent stay here--really couldn't have been better. Perfect location right on beautiful Bryant Park. We had a view of the NYC public library from our 2nd floor room which was surprisingly quiet with modern soundproofing. The room was very comfortable, clean, and modern. The included continental breakfast was simple but a very good quality--delicious bread. The best part was perhaps the friendliness of all the staff we encountered who seemed to enjoy working there and conveyed a lot of joy to us. They were especially kind to my dog. I would definitely recommend this as the perfect place for dog-owners (of course, it helps that you're right across from a park--grassy strip in front of the library). We can't wait to go back!

hotel_name: Park Terrace Hotel on Bryant Park
review_body: The Park Terrace Hotel on Bryant Park is centrally located to many NYC attractions as well as being easily reached by bus, car, or subway. The staff is exceptionally warm and friendly with a strong desire to fulfill any guest request. The rooms are modern, well appointed, quiet, and very comfortable. And to top it all off is a wonderful complimentary breakfast buffet. Can't go wrong here!

hotel_name: Park Terrace Hotel on Bryant Park
review_body: All expectations met! Upgraded to a room overlooking the library. For NYC spacious enough and a wonderful place to land at the end of the day. The staff was very accommodating and friendly. Good breakfast included although they need more seating if possible.

hotel_name: Park Terrace Hotel on Bryant Park
review_body: I don't recall staying in a hotel where everything has been thought out so thoroughly. It shouldn't be rare, but it is. The person who organized this hotel knew exactly what people care about. The stay was effortless.

hotel_name: Park Terrace Hotel on Bryant Park
review_body: Maybe I've just never paid enough before? (but generally go for the same price range). Rooms larger than American normal sizes and the room had everything needed/was well laid out. Passed my benchmark of having an iron/ironing board! Nice hot shower (to combat the cold weather outside).The one exception - and this was mentioned by another traveller - is no kettle! The world does not live on coffee alone. A large percentage of us are tea drinkers. I would have loved to have had a nice cup of tea when back in from meetings/walk out.Great view from room - overlooking NY Library/Bryant Park - and whilst it being quite active during the day outside at night it was really quiet/calm.The breakfast experience was perhaps a bit 'odd'. It was a 'continental' style i.e. not your full-on American breakfast. This was fine but the room doubles as a lounge/bar et al and not really enough places/enough tables IF you were going to judge by a conventional breakfast room. Personally i loved it as meant ended up sitting with strangers and a chance to talk but you could tell some people found it a bit uncomfortable.Bottom line, though, great hotel, in a great location. I would highly recommend and will be back.

hotel_name: Park Terrace Hotel on Bryant Park
review_body: A family member recommended this hotel to me and I couldn’t be happier with his recommendation. Not only is the hotel new, but the staff is awesome. The Terrace provides great views of Bryant Park and the bartenders are engaging and lots of fun. The hotel has a well equipped fitness room and hydration stations on each floor. The Park Terrace has become my “go-to” in NYC

hotel_name: Park Terrace Hotel on Bryant Park
review_body: A romantic and cosy placeIt is very well located, you can walk from the hotel to lots of places to see.Rooms are modern, very comfortable and the view is spectacular if you choose to be on a high level floor. The breakfast is delicious, particularly the bread (and I know what I am saying as a French woman living in Paris).

hotel_name: Park Terrace Hotel on Bryant Park
review_body: Great breakfast with bread from local bakery, coffee from le colombe, home made granola fresh fruit bagels and amazing looking donuts. Line at buffet, understandably. Only con was the elevator which is truly too slow.

hotel_name: Park Terrace Hotel on Bryant Park
review_body: Great Location. Right in the heart of the City and across from lovely Bryant Park. Clean, Comfortable and quite rooms. Loved the In room yoga with mat, and Peleton Bikes available for use. The rooftop terrace for drinks atnight and included continental breakfast is wonderful. More bang for your buck at this hotel than others I have stayed in in NYC. Will come back here!.

hotel_name: Park Terrace Hotel on Bryant Park
review_body: Overall our stay was great - the hotel is clean and there are a lot of modern updates to the space. We were celebrating our 6yr anniversary and the room decor was just perfect. The shower had dual heads (one fixed that was a waterfall shower head and one that was removable with various settings). The bed was comfy as was the couch to just relax and watch some TV after a long day of walking around in the city. There was not a fridge however, so that made us conscious not to bring too much leftovers back to the room. Great location in Bryant Park - and right across from the NYPL. One downfall is that there are only 2 elevators for the 15 floors - it could make for a little bit of a wait going up or down, thankfully we were on the 2nd floor and the stairs were easy access

hotel_name: Park Terrace Hotel on Bryant Park
review_body: New hotel with the best location, best treatment, best atmosphere. The only thing it could be better is the bed that was a little bit too small for two people.Cold breakfast was included and it is very nice.
user_name:
LuciaB B
Palma de Mallorca, Spain

hotel_name: Park Terrace Hotel on Bryant Park
review_body: Great breakfast with incredibly friendly and helpful staff! Especially fond of the square donut filled with cream (yum). The rooms are small, but very modern. My only two complaints were the elevators were slow and our towels were of poor quality the first two days, but mysteriously got plushier and longer later. Don’t know why! Also we had some issues connecting smart phone to tv but wager it could’ve been user error. Next time I believe I’ll download the app. It was an especially convenient location, and the Christmas market was right next door!

hotel_name: Park Terrace Hotel on Bryant Park
review_body: Staff were very helpful and friendly on reception and front of house. Breakfast can be very busy and lack of seats if you go at wrong time. I also thought selection was quite small, it wouldn’t stop me revisiting though.

hotel_name: Park Terrace Hotel on Bryant Park
review_body: My husband and I spent a few nights at Park Terrace Hotel earlier this week for a work-related special event. I can't say enough good things about this hotel and their amazing team - it was a perfect stay. We drove into the city with a car full of stuff, and they were super helpful unloading our car and getting everything up to our room. We had a lot of questions in preparation for the next couple of days and they went above and beyond to answer questions and make sure all our needs were met. Charlie and Rob are the especially the best - very good people! Our room was perfect - very clean, comfortable, well-designed, attractive, and well-lit, with huge windows. A sweet little arrival amenity awaited us. The room was quiet - we didn't hear traffic or other guests. The temperature was consistent and electrical outlets were easy to find and all worked(!). This hotel has a beautiful lounge where they serve breakfast in the morning, and is a bar/lounge at night. It has a gorgeous view with a fantastic furnished outdoor space that was heated! The location was perfect - we had a series of events over the days we were there, and all were within easy walking distance. We had such a great experience. We visit the city at least a few times a year - this hotel will be our new go-to without question.

hotel_name: Park Terrace Hotel on Bryant Park
review_body: Staff excellent, location great, very clean. Maybe a bit pricey but I found out NYC is expensive these days. Add a chair in the room would be useful. So take this one and enjoy New York, the city that never sleeps.

hotel_name: Park Terrace Hotel on Bryant Park
review_body: This hotel has a lot of simple upgrades that made staying there even better. The free bottles of water with refill stations on every floor were a nice touch. Great breakfast included as well. Fantastic location with easy access to the subway.

hotel_name: Park Terrace Hotel on Bryant Park
review_body: It is not often when you stay at a hotel and it is difficult to find any complaints. This was the case at the Park Terrace Hotel in all areas from the front desk reception to the clean and bright room with view of Bryant Park, to the fantastic Continental Breakfast, to the nice terrace complete with warming igloos!!! We have stayed in dozens of hotels in NYC and nothing compares in overall value. This is our new go-to destination in the city.

hotel_name: Park Terrace Hotel on Bryant Park
review_body: We stayed here 2nd week of november. The staff was very attentive and polite. The room was clean and comfortable. Had fridge, blow dryer, iron and ironing board in room and a not so great pod coffee maker in room. The bathroom had shower with sliding glass door to sleep area. If you are traveling with someone make sure you are comfortable there is no real door. Breakfast bar, as other reviewers mentioned, was carb heavy and just adequate. Though the quality of the food is without doubt good, protein consisted of cold hard boiled eggs, and cured meats. The cheese was touching the cured meats so I personally could not eat them. They offered yogurt and some fruit but no vegetables. Also, they charge you for coffee and tea throughout the day except breakfast. The elevator service is very slow at times of day.

hotel_name: Park Terrace Hotel on Bryant Park
review_body: I returned to the Park Terrace a year after my first visit when the hotel was newly opened. My first visit was so nice that I had to come back. And to my delight, my experience was just the same. The best thing is the wonderful staff who are friendly and helpful -- everyone starting at the front desk. And, of course, the complimentary breakfast buffet is plentiful and delicious. The hotel's location makes it easy to get everywhere and is just across the street from Bryant Park with its skating rink and holiday market.

hotel_name: Park Terrace Hotel on Bryant Park
review_body: Location, location, location. Perfectly located for us theatre goers or foodies who want to try everything on restaurant row. Bryant Park is clean and bustily, and walking distance to anything you need. The Park Terrace is new and fresh and filled with employees who clearly love their jobs and their hotel! Our room was plenty big with dreamy sheets and a clever bathroom. The outside terrace at the bar had a direct view of the Empire State building and Bryant Park. The breakfast was exactly what you want after a night out in NY. Espresso, fresh bagels and fruit and yogart with local honey. Try it out . We loved it!

hotel_name: Park Terrace Hotel on Bryant Park
review_body: I love staying here because it is so convenient to Grand Central, Bryant Park and Times Square. Staff pays attention to the little things -- delicious breakfast, outdoor eating area, filtered water, concierge service and always being greeted with a friendly smile.

hotel_name: Park Terrace Hotel on Bryant Park
review_body: Very friendly staff, quiet room facing the rear courtyard, nice room. Great location in walking distance of Penn Station, Grand Central Station, Broadway theatres, lots of Subway stops and restaurants. Reasonably priced for NYC.

hotel_name: Park Terrace Hotel on Bryant Park
review_body: My wife and I went for four days in New York City and this hotel was right in the middle of everything without being outrageously expensive. The breakfast was exceptional as was the adjoining terrace.

hotel_name: Park Terrace Hotel on Bryant Park
review_body: This is my second stay at the Park Terrace and it has easily become my favorite place to stay in Manhattan. The rooms are cozy & comfortable, the location can't be beat, the breakfast is AMAZING, and the staff is top notch.

hotel_name: Park Terrace Hotel on Bryant Park
review_body: On arrival 20minute wait for the lifts. No real information on the facilities particularly concerning the hydration stations. Rooms all kitted it for 1 guest not couples.Staff extremely friendly but dont give a lot of information.

hotel_name: Park Terrace Hotel on Bryant Park
review_body: This has got to be the best hotel in New York and I don’t care what anyone says. For weeks we looked forward to our trip to New York and staying here just made it ten times better. From the moment we walked in we instantly got a warm welcome and was allowed to check in early into our clean and beautiful room (1010). We had a nice view of Bryant Park with its winter village and ice skating rink. I drink A LOT of water and they provide refillable water bottles along with a cold filtered water dispenser on every floor, wow! Awesome free breakfast with a huge selection of different items, my wife and two year old loved it! The terrace is a wonderful place to relax and unwind. Wish we could’ve spent more time there but exploring the city is so tiring that we could not wait to lay in our super duper comfortable bed. Last but not least, the employees. They really make you feel like family. Not the fake we have to do this cause it’s our job kind of niceness but the genuinely warm smiles and welcoming feeling they gave us kind of niceness. Specially a gentleman named Charlie. Thank you Charlie and the whole entire Park Terrace Hotel staff for having us and making sure we had a wonderful stay in New York. We cannot wait to come back! Not to discredit other hotels but don’t waste your time and do yourself a favor, stay at the Park Terrace Hotel on Bryant Park. We cannot wait to come back!

hotel_name: Park Terrace Hotel on Bryant Park
review_body: Front View across library to buildings 2 blocks away give feeling of great spaciousness. Living area very comfortable and bright. Daylight in the ensuite!! Roomy fridge and espresso coffee machine a nice touch. Yoga mat :)

hotel_name: Park Terrace Hotel on Bryant Park
review_body: Very clean, service very good, staff excellent (specifically Jenna). It ‘s located at the corner with 5th Avenue, very close to the Library and many amenities of NYC. Maybe add a chair and bottle of water in the room would be good. Probably a bit expensive.

hotel_name: Park Terrace Hotel on Bryant Park
review_body: Took a chance on a different location/hotel and we're so glad we did. 5 night- six day visit to NYC. Staff and service is 5 star- excellent- along with great breakfast choices each morning. Rooms are new with many amenities; fitness room clean and tidy. Bryant Park area is a sweet spot. The only negative is the elevators (at times, not always) take a bit of time which can require some extra planning for meetings and/or airline, etc... A 4 star hotel with 5 star service. We'll stay here again even WITH the elevator situation but felt it's important for those who live on a tight, fast paced schedule to plan on going to your Zen place before hitting the elevator button.
user_name:
Bejaka
New York City, New York

hotel_name: Park Terrace Hotel on Bryant Park
review_body: The focus was NYC's best offerings of culture. The vibe came from the many friends and relatives of persons participating in the NYC Marathon. Many were staying in the hotel. Enjoyed the Terrace for an excellent breakfast. The room was carefully designed to fit in all details that matter.

hotel_name: Park Terrace Hotel on Bryant Park
review_body: This hotel next to Bryant Park has a perfekt walking distance to many popular NY attractions. The staff is exceptional, with service above expectations, and the breakfast was really fantastic. Recommended!!!

hotel_name: Park Terrace Hotel on Bryant Park
review_body: Check-in and out was easy, the staff were friendly and efficient and the room was a good size. Everything was new and clean. The showers were great and the beds were comfortable. The hydration stations on each floor were a lovely touch. Breakfast was fantastic. There was a bit of an issue with space/waiting times and the hotel was adding more rooms, so I imagine they’ll need to look into this as the expand. There was such a wide range of fresh food with lots of healthy options (and not so healthy, but delicious looking donuts, which my boyfriend enjoyed greatly!). I can’t eat dairy and most staff were good at highlighting what did and didn’t contain it but I think they could all have been more aware of the procedure. Although, maybe that’s because it was all still quite new.The location is fab. There’s easy access to the subway, although we walked to most places as we like to take in the sights as we explore! If we were returning to New York we would stay again. Thank you for such a lovely stay!

hotel_name: Park Terrace Hotel on Bryant Park
review_body: Park Terrace Hotel in New York is so centrally situated, the rooms are a good size, very clean, with proper bathroom, & the staff are friendly & so helpful. Love the rehydrating cupboard near the lift on each floor, & the breakfast was plentiful & fresh& delicious

hotel_name: Park Terrace Hotel on Bryant Park
review_body: This is a great hotel! I stayed there this October for a 5-nights stay and enjoyed every bit of it. What a great service!From the start - I've arrived on 7AM after a red-eye flight, and my room was ready, even though check-in policy is only from 3PM onwards - It was such a nice surprise! The room itself was very nice, great bed, great bathroom and perfect for me - everything was just new and good.Breakfast was also very nice and tasty - but I would suggest add some healthier options such as vegetables, and more seating options as it can be a bit crowded inside and the lovely terrace isn't always an option (due to weather).I really enjoyed my staying and I would to return in the future - sooner rather than later!

hotel_name: Park Terrace Hotel on Bryant Park
review_body: Very well situated just in front of Bryant Park. It is not necessary to take the metro to visit the main attractions of New York Breakfast room too small not enoug table for the guests in the morning.

hotel_name: Park Terrace Hotel on Bryant Park
review_body: Great location near Bryant Park. Wonderful studio with view of Bryant Park. Staff was nice. Room was clean. I would return to this hotel. Indeed, I already booked a room for a few months from now. Other positive reviews are accurate.

hotel_name: Park Terrace Hotel on Bryant Park
review_body: Really lovely stay at the Bryant Park Hotel. Very friendly and helpful staff, breakfast buffet included is a great way to start the day and get exploring. Location is second to none and the rooms though small (as all in NYC) were plenty big enough, clean and stylish with comfortable beds and good shower.

hotel_name: Park Terrace Hotel on Bryant Park
review_body: We had a very good experience with the Park Terrace on Bryant Park. Perfect locations, nice room, fine complementary breakfast, friendly and helpful staff. While back in New York we will stay her again.

hotel_name: Park Terrace Hotel on Bryant Park
review_body: Perfect location as a base to see all the sights of NYC.Newly built, very efficient design with small but perfectly comfortable rooms. Dreamily comfortable beds, calm decor and immaculate housekeeping. Breakfast was generous and a big bonus.Staff in reception were great, very friendly and reliably efficient.Thoroughly recommend this hotel...

hotel_name: Park Terrace Hotel on Bryant Park
review_body: Can't say enough about what a great find this place is. A few of the upper Premier rooms have a counter in the middle of the room with a rotating TV that separates the bed area from the couch, which was very nice. Ours was #1509. Only a partial view, but a great layout. Great bed & shower, top quality cold buffet breakfast in a cozy room or out on the adjoining rooftop terrace. Special shout outs to George, Jose, Gabriela and Jenna, each of who provided some exceptional service.

hotel_name: Park Terrace Hotel on Bryant Park
review_body: The hotel was exceptional. Quiet, beautiful rooms with comfortable beds. Excellent service, great buffet breakfast and lovely night lounge/bar scene. The location was great for getting subways or a train at Grand Central, which was 2 blocks away. Bryant Park is across the street with ice skating and night-time winter market. The rooftop bar has a great outdoor area for viewing the Empire State building and NYC skyline.

hotel_name: Park Terrace Hotel on Bryant Park
review_body: I have chosen this hotel from many and i could not wait to go and find out, as reviews were great. I am already recommending this hotel to all my friends ! I loved the concept ( everything had common sense !!) All mentioned before me many times. Once again i would like to mention the TEAM !! CharlieRandyShannaLarrissaJennaJoseLobsongThe Terrace bar and breakfast teamI was lucky to find it, as i was lost and rejected so many hotels.Everything was delivered, as promised. I can not wait to go to NYC again and again and will only stay at PART TERRACE !! It was exactly what i was looking for. Thanks again guys !!! Miss it badly ! Both : NY and my stay with you.I am Russian, lived in London for 20 years and worked in Mayfair. I am well travelled and was lucky to stay in many good places, but it is something special about this place and NY is FASCINATING ! BEST CITY IN THE WOLRD ( sorry London !! i am a big fan, but NY !! NY !!! gives you thrills !!! ) Thanks again From a Russian, with love !!

hotel_name: Park Terrace Hotel on Bryant Park
review_body: This hotel is one year old so I'm writing this with the hopes it will improve. It's in a great location and has a good breakfast included so there is hope, but there were lots of little things that would make me stay elsewhere next time: -only one of the two elevators appeared to be working this past weekend which meant very long wait times. -Duvet on the bed is very thick so I asked for a regular blanket around 10:45pm - it arrived about 30 minutes later and only after a second phone call to reception. -All 4 pillows in my room were very soft and thin and became the width of the sheet when laying on them. They delivered what I'd consider a real pillow (just one) after my call for this. -They say the bathrooms are marble but my shower appeared to be more of a plastic insert. There was already a crack at the bottom and the door did not seal well so the floor was flooded after each shower. -Housekeeping knocked on my door in the morning and woke me up despite my having the do not disturb sign up. I saw her in the hall later and she apologized but...? -I was on the 11th floor and did not hear street noise. I had inconsiderate guests on my floor that allowed the doors to slam, but that can be anywhere. -Hair dryer had only one setting - low - and would have taken hours to dry my hair. I went outside each morning with wet hair. Also, the way the plug is configured in the bathroom meant it would not fit and you have to blowdry in the bedroom area.-many TV channels showed static and would freeze-Wifi in my room was poor-I had a refrigerator in my room but I found out after leaving a sandwich in it that it wasn't actually working.-Nothing about the hotel was explained to me upon check in and i found out details only on check out when airing my complaints (which the staff was completely indifferent to)- apparently there is a "guest closet' that has extra blankets, etc that you can help yourself to and the popcorn and soda that was sitting on the desk was complimentary. I'm not sure how I was supposed to know any of this. Absolutely nothing was told to me on check in.My stay was frustrating enough to go elsewhere next time - too many good hotels in NY.

hotel_name: Park Terrace Hotel on Bryant Park
review_body: My wife and I chose the Park Terrace Hotel based on the location at Bryant Park for our anniversary weekend. We were not disappointed with our choice. I have no doubt that once the restaurant is completed this hotel will be a great place to return to. The only grip we had was that the elevators are painfully slow.

hotel_name: Park Terrace Hotel on Bryant Park
review_body: From fist hotel visit while planning my event to final check out, everything was handled above expectations. Staff was fabulous, knowledgeable and professional, while providing personal care to each of my guest. Joeann LaMadrid was on top of every task and turnaround was in no time. Every detail was handled marvelously!!!!

hotel_name: Park Terrace Hotel on Bryant Park
review_body: Perfectly located for us. Room was a decent size. Staff was friendly and the breakfast was great. Loved having the smart TV and Nespresso machine in the room.The only negative is the elevators take forever.

hotel_name: Park Terrace Hotel on Bryant Park
review_body: Great location. Great staff. Great rooms. Everything was great about this hotel. The staff was friendly, the breakfast was really good and they even had boxes for food to take out if you are “on the go”. The roof top was amazing and they even had igloos. Loved every part of this hotel. I looked forward to comeback to my room everyday.

hotel_name: Park Terrace Hotel on Bryant Park
review_body: Great location, room was quiet, staff always friendly and helpful, and breakfast very intriguing. Midtown was perfect location, and next to Bryant Park made it handy for many subway locations. Would return again.

hotel_name: Park Terrace Hotel on Bryant Park
review_body: I would visit this very clean, stylistic hotel, again. The breakfast was so good! Everything you need. Conversed with other guests from Europe. The mattress was superb, and I slept very well. AC was quiet

hotel_name: Park Terrace Hotel on Bryant Park
review_body: My new favorite hotel in Manhattan.Super new, very cozy and comfortable. Staff polite and always ready to help.A special thanks to Gabriela who send us a special card and cakes for our 10th anniversary celebrations. She speaks Portuguese as well. It was an amazing experience.

hotel_name: Park Terrace Hotel on Bryant Park
review_body: Everyone was very helpful and pleasant and the rooms and breakfast room was great,the terrace was one of the highlights that we enjoyed in the evening. the heaters and seating were great. It did not hurt that the weather was very mild.The only complaint would be the rush in the morning for breakfast. It was not always possible to find seating. We lucked out and were on the 6th floor so we could easily go to our room.
