hotel_name: Park Terrace Hotel on Bryant Park
review_body: We were visiting New York several times before in other hotels and for sure this is the best that we’ve chosen.Confortable bed,completely new room,high quality amenities in the toilet Breakfast was included and all the products were excellent:fresh squeezed juices,delicious bagels,donuts,etcPlus,nespresso machine in the roomWhat else?

hotel_name: Park Terrace Hotel on Bryant Park
review_body: My wife and I have traveled to Manhattan a few different times over the years and always stayed at different hotels in midtown. Park Terrace is by far the best we’ve ever stayed at. It has a very friendly and helpful staff and a comfortable lobby. The rooms are modern, updated, and relatively spacious compared to other venues we have stayed at. There is also a complimentary hydration station on every floor near the elevator where you can grab a bottle of water any time. The complimentary breakfast is on the 6th floor and is absolutely top notch - bagels, pastries, donuts, prosciutto, cheeses, Greek yogurt, hard boiled eggs, juices, etc. The spread is amazing. Upon check out we overlooked a shopping bag we had checked and were halfway home before realizing it. We called back and they located the missing bag and shipped it back to us, mailing it the same day. Outstanding service. You can see how many reviews I do (just 4 reviews in 9 years) so you know I’m serious when I say you can’t go wrong staying here.

hotel_name: Park Terrace Hotel on Bryant Park
review_body: We booked the hotel about 6 months prior to our trip. Back then the website had different names for room categories. We booked a deluxe Park View room for 7 nights at A$800 per night which is a very expensive hotel room even for NYC.So we kept an eye for a cheaper option and 2-3 weeks before travel we checked Park Terrace again and the room options had changed and now this new term Studio View room was introduced and the previous Deluxe with a View was removed. But now the deluxe Rooms were the smallest room option and then there was Premiere Room and Premier High Floor option at $200 less per night from what we had booked for Deluxe View. So we decided to book our trip again and booked the Premiere High Floor expecting that they would still have a few Park facing rooms in that category. We messaged the hotel requesting “it would be great if they could give us a park facing room on a higher floor”. To which they replied they’ll try but can’t promise. At the time of check-in they said they had given us a room on level 9 and doesn’t have any view. Which was disappointing. Our room had a lot of large windows but they were pointless as they all faced other office buildings with direct view at peoples desks and their office lights on all night. The space between our windows and their desks was about 15 feet :(The hotel was kind enough to move us to a room with a partial Park view on day 2 but again it fully faced a brick wall with just a hint of a view if you go to the windows and look to your side. Well I guess something better than nothing. Other disappointing factors were that the 40th Street which the hotel is on was always fully blocked with traffic because one lane was completely occupied with construction material for the Bryant Park Christmas Market Installation. The whole park was jam packed with shops and an ice rink coming up soon. Good part: The Hotel is new and is well designed. They offer a good buffet breakfast with some great donuts. The only thing missing in that breakfast is hot egg options like scrambled eggs. Made to order eggs would be ever better but not offered at the moment. Best part. They have water filling stations on all levels and we can just grab an empty bottle and fill it up. This helped us save on buying water. All the staff is great. They are welcoming and friendly. Conclusion: If you want to have the Park View you have to shell out the big bucks and grab the Studio View rooms. Any other rooms and you will be facing the wall of another building/Zero view. P.S: The Hotel is only 15 floors which is very short for NYC midtown. Anything above level 7 is considered high floor as per the hotel.

hotel_name: Park Terrace Hotel on Bryant Park
review_body: Nice hotel in a great location. Reasonably priced extras including a constant, free drinking water supply. Good breakfast although more seating is needed at peak times when the weather prevents use of the terrace.

hotel_name: Park Terrace Hotel on Bryant Park
review_body: Great staff great location Beautiful hotel . this hotel is across the street from Bryant Park and the New York public library. It has two subway stations within a block of the door. It is within walking distance of Times square. It has two drug stores two blocks away. There is a Whole foods across the square. If you enjoy walking you can walk down fifth ave to Central Park. Close to everything but out of the hustle and bustle. We loved this place.

hotel_name: Park Terrace Hotel on Bryant Park
review_body: I stayed at the Park Terrace Hotel during a work trip and I appreciated the cleanliness of the hotel, the friendly staff, and the fabulous and healthy breakfast included in my stay. The breakfast had the standard assorted "carbs" but they also had hard boiled eggs, plain Greek yogurt, granola, and fruit (as well as sliced meat and cheese). It's so hard to eat well when traveling, but I was very happy with my hard boiled eggs and Greek yogurt. Thank you!

hotel_name: Park Terrace Hotel on Bryant Park
review_body: This is my second stay in the last four months. Well, action speaks louder than words.Nonetheless, here are my likes:1. Convenient location.2. Good condition.3. Nice decor.4. Good service.Enjoyed the high quality breakfast too, although would prefer to have hot oatmeal and some daily variation.

hotel_name: Park Terrace Hotel on Bryant Park
review_body: As the name of the hotel suggests, great location with a view of Manhattan's Bryant Park. A new construction hotel with modern updates, great rooftop lounge/restaurant with outdoor terrace as well as complimentary breakfast for guests every morning

hotel_name: Park Terrace Hotel on Bryant Park
review_body: This was my first visit and I wanted to find a go to hotel when I visit my company’s NY office. I think I found it on the first try. Thanks to Shanna at the front desk I got an upgraded room. The rooms are small but fine for short work related visits. Room 2009 was relatively quiet and offered a comfortable bed. Very nice breakfast buffet on the 6 th floor starting at 7 am which is included.

hotel_name: Park Terrace Hotel on Bryant Park
review_body: Very well located, great breakfast and nice rooms. USB ports in room for charging phones etc are really useful. Try to go to breakfast before 8:30 as the dining space is quite small and there can be a wait for lifts at peak times. Some road noise but no more than you'd expect from a city centre hotel.These are pretty minor gripes and overall we felt we'd made a really good choice of hotel.

hotel_name: Park Terrace Hotel on Bryant Park
review_body: I visited the Park Terrace Hotel for the first time in July, 2019 for a half marathon event. I liked the hotel so much that we decided to cancel our existing reservation at a nearby hotel for Nov. 2019 for the NYC Marathon and book at the Park Terrace Hotel. The reason? Customer service. How often do you show up to a hotel and the room is not ready an hour or more after check in? Or you make a very specific reservation for a specific type of room and upon arrival, that room is not available? Factor in the stress, excitement, and quirks of marathon traveling and those little mishaps can seem amplified. Working with Mark B. and Charlie has been painless and stress free. They have gone out of their way to block a specific room and to be understanding of all of our requests. I have no doubt that marathon weekend will be much less stressful than it has been in the past because our accommodations are locked in with no surprises. In addition, the hotel is in a wonderful location, is decorated in tranquil colors, offers a breakfast buffet, and is quiet and has everything we need.

hotel_name: Park Terrace Hotel on Bryant Park
review_body: We can honestly say that this hotel was a very big part of our wonderful first trip to NewYork City. Gabriela on the main desk was so welcoming and helpful . So personable and professional. Great rooms and great breakfast. Location is spot on between 5th and 6th Avenue. Not as high as the other hotels which made it feel more boutique. You can see empire estate building from outside eating area . Superb and thanks again to Gabriela, you really made our holiday great . We will definitely be back. The Irvine family x

hotel_name: Park Terrace Hotel on Bryant Park
review_body: I love this hotel, perfect place, beautifully decorated, clean, cool gadgets for the lights and apps like Netflix on the TV. Bed very comfy and a nice welcome gift. Breakfast was amazing as well, fresh pastries and yogurt and bread with all kinds of things on it. The outside terrace is so cool! You can see Bryant park from one side and even the empire state building from the back! The staff was extremely kind. I'd definitely stay here again.

hotel_name: Park Terrace Hotel on Bryant Park
review_body: Where do I start. From the minute we walked in the welcome was great. All staff so friendly. Raymond is an asset to your hotel. Room so clean and everything you need and breakfast fabulous and set us up for the day . Doughnuts amazing. Would not stay anywhere else in NYC. Location fabulous

hotel_name: Park Terrace Hotel on Bryant Park
review_body: This shall be our new go to NYC hotel! The location is ideal, of course. We walked everywhere...Central Park, the High Line, Lincoln Center, Broadway, etc. The rooms are spotless, new, modern. Great linens. Great bed. Great shower and fabulous toiletries. First class all the way. Staff is friendly and welcoming. The deluxe, park view room we had faced the library too and was beautiful. Sure, we had city noise...we were on the 4th floor. The size was ample and we were able to unpack quite well. The terrace on the 6th floor is unbelievable. We had breakfasts there, outside (there are heaters) all 4 days. The food is plentiful and top of the line...the best bagels, granola, cheeses, teas, pastries, etc. Quite a generous array! Hard boiled eggs and meats too. Plenty of tables inside as well as out. View of the Empire State Building outside! Amazing to relax at night there too with small plates and drinks! Or in the afternoons! The elevators were fine for us. And we walked the stairs too to work off the breakfasts! Yes, they even have to go boxes on the buffet table! A place that thinks of it all. Truly a new favorite! Already missing it and have an hour until checking out!

hotel_name: Park Terrace Hotel on Bryant Park
review_body: Small rooms, but CLEAN and comfortable. LOVE the Nespresso machine, complimentary breakfast and modern, sleek bathroom. The water station with bottles is a brilliant idea. Staff is very friendly and helpful. Nice large TV; oh so comfy bed and linens!! And full length mirrors are fab! Wish more hotels would take a leason from Park Terrace Hotel at Bryant Park. Highly recommend!

hotel_name: Park Terrace Hotel on Bryant Park
review_body: If there TA had a ten-star rating this sweet hotel would have it. I retired from customer service and the manager, receptionist, lobby help, breakfast bar, after-hour snack bar, house-cleaning, elevator help....EVERYONE IS AWESOME (givem all a raise!) The room was extremely clear, mattress perfect, sound-proofing from the street; amazing. All the wait staff were very professional, (gzzz I miss that) Walked everywhere, so close to Time Square and the subway line on the corner. Across the street the huge wonderful NY library and Byrant Park. There is another hotel with a similar name pay attention. You want Park Terrace Hotel on Bryant Park. The front of the building is very low-key there isn't a big sign. There was an issue with the thermostat, but it was corrected within minutes. THANK YOU all very much! Judy

hotel_name: Park Terrace Hotel on Bryant Park
review_body: I liked the hotel, the rooms are not too big, I would have like an option for something bigger. I liked the waterbottles and amenities. Breakfast was good, I would have like to be able to order, even at a charge an omelet or eggs.

hotel_name: Park Terrace Hotel on Bryant Park
review_body: My stay at Park Terrace Hotel on Bryant Park will be remembered forever. Excellent customer service, superb employees, everyone kind and very helpful. Breakfast buffet with fresh bagels, three types of cream cheese, fresh cut meats, other cheese, fresh fruit, and wonderful service. All included in the hotel cost.

hotel_name: Park Terrace Hotel on Bryant Park
review_body: I paid $600 plus taxes for a room (605) that was barely wide enough for the bed. Corridors and elevator atriums were cramped and claustrophobic. From an elevator conversation, I know others paid much less than I did - maybe at $250 it would be good value given the location.

hotel_name: Park Terrace Hotel on Bryant Park
review_body: Great location! Friendly staff. Negatives would be the slow lifts, took forever and small dining room meant lack of space and queues during breakfast. Worth the money paid as new hotel and amenities were excellent.

hotel_name: Park Terrace Hotel on Bryant Park
review_body: Top location great facilities I wld recommend this hotel on 40th Street in between 5th and 6th Avenues lovely eateries close by and in winter Bryant Park has ice skating rink which was being installed whilst we were there.Lovely outside area on level 6 to have breakfast or evening drinks under the heaters.Rooms spotless and staff young and happy.Wld stay there again loved it.

hotel_name: Park Terrace Hotel on Bryant Park
review_body: Very impressed on the value that I received for a relatively new hotel. The modern room amenities, filtered water and ice on every fall was a great idea. I love the modern, simple finishes and the location to Bryant Park, New York Library and Grand Central Terminal.

hotel_name: Park Terrace Hotel on Bryant Park
review_body: It was pleasant surprise. I chose a Priceline Express deal for my two nights stay in New York City and it turned out to be an pleasant experience. The room is quite modern and very well maintained. They have a nice lounge at 6th floor open to all hotel guest. Nice breakfast but could be a little crowded. The staff are polite and helpful. Will stay here again next time.

hotel_name: Park Terrace Hotel on Bryant Park
review_body: Very nice hotel with perfect location in Midtown. Breakfast incl. which is a big bonus in NYC. Nice rooms. Nice teracce when warm. Friendly and helpful staff. Breakfastroom was a little crowded some mornings. People were queueing for bagels & tables. I would prefer floor heating in bathroom.I would definitely recommend this hotel.

hotel_name: Park Terrace Hotel on Bryant Park
review_body: A perfect location for our stay in New York!! Very friendly staff and a delicious breakfast included in the room rate, what is hardly to find in New York (unfortunately there are not enough tables/seats at the breakfast room, so one has to be prepared to wait or take the food to your room. Take-away boxes are available). As well as the unlimited bottled water - we appreciated this very much. The Park Terrace will definitely be our choice for the next stay in New York!

hotel_name: Park Terrace Hotel on Bryant Park
review_body: Amazing! I travelled with my 14 year old daugther and we both loved the hotel, stylish, modern and very confortable! The staff was really kind and was always willing to help us. In rainy days, we were given ponchos and umbrellas. Their restaurant recomendations were great! I specially would like to highlight the attention of Harrinson and Rhandi, from the reception. All the facilities were really neat and confortable! We had access to a nesspresso machine in the room and hydration stations in every floor. In conclusion, we totally recommend it and would love to return!

hotel_name: Park Terrace Hotel on Bryant Park
review_body: What a gem this hotel is! Centrally located in the heart of the action (easy walk to Times Square, museums, Grand Central), yet an oasis, especially the lovely rooftop terrace with views of the Empire State Bldg in one direction and Bryant Park and the NY Public Library the other. The rooms are so well designed-modern, pristine and super comfy with divine bedding (Matouk linens). The staff and breakfast were fabulous too. This will be our go to hotel in NYC from now on. Thank you for a perfect weekend!

hotel_name: Park Terrace Hotel on Bryant Park
review_body: Everyone exceeded my expectations of service. Approachable, professional, and charming. The room was warm, cozy, comfortable and chic. Considering the location and the wonderful room, the price is well worth it. Couldn’t check out the spa but I see myself booking there in a few months when I return.
user_name:
philvergara
New York City, New York

hotel_name: Park Terrace Hotel on Bryant Park
review_body: We had a wonderful time. Gabriella at the front desk took great care of us. The staff at the breakfast buffet were very attentive. The food was more than enough and there was plenty of it and was very good. Housekeeping staff made sure that our Was very clean. They did everything they could to make our stay exceptional.The complaints are minor. There was not enough drawer space as there is only one drawer. Hot water Took a little while to heat up and he elevator was slow sometimes. The drawer space is something that can easily be remedied and not much money would be spent. At that point the room would step up in our eyes.

hotel_name: Park Terrace Hotel on Bryant Park
review_body: love the mid-town location on Bryant Park, the small but clean and comfortable rooms, the friendly service from the hotel staff and the delicious breakfast that is included with your room. Also love the fact that there are no hidden resort or amenity fees!

hotel_name: Park Terrace Hotel on Bryant Park
review_body: Excellent service, good breakfast with a nice terrace overlooking Bryant Park. Although it is only a five-minute walk from Time Square, it is a quiet and relaxing neighborhood. Grand Central Station is also a short walk away. The room was small but nice with good amenities. Will stay there again and highly recommend it.

hotel_name: Park Terrace Hotel on Bryant Park
review_body: I love this hotel - I booked room 1210 which had windows on two walls and looked out towards the library and parked. My room was so comfy - loved having a couch and the steam shower was wonderful. Breakfast is a bit nontraditional but fun, loved having a small fridge and plenty of filtered water....location is fantastic, easy to get to subway. Super clean hotel!

hotel_name: Park Terrace Hotel on Bryant Park
review_body: My check in experience was wonderful. The woman checking me in was personal and incredibly hospitable. That was the best part of my stay.I was brought a couple of cupcakes to celebrate my anniversary~ more on that later...During breakfast on the patio I was sprayed with windex from the window cleaning company. Enough so that my food and myself smelled like windex...the only answer I received was to throw my food away, get back in a now existing line of about 20 people, and wait to get another breakfast. The food itself was great: just being seemingly not cared about during this process was ridiculous. They really couldn't plan the window cleaning for a different time frame than when they know people are on the terrace eating? I also would have been much happier had I not had to now use either a plastic or hot glass for my juice...or pull a heavy door with a drunk and plate of food in my hands...waiting to ask where I should throw it away...I love wasting my time standing around repeating myself to multiple people about simple issues...Check out was very impersonal. The main issue I had with it was that I'd specifically asked a tall man for a bag containing leftovers from an amazing steak house be put in a fridge while my luggage was held for a few hours. I was assured it would be taken care of...I returned 45 minutes later because I'd realized I had forgotten my cash in my suitcase and wanted to buy some small things in cash. When I for my luggage for a minute, they brought it out of the luggage room and my food was tied around the top of the luggage...what a waste of $200 worth of steaks if I hadn't come back and asked another person to make sure to put it in a fridge. I then overheard the concierge, I remember exactly which ones, discussing signing cards and banging out the magnolia cupcake order: as though it were a factory process. Pretty much ruined my experience knowing that they feel the cards and cupcakes are a nuisance.I'd originally been absolutely planning to go back, but after the breakfast fiasco where no one cared about my time or food safety, and especially after the checkout process: I'll most likely be looking around for another hotel in the area to spend my money on every couple of months.*photos of breakfast terrace, self service breakfast line ( food was sourced from great local places, but 0 line when I arrived and 20 people wait when I had to get my food myself again), and the steaks I didn't finish that would have been unsafe to eat had I not triple checked they were refrigerated.

hotel_name: Park Terrace Hotel on Bryant Park
review_body: sruff is great, makes you feel very welcome, spacious rooms (especially compared to nyc hotel rooms), great breakfast with pastries, bagels, fruits. (only eggs are hard boiled eggs), great location!!!

hotel_name: Park Terrace Hotel on Bryant Park
review_body: Great hotel- great location, clean, welcoming, great amenities- the complimentary breakfast was amazing. They have water bottle filling stations on each floor which is think is genius and the complimentary popcorn and drink in the room is a nice touch. Really liked this hotel. I would go back.

hotel_name: Park Terrace Hotel on Bryant Park
review_body: Loved our stay in this hotel. Rooms are not large but decent size for NYC. Very clean, lovely soft towels and extremely comfortable bed. Staff are very friendly and keen to help with restaurant recommendations or any other queries you may have. Loved the breakfast although could be very busy and a little disorganised at times. The roof terrace bar was great to relax in after a very busy day sightseeing. Would definitely stay here again when we return to NYC.

hotel_name: Park Terrace Hotel on Bryant Park
review_body: A very likeable young staff in a modern Boutique Hotel. Recommendable in every aspect. From the first moment I felt at home. It‘s my place to be in New York City. Stylish but still cozy - an exquisit blend.

hotel_name: Park Terrace Hotel on Bryant Park
review_body: Nice hotel, very clean , friendly staff, great location on Bryant Park, near restaurants and subways, loved their breakfast buffet and complimentary snacks. water station is perfect after all the sightseeing in New York. We brought pizza and took it to their rooftop bar, amazing view, but not crazy about their wine selections. I would definitely come back and stay at this boutique hotel again.

hotel_name: Park Terrace Hotel on Bryant Park
review_body: We have stayed on Bryant Park for years and decided to to try this property. Park Terrace is now our new favorite. We like:- Breakfast in the lounge- New rooms- Comfortable bed- Outside terrace- Helpful staff (special thanks to Javier in the lounge)Try it! You will not be disappointed.

hotel_name: Park Terrace Hotel on Bryant Park
review_body: The Hotel was in an execellent condition, the rooms very nice and modern, bed linen perfect.. What I appreciated very much was that I could open the windows. Althought it was incredible noisy, I enjoyed the freedom to breath fresh air (at night). The staff was great,and helpful and very friendly. Breakfast, which matched my European expectations, on the terrace was healthy and emjoyable. I will come back if I have to stay around this Location in NY.

hotel_name: Park Terrace Hotel on Bryant Park
review_body: hotel location made my visit to NYC easy, breakfast was acceptable, but hotel staff don't live up to hotel standards, I guess. if can I add something, the elevator was horrible, I had to wait a few minutes up or down, and the TV services always hanging up, which made it useless.

hotel_name: Park Terrace Hotel on Bryant Park
review_body: Wanted an room with a great view of Bryant Park. Website photo gallery and room description led me to believe I'd have that with room I paid for...Deluxe with View. Room was on lower level and view wacomto windows across the street. Clean room but overall was a major disappointment

hotel_name: Park Terrace Hotel on Bryant Park
review_body: Friendly, clean and comfortable. Close to many sights and subways. Convenience features such as the hydration station and guest closet with items you may need were wonderful unexpected features. Breakfast is very busy so plan for that.

hotel_name: Park Terrace Hotel on Bryant Park
review_body: We stayed here for 6 nights this month. The location of the hotel is perfect with a view of the gorgeous Bryant Park! The room itself is a little on the small side with not much in the way of hanging space and draws, but the open view more than compensates. We stayed in a much larger room at a high-end hotel for our last night, but the view was so hemmed in that we decided the Park Terrace was our favourite. The bed linen was good quality, bed very comfortable, bathroom a good size and squeaky clean everyday. The buffet breakfast was gorgeous. Really good quality ingredients, best bagels I've had in my life! Breakfast time can be a little chaotic as there's not really enough inside seats, but if you don't mind sharing with a stranger it works out. They also have "to go" boxes and cups for you to take anything you want from the buffet to your room which is great! The staff were all really nice and friendly. We had a minor problem with our TV one night and the engineer got to our room faster than I did to sort it out. If ever we go back to NYC again, we will almost definitely stay here :)

hotel_name: Park Terrace Hotel on Bryant Park
review_body: Boutique hotel experience, right next door to Bryant Park, walking distance to all the great places: Times Square, Madison Square Garden. Shopping, shows. Big tip: frequent the Whole Foods across the street for great affordable food & enjoy it watching people in the park! The Christmas Village was being erected while we were there & should be a ton of fun. Super management & staff, very friendly & professional.

hotel_name: Park Terrace Hotel on Bryant Park
review_body: Stayed for 3 nights in Deluxe - High Floor (14th). Great location. Staff were friendly and helpful. Room was very clean and quiet. I liked that it had a little cappuccino/coffee maker, fridge and iron/board. Perfect amount of space in the room. Bathroom had good water pressure, but it took a while for the shower to warm up in the morning. I also liked the water bottle/filling station by the elevator. The Breakfast Bar was pretty good, but the layout could use some refinement. It is first come first serve and can get very crowded at certain times. The terrace is nice if the weather is decent otherwise seating is limited. I saw a few very unhappy guests there in the mornings. I think they were expecting something more elaborate. There are only two lifts, so those can get very busy and congested at times. I actually just started using the stairs when going to breakfast and when I was leaving the building. If you can't do stairs be prepared to wait. I would stay here again and think it was a good value for what I paid compared to other 4 star hotels in NYC.

hotel_name: Park Terrace Hotel on Bryant Park
review_body: Very small rooms but well equipped. Breakfast room is too little for all the customers: not enough tables and always queue from 7,30 to 9,30Cappuccino is not included and you have to pay separately. Location very good and central.

hotel_name: Park Terrace Hotel on Bryant Park
review_body: I stayed at the Park Terrace Hotel for 2 nights with my 9-yr-old son and we had a terrific stay. * STAFF: The hotel staff members were all very friendly and helpful throughout the stay, (and before when we were making our reservation). My son was absolutely delighted by the wonderful welcome gift of cupcakes, popcorn, and soda in our room with a cute hand-written note* ROOM: Room and bathroom were clean, comfortable, and well-appointed. The room was small, but it fit us just fine. Bed and linens were comfy. We loved the hand-held shower attachment. We also had a cool view of the NY Public Library and Bryant Park. Windows opened onto a cute Juliet balcony. Also, loved how there was a yoga mat in the room and streaming yoga on the TV. * BREAKFAST: Food was delicious. I agree with other reviewers that it was a bit chaotic and could use more seating, but the quality of food was great, especially since it was free.*LOCATION: Location was absolutely perfect. Close to everything, but quiet since right by the park. * AMENITIES: Gym/Peloton were great. Terrace on 6th floor had beautiful views of Empire State Building. Water stations on each floor very convenient. Yes, elevator was slow (as other reviewers have said) but didn't really bother us, or we took stairs.Overall, this hotel was a gem, and beats out nearby chain hotels for the level of amenities and service. Thanks to the staff for a lovely stay.

hotel_name: Park Terrace Hotel on Bryant Park
review_body: We came down for a weekend in the fall for a quick visit and a show at MSG. Upon arrival there was a slight misunderstanding about our room after an online booking. Larissa at the front desk immediately jumped into action and went over and above to make sure things were corrected. There will always be misunderstandings in life and it's not about the problem that occurred it's about how you correct it. I have stayed in 15 to 20 hotel a during NYC visits this was by far the best experience I have had. Breakfast included, great location, and most important outstanding staff!

hotel_name: Park Terrace Hotel on Bryant Park
review_body: We stayed on Columbus Day weekend with our toddler and our dog. From the moment we unloaded until we left the staff was courteous, attentive and approachable. Breakfast was a bustling affair with many a delightful carb to choose from, ample coffee and tea choices and seats inside and outside. Wonderful toiletries, thoughtful complimentary snacks and a hydration station. I look forward to staying again, and applaud the Park Terrace Hotel. Bravi!

hotel_name: Park Terrace Hotel on Bryant Park
review_body: Great location for business or pleasure as it is in walking distance to businesses, shopping, restaurants, 5th Avenue, Time Square, Rockefeller Center, etc. Clean, new larger rooms (compared to your typical NY properties) and great breakfast and service.

hotel_name: Park Terrace Hotel on Bryant Park
review_body: I really loved the location of this hotel and the staff was friendly, helpful and efficient. The room layout and comfort were really excellent, with a great bed, exceptional lighting including the bathroom (happy wife) and great amenities.The breakfast was really exceptional, with a great selection of breads, pastries, donuts, yogurt, fresh fruits and some meat and cheese selections. The seating area is light, airy and comfortable with great views of the library and Bryant Park. the outdoor roof top area is comfortable and inviting.The downside for us was the noise level outside our room on Wednesday night, we were in a small alcove of two rooms on the 6th floor and apparently the area outside our room (same area breakfast is in) is used for meet and greet or mixers that lasted until after 11:00 our first night. We also seemed to get a lot of light under the door so we placed the provided yoga mat in front of the door bottom and that reduced the noise and light.The following night there was no noisy party and the room was quiet and we slept like babies.

hotel_name: Park Terrace Hotel on Bryant Park
review_body: Superb modern hotel in a prime Midtown location. Easy walking distance from Midtown attractions such as Time Square, The Empire State Building, Rockefeller Centre, and Macy's. Situated directly opposite the New York Library, which is well worth a visit, and Bryant Park which is great for people watching with a hot coffee from the stalls in the park. Also close to subway links in Bryant Square and Times Square. Definitely will stay here again when in New York.

hotel_name: Park Terrace Hotel on Bryant Park
review_body: We loved the more quiet location of this hotel. Located within walking distance of so many sights!Also, the outside terrace was a great plus!The only problem we had with this hotel are the logistics of eating breakfast...the food was AMAZING! But expect a crowded wait to get your food with people “sliding” by you to get what they need. Seating may also be a problem as there are many people eating at the same time.I understand the bar seems the most logical place to put the food, but there has to be a better way so there’s better flow for breakfast.We would, however, stay at the Park Terrace again!

hotel_name: Park Terrace Hotel on Bryant Park
review_body: A colleague recommended this hotel as I needed something walking distance to Penn Station. It's a lovely hotel in a great location. The rooms were very clean and modern. The staff was incredibly friendly and fast at check in. There was also an added bonus of a free breakfast in the morning with coffee, juices, donuts, bagels and fruit. No hot food, but was a nice surprise. The room I had was very small which was fine for one person with just an overnight bag. I think two would have been a bit of a squeeze. But overall, awesome stay and I will most definitely come again.

hotel_name: Park Terrace Hotel on Bryant Park
review_body: Absolutely terrific stay in this hotel. The team was incredibly friendly, helped us a lot and took care of all our concerns. The breakfast had a great and high quality selection and was still delicious after nine days stay. Only point to mention is that there is not enough space for all breakfast guests when it's too cold to sit outside as the room is too small. The rooms are not huge but modern equipped and have everything you need. The bed was very comfortable and the served a small welcome snack. You also get free water on every level which we really liked and appreciated.Worth mentioning is of course the spectacular roof terrace with a view of the Bryant Park and the Empire State Building. We would go back anytime and would highly recommend this hotel!

hotel_name: Park Terrace Hotel on Bryant Park
review_body: This is the first time we stayed in this hotel. We will come back again for sure. The location was great since all our activities were mostly in midtown Manhattan. Congratulations to the staff, specially to Ariete and Jason in the terrazzo area.

hotel_name: Park Terrace Hotel on Bryant Park
review_body: Nice hotel overlooking Bryant Park and the New York library. Room (302) was a reasonable size had a small sofa and coffee table, small kitchenette area. Nespresso machine and pods nice. This room overlooks the small central service area and the trash, don’t bother looking out of the window. Room clean, tidy and well maintained, toiletries are Malin & Goetz so good stuff. Breakfast room was not great one the one morning I used it, lots of debris on the floor from previous diners and the table I sat at was “dangerously” wobbly. It’s is the same room in the evening and it is where the bar is located used it once before heading out, team are attentive but the place is soulless, but I guess you don't come to New York to us your hotel bar. Lifts would be the other challenge, not enough of them for the amount of traffic, waited 10 minutes once so located the stairs and took the 6 floors to the lounge!! With all of that said, I stay again well located and good team.

hotel_name: Park Terrace Hotel on Bryant Park
review_body: Nice Hotel in very convenient location next to Bryant Park. Clean, functional and sufficiently large rooms at a fair price. Breakfast is high quality but might benefit from a few more healthy option (some vegetables?).

hotel_name: Park Terrace Hotel on Bryant Park
review_body: Best location in NYC also has the best breakfast buffet. All new rooms, friendly staff and nice refill water facilities for the hot Summer days in the city.Can highly recommend this hotel to everyone.

hotel_name: Park Terrace Hotel on Bryant Park
review_body: My girlfriend and I had a wonderful stay at the Park Terrace in almost every regard. The room was clean and modern, with helpful technology like light controls next to the bed and phone-casting available on the TVs. Likewise, the view was great and the bed was incredibly comfortable. The Terrazzo outdoor lounge is a really great space and perfect at this time of year, with views of Bryant Park and the Empire State Building. A few issues with our stay that are under varying levels of control by the hotel: 1. The service elevator was not working, which meant staff needed to use the two main elevators, which added to the delays with what seemed like generally slow elevators. 2. Breakfast was really poorly managed from a logistical standpoint. (Get ready for first-world problems) While the quality of the food was great - local bagels and pastries, fresh fruit and coffee - there is/are: a. no clear start or end to the breakfast line  b. too few toasters for what was (as expected at 10am on a Saturday morning) 20ish  people in line c. cream cheese and butter setup in the middle of the buffet line, rather than near  the toasters, such that people would get a bagel, then get out of line to toast them,  then wait in line again to get the topping. Yes, this is because people are stupid, but  that's something a business needs to consider.  d. far too little coffee made available - people standing in line for coffee alone would  have to wait several "rotations" of new coffee before getting a cup - just get a bigger  machine that makes more and get a larger dispenser. While expensive, I think there's a lot of value in this hotel, from the service to the quality to the amenities and location. There are some minor issues I'd love to see them resolve but plan to stay here again in the future.

hotel_name: Park Terrace Hotel on Bryant Park
review_body: Would definitely stay here on our next NYC trip! Great and super helpful staff. Room was clean, quiet and the bed was super comfortable. We were given an upgrade which was lovely–a much larger room than NYC standard and a view of the park which made for a nice stay. We always looked forward to coming “home” to our room after a long day running around the city. The free breakfast was just perfect, ate there for three days and there was enough variety to not tire of. I loved having access to the in-room Nespresso and the water station. Wish we had time to check out the bar. Overall, having found this hotel and gotten a great deal was definitely one of the highlights of our trip. Can’t wait to come back!

hotel_name: Park Terrace Hotel on Bryant Park
review_body: Great location. Good sized room. Very clean and comfortable. Staff very helpful and friendly. Good breakfast. Would stay again. Easy to walk out from hotel to local landmarks including Central Park and museums.

hotel_name: Park Terrace Hotel on Bryant Park
review_body: I would give my stay a 5 except the elevator was extremely slow. It seemed we would wait forever for the elevator every time.Also we paid extra for a higher floor but our view was of a brick wall.other then those two things everything else was wonderful. I would stay there again and recommend this hotel to friends. The bed was very comfortable and really liked the shower. The room was a little smaller then I am use to but I knew going to New York our rooms would be smaller. They designed the room well so that the room felt bigger.

hotel_name: Park Terrace Hotel on Bryant Park
review_body: Some details concerning the breakfast buffet should be improved. There is enough, not to say to much personell, but they are not trained to watch and see when something is missing (jam, cheese, ham). Also the presentation of salami, ham and cheese could be a little more elegant. The quality is very good but the way the products are thrown on a heep is not according to the standard of the house.

hotel_name: Park Terrace Hotel on Bryant Park
review_body: Had a great stay. Rooms and common areas are done to a high standard. Service from all staff at all times was excellent, and the location was ideal (Bryant Park, Subway, Times Square, Broadway, Midtown).

hotel_name: Park Terrace Hotel on Bryant Park
review_body: Full disclosure...I didn't have to pay for this out of my pocket. However, when you have the type of work meetings we do (early morning into late dinners) it's nice to come back to a room that is clean and a bed and linens that are comfortable. Also, the temp control in the room is on point. Not much space to store your clothes but I seldom unpack anyway.

hotel_name: Park Terrace Hotel on Bryant Park
review_body: Excellent location and genuine personalized service. Rooms are a bit tight, but good for midtown Manhattan. You are half a block from 5th Avenue and two blocks from Times Square. Get a room with a view of Bryant Park.The breakfast bar is excellent, but it is often hard to find a table, so try and miss the rush. All in all a good choice for a midtown hotel.

hotel_name: Park Terrace Hotel on Bryant Park
review_body: Amazing location on the park, great building, good rooms, friendly staff. Sixth floor terrace overlooking the park is a treat. Shame about the very slow elevators and the too small breakfast / lounge space on the sixth floor.

hotel_name: Park Terrace Hotel on Bryant Park
review_body: Our room was upgraded for free, nice view. Comfortable bed and premium bathroom products. We enjoyed the in-room Nespresso machine. Each floor has a hydration station with purified water and shaved ice. They supply empty bottles for filling. The front desk personnel are helpful with restaurant suggestions. They will give you the restaurants business card which entitles you to a free glass of wine or 10% off dinner. Breakfast buffet is delicious. Outdoor bar area is beautiful with nightly drink and food specials. My only complaint is not enough elevators.

hotel_name: Park Terrace Hotel on Bryant Park
review_body: The hotel was very good. Location was great. Staff was wonderful, specially the one in the lounge where breakfast is served. Arlette and Jason rock! Very helpful and friendly folks. The only drawback was that our room was tiny.

hotel_name: Park Terrace Hotel on Bryant Park
review_body: This is a conveniently situated hotel, right at Bryant Park and NY Public Library, steps from the B,D, and 7 Subway lines, and one block from Times Square.The hotel is quite affordable, but that bargain reflects a tiny room (even by Manhattan standards) and a decided paucity of amenities. There is a work-out room and a scrumptious complimentary breakfast. However that’s about it.Aside from its price and location, this is a fairly vanilla hotel. The front desk peeps were very friendly. However, Housekeeping left my room unlocked, the door ajar, literally all day from 9 am to when I returned at 10 pm. Luckily, nothing appears to have been stolen. However, when I informed the manager, I got no response. For what it’s worth.Would probably stay here again provided the price remains right. (I paid $320/night the week of UN General Assembly, which is an unbelievable rate for Manhattan that time of year.)

hotel_name: Park Terrace Hotel on Bryant Park
review_body: I like the hotel a lot and appreciated that it was in impeccable condition. Staff was super friendly as well and the location is excellent. Some small downsides one could work on were: 1) that one had to use the toiletries which were used by previous guests. I understand they want to be eco conscious, but imagining what the guests before might have done with the toiletries or that the naked guests before you have used it is not super appealing. Their eco argument is also somewhat offset by the disposable cups they use for breakfast for both (!) coffee and juice. 2) although breakfast was very good, there was not enough space to accommodate all guests. We stayed there for 6 days and were not once able to get a table without waiting in line / having to share our table with other guests. I assume it’s less critical when the weather is good because then people can take advantage of the terrace. Considering the price category, I would have expected more. Also, I found the coffee extremely bad (I understand it is supposed to be some hip NY brand but it was really awful for European taste buds). 3) it takes ages for the elevators to arrive, but I think this cannot be changed due to the hotel’s architecture.All in all, I think I would book again despite small downsides due to the great location and friendly staff.

hotel_name: Park Terrace Hotel on Bryant Park
review_body: Thank you for a lovely room overlooking Bryant park.Ie room 1111. This was the last night of our American Holiday. Previously we stayed 5 nights in New York. 2 nights in Philadelphia and 3 nights in Washington DC. We loved our American Adventure and staying in your lovely hotel was a great end to our time in your wonderful country. Hope to be back next year for the US open Golf. So if you could send me some info about availability ect i would be grateful. Once again thank you and keep up the good work. Steve and Linda

hotel_name: Park Terrace Hotel on Bryant Park
review_body: Perfect location for a short stay in NYC. Have delicious breakfast indoors or on the 6th floor terrace Stroll to Times Square, Empire State, 5th Avenue. Sit in Bryant Park which is at the door- like the garden of the hotel! Jump the subway to the rest.

hotel_name: Park Terrace Hotel on Bryant Park
review_body: My 1-month old vehicle was parked via their valet service for 2 nights. The vehicle is equipped with an app that notifies me when car doors are unlocked, windows are open, engine is on, etc. My phone alerted me at 2:24 AM that not only was my vehicle unlocked, but windows were open and THE ENGINE WAS ON. Out of consideration for the staff, I insisted that my husband wait and address it in the morning. At 6:49 AM, the engine was still on! When we notified receptionist upon checking out, she went in the office and then returned and told us the manager was unavailable, but assured us that he would contact us ASAP. When the valet delivered our vehicle, the driver's seat was in an oddly reclined position and there were several broken tortilla chips in the seat. Management finally contacted us the following afternoon and offered an apology, asking for our email to follow-up. Never to be heard from again!

hotel_name: Park Terrace Hotel on Bryant Park
review_body: Brand new hotel with super location nex to Bryant park and library. Room is nice and clean, room size is decent in NYC. The bed is very comfortable. Best value boutique hotel compare to other famous chain hotels.

hotel_name: Park Terrace Hotel on Bryant Park
review_body: To quote Mary Poppins. It’s a very relaxing hotel vibe...quiet even if it’s packed full of guests! The beds, the service, staff and finishes are top notch. Some rooms are quite small but are fine for a solo traveler. The extra few feet in a deluxe or premier room is worth it for two adults. Add that they are truly pet friendly...and it’s a win in my book!
user_name:
Wanderer20069106784
New York City, New York

hotel_name: Park Terrace Hotel on Bryant Park
review_body: After careful research, I chose this hotel because I thought it had some stand-out features and because of its location...both parts turned out to be spot on. We had a Premier room on the 4th floor which was plenty big enough and with hanging wardrobe space. We didn’t have a view onto the park but we did have a view of the Empire State Building so no complaints there, and plus it was blissfully quiet facing the rear. The bed linen and pillows were of top quality, and the bed was super comfortable. The bathroom was small but the shower was lovely as were the toiletries. Breakfast was plentiful, and the bagels were particularly fabulous, but tables were a bit limited at peak times. We found the hotel staff to be super friendly and helpful when we needed them. The only small negative point is the slowness of the elevators as other people have mentioned, but I’m not sure what can be done about that and it certainly didn’t spoil our weekend. Would happily recommend this hotel to everyone.

hotel_name: Park Terrace Hotel on Bryant Park
review_body: My wife and I recently stayed 5 nights to celebrate our anniversary and we had a great experience at this hotel. We chose a premier studio to celebrate the occasion and the room size was awesome for NYC! We also had a corner room so it was especially bright with all of the floor to ceiling windows. The staff were all super friendly and helpful and we loved the complimentary breakfast. Many people mentioned the slow elevators but we never found them to be that problematic. We mostly took the stairs to go down except when we had our luggage. We could see Bryant Park from our room but really only if we stuck our head out our sliding glass door . The location was ideal to base out of for exploring the city. We would absolutely stay here again!

hotel_name: Park Terrace Hotel on Bryant Park
review_body: Contemporary hotel, great spot near Bryant Park which gave good access to the subway . Nice room,the lift could be a bit slow sometimes ,but no big deal. Breakfast was nice but busy at certain times.level six bar was pleasant .

hotel_name: Park Terrace Hotel on Bryant Park
review_body: Travelled to nyc for my teen daughter to research a school project. On a whim we chose to spend the night and were happy to have discovered Park Terrace - Bryant Park . We agree we were both very satisfied with all aspects of this hotel. Will not hesitate to return.

hotel_name: Park Terrace Hotel on Bryant Park
review_body: The Park Terrace Hotel, which is located adjacent to Bryant Park turned out to be an excellent location. We had a great room, which included an outstanding continental breakfast on their Terrace with and supper view of the Empire State Building. We can not say enough about the staff as each and every one of them were extremely friendly and provided FIRST CLASS service. Next time we are in the Big Apple we will stay here as we have no hesitation in recommending this hotel.

hotel_name: Park Terrace Hotel on Bryant Park
review_body: Excellent reviews encouraged our stay. We booked a Park View Room which was small but faultless in cleanliness and designed well. The park view was not what we were expecting. The website pictures led us to believe we would have direct park views but the views are not opposite the hotel. Perhaps, partial park views (obliquely) would be a more appropriate description. Great location nevertheless. The central location was very convenient to many landmarks. The park views face the side of NYC Library. Staff were extremely helpful. Having stayed 3 days in previous NYC accommodation, we were able to check in early. Very thankful. The loveliest part of the hotel is the outdoor terrace. A beautiful green space/place to meet, sit and enjoy. The terrace /room also provided the complimentary breakfast which was most welcome. Bagels, cheese, donuts, salami, toast, spreads, muesli, fruit, juices, tea and coffee. The hotel does seem to be marketed towards business travellers. Compact, convenient and close to everything with spaces provided for meetings. We stayed during the UN General Assembly meetings and this meant the prices increased substantially. Booked on the day! Tip… Check prior for any events that could impact prices for your stay. We paid $2500 AUD for a three night stay. Overpriced for room. Not a fan of the shared use of a large size shampoo/conditioner. Great place to stay for some … but…we would look to stay in previous hotel or elsewhere for a room that had more space with a better outlook.

hotel_name: Park Terrace Hotel on Bryant Park
review_body: This hotel is a great place to stay if you want to be close to the hustle and bustle of Time Square but still be able to enjoy the beauty of the public library and Bryant Park. The facilities were nice, the buffet for breakfast was very good With a nice variety of Brad’s jellies and jams, unique juices and fresh fruit The bar has a lovely outside patio that is great for a drink on a lovely evening. Rooms are typical New York smaller size but very modern and beautifully designed.

hotel_name: Park Terrace Hotel on Bryant Park
review_body: Really nice new quiet hotel steps from Bryant Park! All the staff aim to please. Bed and shower are great! Nice Bose in room! Like the breakfast (Tiffany was helpful and works hard) and free water. Wish the bar and outside terrace stayed open till midnight especially on the weekend . Will return!

hotel_name: Park Terrace Hotel on Bryant Park
review_body: When arrived was issued a wrong room, Some how we requested a room with a view but given a room with a view of an alley. After bantering with front desk and 75.00 more our room was upgraded. The rest of our stay was very nice and most of the staff very accommodating

hotel_name: Park Terrace Hotel on Bryant Park
review_body: The rooms are very small for the price,you must pay for bedrooms with a view, otherwise you will look at an inner courtyard without light which is very disappointing, The elevators are very slow, a real problem if you enter and leave the hotel frequently .The location is very good and the attention of the staff too

hotel_name: Park Terrace Hotel on Bryant Park
review_body: Great location, amazing breakfast, super friendly staff, room was nice. Shower water pressure a bit low and water filling in the hallway was a bit annoying. Totally recommend the hotel, great value for money

hotel_name: Park Terrace Hotel on Bryant Park
review_body: We had a great stay at the park terrace! Would definitely recommend to anyone, family or couples. The location is great, the rooms are super quiet and breakfast is REALLY good for a complimentary. Downsides the shampoo and conditioner aren’t changed between customers. Eco friendly yes but we were worried that they could be tampered with. The elevators take quite a while, the staff doesn’t always greet you when you walk in, and there aren’t bathrooms by the breakfast buffet. BUT I would stay here again and advise anyone else to as well.

hotel_name: Park Terrace Hotel on Bryant Park
review_body: The hotel is located in a great location.The Premier rooms are good size and are suitable for 2 people.The breakfast was awesome.Great restaurants all around the hotel.Highly recommend this hotel.The only downside is that there are only 2 lifts and we sometimes had to wait for them for a while.

hotel_name: Park Terrace Hotel on Bryant Park
review_body: After a late cancellation and horrible experience at a different hotel in Manhattan we ended up in the Park Terrace hotel. What a fantastic experience. We needed to wait a minute because we booked the room 15 minutes prior arrival at booking.com. Upon waiting to get our data in place, two bottles of water were brought to get us relaxed after a long flight.We were upgraded to a slightly bigger room and because of the birthday of my wife we were treated with a fantastic piece of cheese cake of a local bakery. The room and hotel itself are just like the pictures you see on the website. Absolute stunning quality, I made a Nespresso on my in room machine to combine with the delicious cheesecake and came to rest right from the start. We stayed for three nights and had the best time of our lived first time ever in NYC.Tranquility, elegance and quality are three words to describe the hotel.After breakfast the restaurant is transformed into a bar where you can enjoy a drink and small bite.Tip #1: ask for Larissa Santiago at the reception she helped us getting into the right mood from the start and guided us to some nice spots in the neighborhood. Each night while entering the building she gently checked if everything was still allright and if other help was needed. Thats the service you want to see.Tip #2, drink a cocktail or eat your breakfast on the rooftop bar/restaurant on the sixth floor. Nice scene and relaxing atmosphere.

hotel_name: Park Terrace Hotel on Bryant Park
review_body: This hotel is priced very competitively for Manhattan. We found it after a search online, looking at many options, and settled on it for its combination of price and location. Bryant Park is an excellent central point for exploring Manhattan.We were very pleasantly surprised by the hotel’s furnishing and amenities. Malin @ Goetz toiletries, complimentary artisanal snacks, continental breakfast uses foods from premium NY vendors. The hotel is also fairly eco conscious so rooms are not stocked with bottled water (you get water from a central refilling station), and avoids single use toiletries. The lighting scheme in the room is well designed and is adjustable on a continuous dimmer. In short, what they give you is on need and on point. Oh yeah and the hotel has plenty of Instagrammable photo angles. I would recommend this hotel for budget conscious travelers who still want to enjoy a hip NYC hotel experience.

hotel_name: Park Terrace Hotel on Bryant Park
review_body: Overall a nice property. The room was very clean and the bedding nice. Like many NY hotels, the rooms are small.The elevators are very slow during peak times in the morning and you could wait up to 10 minutes for the elevator.
user_name:
Donna D
Palm Beach Gardens, Florida

hotel_name: Park Terrace Hotel on Bryant Park
review_body: I stayed for a short two night business trip and was hugely impressed.The warmth of welcome from the team and attention to detail was superb as was the quality of the room & restaurant.Look forward to returning

hotel_name: Park Terrace Hotel on Bryant Park
review_body: Nothing but positive things to say about this hotel and its staff. The hotel staff were warm and helpful. They provided everything we needed very promptly, namely cribs for my infants and a wheelchair for my Grandmother. My wife and I normally sleep in a California King bed and was worried that we wouldn't be able to sleep comfortably in a queen but we slept very well. The rooms were clean and modern. Thank you to the hotel and its staff for an incredible stay!

hotel_name: Park Terrace Hotel on Bryant Park
review_body: Loved our stay here. The rooftop terrace and the proximity to Bryant Park were amazing! Also close to subway stop and few blocks from Times Square and Rockefeller Center. The one way street the hotel is on is next to the Library so it is really quiet for NYC. Made resting and bedtime really nice.

hotel_name: Park Terrace Hotel on Bryant Park
review_body: Hotel is clean and modern. Stuff is very friendly and helpful. Terrace is amazing to have breakfast or night drinks whit a great view. Only not so good thing are elevators which are very slow and busy. Beside that everything is perfect. I would suggest this hotel to anyone.
user_name:
emsiemc22
New York City, New York

hotel_name: Park Terrace Hotel on Bryant Park
review_body: Just spent 4 nights here and everything was great....except lifts a bit slow in peak times!However that was minor.Rooms good size, maybe a bit small in the cupboard and draw department especially if you are travelling heavy!Nespresso machine in the room.Good aircon, comply bed, nice bathroom.Our room on 10th floor had no real views....nice walls!Again not an issue as we just sleep in the room.Breakfast is a buffet style ..no hot food. Indoors or outdoors.There is a gym, but didn’t see it.Small lobby,.Rooms are very high tech and internet is rocket powered.Location just off 5th AVE is excellent and close to everything walking, and trains.Hotel is spotless, room service excellent.Has my tick and would return in a blink.

hotel_name: Park Terrace Hotel on Bryant Park
review_body: We stayed here for 5 wonderful nights. Great hotel, fantastic location. Welcoming reception staff. Lovely room, good size. Spotlessly clean. Bed exceptionally comfortable. Luxurious bed sheets. Lovely breakfast area and good choice. Staff attentive. You can take breakfast away in a box if you need an early start etc... Great coffee machine in room. Cold water and ice on tap by lifts. We loved Bryant Park. Great atmosphere. Everywhere was easy to get too. We used both the subway and buses.

hotel_name: Park Terrace Hotel on Bryant Park
review_body: My partner and I stayed in this lovely hotel for four nights in September. I did a lot of research on NY hotels before picking the Park Terrace. It's in a such a lovely situation, far enough from Times Square but in the midst of New York City. Bryant Park is right opposite and is a lovely place to sit, people watch, have a drink, take part in an activity, all on the doorstep of the hotel. The New York Public Library is opposite and Fifth Avenue is right round the corner. The staff at the Park Terrace were friendly and welcoming and always had a smile for us when we were coming and going. We picked a premier room which had five floor to ceiling windows and one which actually opened, very rare in NYC. Loved the welcome gift of popcorn and orange drink. The bed was so comfortable and everywhere was spotlessly clean. The 42nd St Bryant Square subway is two minutes walk away. Breakfast was fabulous! A wide range of cold meats, baked goods, yoghurts, coffee and juice. We sat outside on the terrace and ate which was wonderful. I highly recommend this hotel and hope to come back.

hotel_name: Park Terrace Hotel on Bryant Park
review_body: Great location close to Times Square and subway stops. Very friendly staff and clean rooms. The breakfast was great too. The noise outside at night was very loud and I could hear conversations from the ground when we were on the third floor.

hotel_name: Park Terrace Hotel on Bryant Park
review_body: Nice hotel just in front of the NYC library. My Bedroom was quite and spacious enough for NYC. The terrace where I have taken my breakfast is providing a nice view...and don’t miss these wonderful donuts.

hotel_name: Park Terrace Hotel on Bryant Park
review_body: This is a smaller boutique type hotel located across from Bryant Park and within walking distance to most NYC attractions. Our room was clean, beautiful, and included an amazing breakfast. We had our own Espresso machine, yoga mat, and creative snacks. Bed was comfortable and clean. The staff bent over backwards to make us feel welcome. Professional but not stuffy. We will return:)

hotel_name: Park Terrace Hotel on Bryant Park
review_body: Room was clean and recently renovated, the staff was friendly and social, bed is comfortable, service is great and location is perfect! you can walk to get to Time square, Rockefeller center, Central Park, the Empire State Building, Grand Central Station. The continental breakfast was outstanding with a nice variety and quality foods...and the terrace was lovely. I would definitely remember this place for my next trip to NY.

hotel_name: Park Terrace Hotel on Bryant Park
review_body: The rooms are small but perfect at the same time. The layout and amenities are spot on. The breakfast/lounge area is decorated and laid out perfectly. That coupled with the terrace makes it the one of the best place for breakfast or an evening cocktail in NYC.The exterior of the building is clad in polished architectural precast By definition it could be classified as terra cotta which can also be found throughout the interior.

hotel_name: Park Terrace Hotel on Bryant Park
review_body: My husband and I stayed at the Park Terrace Hotel on Bryant Park for our anniversary and were thrilled with the location, amenities, suite and service. The staff go above and beyond and the breakfasts each morning are delicious. Would highly recommend.

hotel_name: Park Terrace Hotel on Bryant Park
review_body: We stayed four nights at this hotel which is one-year-old The location is perfect along with the breakfast which is included in the price. The staff was great. We were one block from Broadway The three plays that we saw were all great. Being across the street from Bryant Park was super

hotel_name: Park Terrace Hotel on Bryant Park
review_body: This hotel is wonderfully located just off 5th Avenue, walking distance to theaters, across the street from beautiful and lively Bryant Park and the NY public library. My room will spanky clean and well-appointed.

hotel_name: Park Terrace Hotel on Bryant Park
review_body: Lovely hotel, fantastic service, beautifully designed. Always like to be near Bryant Park. Loved the bar area and terrace. Breakfast was lovely and included for once. Would definitely stay here again.
user_name:
Lisahartshepherd
Newcastle upon Tyne, United Kingdom

hotel_name: Park Terrace Hotel on Bryant Park
review_body: I stayed here for business and absolutely loved it. Fantastic service! Very comfortable beds and linens and a nice sized bathroom, a difficult feat in NY. There is a nice bar on the top floor that serves light snacks. Will definitely return.

hotel_name: Park Terrace Hotel on Bryant Park
review_body: This is, by far, my favorite hotel in NY...and I come here at least once a month. The location is amazing, I often get a view of the NYPL outside my window. The staff is so incredibly kind and helpful. They are eco-friendly and offer refillable water bottles on every floor. The breakfast (which is included) is delicious - fresh pastries, delicious cheese, and yogurt. Not to mention a great coffee bar. The terrace view is gorgeous. The rooms are clean and bigger than most NY hotel rooms...by a lot. I feel comfortable and at home. I would give them all the stars and recommend them to anyone looking to stay in NY.

hotel_name: Park Terrace Hotel on Bryant Park
review_body: Excellent location, modern and clean room, a super breakfast and excellent service.It is not inexpensive, but nothing is in Manhattan.If we come back to New York, it will be in this hotel.This was simply perfect!

hotel_name: Park Terrace Hotel on Bryant Park
review_body: It is a nice hotel and easy to get around. Closed to subway and reputable streets. The room facility is good enough to take care the daily use, clean, tidy and new. The breakfast is included, not much choices but it is enough.

hotel_name: Park Terrace Hotel on Bryant Park
review_body: Location, service and quality of accommodation was very high quality. Included breakfast was outstanding. Like any New York city hotel the parking was not included but Valet was quick and efficient. Room was modern and nice for a couple.

hotel_name: Park Terrace Hotel on Bryant Park
review_body: Right across from Bryant Park set in what feels like a brand new building. The hotel is meticulously clean, the staff is friendly and efficient, the included breakfast on the 6th floor (beautiful setting) is great and they have a Peliton bike in the basement. Overall - a great place.

hotel_name: Park Terrace Hotel on Bryant Park
review_body: Loved this hotel during our 4-day trip to NY. Situated literally in Bryant Park, where you find a vibrant life all day, coffe, food, shops, metro, airport-shuttle and more. Spacious well equipped rooms, heavenly bedsheets, service minded staff and an amazing, high quality breakfast!

hotel_name: Park Terrace Hotel on Bryant Park
review_body: Clean, new, amazingly comfortable beds, and sound proof! We were pleasantly surprised and will definitely stay again. The breakfast was very nice with a beautiful terrace. The filtered bottled water filling stations on each floor were such a nice addition.

hotel_name: Park Terrace Hotel on Bryant Park
review_body: Great staff, spacious room, nice amenities, good value for midtown. Service was very good, I forgot an item and called. They got right back to me. Food and wine was great, too. Love the outdoor space/patio.I will be back.

hotel_name: Park Terrace Hotel on Bryant Park
review_body: I had very nice overnight at the Park Terrace during the US Open. My room was small but bright and clean. The Nespresso machine is great to have and I love the refillable water bottle stations (bottles provided) on every floor. The welcome snack in my room was a lovely gesture and the complementary breakfast spread was beautiful and delicious especially enjoyed on the terrace. Location is great for the train station and all my meetings. Def going back!

hotel_name: Park Terrace Hotel on Bryant Park
review_body: The basic room is only OK. It is really small and the queue size bed is just in the corner close to the side wall. The matrix is not fully supported on the left side. After sleeping in left side, my back hurts the other morning. But right side is OK. So I suspect the matrix is not well balanced internally maybe due to excess use. The restroom for basic room is really really compact. You can not flush the toliet unless you put the lid down a bit since the button is behind the lid. But the overall hotel's service, location, and breakfast is good. Just the basic room is too too small so that it is uncomfortable to live inside. Should pay more to live in a premier room, whch can give you better room size as well as view.

hotel_name: Park Terrace Hotel on Bryant Park
review_body: If you want unnecessary services, you may not be satisfied with this hotel. But everything that is necessary is very good. Specially location.If you stay here you will surely be mistaken in your room for a clean shower and comfortable bedding.

hotel_name: Park Terrace Hotel on Bryant Park
review_body: I lived in NYC for 25 years and now I am a tourist!! I love love love this hotel! the most amazing part of it is the staff!!! They cater to your every need with a smile on their faces ! The rooms are clean modern and comfortable! My fav part of the hotel is the breakfast room on the 6th room and outdoor terrace. It is gorgeous and makes you feel you are in a 5 star hotel ...breakfast is gourmet offerings, conference area, laptops, and in the outdoor space amazing views of Bryant Park. Christmas time is beautiful too in this hotel! A must stay! Will continue to book this hotel for all my trips to the Big Apple1

hotel_name: Park Terrace Hotel on Bryant Park
review_body: Lovely boutique hotel adjacent to Bryant Park within walking distance of theater district and other areas, yet without the noise. The staff was very friendly and helpful. We loved the 6th floor terrace with day and night time views of the city, especially seeing the Empire State building all lit up.

hotel_name: Park Terrace Hotel on Bryant Park
review_body: Great hotel, staff and breakfast on the terrace. The location was ideal and directly across from Bryant Park. Lots of great dining nearby. I will stay there next time in NEw York for work or pleasure.

hotel_name: Park Terrace Hotel on Bryant Park
review_body: This is a very nice hotel with excellent staff, great location and an bar/breakfast area that is lovely. The breakfast itself is terrific. The rooms, however, are a bit small - but quiet and comfortable.

hotel_name: Park Terrace Hotel on Bryant Park
review_body: The girl that did the check-in was really nice, she even wanted to give us a better room but she asked someone, i guess he was the manager, and he said that cause we booked the room on sale she shouldn't go too high. And we got a room on the 6th floor, side or back don't know exactly which.. The view was really bad, basically we were seeing in another building and down there was a yard with the trash cans. The room was really really small. The bathroom door was broken, so you couldn't close it completely. The bed was nice, really comfy. The hotel was in a nice location and the breakfast was also nice. But i wouldn't stay there again. I don't think it deserves its price, even on sale.

hotel_name: Park Terrace Hotel on Bryant Park
review_body: My stay at Park Terrace was a dream! I arrived early to find out my room was indeed ready, so I put my luggage down and went to my event. The staff was so welcoming and accommodating as well. I loved the popcorn and soda welcome, and it was this attention to details/hospitality that will make me go back again and again. Sometimes staying in NYC can be cumbersome, but the staff, the facilities, and the rooms will definitely make me return to Park Terrace!

hotel_name: Park Terrace Hotel on Bryant Park
review_body: Great location excellent staff great breakfast and the park is so awesome. Lots of restaurants nearby and close to subway stations. Upgrade to a suite as the queen rooms are a bit on the small side. Having refill stations for water is so thoughtful. Next imenod like to be there for yoga in the park. Super comfy beds

hotel_name: Park Terrace Hotel on Bryant Park
review_body: I enjoyed the up to date room with friendly and helpful staff, sound proofing, very comfortable bed and pillows, clean linen, modern bathroom, swivelling TV, gym room and terrace breakfast overlooking NY Public Library and Park.

hotel_name: Park Terrace Hotel on Bryant Park
review_body: Perfect is the right word here. Right in the middle of midtown, just 2 minutes walk to subway station, opposite lovely Bryant park, lots of places for breakfast (we took hotel`s breakfast which was very good), coffee and dining just by the front door. And yet, we stayed on 3rt floor by the elevator and heaad no street noise! Nespresso machine and capsules in the room are a great start. Clean rooms, excellent staff. Will defintly stay again!

hotel_name: Park Terrace Hotel on Bryant Park
review_body: Room was so clean it seemed like we were the first to stay in it. Had a great view of Bryant Park. The staff were very friendly. The food was delicious. Overall it was a great experience and we hope to return soon.

hotel_name: Park Terrace Hotel on Bryant Park
review_body: This was a trip to go to the US Open. The hotel was fabulous as well as the breakfast bar and view from the terrace overlooking the Empire State Building was beautiful, especially at night. Just a very relaxing hotel that was extremely well located across from Bryant Park. Easy walking distance to everywhere we wanted to go.

hotel_name: Park Terrace Hotel on Bryant Park
review_body: The very nice, attentive and above all helpful staff at the front desk of this hotel are to be highlighted.The breakfast was delicious - just very good.Many thanks to all the staff for this great and unforgettable stay.If New York, then in this hotel :)

hotel_name: Park Terrace Hotel on Bryant Park
review_body: Excellent central location for people looking to be able to see many parts of the city on a short trip. Be sure to pick a room overlooking Bryant park. All the staff from reception to service are very friendly and helpful. We had a great stay. Thank you

hotel_name: Park Terrace Hotel on Bryant Park
review_body: We booked the Park Terrace Hotel based on previous reviews and were not disappointed. The hotel was perfect in every way. The rooms were a good size for NYC, the staff was beyond accommodating and the breakfast is included and DELICIOUS. We loved drinks on the terrace, Bryant Park is across the street and had good/free entertainment. The location is great if you like being mid-town.

hotel_name: Park Terrace Hotel on Bryant Park
review_body: Stayed for 6 nights. Hotel is modern and very clean. Wonderful terrace with great breakfast buffet. Fabulous spot on Bryant Park. Definitely worth the price, small things like water station and great WiFi set this place apart from many other hotels in NYC. Thanks for early check in after a very long flight

hotel_name: Park Terrace Hotel on Bryant Park
review_body: We had a wonderful stay at the Park Terrace Hotel. The location was perfect, our room was cozy, clean and quiet. Breakfast was delicious and we looked forward to it every morning. The staff was very professional, friendly and extremely accommodating. Housekeeping was punctual and clean every day. We loved the water bottles and refill for guests. Special little treats were definitely noticed..

hotel_name: Park Terrace Hotel on Bryant Park
review_body: Next to one of the best places in NYC, Bryant Park. Great subway access. Quiet. Wonderful terrace. Amazing breakfast (complimentary, at least at the time of this writing).Terrace service was a bit slow, but you can get crummy service anywhere, so I suspect this will solve itself over time. The food, however, was yum!Gym was very clean, and very nice.The rooms do not have much storage... as in none. We typically like to unload our suitcases and live out of drawers, etc. The room has a closet with one shelf and one drawer. So, we had mini piles of clothes on the ottoman and couch. No biggie, but no storage.Overall, wonderful!

hotel_name: Park Terrace Hotel on Bryant Park
review_body: Generally good. However the shower door allowed water to seep into the bathroom.The Terrace Specials advertised in the room were not always available in the Terrace. Either the list in the room was not updated or the personnel in the Terrace were not informed of the advertised specials.

hotel_name: Park Terrace Hotel on Bryant Park
review_body: Had a great stay the amenities were great and my room was very clean. But after a long drive and nyc traffic. In all the hussle and bussle. I left 600 dollars in my car. I called down to front desk immediately after leaving my room they informed me that i would have to walk 2 blocks to receive my car. it had already been parked. By the time I got there It was already stolen i dont know who stole it but i really would have like to see a situation like that taken seriously. Seeing how I paid such a premium for the room. Kinda made my birthday awful. They didnt even check up on the situation later. I guess they must think the employees deserve the money more then me who worked hard to save that to make my Birthday special. Oh well I guess thats the kinda people in nyc.

hotel_name: Park Terrace Hotel on Bryant Park
review_body: Perfect location, very good service, breakfast included in the rate, servicial staff, what else you need? I recommend this Hotel to have a relaxing time in Manhattan. Rooms are small but comfortable, expresso machine and more!

hotel_name: Park Terrace Hotel on Bryant Park
review_body: Cozy but well appointed rooms. The amenities (e.g. gym, sauna, nespresso in the room, free breakfast etc) and of course the location made it even a better deal. I can definitely see myself stay back there next time we visit.

hotel_name: Park Terrace Hotel on Bryant Park
review_body: I enjoyed my stay and recommend the place. Friendly team with good breakfast food and a very clean room. The TV and Wifi were very good too. They need to improve the sound proofing on room doors or the elevator doors. I could hear the elevator beeping in my room when it was on other floors. Thankfully I only heard it when awake as it did not wake me up.
