hotel_name: Park Terrace Hotel on Bryant Park
review_body: Staff were very helpful & could not do enough Charlie especially good Location amazing Room size a little small Inadequate closet or suitcase spaceBreakfast excellent quality biggest issue was getting to it with area too crowded long lines table waiting & food running outHowever all else very good
user_name:
Wayne A
City of Greater Geelong, Australia

hotel_name: Park Terrace Hotel on Bryant Park
review_body: Great location for shopping. Would be nice if hotel turned the breakfast area and rooftop patio into a bar/restaurant for nightly entertainment options without leaving hotel. All in all great location clean hotel great service.

hotel_name: Park Terrace Hotel on Bryant Park
review_body: Best holiday ever. Central location, easy to get to everything and a comfortable peaceful nights sleep ready for a most welcome excellent quality breakfast each morning on the terrace. Nothing is too much trouble for the staff.

hotel_name: Park Terrace Hotel on Bryant Park
review_body: The location was perfect. We loved the breakfast and freshness that is lacking in many other hotels. Hats off to management as all the staff from front desk to cleaning services were very friendly and helpful! Parking was also not an issue as they have special rates at a garage nearby. Thanks to everyone and I am pleased to say we have a new go to hotel when in New York.

hotel_name: Park Terrace Hotel on Bryant Park
review_body: Bryant Lark location in the center of manhattan. Great time. Would recommend to others. Price point was good for manhattan. Clean and good service Did t use the lounge but heard the rooftop deck for a drink is awesome
user_name:
Richard S
Dix Hills, United States

hotel_name: Park Terrace Hotel on Bryant Park
review_body: We've stayed at other Manhattan hotels on numerous occasions. For the price, location, amenities, service this was top notch! Not to mention a fantastic FREE continental breakfast on their rooftop patio. Most free meals are stale bagels and cold cereal. This was Zucher's gourmet bagels with three choices of cream cheese, fresh fruit, delicious pastries and donuts. We will happily return to this hotel!

hotel_name: Park Terrace Hotel on Bryant Park
review_body: Friendly staff & totally attractive too! Great location across from Bryant Park. Cute enough modern room accommodations and there’s also a beautiful lounge for a delicious varied breakfast ( think Doughnut Plant Donuts!) or great for cocktails!

hotel_name: Park Terrace Hotel on Bryant Park
review_body: We loved this hotel. Service was excellent (Charlie made sure all our needs were met, and Randy was always there for us!) Breakfast was delicious and so fresh. Outside Terrace was wonderful with view of Empire State Building! Location was perfect, loved being by Bryant Park and close to Grand Central. We will definitely be back!

hotel_name: Park Terrace Hotel on Bryant Park
review_body: Well I think I summarized it in my headline :) but to break it out in detailsROOMSA bit small BUT really well done. Perfect layouts, floor to ceiling windows with great views of Bryant park and the NYC Public Library. New modern finishes. The TV wall with the art has a classy pannilng so you don't see ANY wires (which I'm a stickler about...note: I'm A stickler about pretty much everything :) You can certainly get bigger, but I don't think finishes get any nicer than this. Again, mostly due to the newness of the hotel. (Tiny note to the management, please go in and change ALL the hinges on your shower stalls to open IN and not OUT...or at least to swing in both directions)LOCATIONHeart of NYC. We had a baby with us in a stroller, so subway or any taxi/share riding was out of the question. We walked EVERYWHERE. So being this central was key. TERRACETheir 6th-floor terrace AND common area is just criminally underutilized. Which worked out great for us, because most of the day (we were there during weekdays) we had the place all to ourselves :) I'd post pictures, but I'm a stickler about privacy too, so I won't. But their website pictures of the terrace are spot on. And something you can't see, that I definitely want to give a shout out to the management for: GREAT LOUNGE MUSIC playing all the time in the lounge/terrace areas! Really set the mood. Just lovely! (oh on that note, we also noticed the beautiful smell in the lobby, keep up the good work with the scent machine too! I used to live in NYC and the streets sure don't smell any BETTER these days :) So the lobby smell is so refreshing! again these are inexpensive but important touches that make a world of difference for the customer experience)BREAKFASTI have to say I'm torn about the breakfast here because it's DELICIOUS, the croissants and pastries are irresistible. The bagels and flavored cream cheeses are perfect. And they have GREAT PROSCIUTTO (which I'm very picky about!)...that said, after 3 days, you have gained 3 lbs and you just can't eat this for breakfast every day..They DO have a lovely greek yogurt spread with toppings, but who's going to eat that next to the die-for-pastries? :)GYMModern and kept clean. All you need from a gym. And you'll need it after the breakfast pastries! my god, I ate too much :)LAUNDRYNo one mentions this, but again we were traveling with a baby, so I did a load of laundry EVERY NIGHT. They provide a FREE LAUNDRY ROOM! Their machines are clean, short efficient cycles, and they'll give you their commercial-grade laundry detergent which worked wonders on baby throw up and food stains. SERVICEEveryone we interacted with was just SUPER nice to us and our baby (who, you know, acts like a baby and makes a mess and wants to touch things he shouldn't touch, and throws cheerios on the floor, and spill mom's coffee...). I'm blanking on the names of the two ladies at the front desk (i'm SO sorry! One was Gabriella, I'm 70% sure, and the other...shoot...I should have written it down!) but they were BOTH lovely and patient and helpful, especially on our last day when our flight was delayed and we needed some extra time in the room for the baby to nap...RIDE TO AIRPORTOh yeah, that reminds me, definitely take them up on their "flat rate" taxi ride to JFK. The driver arrived early and waited for us, and was really patient with us when the baby had a meltdown on the way (to be fair, it was raining and the 45 min ride turned into a 90 minute ride in horrible stop and go traffic, so I was getting a bit sick too...what I'm saying is, don't blame my angel baby :) Back to the point, really good transportation option, good price and we had a nice driver. I would definitely stay there again...but I don't see when, because, as you might be able to tell from my review, we're NEVER traveling with a baby AGAIN :) lol

hotel_name: Park Terrace Hotel on Bryant Park
review_body: Rooms clean and well appointed. Location perfect in mid town. Staff super helpful. Very modern but not sterile. Price was surprisingly affordable given location and room size and quality. I plan on making this my manhattan hotel when travelling for biz.

hotel_name: Park Terrace Hotel on Bryant Park
review_body: Who said perfection was not possible?Perfect from A to ZIncredible breakfast, super clean, staff very nice and helpful, location perfect next to Central Park, room with a decent size and quietEverything you can ask for a boutique hotel

hotel_name: Park Terrace Hotel on Bryant Park
review_body: Stayed at this property about two weeks ago and Im now getting the chance to submit a review via this site as I was asked to be staff. I found this location to be greatly desired within walking distance to various attractions, fabulous complimentary a la carte breakfast, modest gym and high end amenities and fabrics. Attractive bar area and terrace with the exception of the carpet detailing. Unfortunately amongst my comings and goings I got the sense from several reps that they were not happy under their management. That the property had so much potential if not for leadership. Someone by the name of jampar in particular and I cannot support a place where the reps are miserable.

hotel_name: Park Terrace Hotel on Bryant Park
review_body: Really glad we chose this hotel overall and would definitely comeback. The rooms are brand new and comfortable. Not really big though. We picked the deluxe with a view and were surprised with how small it is. Little storage in the room aside from a hanging rack. Beautiful bathroom and love the premium shampoos and body products.Great location in front of the Bryant Park. Watch out when booking rooms with park views - these are not directly facing the park views. The hotel is rather facing the side of the library. So not sure if worth the up charge for park views.Awesome terrace to relax at. Friendly & helpful front desk staff! One minor negative: The walls are thick, but it gets noisy in the morning in the hallways. The neighboring doors are extremely loud when they’re being closed. The housekeeping staff knocks repeatedly on every room, yells out ‘housekeeping’ loudly before opening the room and then hearing the door slam.. over and over again. Seems like they take a count of every empty room in the morning around 8ish.. so for quite some time all you hear is knocking, then “housekeeeeeping” (x2 on each room) and doors being opened and closed. Hope the management reads this and takes into consideration how disturbing that system is to those guests still trying to get some sleep.

hotel_name: Park Terrace Hotel on Bryant Park
review_body: Beautiful hotel with excellent service! The staff is extremely kind and helpful. They had great food and activity suggestions and assisted with my travel around the city. The breakfast selection is very nice and the rooms are well designed. Overall a great experience!

hotel_name: Park Terrace Hotel on Bryant Park
review_body: very close to times squire and train stations, lots of live music events and great garden in front of the hotel. hotel staff are very friendly. free breakfast, gym, laundry are ++. wished to have a refrigerator for cold drink and a better view from the room although the total value and satisfaction for the cost were great.

hotel_name: Park Terrace Hotel on Bryant Park
review_body: Very nice hotel, modern, spotless and with breakfast included (really great). Very friendly and polite staff, especially Larissa Santiago (concierge).It is my third times in NYC and this is the best hotel I have stayed in.Recommended.

hotel_name: Park Terrace Hotel on Bryant Park
review_body: Really enjoyed our stay. Breakfast was lovely on the outside terrace, staff was very friendly, always smiling and helpful and hotel was clean, quiet and close to all nyc sightseeing - a pleasure, would definitely stay again.

hotel_name: Park Terrace Hotel on Bryant Park
review_body: The Staff make the place nicer than we expected, especially front desk. Charming and helpful. The location speaks for itself, the price is reasonable. When the restaurant opens, it will be even better. The breakfast buffet, while making me happy, did not impress my friend from Hong Kong as she thought it only 10% of a full offering. NYC is not in Asia, as we know. The beds are good. Nice quiet attractive place. People should know this hotel is a relatively small facility, which is OK. All services not offered inside are offered outside nearby.

hotel_name: Park Terrace Hotel on Bryant Park
review_body: This hotel was top notch!! From everything to the early check in, to making my birthday weekend sooo special!! There was 2 cupcakes and a beautiful slice of red velvet cake in my room and our sisters room too, MY favorite cake! the rooms were luxurious, small but compact, even a yoga mat!! We had drinks on the spectacular terrace with a beautiful NY view, the staff was exceptional, so friendly, even let me borrow her charger where I forgot mine. And the breakfast was TOP NOTCH, fresh NY bagels and cc, fresh breads, homemade donuts, fruit yogurt, fresh strong coffee. It was perfect all around and my family was so pleased!! I can't wait to go back to NYC just to stay here again

hotel_name: Park Terrace Hotel on Bryant Park
review_body: We booked a room at higher floor and upgraded it to studio for extra cost. Studio was very spacious and with a view. Staff vas very helpful. Bed was comfortable. Breakfast good. Spending time on a terrace is very pleasant. Hotel location is very convenient and it’s quiet. Definitely will stay there again.

hotel_name: Park Terrace Hotel on Bryant Park
review_body: I chose this hotel thanks to the good reviews it already had, and I can only contribute to make this note even higher !I loved all of it :* zen atmosphere of the lounge. Even though it was in July I spent a few hours reading a book by the fire, how unique is that !!* staff very helpfull and kind and friendly* incredible breakfast* unique view from the terrace.* very silent room (and I am very sensitive to the noise when I travel, I have troubles to sleep)* clean and modern bathroom and room*comfortable bed (again, I am very sensitive to this issue)* very well situated* breakfast included in the priceI also loved the popcorn offered on the first day in the room, the fact that they gave me another room when I asked, that they gave me a kettle and tea for my room for the whole stay, the very early (6.30 am !!!) check-in with no additional cost...I loved everything about this hotel and I will certainly go back next time I am in New York !! It is more expensive than other hotels but it is worth the difference (you can win your money back on the breakfast buffet, on the taxi/uber fees since you can easily walk to a lot of locations , and you will feel less stressed out so no need to go to a chiropractor or buy pills when you come back !! :) Do not hesitate, pick this hotel !!

hotel_name: Park Terrace Hotel on Bryant Park
review_body: We spent 2 nights at this new, beautiful property. Great location, amazing staff, great breakfast, beautiful rooms, wonderful sauna, Nice rooftop seating, etc etc. We would highly recommend!! Perfect stay!
user_name:
Lynne P
Hastings on Hudson, New York

hotel_name: Park Terrace Hotel on Bryant Park
review_body: We were very happy with Park Terrace. Rooms were clean, bed comfortable and the breakfast really hit the spot. The hotel is very central to Times Square, Central Park, Museums etc.I wouldn't hesitate to recommend this place to anyone.

hotel_name: Park Terrace Hotel on Bryant Park
review_body: room was top quality, Brand new hotel ! staff friendly and helpfullBreakfast was amazing, not so much items bad healthy and diffrent types of breakfast. And water dispenser 7/24 provides cold water with new bottle for carring

hotel_name: Park Terrace Hotel on Bryant Park
review_body: Stayed at Park Terrace this weekend. Staff were professional and ultra courteous. We’ve travelled enough to know that things can happen. What makes for a great hotel is how they handle the “bumps”, and Park Terrace handled it beautifully. We had a small hiccup with our room upon checkin (we had a premier suite with a view) and the staff were excellent. Offered us option to address the issue and did so promptly. Location was excellent with close access to subway and walking distance to lots of sites throughout Manhattan. Breakfast was amazing as was the wifi - would definitely stay here again! Picture is view from breakfast.

hotel_name: Park Terrace Hotel on Bryant Park
review_body: This hotel was in a great location. The staff were very accommodating!The room was very clean and breakfast was wonderful! This hotel is relatively new and I feel like people haven’t really discovered it yet.

hotel_name: Park Terrace Hotel on Bryant Park
review_body: We had an amazing experience staying at the Park Terrace Hotel on Bryant Park. The service is very welcoming, everyone is very nice and attentive, made us feel welcomed and comfortable. Espassicly have to indicate Gabriella, she welcomed us when we arrived, we arrived very early in the morning after a very long flight and she was great, offering us to get some breakfast while they are doing everything that they can to rush the room, updated with the status and accommodating us as soon as the room was available. We took the Premier room, the room was relatively roomy, very comfortable and clean. the only remark I would have it's about the bathroom door... it's not really closed :) The breakfast is great, a nice variety of choices, everything was very clean and fresh.

hotel_name: Park Terrace Hotel on Bryant Park
review_body: It was like an oasis of middle of the huge city.Staffs of the reception are very friendly, the room is simply well designed with good taste and comfortable. The breakfast is well selected and can be eaten at the terrace optionally.

hotel_name: Park Terrace Hotel on Bryant Park
review_body: Loved this hotel right on a Bryant Park. Walking distance of Time Square, 5th Avenue and Empire State. Lovely room on 9th floor and staff very helpful both on 6th floor restaurant especially Matt Donoghue, and also at reception.

hotel_name: Park Terrace Hotel on Bryant Park
review_body: The cleanest room, decent size and they have a killer breakfast. We didn’t explore the cocktail hour but I’m sure that was lovely too! Service was also great, everyone was very friendly and our room was made up daily with fresh towels. Such a great hotel, in a great location in NYC!

hotel_name: Park Terrace Hotel on Bryant Park
review_body: This hotel was perfect. I stayed here for four nights on a very busy and tiring business trip and I am so glad to have chosen Park Terrace. The location is fantastic - close to the trains and who can beat lovely Bryant Park. The staff at the hotel were wonderful - friendly and super helpful when I had questions. The room was clean, comfortable and a perfect space to come back to at the end of a long day. I only had the breakfast on my last day and then regretted not taking advantage of it on the other mornings - bagels, donuts, strong coffee, fresh fruit - it was without a doubt the best breakfast I've had at a hotel. If you're looking for a really large room, you might be disappointed, but if you want a crisp, clean, comfortable and well-designed space to stay, this is a fantastic choice.

hotel_name: Park Terrace Hotel on Bryant Park
review_body: This hotel is a fabulous New York City find! Great location, great service, great rooms, great hydration stations on every floor and great Terrace with breakfast in the morning and drinks available at night. I’ll stay here again and again.

hotel_name: Park Terrace Hotel on Bryant Park
review_body: Lovely hotel. Frendly and helpful front desk and employees. Beautiful terrace with views of Empire State building and other buildings lit up at night, we could hear wonderful music being played in Bryant Park.while enjoying our drinks. Bryant Park is a hidden gem right across the street. Hotel in a great area. Loved the clean, crisp bed linens and the shampoo and products in the bathroom so much I ordered when I returned home. Plan on going back to Park Terrace my next Newy York visit.

hotel_name: Park Terrace Hotel on Bryant Park
review_body: Just an excellent facility.... staff... and location. Stayed an extra night because our experience was so good... wether traveling for business or a first timer in NYC... the staff was professional, courteous and helpful.

hotel_name: Park Terrace Hotel on Bryant Park
review_body: Pros: Great location, helpful and welcoming staff, super clean and stylish accommodations. Large room. Awesome high end breakfast bar, dining terrace with one of the best Manhattan views.Cons: none.Advice - provide light blankets for summer instead of the comfy warm comforter (leave it in the closet).

hotel_name: Park Terrace Hotel on Bryant Park
review_body: From the moment we walked in the door we were always greeted with smiles and prompt service to make sure our stay was excellent. Loved the rooftop bar and the complimentary breakfast. Awesome location! We were will be back!

hotel_name: Park Terrace Hotel on Bryant Park
review_body: Room and bathroom were super clean with high end fixtures and accents. Interior design is nice and had attention to details. Towels and sheets were new and soft.Had peace and quiet for working inside my room.

hotel_name: Park Terrace Hotel on Bryant Park
review_body: We liked the location not far from subway station in central NY, rooms ( not big but comfortable and well equipped) and cleanliness. The small issue was the lack of good organization of breakfasts. But anyway this is a good hotel and we would freely recommend it to our friends when in NY.

hotel_name: Park Terrace Hotel on Bryant Park
review_body: We chose Park Terrace for it's superb location across from Bryant Park and being steps away from all that the city has to offer. We were warmly welcomed by José, Noah, and Charlie who graciously answered our questions and helped us download the hotel app which was invaluable during our stay. We opened the door to our Parkview room on the fifth floor and were delighted with how they utilized the room to make it a comfortable place for us to recharge after a tiring day. The bed was incredibly comfortable, shower divine, and they had little amenities anticipating our every need. I ended up forgetting my sunglasses at home and was delighted to find fold up sunglasses in what they called the "hangover recovery kit". We gathered with our friends at the Rooftop Terrace on the 6th Floor which offered a great view of the Empire State Building and a perfect place to spend "happy hour" or end our day. After a tiring day of endless walking we returned to the hotel to ask the concierge, Larissa, to recommend a place close by where we could get a late lunch. She referred us to the L'Adresse American Bistro, gave us coupons for a free drink, and even called ahead to make sure they were ready for the six of us. The breakfast bar at the Terrazzo on the 6th floor offered a delicious array of breakfast foods from fruit to delicious doughnuts. It was unanimous among the 6 of us that we wanted to return to Park Terrace next summer. They made us feel welcome and at home!

hotel_name: Park Terrace Hotel on Bryant Park
review_body: what an amazing city, Park Terrace Hotel right in the center, connected to any transportation you need and located at the most mazing park i've ever seen. i recommend the hotel because of the extremely helpful stuffy, the fuctional and comfortable placement.

hotel_name: Park Terrace Hotel on Bryant Park
review_body: They arranged for us to be on the same floor with our nanny & our rooms were ready at 1130am! Gabriella & Noah(?) were great (green tea scent that others have talked about you can smell outside - which is refreshing!). Pros: -Location! Across from Bryant Park (not directly, so you won't get a great view from your room, but decent). End of block is a subway & times square, empire state, Rockefeller are close enough to walk, but far enough from congestion. - Kiddos felt special getting Magnolia Bakery treats set up in the room. BONUS: They wrote an extra special note to our kiddos, which they loved! -Breakfast was enough to get going for day & not too much that your too full for lunch. -Cozy rooms (we had the 2 of us in a king & 2 kiddos on the sofa bed), but we had enough room. If we had gone with a queen we would have had more room, so that was on us. -Bathrooms feel clean/new still -The 6th floor terrace has great view of empire state building - Water stations - we filled up daily & were good for our adventures. Never had to buy water. - They have a self service laundry area & dry cleaning. Other items: - Air was not working, so we moved rooms after we had unpacked. They were so accommodating & moved us to upgraded room. In new room the water wouldn't heat up, but they had fixed in no time. They were so accommodating & caring about the inconvenience it didn't phase us at all. 1st room we did like better though on layout. -elevators take a while to go up & down in busy times

hotel_name: Park Terrace Hotel on Bryant Park
review_body: If you like spacious hotel rooms this one is not for you, as the rooms, whilst modern and comfortable, are small. But you are usually not in your room much in this city! The Hotel manages to be right in the heart of NYC for all your sightseeing, yet still offers some respite from the noise and infrastructure of that city by being so close to Bryant Park. We loved strolling through the park, had a couple of warm summer evening meals in the cafe there and watched a free movie there one night.Another pleasant outdoor location was the 6th floor terrace of the Hotel restaurant with views of the Empire State Building to the back and the Library to the front. As to the restaurant breakfast included with our stay, it was an amazing array of fresh fruits, granola, several varieties of breads and sweet baked treats, artisan cheeses, butter, yoghurt, nuts, jams, and charcuterie.We could get anywhere using the 42nd street subway station or the 5th Avenue buses. The Reception staff were welcoming and helpful. The room was quiet for sleeping. We appreciated the environmentally friendly aspects in regard to water stations and toiletries. All in all, we thought we made an excellent choice for our 6 nights in NYC.

hotel_name: Park Terrace Hotel on Bryant Park
review_body: The Park Terrace is very centrally located in Midtown, and the staff was exceptionally helpful and courteous. The rooftop terrace bar is a nice touch. We also enjoyed the complimentary breakfast buffet for its variety and well prepared cuisine.

hotel_name: Park Terrace Hotel on Bryant Park
review_body: This was a quick two nights in New York City to attend a concert and visit some museums. We know the city well and have stayed there on numerous occasions. We preferred to be centrally located on this trip to attend our concert in Madison Square Garden and a restaurant nearby. We walked everywhere for that evening. Took a car service uptown next day to visit numerous museums and sights further away from hotel. Clean, modern hotel with outstanding staff at both the Front Desk and the Bar/Breakfast area. Room was a bit small but comfortable with all the basics necessary for a pleasant stay. We had a room with a view of Bryant Park. There was scaffolding and construction in area of hotel entrance but it did not interfere with our stay. No noise factor to worry about. Breakfast was included in the room price and it was very, very good.

hotel_name: Park Terrace Hotel on Bryant Park
review_body: Great place - the staff (in particular Charles) went above and beyond to make our stay awesome. We stayed four nights and loved it. The 6th floor Terazzo (indoor and outdoor) and breakfasts are also a great feature of this hotel.

hotel_name: Park Terrace Hotel on Bryant Park
review_body: The location of the hotel is perfect - close to Times Square, restaurants, Bryant Park and other attractions. Room was very clean and had all the modern amenities (fridge, coffee maker etc.). A huge plus was the complimentary continental breakfast, one of the best you will experience, with a friendly staff to assist if needed. Overall great place to stay and excellent staff. Highly recommend it.

hotel_name: Park Terrace Hotel on Bryant Park
review_body: A new hotel with quality throughout. Friendly and helpful staff and a beautiful patio available all day and evening. Good breakfast and small plates for evening. A central location and being located across from Bryant Park let on choose to relax or join in the local activities. A surprise and makes for an enjoyable business trip.

hotel_name: Park Terrace Hotel on Bryant Park
review_body: Great location next to Bryant Park. Comfy rooms, great breakfast, friendly staff and lovely rooftop deck. Will definitely come back and recommend to others. Parking was a few blocks away but not a huge deal.
user_name:
bethskoro
Washington DC, District of Columbia

hotel_name: Park Terrace Hotel on Bryant Park
review_body: Booked at the last minute and didn't know what to expect. The hotel is new, and in a great location. Room was petite, but very well appointed, and worked perfectly. We loved the lounge and outdoor terrace, and the breakfast was delightful. Would definitely stay again!

hotel_name: Park Terrace Hotel on Bryant Park
review_body: I have never been happier to leave a review. The hotel was in a perfect location and was the perfect combination of luxury and hospitality. The staff was wonderful. We were celebrating my daughter’s birthday and they were so kind as to have cupcakes in the room when she arrived. The terrace is a beautiful spot for breakfast and drinks in the evening. The Park Terrace is the only place I will stay when traveling to NY. I would really prefer to keep it a secret!

hotel_name: Park Terrace Hotel on Bryant Park
review_body: The location is amazing, but the rooms are extremely tiny! I wasn’t expecting a huge room given that it’s NYC, but this was crazy small. When I had booked the room, the photos had showed a room with a little sofa which we did not get. There was no dresser, so our whole room was just filled with our luggage.

hotel_name: Park Terrace Hotel on Bryant Park
review_body: This beautiful hotel is very well located in front on a nice park and a few steps from 5th Avenue. The hotel offers a beautiful terrace. The people working there are customer service oriented. I recommand it highly!

hotel_name: Park Terrace Hotel on Bryant Park
review_body: Great boutique hotel! Breakfast served daily on 6th floor! Delicious! Outside seating with great views too! Continental Breakfast:) Do not stay on 6th floor. Due to breakfast workers, it was loud with them preparing food... Valet parking was worth it! You don’t need a car! Walk to restaurants, Broadway shows, bars. Bryant park is beautiful which is next to hotel. Relax and people watch :)

hotel_name: Park Terrace Hotel on Bryant Park
review_body: Amazing hotel in an amazing location with an incredible terrace overlooking Bryant Park serving amazing breakfast included in the price of the room. Also rooms looked brand new with very nice sheets, all very small but beautiful and just Amazing staff. Perfection!

hotel_name: Park Terrace Hotel on Bryant Park
review_body: We stayed three nights and we really enjoyed our stay here. Hotel staff are professional, competent and friendly. I appreciated that they always welcomed us with smiles when we returned from a long day in the city. Location is perfect (our room was overlooking Bryant Park) and the room was modern, chic, and upscale. Room itself wasn't spacious but it had everything we needed (small refrigerator, espresso machine, and a dining table with two chairs) and was the perfect size for two adults and a baby. Needless to say, we will be coming back in the future.

hotel_name: Park Terrace Hotel on Bryant Park
review_body: Thank you Park Terrace for existing. Our trip to New York turned into a peaceful experience because of the quiet you guaranteed by night , your kind staff, and the five star quality of your rooms and I’m being specific talking about the fluffy towels, comfortable sheets, wonderful peppermint shampoos, etc etc... the only scary thing was the cold at the entrance that made all the concierges cold. Please solve that because they are so nice they don’t deserve it! Thank you again for all Park terrace! Ooooh and the breakfasts my god, the breakfasts!!! Thank you and see you soon! :)

hotel_name: Park Terrace Hotel on Bryant Park
review_body: Spent a few days on Bryant Park, a perfect central location from which to explore the city. The hotel was wonderful! Quiet, clean, intimate, beautiful, well-appointed. Exceptionally welcoming staff. Terrific street and neighborhood, easy subway access. But mostly: the breakfast! A European style buffet, breads, meats, cheese, candied walnuts, amazing cut fresh fruit, dark coffee, juice bar, tender NY bagels and unbelievable donuts and pastries. All in front of the fireplace or on the patio with views of the library/park or Empire State building. We're never going to stay anywhere else.

hotel_name: Park Terrace Hotel on Bryant Park
review_body: We loved our stay at Park Terrace. Great location, very comfortable, excellent breakfast. Good value for what you get. This was the most pleasant, peaceful stay we’ve had in NYC. Right next to Bryant Park and a 5m walk from Times Square. Metro stations very close. Room is Manhattan small but well designed to feel more comfortable than other hotels I’ve stayed at in the area (we had a standard room). Very quiet for NYC. Area felt very safe.

hotel_name: Park Terrace Hotel on Bryant Park
review_body: Perfect location, amazingly friendly and helpful staff, clean new rooms, awesome breakfast, all for a great value. This hotel exceeded my expectations and I don't think there was one think I would complain about.

hotel_name: Park Terrace Hotel on Bryant Park
review_body: I would absolutely recommend Park Terrace Hotel to my friends if they were to come and stay in New York. Not only is it conveniently placed, it has great service with people who are always asking how your day has been. Keep it up!

hotel_name: Park Terrace Hotel on Bryant Park
review_body: First of all is a good value for money hotel. The hotel looks nice and the rooms are clean and trendy.The location is just amazing - on the Bryant Park, very close to both times square and empire state building.The breakfast is fresh and delicious.

hotel_name: Park Terrace Hotel on Bryant Park
review_body: The staff was awesome. When we checked out, Charlie who works there literally ran down the street a couple of blocks until he got us a taxi cab for us so we wouldn't miss our flight back to Mpls. He went above and beyond. I would highly recommend this hotel, I know my family and I will be staying there again on our next trip to NY.

hotel_name: Park Terrace Hotel on Bryant Park
review_body: Well designed. David Chipperfield. Brilliant location. Midtown Manhattan. The hotel is literally steps away from Bryant Park and Times Square. Rooms are small but hey... you're in NYC. Get out there and enjoy the big apple

hotel_name: Park Terrace Hotel on Bryant Park
review_body: So Grateful that the management and staff were able to accommodate my girlfriend and me with such short noticed after our plane trip was canceled due to a thunderstorm. We wanted a place close to Times Square and with a view (which can be difficult in NYC) and got both in one shot. The two days stay was perfect with unlimited filtered water and a super chic and modern room. The bar served one of the best Old fashions ever and the gym was impressive. Can't wait to return.
user_name:
mistamiggs
New York City, New York

hotel_name: Park Terrace Hotel on Bryant Park
review_body: Loved our stay at Park Terrace Hotel on Bryant Park. Convenient location. Clean rooms. The rooms are small but have everything you need. Great workspace/dining space in room. Loved their water station and toiletry closet on each floor. Forgot something, no problem.

hotel_name: Park Terrace Hotel on Bryant Park
review_body: We loved the hotel. The included breakfast was excellent and we thoroughly enjoyed having cocktails and breakfast on the landscaped outside terrace on the 6th floor. It had great views of the city and lovely Bryant Park that was right across the street. We were in NY to see two shows and the location was perfect for that. I could even sign in and listen to my Pandora or watch my Netflix.

hotel_name: Park Terrace Hotel on Bryant Park
review_body: Great service, great room, amazing breakfast (fresh fruit, fresh breads, even mango). Very good location, close to everything. Our room had a beautiful view of the New York Library. We will go back any time.

hotel_name: Park Terrace Hotel on Bryant Park
review_body: Great new hotel in the middle of the city. Close to theatre district without all the noise and bustle. Well designed room with excellent lighting for work or reading. One thing that could be improved is the couch which I found uncomfortable for my back,

hotel_name: Park Terrace Hotel on Bryant Park
review_body: After lots of searching for a decent hotel we settled on this one and we couldn't of been happier. From the first time we walked into the hotel we were made to feel welcome by the front of house staff. Following that, every member of staff we spoke to were genuinely happy to help us. On our third night I left my camera in a restaurant and on returning to the hotel I was lucky enough to receive the help of two members of staff from reception. Nothing was too much trouble and they assisted me in retrieving my camera, for which I am extremely grateful.The hotel is in an ideal location, overlooking Bryant Park and 5 minutes from Times Square and offers all of the facilities you need to enjoy your stay. The outdoor breakfast area was lovely and you can sit gazing at the Empire State building!The rooms offer everything you need, very clean, plenty of coffee, water stations, safe and excellent entertainment options. Bathroom was excellent, plenty of space and a good strong shower to refresh you.I'll admit to never using the provided Yoga mat....... maybe next time!Thanks for looking after us Kevin and Natalie.

hotel_name: Park Terrace Hotel on Bryant Park
review_body: Great service. Happy and helpful staff, delicious breakfast and so much choice of food. The location was central to everything yet far enough away from the hustle and bustle. Bryant Park was a delight to sit in and people watch.

hotel_name: Park Terrace Hotel on Bryant Park
review_body: I booked a Deluxe Room last minute after being stranded in NYC because of flight cancellations. The Park Terrace team was so welcoming upon arrival. The location was perfect to NYC attractions and restaurants. The rooms and hotel grounds as a whole were stylish and impeccably clean! Probably the best hotel I have stayed at in the city. Charlie offered an umbrella for us to use in the rain and even coordinated to have cupcakes delivered as a surprise to my room from Magnolia Bakery to make up for a horrible day of travel! The breakfast was delicious with a great view from the terrace and they even let my coworker and I work in the lobby late into the next day until our flight. Offering water throughout the afternoon.The entire Park Terrace team made up for a horrible travel experience and Charlie was the icing on the cake with his personal touches on the entire experience. I will make a point to stay here again on my next business OR personal trip to the city.

hotel_name: Park Terrace Hotel on Bryant Park
review_body: Hotel is nice, location is great. Hotel staff is friendly and helpful, especially Charlie at the front desk. My only complaints are regarding the extra fees we were charged, and that we weren’t notified when our room was ready as promised. We arrived early after a red eye and left our bags with the front desk. The woman who checked us in said that they would call or text when our room was ready, and that it should be ready before the normal check in time of 3pm. We didn’t receive a call or text, and only found out our room was ready when we called at 3pm. Our family of three stayed in a studio suite, it has a king bed and sofa sleeper. Their website advertises that it sleeps up to three people, so I was very surprised to see an “extra person” charge for each day of our stay when we checked out. The room was decent size for NYC, but I wouldn’t consider it luxurious, and at nearly $500 a night, I’m not sure it’s really worth it.

hotel_name: Park Terrace Hotel on Bryant Park
review_body: We spent considerable time researching which hotel to stay in for our first trip to New York and we were not disappointed by this hotel. The hotel was quite busy when we tried to check in at 1pm, so no rooms were available, but by 330pm we were given a deluxe room on the 3rd floor with a view of Bryant Park. Be aware that it is more of a library view with an angled view of the park if you look up the street, but still it was nice not to have to look out at another tall building. The staff left a little treat and note in our room for our anniversary which was a nice touch. We found all the staff here to be very friendly. The soundproofing in the rooms is great, we couldn't hear anything in the hotel, or from the street below even though we were on the 3rd floor. The free breakfast is very busy and chaotic in the morning and it is usually hard to find somewhere to sit, however the food is delicious and well worth the wait. The rooms are not large, but you are in Manhattan. We didn't have any issues navigating 2 people with 2 large suitcases. The rooms were modern, clean and bright. However, I'm not a big fan of residential sized bathroom amenities that are shared amongst guests, so we did end up purchasing our own amenities at the local CVS. I would have much preferred individual sized shampoo, conditioner, etc. The hotel is in the perfect location to explore midtown manhattan, we were able to easily walk to Times Square, The Broadway Show "Come From Away: - which you have to see!, Central Park, Rockefeller Center, Empire State Building, shopping on 5th Ave and Madison Ave. For everything else the subway is 2 min up the street. Blue Bottle coffee is a few doors down and it is hands down one of the best coffees I have ever had. If i had to pick one item where improvements could be made, it would be the elevators, they are extremely slow. Overall, we loved our stay and would recommend this hotel as a base for anyone exploring NYC.

hotel_name: Park Terrace Hotel on Bryant Park
review_body: Great hotel, with so many wonderful facilities. Rooms were modern and spacious, bedding super comfy and a large TV for those wanting some down time.Breakfast a highlight, as was the hotel terrace. Views straight into the Empire State Building. Staff all warm and friendly. Made my stay a very memorable one. Can’t wait to return.

hotel_name: Park Terrace Hotel on Bryant Park
review_body: What an exceptional hotel this was! I am an international tourist & transferred here, late at night, after suffering an airborne allergic reaction in the previous NYC accommodation. I am anaphylactic and have multiple allergies, including foods. Staff at Park Terrace were so helpful and supportive. I was assigned a comfortable, clean & well presented room...and told to contact reception if I needed anything at all. They even helped me to navigate my phone records to print boarding passes and theatre tickets. The complementary breakfast catered for dairy, gluten and peanut allergies. I am super impressed with staff attitude as well as the hotel presentation. Congratulations Park Terrace Hotel. Hotel staff present as a “shining beacon of light in the NYC accommodation scene” and deserve commendation and recognition for your outstanding service.

hotel_name: Park Terrace Hotel on Bryant Park
review_body: A wonderful hotel with beautiful rooms and all required amenities (incl an espresso machine).I enjoyed the room very much even if only for one night this time but I will definitely be back !Very easy checkin and helpful staff too.

hotel_name: Park Terrace Hotel on Bryant Park
review_body: Nice, modern, perfect location. Friendly people. The internet service, connections could be better.Very clean, very good breakfast for the money, good in room coffee. Very, very contemporary plumbing, electrical,

hotel_name: Park Terrace Hotel on Bryant Park
review_body: Beautiful new hotel located across from Bryant Park. Rooms are oversized with all the luxury amenities you would expect from a 5 star.Fitness center is top notch.La Pecora Bianca is opening soon on the ground floor and I cant wait to return to try it out!Be sure to visit their "Terrace". Rooftop-like space overlooking Bryant Park. Great food, beverage and service with a polished staff. Good to do business or have some cocktails with a view.

hotel_name: Park Terrace Hotel on Bryant Park
review_body: Stayed here for the weekend with my daughter to celebrate my birthday. We were impressed with the customer service. Everyone was smiling and ready to accommodate. The room was clean, and the bed was fresh and comfortable. Our shower had amazing pressure and we had use of top of the line Toiletries. There is a pretty good complimentary breakfast upstairs, but go early. They don’t replenish the stock as it gets low. This is right across from Bryant Park and close to everything. What more could one ask for? I will definitely consider staying here again whenever I’m back to NYC!

hotel_name: Park Terrace Hotel on Bryant Park
review_body: Room was like new. Staff were very friendly and helpful. Don't miss out on the great free breakfasts. Dinner at the Bryant Park Grill across the street was excellent. Short walking distance to Times Square and the Theater District.

hotel_name: Park Terrace Hotel on Bryant Park
review_body: Never disappointed . A return stay with all positive feedback. Mother daughter long weekend .Great location, wonderful friendly staff. Lovely hotel, multiple options offered at breakfast time.Thank you for all.

hotel_name: Park Terrace Hotel on Bryant Park
review_body: Great service!! Called late night to try and send my wife flowers, unfortunately it was too late for their vendor but got her a cupcake and a note from magnolia bakery sent up to her instead!! They are awesome!!

hotel_name: Park Terrace Hotel on Bryant Park
review_body: Excellent location right across from the park. Clean. Helpful staff. Delicious, abundant breakfast buffet. We ate on the deck and it couldn’t have been more pleasant. Easy walk to theater district but much nicer than staying in the Times Square area. Highly recommend. Will stay here again.

hotel_name: Park Terrace Hotel on Bryant Park
review_body: The Park Terrace Bryant Park is in a perfect location. The updated rooms, amenities and Terrace Lounge make your stay very comfortable. Great beds! The staff is the real gem of this establishment. We treated with friendly and helpful ambassadors who made our stay extra special.

hotel_name: Park Terrace Hotel on Bryant Park
review_body: I would stay here again for sure. The location can't be beat - close enough to everything but not right in the middle the craziness that's Time Square. My room did not face the street and it was super quiet. Never heard dump trucks, ambulances, sirens, etc. Easy walk to Grand Central Station. Bryant Park is across the street and there's always something going on there.

hotel_name: Park Terrace Hotel on Bryant Park
review_body: We came after a long travel and to see such a small room where I didn’t even have space to keep my bags. I was offered a room in the 2nd floor and 6th floor where the breakfast is served and yes it’s very noisy on this floor. I have a 2 year old. I chose the 6th floor thinking higher floor would be better. This room (611) is in such a corner and I don’t think anyone would like it. I asked them to put me to a room where there is a better view on a higher floor. They kept showing me the upgrade rates. I am like why do you want me to upgrade when I already have paid. I would never recommend this hotel to anyone and definitely wouldn’t come back. They have a lot of categories, all so confusing and they don’t have any king beds available in the first 4/5 categories. Please in case you are booking, call them and confirm what category you are booking and don’t be fooled by reviews just like me. All they talk about is money and very professional but u helpful customer service. I have travelled all around the world and never felt so bad about the service.

hotel_name: Park Terrace Hotel on Bryant Park
review_body: From the moment I walked into the Park Terrace, I could smell it in the air, as white tea, and fig permeated my senses. I thought to myself, this is where I’m supposed to be! As I walked to the check in counter Larissa confirmed it! This place is classy, elegant, and filled with beauty. As Mrs. Santiago helped me check into my suite, she made a lot of great suggestions for places to visit in the city, and helped me book a trip on the sailing vessel, The Shearwater, an 81 foot wooden schooner built in 1929. As I spent the afternoon sailing throughout the Hudson, I couldn’t help from thinking that the one thing I was missing was that Puerto Rican beauty waiting back for me at the hotel. I spent the rest of the hot afternoon bicycling throughout the city to some of the other great places she suggested I visit during my stay, I.e Hudson Yards, The Highline, and down to Bleecker Street in the West Village. As I licked my ice cream in the hot summer sun, and reflected back on the great day, the highlight of it all was meeting Larissa, and the rest of the friendly Concierge at the Park Terrace Hotel.

hotel_name: Park Terrace Hotel on Bryant Park
review_body: Loved this hotel. Great location, atmosphere, and service. The breakfast bar exceeded expectations as there were tons of options... way better than a typical continental breakfast. Will definitely stay again next time I'm in NY.

hotel_name: Park Terrace Hotel on Bryant Park
review_body: We had a great stay at the park terrace! It was very clean and everything was as described. The location was walking distance to many places and very close to the subway. The breakfast was very good, I would suggest going early because some popular items run out and would take a while to be refilled.

hotel_name: Park Terrace Hotel on Bryant Park
review_body: Had an excellent stay- highlights were: 1 block from subwaySpacious room with sitting areaComfy firm bed and hi quality linensVery functional bathroomWonderful breakfast with ample selectionsBeautiful terrace overlooks Bryant Park, an oasis in the cityWelcoming lobby that’s quiet and elegant, the staff were all very knowledgeable and helpful and everything was no fuss.

hotel_name: Park Terrace Hotel on Bryant Park
review_body: I stayed in this hotel for 4 nights in August. The physical space is amazing. Beautiful decor, clean, comfortable rooms. The beds and sheets are super comfy and its so quiet for a NY hotel. You can’t hear traffic, sirens or noises from the other rooms.So many thoughtful inclusions: great Breakfast, hydration stations on each level, complimentary drink on arrival. During my stay, I had some terrible news about a death in the family and the staff were so amazing. They were so sympathetic and caring. To have a space and people like this to hold me at a time when I was grieving was remarkably special and I will always remember my stay at the Park Terrace with much gratitude and fondness. I will definitely return.

hotel_name: Park Terrace Hotel on Bryant Park
review_body: I lived in Manhattan for years but was a bit nervous booking a hotel. I had never stayed in a hotel in the city and had only heard nightmares.I was looking for a clean and relatively affordable place to stay in the city. My 5yo and I were doing a quick weekend trip.I booked a room at a nice rate based solely on TripAdvisor reviews.We managed to walk to the hotel from Penn Station on the hottest day of the year. It was a 10-15min walk. I mistakenly tried to check into a different hotel called Bryant Park hotel, I think?!?They quickly explained I was at the hotel two doors down. I am SO glad we were in that hotel!The lobby smelled amazing. Some sort of green tea fragrance. Loved it! The front desk staff was incredibly nice. They had our room ready hours before check-in. The room was super clean! Brand new. The room was small but perfect for us! Bed was super comfy and CLEAN! The bathroom was small with a standup shower stall. Loved the toiletries! The hotel offers refillable plastic water bottles. I was impressed with the mini bar/prices and free amenities.We were a 6min walk to Times Square and 15min walk to 30 Rock!We met friends on the 6th floor terrace. Awesome space with an incredible view of the Empire State Building. Drinks wereDelicious.Our rate included breakfast. I was blown away by the offerings. Fresh fruits, pastries, bagels, croissants, hard boiled eggs, charcuterie, yogurt, juices and delicious coffee. We had a lovely breakfast on the outdoor terrace.I LOVED this place! A true hidden gem!

hotel_name: Park Terrace Hotel on Bryant Park
review_body: Totally satisfied with my stay at Park Terrace Hotel. I was a solo traveler and stayed for 5 days in one of their deluxe rooms with a view. The room is exactly as showed on the web site. I loved the sitting area in the room because I had family come and see me and we had a small space to get together. The room itself and the bathroom was clean. Loved the bathroom amenities that was provided - you didn't have to worry about shampoo/conditioner/soap/body lotion. Product was top of the line. And as a woman, I truly appreciate. They had a nepresso machine which I loved because I'm one of those people who just can't function without a sip of caffeine. You're also provided with an iron and ironing board( a lot of hotels don't have them inside the rooms anymore). Housekeeping was wonderful. I always came back to a pristine room. Oh and the almost forgot about the drinking water station! Wonderful! Breakfast was free with the accommodation. No complaints here. Enjoyed it each morning. The terrace was a bonus. Outdoor space in a big city is always welcome.Location was great if you're visiting and doing a lot of sightseeing. Metro stations near by. Lots of places to get a grab to eat. and of course Bryant Park to just people watch and chill. I didn't have much interaction with the staff except for when I was checking in and out but they have a young and good-looking front desk staff that always have a welcoming smile when you come and go through the lobby. Will definitely stay here again on my next visit. Will highly recommend.

hotel_name: Park Terrace Hotel on Bryant Park
review_body: Its a very good hotel in face of bryant park. All are very friendly and help us when we need. Breakfest on the terrasse at 6th floor. The bathroom is a litle bit small but has a separate shower. We had a deluxe room.

hotel_name: Park Terrace Hotel on Bryant Park
review_body: We have a very confortable stay in this very well located hotel. The terrasse for breakfast is beautiful and the breakfast is hight quality with fresh fruits and products. We appreciate the high quality of beds and quietness of the room despite the noise outside. Bryant Park nearby is my favorite place in neighborhood.

hotel_name: Park Terrace Hotel on Bryant Park
review_body: Every part of our stay was excellent! From great complimentary breakfasts every morning to the complimentary bag holding to the service of each employee, this hotel and its staff helped us have a great vacation! I would stay here again without question on another trip to NYC.
user_name:
Jason D
Cuba City, Wisconsin, United States

hotel_name: Park Terrace Hotel on Bryant Park
review_body: Stylish clean rooms with great decor. Solid breakfast buffet option on lovely roof patio area. Gym equipment was minimal but clean and did the trick. Staff was friendly. Water bottle solution for guests was smart and environmentally friendly!

hotel_name: Park Terrace Hotel on Bryant Park
review_body: Location! Location! Location! This hotel is situated in the best place... away from the noise of Times Square but close enough to everything you need to get to. The hotel was so kind to put a little treat in our room for my mums birthday, which made it extra special, and the reception staff were always so friendly.The room is abit expensive for a park facing room. You only get a diagonal view of the park and a full view of the public library. The room is neatened up everyday but it’s not a thorough proper clean. And, the breakfast area should consider having refills of any breakfast items ready in the kitchen, rather than wait until it’s done, and then leave guests waiting while they refill any items.Other than that, our stay was really lovely and I’m glad we stayed so close to Bryant park.

hotel_name: Park Terrace Hotel on Bryant Park
review_body: I was in NY for a celebration. The hotel was a wonderful home base. My initial room a bit claustrophobic, it was a small interior room with one window too high to open that must have faced a wall? I asked to upgrade and they upgraded me to a wonderful room that looked out on the Library and Bryant Park. Everyone I interacted with was kind and professional. The breakfast, which many have discussed is excellent. I enjoyed sitting outside to eat and my last morning I had to take breakfast to go. I appreciated that I could.

hotel_name: Park Terrace Hotel on Bryant Park
review_body: Good value: If you take the time to compare. Good location: Blocks from Time Square and the subway. Great staff: Very helpful with directions. Clean! - this a very clean hotel! Beds: a little hard. Breakfast: It's fair. Don't expect eggs and sausage. Bar: Meh, your in NYC, why are you sitting at the hotel bar anyway? View: We were on the backside - ya, pull the shade nothing to look at there.

hotel_name: Park Terrace Hotel on Bryant Park
review_body: We appreciated the central location. We enjoyed access to the Terrace for breakfast, at dusk, and at night. Breakfast options were excellent - not Full American, but nice European. The Empire State Building view was great as well.

hotel_name: Park Terrace Hotel on Bryant Park
review_body: Really enjoyed Park Terrace Hotel. Staff were all friendly and helpful. Room was clean and received complementary NYC snacks that were really good. First time I stayed at a hotel that provided unlimited filtered drinking water with bottle. We really enjoyed breakfast too. Highly recommend Park Terrace Hotel.

hotel_name: Park Terrace Hotel on Bryant Park
review_body: Our stay at the hotel was effortless and enjoyable. The staff was very considerate, kind, welcoming, and generous. They surprised us with cupcakes as a congratulations and a thank you for choosing their hotel for the occasion. We stayed in one of their park view deluxe rooms and I felt for the location and the complimentary breakfast it was totally worth the money. Very clean and modern as well!

hotel_name: Park Terrace Hotel on Bryant Park
review_body: Really lovely place and great staff. One male reception host (blond and wears glasses...sorry I didn’t get his name) helped us prep for a walking tour and then remembered and asked us about it another day and then ran out with an umbrella to protect us from the monsoon type rain we were having as we departed. Just above and beyond and very kind and thoughtful of him. All staff were kind and welcoming and we felt it was a lovely hotel. One mild negative was that the towels smelt quite Indian spiced and I don’t know why, however they appeared clean and it wasn’t offensive. A cooked breakfast would have been awesome too.

hotel_name: Park Terrace Hotel on Bryant Park
review_body: We chose this hotel for our 2nd year anniversary stay in Manhattan from 30th June to 6th July and although we both were initially hesitant booking due to this being a new hotel and having very little reviews, it was the best decision we made. From the minute we walked through the door, we were welcomed with smiling friendly faces. The room itself was just gorgeous! We booked the deluxe room with park view - everything about this room was mesmerising - it was clean, modern and full of gadgets. The location is perfect, very close to the bus tour starting locations, top of the rock and many more. The breakfast was an added bonus, so delicious and tasty, the boxes provided by the hotel to take breakfast away is such a thoughtful bonus. I can not wait to return to NYC to stay at Park Terrace Hotel. Thank you so much for making our 2nd anniversary so memorable. I would reccomend this hotel to everyone! Thanks again. Mr & Mrs Younus❤

hotel_name: Park Terrace Hotel on Bryant Park
review_body: Gorgeous hotel, near a lot of attractions. Walking distance from Times Square, Rockefeller Center, Fifth Avenue shops, and Grand Central Station. Staff is professional and beyond accommodating. The rooms are luxurious and modern and compliment New York's forward thinking culture.

hotel_name: Park Terrace Hotel on Bryant Park
review_body: My boyfriend and I stayed at the park terrace hotel for one leisure night. The hotel was centrally located and appealing. The room was very clean and the staff were pleasant. The hotel offered a continental breakfast which was nice. Our overall stay was enjoyable.

hotel_name: Park Terrace Hotel on Bryant Park
review_body: The room has great bed and equipments for people would like to stay here. But the breakfast is always same everyday. It could be better to stay over 3 days people that the food can have change. Location is wonderful and prefect.

hotel_name: Park Terrace Hotel on Bryant Park
review_body: Very good location, close to everything. Rooms are tiny but well designed. Breakfast is pretty good, wish it has some vegetables and sometimes hard to get a seat. Service staffs are very polite and professional.

hotel_name: Park Terrace Hotel on Bryant Park
review_body: Wonderful hotel in a great location right on Bryant Park. Lots of nice restaurants close by. Make sure to stop in the New York City Public Library across the street. . Breakfast was much nicer than the usual. Rooms clean and well appointed. Nespresso machine was a real plus. Friendly and professional staff.

hotel_name: Park Terrace Hotel on Bryant Park
review_body: Stayed here at the end of July and loved it. We will definitely frequent this hotel again. The room was very nice and we appreciated the thoughtful welcome gifts. We were in NYC for a show and had no trouble walking. Would highly recommend.

hotel_name: Park Terrace Hotel on Bryant Park
review_body: Disappointing 9th floor view considering we booked a "high floor" at a higher rate. Although considering the speed of the elevators maybe this was a plus. Rooms are minuscule, though I suppose we should have expected that in Midtown. On the plus side we did find the lobby and room to be generally modern and up-to-date. Location is prime and room was clean, quiet, and comfortable. The breakfast lived up to its billing.

hotel_name: Park Terrace Hotel on Bryant Park
review_body: My stay at the Park Terrace Hotel on Bryant Park was exceptional. The hotel is beautifully furnished, clean and the staff went above and beyond to ensure we had everything we needed and always greeted us with a smile. The included breakfast was lovely, and was constantly refilled to ensure no one missed out. I would definitely stay at Park Terrace again.

hotel_name: Park Terrace Hotel on Bryant Park
review_body: I travel frequently for work and this hotel was exceptional. They have thought of everything, movable table for work, Bose speaker to connect to, enough space to be comfortable. The breakfast was outstanding. I will be coming back to this hotel

hotel_name: Park Terrace Hotel on Bryant Park
review_body: The hotel is conveniently located close to the theater district and close to subway stations that cover most of the major lines in the subway system. The rooms are small, as is typical for NY hotels, but very comfortable and efficiently planned. The breakfast was very high quality food - bagels, pastries, eggs, cheeses, charcuterie, fresh juices and coffee. It was served in a room that had an outdoor space attached with comfortable seating and views of the Empire State Building and Bryant Park. The staff were extremely helpful. The gym was well designed with nice equipment and there was fresh filtered water available on every floor. I will go back next time we visit NYC for a theater weekend.

hotel_name: Park Terrace Hotel on Bryant Park
review_body: If you're staying near Bryant Park, Park Terrace is an excellent hotel. There are similar priced hotels in the area, and they will give you more space but the rooms will be older and the breakfasts will be mediocre. If you are ok with a little less space, you'll be happier here. We had a premier queen that had a separate seating area, though the room was still tight. Our room faced the back of another building with an alley in between. Though it wasn't much of a view, it was very quiet and we didn't hear any street noise. The room itself was comfortable with a great bed and bedding. There were USB charging ports on both sides of the bed. One nit is there should be more hooks in the bathroom – there is only one allowing only one towel to be hung. There are coat hooks on the wall near the thermostat, but having more in the bathroom would be better. The breakfast was continental and high quality, including a rotating selection of fruit. And they provide takeaway boxes in case you can't have a proper sit down meal. Espresso drinks are available from a barista at an extra cost. Lastly, like all hotels in NYC, the price of the rooms vary greatly with demand. In our research, when prices were high at Park Terrace, they were high at other nearby hotels as well. So don't think of what you’re getting for, say, $400 or $700 night, if that's the rate for your stay, because you'll be paying that for similar class hotels in the area. If that's not in your budget, then you'll need to find a lower class hotel, motel, hostel, etc.., or stay on a different date or at a different location. We found Sunday nights generally had the lowest rate.

hotel_name: Park Terrace Hotel on Bryant Park
review_body: We took a chance trying a different location to find our new ‘go to’ hotel. Convenient to several subway lines, Grand Central and Madison Square. Enjoyed the customer oriented staff and the healthy offerings for breakfast. We actually rested well without the typically grinding of the city because the hotel is across from the Park and mid avenue. Clean modern room. Loved it!

hotel_name: Park Terrace Hotel on Bryant Park
review_body: The hotel was located right across the street from Bryant Park. 1/2 block from 5th avenue, two doors down from Corepower Yoga studio and across the street from a Whole Foods market and subway stations. Needless to say, I loved the location. Service at the front desk was very good. I was in a premier room. Which was plenty of room for just me. It had a separate little square table with 2 chairs and a reading chair with big lamp as well. Lighting in the room was great ! Room lighting as well as bedside lighting. Yoga mats in room which were great as Corepower was next door and there is also free yoga in Bryant Park during the Summer although my class was cancelled due to rain. The breakfast is continental but really good. Fresh cut fruit with berries, grapefruit, melons, yogurt, granola, Bagels, assorted donuts, some prosciutto and salami and these awesome walnuts. Coffee,tea and juice were complimentary. Espresso drinks extra. Breakfast was well worth it ! Nespresso machines in the room were awesome too. My room did have a mini-fridge. Bed was super comfortable

hotel_name: Park Terrace Hotel on Bryant Park
review_body: Everything at this hotel was just okay. Upon check in, I was upgraded to a premium room but no one told me. Yes, you'd think this would be a good thing, but when I've paid for a room with a view, I don't want a marginally larger room instead (with a view of an air conditioner) with no explanation. The desk staff acted like they had done me some grand favor and then went into the back room to talk about me privately before finding me the room I had booked. My booking had also said that my room would have a refrigerator - which it did not, and they wouldn't give me one. The cleaning staff seemed uninterested, sometimes leaving me new towels and toilet paper, other times not. The tv/iphone pairing did not work and the air conditioning barely cooled the rooms at all. The breakfast spread was the best part of the stay -- if only the counters and tables had been kept clean of old food and dishes. A disappointing stay to say the least. I'd think it was just my experience but others I talked to in the hotel as well as a good friend also staying in another room had the same experience. Finally, after posting my review on Expedia, I got a non-descriptive and unspecific response about how really they couldn't have done much to help me, or what could be done to apologize for my disappointing experience. In customer service, it isn't so much about the mistakes made as it is what the company does to respond - and this hotel really seems to not care at all about their guests. Too bad. Plenty of other much better hotels in the area.

hotel_name: Park Terrace Hotel on Bryant Park
review_body: great staff, friendly and accommodating. great location with a nice terrace and good breakfast to start your day. had downpours and the front desk was quick to provide us with umbrellas to keep us dry

hotel_name: Park Terrace Hotel on Bryant Park
review_body: Loved this hotel. It is convenient to multiple subway stations and only a few blocks from Time Square. Lots of great food really close. The staff was extremely helpful and friendly. The rooms were very nice - we had a beautiful view of Bryant Park. Loved the roof top terrace. Especially loved that they provide refillable water bottles and water stations on every floor. Much needed in hot new york.

hotel_name: Park Terrace Hotel on Bryant Park
review_body: Marvellous location, even a whole foods healthy grocery store on the corner. Marvellous view from our north facing view of Bryant park and the beautiful library building. Sixth floor terrace is of park to the north and Empire State Building to the south. Sleek , clean , comfortable room and wonderful staff. Couple blocks to Time Square, Radio City, Rockefeller Centre. Entrance to hotel is on very quiet street for mid Manhattan with main roads and subway entrances to the east and west.

hotel_name: Park Terrace Hotel on Bryant Park
review_body: We had booked an apartment through AirBnB which fell through 3 weeks before our trip to NYC so we scrambled to find a hotel. This was the highest rated hotel in midtown that was reasonably priced. Normally I book Marriott's but this looked like a much better deal than others available. It exceeded our expectations. Very comfortable and stylish room. Terrific service and nice amenities - Water stations a nice touch.. Great location -- we love Bryant Park. Breakfast and happy hour both really nice. We will definitely stay here again on next trip to NYC.

hotel_name: Park Terrace Hotel on Bryant Park
review_body: Wonderful staff, location in the city next to Bryant Park, rooftop lounge overlooking the Empire State Building, delicious breakfast. Staff was terrific and helped with restaurant suggestions and transportation tips. Great value on the weekends.

hotel_name: Park Terrace Hotel on Bryant Park
review_body: I enjoyed my visit to the Park Terrace Hotel on Bryant Park. The location is excellent at mid-town Manhattan and the morning breakfast, as well as a nice terrace for drinks was perfect. The hotel staff are helpful and welcoming.

hotel_name: Park Terrace Hotel on Bryant Park
review_body: Very clean and accommodating, most comfortable bed in any hotel I've stayed in! Would've liked to have eggs and bacon for breakfast but what was available was delicious. The TV was a bit glitchy at times.

hotel_name: Park Terrace Hotel on Bryant Park
review_body: We stayed here for two nights to see a show and go to a Yankees game and really enjoyed the hotel! It was the perfection location. Just a quick walk to dinner and the show, a nice walk through Times Square on the way home, and close to several subway stops and lots of shopping. Of course, being across from Bryant Park was nice, too! We stayed in a Deluxe View room on the seventh floor, and our room looked just like the picture on the website with the couch and table. We had a nice side view of the park and I loved that our window opened. There was enough room for our carry-on suitcases and bags without making us feel crowded. The room felt light and fresh. There was a coffee maker with tiny mugs, and a really nice, small snack bar station with delicious looking treats that we didn’t eat. They also had a little box of essentials - Tylenol, bandaids - which we did use, so I was thankful for that! There was a nice welcome treat, and they also left us cupcakes from a local bakery for our anniversary! Five stars for that! The bathroom was a decent size for NYC, and the counter wasn’t huge but provided enough space for all of my things. The shower was good for one person and the shampoo and conditioner smelled amazing. The breakfast spread was really nice - although there is no hot food and it’s mostly pastries (good ones!!), the yogurt and granola was good. Overall, it was a really great benefit! The outside terrace space was really pretty. My husband had good service when he grabbed a drink at the bar. Also, the water bottles and filling station were perfect for the hot weekend.I tried out the Peleton in the gym, which was clean, well stocked with towels and water, and quiet. There was a wide range of other equipment. The front desk staff was friendly and helpful with any questions we had, including drink recommendations. In addition, all the staff I met in the halls or elevator were very friendly!There were just a few small things that made me take off one star. The bathroom door slides but does not shut and leaves a large gap into the room - so there’s is very little privacy. The conditioner had some black buildup/mildew where the screw-top meets the container. I also wish they had body wash instead of or in addition to a soap bar. A hook or bar to hang washcloths inside the shower would be nice. I wish the bar opened before 5 so we could enjoy an afternoon drink on the terrace, but it looks like they are working on that. Overall, we would definitely stay here again! Loved the location, the room was a nice size, the staff and service were friendly, the gym was clean and useful, the breakfast is delicious and free, and the water stations were extremely useful! This hotel has done so many things right! Thanks for a great weekend!

hotel_name: Park Terrace Hotel on Bryant Park
review_body: We planned a last-minute trip to NYC to celebrate my birthday, so just days before we were hotel searching (tricky during the high-demand summer months). I am so glad we found this hotel because it was a fabulous experience! And we will stay here again!First, the staff are amazing. Very friendly and always helpful. We arrived well before check-in, but they invited us to enjoy coffee in the lounge before we headed out for some activities, stored our luggage and had it ready in our room when we checked in that afternoon. When we walked in, I had a beautiful handwritten card from the hotel staff and cupcakes from a local bakery! Incredible! My friend had arranged to have a bottle of champagne in our room for check in, and the hotel staff used this tip to order the cupcakes, even getting cake flavor recommendations from my friend. The room was space-planned well, very clean and featured nice amenities like a Nespresso machine, fridge, Bose Bluetooth speaker, large-sized toiletries, bathrobes, safe, lounger chair (that I believe folds out to a small bed), and small table with chairs. Each floor had a water bottle refilling station which is fantastic! Plus, there was a supply closet on each floor for guests to get items they may have forgotten: toothbrush, razor, contact lens case, comb, etc. Such a great idea and saves hassle of having to go to front desk. Breakfast is included and was a nice continental spread of pastries, yogurt, fruit, juices and coffee. In the afternoon and evening it’s a lounge for cocktails. The rooftop outdoor space has tables and couches, so at either time of day you can enjoy being outside. Loved the midtown location and Bryant Park is steps away. Thanks to everyone at Park Terrace!

hotel_name: Park Terrace Hotel on Bryant Park
review_body: Great place to stay for work! It was conveniently located and had great breakfast/ cocktail hour, which was also a great place to get some extra work done in the morning and evening. The rooms were very comfortable and clean, and I loved the amenities they have available on each floor!

hotel_name: Park Terrace Hotel on Bryant Park
review_body: A surprise trip to NYC for our 10th wedding anniversary was made even better when we were giving a free room upgrade to celebrate. The staff are so friendly and can’t do enough to help out. The hotel is clean a very well air conditioned. It’s was nice to have breakfast on the roof terrace every morning before we went into the city. The hotels location is really great also.

hotel_name: Park Terrace Hotel on Bryant Park
review_body: I ended up here after my flight to Chicago was cancelled, so literally a last minute booking. Choice of hotels was very limited, it was late and the weather was awful, so we were probably lucky to find a room here. Thankfully it proved to be a good choice. Check-in was smooth and quick, the room was clean and modern, but on the small side, even by NY standards... I initially thought the bathroom was a cupboard! That said, I was mainly there to rest and the bed was comfy and the room quiet, so I can’t complain. There is a breakfast buffet included with a good choice of breads, pastries and fruit, more than enough if you want a quick bite to eat before heading out for the day. Check out was as smooth as check in. Would I stay here again? Probably yes, although I would consider paying a little more for a slightly bigger room if I was staying more than a night, or travelling with someone.

hotel_name: Park Terrace Hotel on Bryant Park
review_body: Clean, modern, nice staff. Good breakfast/restaurant area. Nice fitness. Good food qualityIt is the second time I come, and I will coming again soonGood friendly environmental policy. Excellent placedThe only weak the waiting period for lifts is a bit long

hotel_name: Park Terrace Hotel on Bryant Park
review_body: Bit expensive for a view of bricks and A/C units.Staff are good peoples, breakfast was very good. And parking is a discount which I recommend is you have wheels. Bryant park is right there so excellent if you kids or like a chilled time. And whole foods is right there as well. Yummy.

hotel_name: Park Terrace Hotel on Bryant Park
review_body: This Hotel is the cutest, right across the street from Bryant Park, walking distance to Central Park, Times Square etc but far enough away to not be caught up IN it. We LOVED the Breakfast, fresh Bagels, an assortment of Cream cheese spreads, fresh squeezed juices, Fresh Doughnuts, Croissants, Fresh fruit varieties, Granola, Greek yogurt, fresh Coffee on the Terrace which turns into a full bar at 4;00 till about 11:30. I know hotel rooms are usually small but this size was perfect for 2 people w a Small queen bed and a sofa, you really don't need much more room than that, they also have filtered bottled water service on each floor. We will absolutely be coming back!

hotel_name: Park Terrace Hotel on Bryant Park
review_body: Beautiful hotel, lovely smiling staff, perfect location right on Bryant park.The breakfast was located on the 6th floor cool terrace (indoor and outdoor), and surprisingly included amazing fresh berries and yoghurt, fresh pastries and bagels, assortment of fresh juices- what a surprise!Great Complimentary WiFi.
