When housekeeping missed my room the one day and I mentioned it they immediately sent someone up to clean with apologies.The hotel is located right on Bryant park close to everything but on quiet 40th st so no street noise.Very cool water and ice stations with empty bottles on each floor.Really amazing stay! So surprised and couldn’t ask for more!

hotel_name: Park Terrace Hotel on Bryant Park
review_body: This new hotel is exceptionally well appointed, reception staff were very friendly and welcoming. A nice touch and very much appreciated acknowledgement of our trip to celebrate a special occasion. Location was excellent, walking distance to Times Square, Central Park and 5th Avenue shops and the subway. Continental breakfast was very enjoyable on the outdoor balcony each morning.

hotel_name: Park Terrace Hotel on Bryant Park
review_body: We spent 4 nights here, and was a great choice. The day we arrived, the check in was fast and easy, besides we got an upgrade of the room. Rooms are very nice, good size, very clean and have almost everything... we only missed a minibar or refrigerator, to keep cold water or sodas. We will return! Breakfast is also very good.

hotel_name: Park Terrace Hotel on Bryant Park
review_body: Our vacation stay at Park Terrace was the BEST experience we've ever had. The room was very comfortable, breakfast was always fresh, well prepared and deliciously health. We were able to refresh our used clothings as the hotel provided laundry services. Excelent, excelent, wonderful. Thank you.

hotel_name: Park Terrace Hotel on Bryant Park
review_body: I’ve spent an excelent couple of weeks.Please accept my Appreciation. Special thanks to the front desk staff. Always thoughtful and kind. If one needs to stay in midtown, this is a place to consider.

hotel_name: Park Terrace Hotel on Bryant Park
review_body: Seriously very good overall, I'll totally stay there again. You cannot beat the location. Staff was unbelievably nice and friendly. 'Park view' rooms are nice but are really a view of the Library, which I'm sure is better than viewing the building to the south on the other side. You can see Bryant Park itself to the left. I'm sure keeping the windows clean is difficult, but they were super dirty inside and out - to the point of spoiling the view. I love being able to open a window or a door to the outside and that is how I kept it most of the time (helped with the dirty window problem) Bathroom was very nicely done, great fixtures, well lit. Shower enclosure was incredible - one of the nicest and most functional I've seen anywhere, although hot water took quite a while. Breakfast bar on the 6th floor Terrace was the best! Great food and staff! Outside Terrace area seating and views are incredible.

hotel_name: Park Terrace Hotel on Bryant Park
review_body: Such a great hotel! From the free breakfasts (YAY yogurt bar and La Colombe coffee), bottled water and complimentary Magnolias in the afternoon, to the amazing location and wicked fast service--this hotel has it all. Will definitely be staying here again. I literally don't think I interacted with any of the staff that I didn't like, they were all supremely friendly and kind. Do yourself a favor, and book this hotel now.

hotel_name: Park Terrace Hotel on Bryant Park
review_body: Our stay was everything I expected and more. The staff was friendly and helpful. The complimentary breakfast was excellent. And the rooms are spacious and comfortable. The added bonus is you can access you Netflix account and there is free water bottles. Loved it!
user_name:
Gerrylyn W
New York City, New York

hotel_name: Park Terrace Hotel on Bryant Park
review_body: Not a great value for the money. You don’t have empathy towards your customers and that needs to change. Please see the below comments1. Last three days, dirty towels were left in the bathroom and no new towels were replaced with2. The noise in the room from the airconditioning unit; you guys didn’t act up on it. I think someone from the staff should try sleeping in the room with this noise constantly beating down on them to understand customer problems.3. Simple things like bathrobe not being in the room, toiletries not fully available are basic aminities from a hotel and lack there of in providing shows the quality of the service.

hotel_name: Park Terrace Hotel on Bryant Park
review_body: Nice rooms, friendly staff, good location across from Bryant Park, enjoyed the terrace for drinks, the included breakfast was excellent, far enough awway from Times Square to get away from the madness, very happy with stay

hotel_name: Park Terrace Hotel on Bryant Park
review_body: My husband and I stayed for 2 nights for 4th of July. I knew the room would be small but space was well utilized and so well decorated that I didn’t mind at all. It was perfect space for what we needed. The only reason I give 4 stars and not 5 and why I probably wouldn’t stay again is the bathroom situation. It’s just not private and separated by walls that are not really even walls. I almost wanted to make my husband leave the room so I could use the bathroom and I wanted to leave the room when he did!!!!! The breakfast was great, employees were nice. Soooo I would stay again if it was just me but as a couple I don’t think so

hotel_name: Park Terrace Hotel on Bryant Park
review_body: I would stay here just for the breakfast bar, but at Park Terrace you get free amazing breakfast AND central location, wonderful staff, and a generally classy NYC experience wrapped up in a modern boutique hotel.

hotel_name: Park Terrace Hotel on Bryant Park
review_body: We stayed at the Park Terrace hotel during the 4th of July and had a wonderful stay. A great location, combined with the excellent staff, makes this a top choice. They don't have a club level (like some of the other major chains) but very nice open air bar & bites area on the 6th floor. The rate included an upgraded continental breakfast every morning with premier bagels/pastries, deli meats and some of the nicest fresh fruits I've seen. Try the coconut glazed donuts (from a local specialty pastry maker) which were to die for. Another big ++ is that the Park Terrace DOES NOT charge a destination/resort fee - which can save you $15-$30 a night (vs other hotels in the area). We had a thoroughly enjoyable stay and hope to stay there again on future visits.

hotel_name: Park Terrace Hotel on Bryant Park
review_body: We love the location of this hotel, across the street from Bryant Park. And it's short walk to and from the theater district. The hotel's 6th floor terrace is a great place to have breakfast or drinks or to just hang out. And our room was very quiet.

hotel_name: Park Terrace Hotel on Bryant Park
review_body: Great location- walking distance to Broadway shows, great restaurants, and Times Square. Beautiful park and Whole Foods store across the street. The staff were so helpful in helping me find places. Great breakfast too!

hotel_name: Park Terrace Hotel on Bryant Park
review_body: Beautiful, clean hotel. Extremely nice and helpful staff. Nice roof top lounge and good drinks!! Right across the st from Bryant park.Will definitely come back. Breakfast was also very good with options

hotel_name: Park Terrace Hotel on Bryant Park
review_body: Per my initial rating, see comments regarding housekeeping and the multiple stained sheets. New hotel across from Bryant Park which is excellent, overall hotel space is beautiful (lobby, 6th floor terrace), convenient to the subway, Times Sq is an easy walk, and the price point is excellent. Room was spacious, reserved the Premier room which was nice. Front office staff/valet extremely professional, friendly and attentive.

hotel_name: Park Terrace Hotel on Bryant Park
review_body: The people and the service couldn't have been better. Everyone was incredibly kind and super helpful. They would stop and help us whenever we needed it, even in the early hours of the morning. They would help us with whatever we needed and were incredibly accommodating. 10/10 would recommend and would definitely book here again.

hotel_name: Park Terrace Hotel on Bryant Park
review_body: The hotel has a great location for many points of interest and for evening Broadway shows. I like modern hotels and this one is very new and sleek. The rooms are small but very comfortable, with a nice Nespresso coffee machine. Parking is at a garage 5 minutes walking distance. We did not use their gym. There is a lovely terrace for a drink/small meal and for morning breakfast. I would likely stay there again if in NY.

hotel_name: Park Terrace Hotel on Bryant Park
review_body: Elegant hotel with nice breakfast on the terrace. Location over Bryant Park and next to fifthave. Was super convenient. Great and friendly staff, very helpful and made my stayel perfect. Will come back again

hotel_name: Park Terrace Hotel on Bryant Park
review_body: Price is definitely not worthed it. When we checked-in, we found out that all the pillows on our bed were never replaced beforehand, not even the pillow covers.To make matter worse, room cleaning on the first day wasn’t done whatsoever, for the reason that the cleaner require that we vacate the room during cleaning. I was never told that there is any regulation for that.Furthermore, after staying for 4 nights, the housekeeping didn’t even bother to change our bedsheets, nor replacing the runout bathroom amenities.In all conclusion, I consider that I was tricked into booking this hotel. Worthless and terrible decision.

hotel_name: Park Terrace Hotel on Bryant Park
review_body: great location excellent staff and the rooms was clean and comfortable. i enjoyed the park across the street and the access to any midtown attractions. time square mins away and subways at mins away to everything.

hotel_name: Park Terrace Hotel on Bryant Park
review_body: Larissa and team where fantastic. Very comfortable stay, beds and pillows are great. Great location and access. Bryant Park is a great park with a lot of activity, restaurants and shows. Highly recommend.

hotel_name: Park Terrace Hotel on Bryant Park
review_body: Great experience. Free water and free access to washer dryer and free breakfast. Staff was so friendly and attentive and were so helpful in everything. Very homey feeling will definitely come back and stay in this hotel again

hotel_name: Park Terrace Hotel on Bryant Park
review_body: Room was smaller than I was expecting, but the location, staff and amenities made up for that tenfold. Staff was friendly and helpful. Maid service did a wonderful job. Breakfast was delicious; they even had to go boxes so you could take your breakfast across the street to enjoy at Bryant Park.

hotel_name: Park Terrace Hotel on Bryant Park
review_body: Yet another 5 star rating for PTH and so well deserved. The service during a 10 night stay was quite without fault from a young and enthusiastic staff. Where else, during a casual conversation would you be asked "would you like a fridge in your room?" and 10 minutes later have a staff member knock on your door literally holding a refrigerator - or be met in the lobby bringing back a take-away dinner and be told "you'll probably need these" and be offered cutlery wrapped in a cloth napkin - and we did. The sumptuous breakfast selection and the encouragement to take fresh pastries in the provided "to-go" boxes for your enjoyment later in the day was an added bonus. The positive experiences just go on. The central Mid-town area opposite Bryant Park with its program of free entertainment has to be one of the best locations in NYC. A later query on an account item was quickly and professionally resolved which further enhanced our opinion of the hotel and staff.

hotel_name: Park Terrace Hotel on Bryant Park
review_body: Best Hotel!!Awesome staff, very clean, best location, execellent breakfast.I'm gluten free and the staff make sure I'll have gluten free bread every morning. I will defenetly return to this hotel soon.

hotel_name: Park Terrace Hotel on Bryant Park
review_body: This will be my new go to hotel in NY. I love the location of you are going to NY for a visit or for work. Easy to walk to a show, across the street to Bryant Park and everything else. The hotel is super clean, modern, comfortable, etc. The staff is great, very nice and eager to help however they can.

hotel_name: Park Terrace Hotel on Bryant Park
review_body: Spent 7 days at the park terrace late June 2019 staying in a deluxe room.The room was of a good size with a comfortable bed and good shower. Well maintained with everything felt new and clean.A lovely continental Breakfast was included as was drinking water.Very friendly service.Great central location with the roof terrace area overlooking Bryant Park.Recommended.

hotel_name: Park Terrace Hotel on Bryant Park
review_body: Excellent property and great service all around. Every staff member was friendly and helpful. Breakfast was very high quality in lovely setting. Convenient location, close to everything. This place is a gem!

hotel_name: Park Terrace Hotel on Bryant Park
review_body: Settled across the street from Bryant Park and the New York Public Library. My family and I had a wonderful stay at the Park Terrace. The staff was extremely welcoming and helpful. Checking in was very relaxing and the front desk staff were courteous and made us feel at home as soon as we walked in the door. Our room was very clean and we enjoyed our stay immensely over the five nights during our holiday. Every staff member we encountered always had a smile and a delightful manner. Management has done a very good job of setting an exceedingly welcoming and friendly tone overall. Having easy access to Bryant Park was a major plus for us. After a busy day in the city, it was brilliant to be able to enjoy the park, lay out on the grass and unwind.The Park Terrace Hotel is truly a gem in the city and I would have no reservations on recommending the hotel to family, friends and colleagues.

hotel_name: Park Terrace Hotel on Bryant Park
review_body: Had an early flight, so we got to the hotel by 930 am on check-in day, and the front desk had our room ready, which was awesome (not to mention the late check out they gave us on check out day, as we had a late flight out). Hotel staff throughout our stay were all excellent, so friendly, full of sincere, welcoming smiles, yet entirely professional and promptly responsive to all of our questions and requests. Included breakfast was awesome, and the hotel's location was suberb - walking distance to numerous attractions - or to a subway station right down the block! Upon arrival, I had an allergic reaction to something in my room (never did figure out what it was), but they were kind enough to move me to a different (brand new - literally only used 4x previously) room - which was then perfect - sufficiently roomy - comfortable and clean. Didn't even realize that they had a pretty nice gym downstairs - with towels, showers, etc... I'll use it when we return next time, which we surely will when in the city next. Thx all for a nice, comfortable stay!

hotel_name: Park Terrace Hotel on Bryant Park
review_body: I absolutely love this hotel and this will be my new go to hotel when I visit NYC. The customer service is above any I have had during a hotel stay besides a true 5 star hotel. Larissa greeted us and ensured all of our accommodations were top notch. The rooms are clean, modern and well appointed with towels and full size toiletries. The free breakfast is very elegant and yummy. Fresh pasteurized, fruit and jellies from various NYC eateries. Each floor has a water station with empty water bottles and an ice machine ( our floor did not have an ice machine). What a nice touch. The terrace is beautiful and overlooks Bryant Park for an awesome night cap. The location is prime. A few blocks to time square and across the street from Bryant Park. It was by far a surprisingly great experience and exceeded my expectations. I’ll definitely be back many times!
user_name:
nakanyam
Washington DC, District of Columbia

hotel_name: Park Terrace Hotel on Bryant Park
review_body: The location, room, amenities were great for the price. Facilities are modern and clean, and did not feel cheap. I had a 3-night stay in the premier room with view, facing the bryant park. The room was quite spacious with a large-ish loveseat and another chair. The bed and linen were great, and the bathrobe was waffle but quite soft. The bathroom amenities were good quality as well. The water dispenser on each floor was very useful and the welcome snacks were great too. The storage space in the room was good enough for one person, but slightly tight for two people. The breakfast options were a little limited, but the bagels and cream cheese selection were amazing.There were some minor quirks that the hotel could improve on:1) The shower leaked water quite a bit.2) The outlet in the bathroom and the hairdryer are positioned so that you really have to squeeze it and then hold it while you're using it because otherwise it pops back out.3) A hotel staff was using the water dispenser in the gym for a while and drained it of cold water. It's great to have filtered water, but lukewarm water isn't fun during a workout.4) Not sure if their default setup is for a single male guest, but the room was set up with one large gown instead of the default one large and one small I see normally.

hotel_name: Park Terrace Hotel on Bryant Park
review_body: Beautiful hotel, clean, upscale.Enjoyed our stay. Staff was fantastic and courteous. Breakfast was better than continental breakfast. I hope visitors continue to respect the hi hotel, we will definitely return!Thanks, for making our stay an enjoyable one.

hotel_name: Park Terrace Hotel on Bryant Park
review_body: This past weekend (7-6-19) my daughter,2 yr old grandson and myself had a wonderful experience here.It's right in walking distance near Time Square and right across the street from Bryant Park. The hotel is one of the cleanest we have stayed at in a long time.But the best part is their customer service!! Everyone we have encounter were very very friendly and was willing to help in all ways. I would definitely recommend the place to stay.

hotel_name: Park Terrace Hotel on Bryant Park
review_body: Took my teen son for his birthday and the staff were so thoughtful, they upgraded our room which was lovely and in the room on arrival was a box of cupcakes from Magnolia Bakery and a handwritten note wishing him a happy birthday and a fun stay in New York etc....it was so touching. The breakfast is amazing though not quite what we prefer for healthier options but the coffee was great and it was nice to have for something small first thing in the am. Also a lovely spot to sit in the vending and have a cocktail. The location is great, close to everything but so nice to have the park directly across the street for some greenery. Very comfy bed and really great shower. Over being able to make coffee in my room anytime too. Was such a great time, the staff were all so kind and happy and helpful at all times. Thank you!

hotel_name: Park Terrace Hotel on Bryant Park
review_body: It took so long for me to decide on a hotel in NYC. I stumbled upon Park Terrace because of the yoga offerings at Bryant Park. I’m so glad we stayed here. There’s a lot going on in the city and it was comforting to walk into the lobby infused with pleasant aromas, have a soft robe to cozy up in, and a comfy comfy bed to crawl into. Our stay was quiet. Our view was part of the park and the New York Public Library.The breakfast bar was absolutely dreamy. Wonderful coffee, fresh local donuts and bagels, carrot ginger juice, fruit, granola, oh my! A foodies heaven. We are going to recreate the breakfast bar here at home and have a few friends over. I already ordered the coffee and I’m reaching out to the bakery for granola. It was also a delight to interact with the people who work here. Hi Randy! Thank you for your friendliness and help.

hotel_name: Park Terrace Hotel on Bryant Park
review_body: We have just spent a 5 night stay at The Park Terrace. I researched many hotels in Manhattan and I am so happy I came across this hotel. The complimentary breakfast was awesome. Staff very helpful. Room modern clean with all the necessary amenities. I would definitely recommend this hotel .

hotel_name: Park Terrace Hotel on Bryant Park
review_body: I travel a lot for business and personal, nearly every week. I have never left a hotel review, but Park Terrace Hotel is worth sharing. We booked the least expensive room. It was small (to be expected in NYC), but well appointed (brand new, Nespresso, great toiletries. We decided to upgrade the room to their best room, upgrade cost was reasonable and easily handled with the staff even though we initially booked through a third party. Their king suite overlooking the library and park was amazing, sliding glass doors open for fresh air. Somehow it was also super quiet (again rare in NYC). The breakfast is really spectacular. One of the best bagels I've had in NYC (and I lived there for several years). This is rarely included in a hotel rate in NYC, so to get something of high quality is exceptional. Also, no one mentioned this in other reviews, but hotel actually has FREE laundry machines in the basement. Amazing if you are on a long trip like I was. Staff at NYC hotels are notoriously rude. Staff here couldn't have been more helpful or friendlier. Truly a boutique experience in NYC. This will be my go-to hotel in the future.

hotel_name: Park Terrace Hotel on Bryant Park
review_body: My husband and I decided last minute to take a couple days to go to New York and I knew I wanted to be near Bryant Park that is how I found the Park Terrace Hotel. When we arrived it was just as pretty as the pictures on their website. The first night we did have a noise issue with our air conditioner however management quickly moved us to another room that suited us perfectly. The hotel is in the perfect walking distance to everything you want to see and do. We also enjoyed breakfast on the terrace every morning and the staff was extremely friendly and helpful. I highly recommend this hotel.

hotel_name: Park Terrace Hotel on Bryant Park
review_body: Good location, nice (small) room...made our vacation easy and enjoyable. Exceptionally nice staff. There was some construction noise, we we're on the second floor with a poor view. Not sure if this is because we didn't book directly or not. We would stay again.

hotel_name: Park Terrace Hotel on Bryant Park
review_body: Stayed 3 nights and Larissa and the front team were fantastic. Also the bed and pillows are very comfortable. Great place, great staff and great location. The park across the street is nice and its easy access to all the sites.
user_name:
DCDee
Washington DC, District of Columbia

hotel_name: Park Terrace Hotel on Bryant Park
review_body: A very good hotel. The breakfast buffet was amazing, the service was gracious and the location is hard to beat. Overall, very happy with our stay as we were able to share a weekend getaway while still being in the heart of the city.

hotel_name: Park Terrace Hotel on Bryant Park
review_body: I organized a group trip to NYC. This hotel was a fabulous choice. The staff was fabulous. The breakfast was a big hit along with the gratis popcorn. Not one complaint from trip group members; only praise. Happy to use it again.

hotel_name: Park Terrace Hotel on Bryant Park
review_body: Great location, fairly priced, young but very pleasant helpful staff, very nice breakfast. 200 minimum is a bad idea. Four score seven years ago our fathers brought forth concise reviews of accomodations. Valley Forge did not rate well despite the extensive review of history.

hotel_name: Park Terrace Hotel on Bryant Park
review_body: Went for 4th of July weekend with my wife and we had a great time. NY Botanical garden, Broadway show, fireworks. Walked a lot. Clean, close to transportation, great breakfast, friendly staff. Highly recommended and will definitely stay again.

hotel_name: Park Terrace Hotel on Bryant Park
review_body: If you are looking to be in midtown near fifth, Bryant Park and the library, this is a great inn. They have some very noteworthy features like water stations on every floor, gourmet in room healthy snacks from local vendors. They also have a nice breakfast spread with some not so healthy, but delicious (and Kosher!) doughnut plant donuts. Rooms are comfortable and great shower/bath.

hotel_name: Park Terrace Hotel on Bryant Park
review_body: Loved this hotel . Staff were so friendly , breakfast is amazing . Couldn’t wait to go to the complimentary breakfast !! Rooms were clean and modern . Loved the free water bottle refill stations . Would definitely stay here again .

hotel_name: Park Terrace Hotel on Bryant Park
review_body: Great location to subway! Breakfast was delicious and had a good selection of assorted breads, donuts, meats, cheeses, and fruit. Gym was clean, had towels and water. Was able to work on terrace with great WIFI connection.

hotel_name: Park Terrace Hotel on Bryant Park
review_body: Stay at the Park Terrace on your next trip to NYC. It was centrally located, unique, clean and wonderful. Loved the special touches like breakfast on the Terrazzo deck and filtered water fill stations on every floor. Clean, comfy rooms and wonderful staff make this a must stay location.

hotel_name: Park Terrace Hotel on Bryant Park
review_body: This hotel was absolutely fantastic in every way! The property seemed new and it was very clean. My room was small but that's NYC. Still I was very comfortable and the bed was very comfortable as well. But let me tell you about the staff: Noah, Gabriela, Charlie -- rockstars! They were SO nice and professional and helpful in every way. I worked in HR for hotels and these employees embody what customer service should look like. The hotel has a nice bar on the 6th floor with a terrace and the bartenders were also friendly and helpful. Bryan Park is great for sitting and people watching and 5th Ave shopping is nearby. There's also a Whole Foods nearby and a great sushi place that's close. I have nothing but rave reviews for this place and I would recommend to anyone and go back in a heartbeat.

hotel_name: Park Terrace Hotel on Bryant Park
review_body: I wish I knew about this hotel sooner! The room is updated and clean, the bed is comfortable, the staff is very friendly and helpful, and the included breakfast is really great. The terrace is a perfect spot for a glass of wine at the end of the day! All this - across the street from beautiful Bryant Park. My one word of caution is to check the events schedule at Bryant Park, since it's the summer. I was there on a night when there was a movie showing and the sound definitely travels. It wasn't enough to disturb me, but I could hear it.

hotel_name: Park Terrace Hotel on Bryant Park
review_body: Get away trip with my wife. Price point is similar/slightly less than other luxury hotels we have stayed at in NYC. It is absolutely fine. Nothing was wrong per se. They lost my suitcase, but found it relatively quickly. Check in was easy and friendly. Room was...just fine. It had large windows overlooking Bryant Park, but still felt VERY small for the price. I understand NYC hotel rooms are small, but it just felt OK. Bed was comfortable enough. Small refrigerator and espresso machine are nice touches. Bathroom was small and oddly shaped; the large sliding door was not built for privacy. Breakfast was a nice twist on the usual breakfast foods. I wish they had a restaurant on site and with the bar stayed open later than 11. Good food nearby, easy subway access and walkable to the usual midtown Manhattan tourist locales. Overall liked it fine, but felt they are trying to be a luxury hotel but not quite there yet.

hotel_name: Park Terrace Hotel on Bryant Park
review_body: This hotel is PERFECT! The staff are amazing (Charlie is great!), the breakfast is stellar, the amenities are top-notch, the rooms are clean and crisp, and the location can't be beat. We stayed for the weekend and didn't want to leave. The accommodations couldn't have been better!

hotel_name: Park Terrace Hotel on Bryant Park
review_body: I could say my favorite was the view, or the velvet pillows (I love velvet), or the fresh breakfast, or the location, or the terrace oasis...or the crunchy ice (all accurate, don't ask me to rank) - but really it was the people who worked there. Everyone was so truly kind and welcoming. Special note to Gabriela and Aidan who made me feel like family (the kind you like)!

hotel_name: Park Terrace Hotel on Bryant Park
review_body: We are experienced travellers, experienced travellers to New York and have stayed in multiple hotels in the city. The Park Terrace Hotel on Bryant Park takes the prize. This is a relatively new hotel, staffed by all young, helpful and very eager people. The rooms are beautiful with nice amenities and most importantly, location is the best in all Manhattan. Situated on 40th St. across from Bryant Park and the central library you have easy access to multiple subway lines and can walk almost anywhere in the city quite easily. Included breakfast was phenomenal and plentiful and Jenna sure knows how to make a great latte (super extra strong as requested). Gabriela at the front desk has to be singled out for her friendly and helpful attitude. It always felt like we were at home when we saw her. I was hesitant to give such a great review in case they get too popular and are full all the time,but this hotel deserves 5*. I will be back to my new New York home.

hotel_name: Park Terrace Hotel on Bryant Park
review_body: Stayed here for 11 nights and absolutely loved it. This is a newly refurbished hotel. There were cupcakes from my favourite Magnolia Bakery on arrival for my birthday. Love the room, the yoga mat (well utilised), the bed was nice & comfy, shower room etc. Coffee machine in the room and kettle was also provided (for tea addicts) for use during our stay. So close to one of my favourite parks in NYC. It was also walkable uptown and downtown and close to subways etc. Staff were very friendly & helpful and responded immediately to our requests. Loved the terrace although some rainy days stopped us using it. Nice to drink at the bar in the evenings. Although the breakfast can be a bit repetitious for some, for me it was adequate - fruit, yoghurt, pastries, bagels, condiments etc and boiled eggs! I am hoping we can come back and stay again. Loved the gym too. I have no negatives ;-) Thank You to all staff - from frontline to behind the scenes for making our stay wonderful.

hotel_name: Park Terrace Hotel on Bryant Park
review_body: The room and whole site is nice and clean, and the staffs are friendly. The breakfast gets redundant when you stay for couple nights. The free water system is great, I didn't have to run out and get pricy water. One minus is my cab reservation to JFK was cancelled without notice due to gay pride, only found out at check out,and had to carry luggage alone to Madison and hail a cab which I found it to be very unhelpful, unprofessional and disappointing. It wouldn't have taken much effort to leave a note or call up my room.

hotel_name: Park Terrace Hotel on Bryant Park
review_body: This was a great find! Complimentary breakfast was amazing and staff was so attentive and welcoming, especially Gabriella, who welcomed us back into the hotel each and every time by name. Room was spacious for NYC hotels and extremely clean. Loved having the terrace bar for happy hour. Location was perfect to access both midtown and downtown via walking or with close proximity to the subways. Highly recommend!!

hotel_name: Park Terrace Hotel on Bryant Park
review_body: Can't recommend this place enough. Everyone was so friendly. The room was amazing. View of Bryant Park. The free breakfast is very high level and should not be missed. The bathrooms are very sleek and the bed was oh so comfortable. Will stay there again for sure! Also this is mid-town for those non New Yorkers reading this. Very central. A lot of business nearby, but a quick walk to Central Park, or tons of nearby locations.

hotel_name: Park Terrace Hotel on Bryant Park
review_body: Can’t say enough...beautiful property...extremely clean...lovely rooms that are very efficiently designed...although perhaps small for two guests...I’ll be back...with my two dogs next time for a longer stay
user_name:
Wanderer20069106784
New York City, New York

hotel_name: Park Terrace Hotel on Bryant Park
review_body: The location of the Park Terrace is excellent - easy access to all parts of NYC. The staff was wonderful and surprised me with dark chocolate from Royce to commemorate my birthday when I told them I wasn't a cupcake fan. The rooms are small yet very comfortable with a a good sized bath. The breakfast was excellent with good options for all. The terrace is a lovely place for a drink and/or breakfast. A great hotel for all types of trips - we will certainly be staying here on our next trip to NYC.

hotel_name: Park Terrace Hotel on Bryant Park
review_body: It was a relaxing stay. The room was super quiet and lovely. The Nespresso coffee was a special amenity. The hotel is a fantastic location. Sitting on the Terrace enjoying a cocktail was delightful. The entire staff is gracious and helpful. The complementary breakfast selections are all delicious.

hotel_name: Park Terrace Hotel on Bryant Park
review_body: I appreciate your courtesy and wonderful treatment during our 6 year anniversary! Helped us switch rooms with ease wonderful service! From the check in to luggage service to complimentary breakfast! Great value for the money spend the extra $60 and get a nicer room it’s worth it!!!

hotel_name: Park Terrace Hotel on Bryant Park
review_body: We were amazed at how quiet the room was on the 5th floor. And it made great use of a small space that had everything we needed. Breakfast was excellent and we felt it was the perfect location to get to all the sights and shows.

hotel_name: Park Terrace Hotel on Bryant Park
review_body: The Park Terrace sets the bar for personalized service as well as modern comfort in a NYC hotel. Location is also excellent which further adds to the appeal. I've found my new "go-to" hotel in NYC. Will stay again and recommend to everyone I know.

hotel_name: Park Terrace Hotel on Bryant Park
review_body: What a fantastic stay! The staff was warm and welcoming. The room was spacious and beautifully decorated, with everything sparkly clean. The bed was very comfortable. Lots of plugs for keeping things charged. The water stations were a nice touch since it was so hot out. The breakfast was a highlight. Both healthy and not-so-healthy options. The fresh fruit was ripe and delicious and the doughnut I had was incredible. Coffee made to order. Also, the location is great. Great stay. Thanks.

hotel_name: Park Terrace Hotel on Bryant Park
review_body: This is such a nice hotel. Great service, really good location right on Bryant Park - close to shopping, dining, subway and my meetings. So many hotel rooms in NYC are small and dingy with lots of road noise. This one is bright, clean, quiet and modern. I honestly can't think of a negative. Maybe add a magnifying mirror in the bathroom - those are really useful. I didn't try the breakfast so I'm not sure how that is, but I love that it's included.

hotel_name: Park Terrace Hotel on Bryant Park
review_body: I loved it here!!! Amazing location, very comfortable and clean accommodations, bonus amenities, genuine and friendly service (thank you Charlie!), and an unexpectedly lush breakfast buffet included on the 6th floor balcony with gorgeous views. Would definitely stay here again!!

hotel_name: Park Terrace Hotel on Bryant Park
review_body: Our room was small, however it was newly decorated , modern , extremely clean. Loved the bathroom . The staff was extremely helpful and nice. Loved the continental breakfast . I highly recommend this hotel .

hotel_name: Park Terrace Hotel on Bryant Park
review_body: Location, modern comfort, superior breakfast, and staff that can help with any requests make this one of our favorite places to stay in New York City. Bryant park is beautiful and full of energy and a quick walk from the hotel. Restaurants abound and the front desk folks can make anything happen, it seems.

hotel_name: Park Terrace Hotel on Bryant Park
review_body: Nice, small hotel in a great location. I was there for only one night on business so didn't have a chance to thoroughly take advantage of everything. Being brand new it was very clean, personnel were were very helpful and friendly. My only complaint was that the espresso machine in my room wasn't working.I will give them another try.

hotel_name: Park Terrace Hotel on Bryant Park
review_body: I stayed at Park Terrace Hotel on Bryant park for 9 days. When you enter you the lobby you are warmly greeted by the receptionists, Gabriela was exceptionally kind! The rooms are well designed and the bed and pillows are vey comfortable. Breakfast was delicious with assortments of fruits and baked goods. The coffee was wonderful! made to perfection by Jenna !! The service was meticulous during breakfast and throughout the hotel! The lounge and terrace on the 6th floor were beautiful . Would definitely return when in NYC!

hotel_name: Park Terrace Hotel on Bryant Park
review_body: Because soon the price will go up and I can no longer enjoy this clean, well appointed, wonderfully staffed hotel across from the park and library. And a Peloton in the large and stocked fitness center.

hotel_name: Park Terrace Hotel on Bryant Park
review_body: Excellent stay, nice amenities, the terrace is highly appreciable. The first room I was given did not satisfy me, they very kindly proposed to change and since then, my 4-night stay was just perfect!!

hotel_name: Park Terrace Hotel on Bryant Park
review_body: Terrace and breakfast are best I have ever had and I travel 100 nights per year. Staff was gracious and very happy to be at work!! Very helpful. Check in was easy. Room was very clean and bright! Location across from Bryant Park excellent!! Jenna was best server and always smiling - An asset to restaurant. Bar manager was great and knew the City very well.

hotel_name: Park Terrace Hotel on Bryant Park
review_body: We are New Yorkers, born and raised, live on Long Island now yet never stayed in Midtown hotel before. From the moment we entered the lobby of the Park Terrace Hotel, we were met with an aura of calmness. The aesthetics are beautiful. I loved the smells, sights and sounds. The staff was extremely friendly, professional, helpful, kind and happy. The room was very European...minimalistic, clean lines, cool colors, simple pleasures including complimentary NY based soda and popcorn. Very well done. The views from our Juliet balcony were delightful. Looking down upon Bryant Park and the library added to the relaxing feel of the hotel. The Terrace Lounge was lovely while the bartender, Liam I believe, was so nice. He stated he feels like he “works on a cloud” due to the location. The breakfast was delicious. I was especially pleased that the hotel supports local businesses, as well as, and tries hard to be green. The location to fabulous NYC landmarks and excitement is only a short walk away. I can’t say enough about how much I enjoyed our one night stay in this charming oasis! More than I could have hoped for. Thank you so much Park Terrace for making my husband’s birthday celebration super fun.

hotel_name: Park Terrace Hotel on Bryant Park
review_body: They really thought of it all at this hotel. It’s very relaxing and you do come away refreshed even in the craziness of NYC.All staff are excellent and nice. It wonderful having Bryant Park on your doorstep!

hotel_name: Park Terrace Hotel on Bryant Park
review_body: Have had the opportunity to stay in several locations in New York - all of varying standards - when this trip came up on short notice, was suggested this location through availability search - so glad I did and will be using as my go to digs for all future visits! Location, service and contemporary quality rooms all made this short trip ever so sweet.

hotel_name: Park Terrace Hotel on Bryant Park
review_body: I can’t say enough wonderful things about this hotel. The location was perfect! The staff was amazing and the hotel was just gorgeous! Everything was very clean. The terrace is just beautiful, and the view is amazing! The breakfast was very tastefully done. This hotel will be my hotel of choice during our next visit to the city. I promise that you won’t be disappointed.

hotel_name: Park Terrace Hotel on Bryant Park
review_body: Waited a day for bath robes3 calls neededFirst pair were stainedBreakfast tables aren’t cleared so you either do it yourself or have to ask someone.Food can be replenished slowlyOnly one poor girl making coffees, so you wait 15mins for yours at timesNo fridge in roomTv didn’t work

hotel_name: Park Terrace Hotel on Bryant Park
review_body: North facing rooms overview NYC Library & corner angled view of Bryant Park and the H&M Tower. Great location, but there are better views for less $$$. No hot breakfast food provided. Breads, pastries, fruit, yogurt, jam & cold cuts.

hotel_name: Park Terrace Hotel on Bryant Park
review_body: I must say that the entire staff goes the extra step to make your stay a wonderful experience. I let them know that a family member was celebrating a birthday & they had cupcakes waiting which was a special touch. They continued to check in to make sure our stay was memorable. The rooms are a good size for NYC, beds beyond comfortable & the breakfast provided is excellent. Highly recommend!!!

hotel_name: Park Terrace Hotel on Bryant Park
review_body: A Midtown gem of a hotel, centrally located, totally updated rooms with all amenities. A great breakfast included, outside terrace available for evening lounging or breakfast outside in good weather. All around, a great find and I will definitely be back!

hotel_name: Park Terrace Hotel on Bryant Park
review_body: I like the convenient location the most. Next to Bryant Park. Metro is just around the corner. You can walk to the Boardway or Macy easily. Supermarkets and restaurants are nearby. I like they provide free breakfast and washing machines. 24hrs gym room with new equipment is my favorite.
user_name:
ImeY
Hong Kong, null, Hong Kong

hotel_name: Park Terrace Hotel on Bryant Park
review_body: Location is great You can walk to most places. You can also use mass transportation to most places in Manhattan from close by. We are definitely going to come back. We paid $200 including breakfast and taxes. Already told some friends about it.

hotel_name: Park Terrace Hotel on Bryant Park
review_body: Quick Check in and out , very Nice wellcome, The y are all very Nice and helpfull, gorgeous breakfast , in front of Library and Bryant Park ,Nice vieux, very nice hôtel , not noisy for New York , restaurants around the hôtel I will come again for my next trip

hotel_name: Park Terrace Hotel on Bryant Park
review_body: I stayed here for six days on a business trip to NYC. The rooms are bright and extremely clean. The coffee machine and guest hallway amenities are appreciated. The staff is excellent, minus the one person who checked me out on Saturday morning. They go out of their way for you and are extremely professional. The breakfast buffet and coffee are delicious. I highly recommend this hotel. Kudos to the housekeeping team!

hotel_name: Park Terrace Hotel on Bryant Park
review_body: It was like being transported to some of the more stylish mod London establishments. Only better in that not only was the service impeccable and spot on, the fittings of the rooms were subtle, comforting and alluring, while still being sparkling new condition. And I loved some of the little touches, like the water bottle stations near the elevators on each floor. Well done.

hotel_name: Park Terrace Hotel on Bryant Park
review_body: It is my second stay at the Park Terrace Hotel. The rooms are very well appointed, and the amenities are really nice (Nespresso machine, arrival treat, breakfast bar, amenity closet in the hallway if you are missing something int he room). The terrace for drinks on the 6th floor is an added treat. The staff is wonderful, helpful and always pleasant. I will be back!

hotel_name: Park Terrace Hotel on Bryant Park
review_body: I picked the hotel for the location, but I will be back after experiencing the level of service and the well appointed room. The staff were warm and welcoming, they were able to provide a room a few hours before the usual check-in time, the room was clean, up to date and well organized (loads of plugs, wifi, connectivity for smart phones) and I loved the espresso machine in the room. Very impressive.

hotel_name: Park Terrace Hotel on Bryant Park
review_body: I have stayed in several hotels in the Times Square / Bryant Park / Empire State Building areas over the last year - none of which compares to my stay here!To start - the location is great, directly across from Bryant Park, walkable to many sites, and of course accessible by subway.Everyone at the front desk was very pleasant and there was never a wait.The room was impeccably clean and comfortable. Small, but perfect. The bed and linens were so cozy!!! The complementary popcorn and seltzer were a nice touch.As many reviewers have mentioned, the included breakfast was also great. Would love to see some gluten free options besides yogurt and fruit. Those bagels and donuts were taunting me...I did not have a chance to visit the gym or lounge. Will do that next time as I'll definitely be back. The nightly rate seemed reasonable, especially comparatively.Thank you so much for a great stay!

hotel_name: Park Terrace Hotel on Bryant Park
review_body: This is a great hotel. Period. Rooms are not large but modern and squeaky clean. Staff is very helpful. New York needs more sites like this! Terrace is also great fun and the breakfast yummy. Ten more characters....

hotel_name: Park Terrace Hotel on Bryant Park
review_body: We absolutely loved this hotel. Yes the rooms are small, but they are well set out and very clean. Great location near Bryant park, walking distance to subways, buses and Times Square. Great breakfast every morning with bagels, fresh fruit, donuts and great coffee. But the best thing about this hotel is their fantastic helpful staff who are just so friendly and willing to help you. Special mention to Katchana & Gabriela, these girls were just so helpful and wonderful with absolutely everything, and made us feel really welcome when we returned from a day of sightseeing.. Also Jose, Imar & Charlie for helping us with subway directions to get around. To Arthur & Izabel for looking after us at breakfast every day. To all the lovely staff in housekeeping and in the elevators each morning who are always so friendly.. Thanks also for the Magnolia Bakery cup cakes for my birthday such a nice thought. Just simply a great hotel that really excel at customer service and one that I will recommend to all my friends and family in Australia when travelling to NYC.

hotel_name: Park Terrace Hotel on Bryant Park
review_body: Having never been to NYC before we had no idea where to stay but we had the best luck - a new hotel, right on amazing Bryant Park. Fantastic location, so handy to everything, outstanding staff, immaculately clean room, (Nespresso machine for caffeine top ups), great drinking water system, amazing breakfast (barista coffee), good fitness room. The list is endless, can not recommend highly enough.

hotel_name: Park Terrace Hotel on Bryant Park
review_body: We loved our stay at the Park terrace. Room was quite big and clean with everything you need.Staff was friendly and helpful at all times, breakfast buffet was amazing. They offer refillable bottles and water machines as well so you have everything you need.Location is also great to visit the city.Would definitely recommend and come back!

hotel_name: Park Terrace Hotel on Bryant Park
review_body: Situated on Bryant Park which is a great location for anyone visiting central NY City. It’s a few minutes walk to plenty of places including Times Square, the Theatre District, Grand Central Station, and many moreA small lobby where the staff always greet you personally with a smile whether entering or leaving the hotel. A nice change from some of the large lobbies in other hotels. The room was well equipped, big enough for me, and everything worked as expected. There’s a free water station by the elevator on each floor which is a nice touch compared to some hotels these days. I’d recommend this place is the price is right.

hotel_name: Park Terrace Hotel on Bryant Park
review_body: I liked my trip in this hotel. Everybody was very king. I like this place, Bryant Park is betwween 5th avenue and 6th avenue, easy to visit the city. The breakfast is excellent, the terrace is great. I have nothing wrong to say about this hotel
user_name:
jeannette075
New York City, New York

hotel_name: Park Terrace Hotel on Bryant Park
review_body: My husband and I just returned from a three night stay at this fabulous new boutique hotel. We loved everything about it--perfection! When we first arrived around 9:30am from our train ride, the front desk welcomed us and took my cell phone so that when a room was available (the usual check in is 3:00pm) he could call us. We were told we could go upstairs to the 6th floor terrace and take advantage of the complimentary breakfast bar which is offered. The 6th floor area is beautiful and shortly after eating a delicious breakfast, a room was ready for us. We found out when we went back down to the front desk that they had upgraded us to a wonderful room with a view of the library and Bryant Park. We were so delighted. Upon arriving in our room we found everything to be just perfect. A nice and airy room, spotlessly clean, and a modern roomy bathroom, including wonderful upscale bath products. The kettle corn and orange pop were a terrific welcome treat also! Each morning we had the most amazing breakfast and were able to bring it out on the terrace. The terrace is really beautiful, very lush with green plants and wonderful seating areas to relax. It is truly what sets this property apart. If you look to one side, you can see a perfect view of the Empire State Building and if you look over the other side, you can see the lovely, bustling Bryant Park and the NY Public Library. It is truly an oasis.The amazing breakfast included fresh juices (carrot/ginger was my favorite), lattes/cappuccinos, all sorts of breads and treats from local purveyors such as bagels, breads, jams, cheeses/meats, the most delicious chocolate babka, hard boiled eggs, and a yummy curated yogurt station with all sorts of fresh fruits, including blueberries, raspberries, blackberries, melons, etc. Really delicious and totally filled us up for the morning. They even had take away boxes you could fill to take breakfast with you (or an additional treat to go). The staff is all young, energetic, enthusiastic, and adorable, and they could not do enough for us. They took such good care of us at breakfast, bringing us our special coffee drinks in the morning, and tending to us in the afternoon/evening, where they had other treats like cupcakes and breadsticks, etc. in the afternoon, again, from local establishments such as the popular Magnolia Bakery. The front desk helped us navigate our way each morning and again, could not have been more helpful--can't wait to return!

hotel_name: Park Terrace Hotel on Bryant Park
review_body: This hotel is amazing, everything was wonderful. The lobby smells sexy, like white tea and sandalwood. The rooms are large by NYC standards and extremely comfortable. The staff, especially the check-in staff were friendly and accommodating. The number one reason to stay at this hotel is the amazing terrace. Free breakfast comes with your room and can be eaten overlooking the city skyline and Bryant Park. AMAZING. We also enjoyed the terrace for cocktails at night and it was perfect to watch the Empire State Building light up. I cannot say enough wonderful things about this hotel. 10/10 will be back.

hotel_name: Park Terrace Hotel on Bryant Park
review_body: I had the most incredible experience at this hotel. From the second I walked in I was blown away by the beautiful lobby. The kind gentleman who checked us in made sure we were all set with everything we needed. Throughout the evening and following morning, I was greeted with warm smiles of the attentive staff. The room was cozy with complimentary treats of NYC and a Nespresso machine. The complimentary breakfast was absolutely delicious and I was very sad to have to leave the gorgeous establishment in the perfect NYC location.
user_name:
jamyal12
New York City, New York

hotel_name: Park Terrace Hotel on Bryant Park
review_body: From the moment that you walk into the lobby, you are greeted with a clean fresh scent reminding me of Elizabeth Arden's Green Tea perfume. The lobby is small, modern and clean as the main common areas are on the 6th floor. The staff is very service oriented and gave us cupcakes upon arrival as we were celebrating a birthday. The rooms are smallish but extremely modern and clean. The bed was very comfortable and the noon check out was welcoming. The terrace on the 6th floor was perfect. We wished we weren't so booked up for the weekend and could have enjoyed more time on there. Everything about this hotel is great. It's a boutique hotel that is not a chain and there are no other hotels in their portfolio. I wonder if that is why it's attention to detail is so perfect. None of the staff members were lax, everyone catered to us and was super attentive and friendly. We found the Park Terrace on a discount site but ended up booking direct for the same price. Lately we've had very poor service when booking through third party sites so we browse on there and always book direct.I would highly recommend this for special occasions in NYC. Well worth the money. And the location being steps away from Bryant Park was just perfect. We didn't get to enjoy the breakfast but will make sure we do on our next visit, along with drinks on the terrace. You will not be disappointed by booking this hotel.

hotel_name: Park Terrace Hotel on Bryant Park
review_body: Pleasant stay. Breakfast is very good (fruits, berries, bagels, italian style meat...). Quiet room in the middle of everything. Friendly and very polite staff. Room cleaning was very good. Overall very good stay at this hotel.

hotel_name: Park Terrace Hotel on Bryant Park
review_body: Great location, close to everything, wonderful staff, awesome breakfast included. The subway and bus lines are all very close and it’s easy to walk to Times Square, theatre district, 5th Avenue shopping and MOMA. Stay here - you will not be disappointed!!

hotel_name: Park Terrace Hotel on Bryant Park
review_body: Really enjoyed our stay in this relatively new modern accommodation. Booked a "deluxe" room which was clean, comfortable and an acceptable size. Rooms have all the necessary facilities you would expect and are of a high quality. Particularly liked how "soundproof" the room was from adjoining rooms and corridor. Continental breakfast was very good with fresh produce and good choice. Terrace bar was a great way to end busy days and nice to sit outdoors overlooking Bryant Park. All staff we encountered were friendly and helpful. Still some building works going on which was explained to us and did not impact on our stay. Relative to European prices the accommodation and bar prices were on the higher side but I suppose it is New York!

hotel_name: Park Terrace Hotel on Bryant Park
review_body: This is an amazing place to call home during your stay in NYC. Rooms are small but super efficient with very nice finishes. Staff is attentive and kind. Rooftop lounge is so lovely. Location is perfect. We cannot believe the value!!!

hotel_name: Park Terrace Hotel on Bryant Park
review_body: Loved staying here, the hospitality and location are amazing! The bed is super comfy and the complimentary breakfast is surely the best I’ve ever seen. Great selection of local foods. The staff is awesome and very helpful. fantastic stay and can’t wait to come back! Thank you!

hotel_name: Park Terrace Hotel on Bryant Park
review_body: Perfectly placed on Bryant Park you can easily access the subway, walk to destinations like Times Square and Grand Central Station in under 10 mins. So many food and drink options surrounding. The rooms were spacious for NYC and the bathrooms were the same. Staff were friendly and offered assistance and tips when needed. The terrace bar was also nice for a relaxed night within the vicinity of the hotel.

hotel_name: Park Terrace Hotel on Bryant Park
review_body: We have just enjoyed a 6 night ‘holiday ‘ stay.Others mention the rooms are small, but if you use the available space carefully, we could fit 2 adults and 2 large suitcases (6 weeks away).We had the ‘cheapest’ room with a queen bed, and no view of Bryant Park. Everything is quite new. Nice !Our shower leaked initially, but a maintenance guy came around immediately .Toiletries were good quality.The breakfast was one of the best continental breakfasts ever ! Fresh fruit (blueberries, blackberries, raspberries, mango and so on). Great carrot and ginger juice too. Coffee was made to order.... but a little more barista training could be useful!Housekeeping was mostly good, but missed a couple of times with toilet paper, soap and note paper. The head of housekeeping was coincidentally at the front desk as we checked out. She will be correcting these issues I’m sure.Most staff were excellent, and genuinely friendly.We’ve stayed in the Bryant Park area before... it is so convenient!We would certainly stay at this hotel again!

hotel_name: Park Terrace Hotel on Bryant Park
review_body: Stayed at this hotel for 1.5 weeks. Good location, near the subway and walking distance to many iconic tourist attractions. The hotel is a small boutique hotel.The rooms are very small but modern and clean. Our room was directly next to another room (like a family room), some nights you could hear the people next door using the hair dryer at midnight, talking or closing and opening the door. The bed was comfortable, the bathroom was modern and shower pressure was very good. There are water stations near the elevator to fill up water bottles provided, which is a great idea. Breakfast is included in the price, however during our stay, there was no toaster available as it had 'broken'. I did hear many guests asking about a toaster. The breakfast was simple but nice, croissants, bagels, bread, fruit, donuts, tea, coffee and juice. Would be great if they had cereal available or even a toaster. Breakfast was not often replenished, and you had to constantly ask staff to fill up the food and juice. Also very hard to get a table at breakfast, and some breakfast staff were unfriendly.One morning the fire alarm went off, we left the room quickly, no mention of a practice drill, until we asked staff in the lobby. As a 4 star hotel, hotel guests should be provided with information about these fire drills.Lovely hotel, however for the price we paid per night, I expected a little more organisation and information for guests. Would be great if on check in they provided information about the hotel, eg the bar, yoga, wifi etc. Seemed to me that staff were still learning about this information themselves.

hotel_name: Park Terrace Hotel on Bryant Park
review_body: My wife and I could not have been happier at the Park Terrace. The view from the terrazzo was worth the stay on its own. Yet in addition to the great views and excellent amenities (and really good breakfast) was the personal service. When we told them we were staying for our anniversary, they gave us a free upgrade and left us cupcakes and other snacks to help us celebrate. It's a nearly perfect place.

hotel_name: Park Terrace Hotel on Bryant Park
review_body: I cannot compliment the Park Terrace enough. My 3 night stay while in NYC on business was fabulous. My room was pristine and modern and the complimentary amenities (Nespresso, Malin & Goetz products, high quality yoga mat) made my trip feel like a vacation. I took advantage of the free breakfast one morning and wish I had taken the time the other two mornings! The options were plentiful and delicious and I ate on the beautiful terrace overlooking Bryant Park. It didn't hurt that the weather was perfectly sunny and cool! I ate at Terrazzo one evening and the flatbread and jalpeno marg I ordered were both fantastic. I used the gym one morning and was impressed by the cardio and strength options. Plus the sauna was the perfect end to my workout. Also as someone who appreciates chilled water whenever I happily took advantage of the water dispenser located on my floor. What else can I rave about.....the concierge was always helpful and friendly. The queen bed in my room was super comfortable. Didn't have time to flip through any of the free magazines provided in my room but appreciated them all the same. Will stay here for all future trips to Midtown.

hotel_name: Park Terrace Hotel on Bryant Park
review_body: Can't say enough about this hotel - it was very clean, the entire staff was very friendly and the location is perfect! The breakfast was great - including great coffee which is a must for me, the terrace overlooks Bryant Park and the library (which offers free exhibits and is a must see) is beautiful and a great place to start your day.

hotel_name: Park Terrace Hotel on Bryant Park
review_body: This hotel has it all - great location right on Bryant Park, brand new rooms that were spotless, a great breakfast and you can enjoy it on the outdoor terrace. The people and the service was also excellent.

hotel_name: Park Terrace Hotel on Bryant Park
review_body: This hotel is in the perfect location for shopping on 5th, walking in Central Park, Broadway shows and more. Nestled right next to Bryant Park and close to all the subway lines...you can get anywhere....fast. The hotel room was small, but it had nice touches to make your stay comfortable: A small amenity in your room, hydrating stations ( cute water centers) by the elevators, Beautiful breakfast room with a nice continental breakfast, plus the staff is very attentive and helpful. I stay in hotels all over the world and this one checked all my boxes for a quick in and out of NYC. I was there for 1 day.

hotel_name: Park Terrace Hotel on Bryant Park
review_body: The staff was so friendly, I wish they worked for me. The room was new, well designed. The terrace was a great destination. Location is pretty perfect. Nothing really negative, bed as a bit soft. Great products in the bathroom. Loved the shower. Hopefully coming back soon.

hotel_name: Park Terrace Hotel on Bryant Park
review_body: Friendly, smiling customer service. The breakfast bar is amazing. Fresh berries, healthy granola and yogurt, toasted bagel lathered in cream cheese and hot coffee was a great start to each day. The cold, filtered water on each floor is super slick too!

hotel_name: Park Terrace Hotel on Bryant Park
review_body: I chose this hotel among hundreds, I was very happy for the great location at Bryant park and the good breakfast, though they have queen bed instead of king, I slept very well. Rooms are a little bit small if you have big luggages as I had. Also, I paid for a deluxe room and I got a classic room, I asked to change it and they did it, but gave me exactly the same kind of room....also they keep a high deposit, so be sure your credit card is covered.

hotel_name: Park Terrace Hotel on Bryant Park
review_body: I stayed at the park terrace hotel last week for 5 days, we arrived in the evening, i was shocked to see how small the rooms were but then again it is New York. The air conditioning was good and the staff were so lovely, Noah and Leoan, and one other member of staff at reception (im so sorry i can't remember his name) were so helpful. Everyone was. Breakfast was simple but lovely, a buffet complimentary for every guest. the gym had good facilities. Only fault would be that there is no room service, or fridge in the room if you want to bring food back, and if you sleep during the day like i did (jet lag) then you can hear loud drills and noises as they are doing up the hotel still.Recyceable water bottles and water machines around the hotel are a nice touch too.Thanks team Bryant Park!

hotel_name: Park Terrace Hotel on Bryant Park
review_body: Just spent 10 days in New York staying at the Park Terrace. Location is great to access all the main attractions of New York.Staff are all really good - from the staff who travel the lift with you, those on front desk, supporting breakfast, staffing the afternoon/evening bar to those keeping the rooms spotless. Only gripe is just how little storage space the rooms have - 1 draw ( the 2nd draw contains the large safe) and a tiny wardrobe - 2 people with 9 nights worth of clothes made for a tight squeeze to unpack and not live out of suitcases—- but we managed with extra coat hanger. Would happily book here again.

hotel_name: Park Terrace Hotel on Bryant Park
review_body: Small rooms considering the price but everything else perfect. Next to Bryant Park, Walking distance to Times Square and 5th avenue that will take you directly to Central Park. Subway next to the park. Very service minded staff!

hotel_name: Park Terrace Hotel on Bryant Park
review_body: I can’t recommend this hotel enough. The location was excellent. We walked to see a Broadway show, to Times Square, Rockefeller Center, and the Empire State Building. The breakfast is lovely- delicious lattes and cappuccinos prepared by a barista, some of the best donuts I’ve ever had, and many other treats. We enjoyed the free sparkling water and kettle corn in the room. The lobby staff were so friendly and helpful and had great recommendations for us. We would definitely stay here again!!

hotel_name: Park Terrace Hotel on Bryant Park
review_body: This hotel was a huge reason why our trip to New York was so brilliant. Having such a comfortable base in a great location allowed us to move around the city very easily. Subway station at the end of the street but also within walking distance of so many attractions, this place is definitely worth considering if spending a few days in New York.It’s relatively new so everything still feels quite fresh. Our room was spacious with a very comfortable bed, excellent shower and a seating area. All the staff we met were very helpful and happy to offer suggestions if looking for somewhere to eat or drink locally. Breakfast was complimentary and a very nice way to start the day with local produce available. It was very busy at certain points of the morning so sometimes certain options weren’t available but staff were generally quick to re-stock.If we go back to New York, this place will be the first option we look at and I’d happily recommend to anyone looking to book a trip in NYC.

hotel_name: Park Terrace Hotel on Bryant Park
review_body: Hotel was in a great location, across from Bryant Park. All the staff went out of their way to provide exceptional service. Room was small but very clean and functional. Slept great on terrific bedding. We enjoyed the free continental breakfast which was served in a beautiful room. Probably the best continental breakfast we've had. Looking forward to staying at the Park Terrace on our next visit to NYC.

hotel_name: Park Terrace Hotel on Bryant Park
review_body: Lovely room, complementary WI FI and breakfast - amazing location! The staff was always helpful and friendly. Enjoyed the hydration stations, laundry facilities and yoga mats in rooms. Gym looked good, but did not use it.

hotel_name: Park Terrace Hotel on Bryant Park
review_body: Very nice place to stay in NY. We enjoyed the room, the localisation, the breakfast. Health alternatives to choose at breakfast and great coffee. Close to Top of the rock, MoMA, Central Park etc.......................................

hotel_name: Park Terrace Hotel on Bryant Park
review_body: We stayed in this awesome hotel which we could not fault. The staff in all areas of the hotel were very friendly & accommodated everything we needed. Great location & very quiet. Hard to beat this hotel and we enjoyed being there. It will be our go to hotel in NYC.

hotel_name: Park Terrace Hotel on Bryant Park
review_body: Nicely located beside Bryant Park. Staff was friendly and helpful, offering advice on things to do in town. Breakfast option had variety. Clean and neat room, but very quiet. Had a very good experience, so would come back again.

hotel_name: Park Terrace Hotel on Bryant Park
review_body: Love this hotel! Stayed here for a week in May-2019. Location is perfect and close to dozens of attractions and sights. The hotel overlooks Bryant Park. The breakfast was included and was amazing, and we really enjoyed eating on rooftop deck in the mornings. The staff is awesome, and the rooms are super clean and modern. Service upon check-in and check-out was superb! We'll be back!

hotel_name: Park Terrace Hotel on Bryant Park
review_body: One of the best hotels in New York. Small rooms, but very efficient and neat layout that takes advantage of every square in. Great on-site amenities and great location. Staff was very helpful and willing to do anything to make sure our stay was great. Spring in New York - what could be better?

hotel_name: Park Terrace Hotel on Bryant Park
review_body: I spent ages looking over hotels before we booked as the one we stayed at previously was fully booked and I'm so glad I chose this hotel. The staff were all friendly and lovely and welcoming on arrival. Our room was a good size and we had enough room for two of us and place to store suitcase etc. The added breakfast was a bonus.There is some building work going on in the hotel and it has scaffolding out the front but it didn't impact our stay apart from the last day when the water was shut off but we were given notice.

hotel_name: Park Terrace Hotel on Bryant Park
review_body: I was very happy with my stay, the room was clean and seemed large by New York standards. The reception and concierge were accommodating and helpful and the breakfast spread was fresh and had something for everyone. Highly recommend.

hotel_name: Park Terrace Hotel on Bryant Park
review_body: We stayed in the premier studio suite with park view. Note on website, it states a king bed with kitchenette. When we checked in our room, it was super small under 400 sq ft, with a queen bed and no kitchenette in sight and had no park view. When I called the front desk, they said they needed IT to correct their website and that I should of request a king size bed. Why would I request a king size bed if your website states a king size bed in our room?? First day of our stay the AC thermostat broke, the engineer came to fix it and stated that the hotel is well aware of ongoing issue. Second day, after a long day out in NYC.. we went to shower and there was no running water. It took them more than 45 minutes to fix the problem. I had to let the water run for at least 20 mins because the color of water was green then yellow. It was so gross!! I didn’t even want to take a shower anymore. Third day, our AC thermostat broke again, after the engineer left the AC ran really loud the rest of our stay. It was so loud, it disrupted my sleep at night. Also we notice there was no ceiling above our door. A long rectangular piece was cut out, we could see the interior pipes of the hotel. I had a lot of anxiety that a rat would creep into our room at night. It was the worse feeling to have to pay almost $700 a night for what we experienced. I 100% regret selecting this hotel. This was my first trip to NYC and I was highly disappointed and disgusted with our stay. I advise everyone not to stay at this hotel. It is not ready for production for any guests.

hotel_name: Park Terrace Hotel on Bryant Park
review_body: We had a fantastic stay at this hotel. Fantastic location just a few blocks from time square a subway line at the end of the street. The room was clean and modern. Staff were friendly, helpful and professional.

hotel_name: Park Terrace Hotel on Bryant Park
review_body: The hotel is located in central of NY, near everything you want to see. I love how it is being in the center of the city but feel relaxing, quiet. The rooftop is our family’s favorite. Both husband and I love it. The breakfast is so yummy and everything is so tasty. We are here to celebrate husband ‘s birthday and cupcakes were brought up to the room along with a personal note. Love it. The staff is definitely the key to this hotel. Everyone is so friendly and helpful especially Gabriella in the front desk. She is awesome, super helpful and friendly. She should get a raise if she is not already in a management team. The evening team ,Charlie is the best. He is fast, efficient but also engaging. We love the engineer who fixed our TV within 5’ of our call to front desk. We will be back next time we in New York.

hotel_name: Park Terrace Hotel on Bryant Park
review_body: Great location. Close to everything with easy access to the subway. Fabulous breakfast. Awesome staff! The roof top terrace definitely shouldn't be missed. My new go to for a NYC hotel. Couldn't have asked for better.

hotel_name: Park Terrace Hotel on Bryant Park
review_body: awesome room. awesome hospitality. Awesome location. awesome people.. and free cupcakes. We enjoyed the stay and rested peacefully. They had a lot to offer and the rooms were clean, and there were great extras.

hotel_name: Park Terrace Hotel on Bryant Park
review_body: This is a must stay hotel, right in the heart of New York.All the staff are friendly and happy to accommodate your needs.The terrace is a great place to hang out and enjoy a drink with friends and take in the views.

hotel_name: Park Terrace Hotel on Bryant Park
review_body: This little midtown gem is the best value in town. Conveniently located in the heart of midtown near the theater district and right in front of Bryant Park. The staff treated us royally for two weeks. They are wonderful from the front desk to the elevator operators. We were always greeted when we came and went. The concierge Leon ran out to give us an umbrella when it started to rain. They have a great lounge on the 6th floor with a beautifully landscaped terrace that you can have breakfast or drinks or just some quiet time. We had the best experience.

hotel_name: Park Terrace Hotel on Bryant Park
review_body: Clean, modern rooms with good WiFi, very helpful staff and great breakfast spread with items from gourmet shops from all around the city!Convenient cafes nearby include Maison Kayser, Lady M!Only the elevators are rather slow at peak hours!Will definitely stay there again.

hotel_name: Park Terrace Hotel on Bryant Park
review_body: Central location. Paid for room with a view- was brilliant. Nespresso and topped up pods a lovely touch. Breakfast each morning was complimentary with nice coffee, bagels, meats, fruit and doughnuts. Staff very helpful. Would recommend.

hotel_name: Park Terrace Hotel on Bryant Park
review_body: Great location, overlooking Bryant Park & minutes from Time Square. Small rooms but with modern layout including free Nespresso coffee in rooms. Very friendly staff. Great quality of breakfast although seating area limited. Would stay there again.

hotel_name: Park Terrace Hotel on Bryant Park
review_body: Excellent location for exploring the eclectic sights and experiences of NYC and being next to Bryan Park meant we had a break from the noise and buzz between the skyscrapers. Friendly and helpful staff. No cooked breakfast but plenty of fresh fruit, pastries, meat/cheese and granola to choose from. Clean, modern rooms. We had a room with a view of the park. Would stay here again.

hotel_name: Park Terrace Hotel on Bryant Park
review_body: My daughter and I stayed here for her college graduation and had a great stay. The room was really nice, we loved the water stations to refill our water bottles each day throughout the hotel, the room was very nice and comfortable. We liked the large tvs and the large bottles of shampoo, conditioner and body lotion in the rooms, and it was nice to have the coffee maker and refrigerator in the room. And the breakfast buffet was wonderful - great selection and very high quality food. We'd definitely stay here again.

hotel_name: Park Terrace Hotel on Bryant Park
review_body: I have been to many 5 star hotels in my day and I would pick this one (over and over again) over most of them. The centralized location made it a top pick for us. The exceptional service, free breakfast and beautiful views are what made it different. This hotel is centralized and walking distance to Bryant Park (of course), Broadway, Times Square, the Empire State and Rockefeller. Do yourself a favor and book this hotel. It’s a bargain for what is offered and for where it is located.

hotel_name: Park Terrace Hotel on Bryant Park
review_body: Great location by Bryant Park Midtown. Clean and friendly staff and service. The hotel provided a delicious free breakfast with wonderful pastries and fresh fruit. Great way to start the morning in NYC

hotel_name: Park Terrace Hotel on Bryant Park
review_body: Top Location on Bryant Park/5th Avenue, clean rooms with modern furniture, very friendly staff, filtered water and nespresso free of charge in the room available, very nice Terrace overlooking Bryant Park (breakfast is served there as well)

hotel_name: Park Terrace Hotel on Bryant Park
review_body: Amazing room, clean, enough space for two! All staff were beyond friendly and helpful. Breakfast was delicious. Great patio for outside eating and drinks. Will stay again on next visit to the city! Dehydration stations were great!

hotel_name: Park Terrace Hotel on Bryant Park
review_body: The location of this hotel could not get any better. Tucked away beside Bryant Park, it was quiet, but walking distance to everything. It was very clean, comfortable and the staff were super helpful and sweet.

hotel_name: Park Terrace Hotel on Bryant Park
review_body: The hotel did not seem to be ready yet for full price business. Room was too small; pictures of room were deceiving.There is construction out front. No extras in the room such as microwave/fridge.Desktop filled with “for sale”, overpriced snacks and there was no space in the room to store them, so desk was unusable.

hotel_name: Park Terrace Hotel on Bryant Park
review_body: I highly recommend this hotel!! I recently stayed at the Park Terrace for a long weekend with my boyfriend and one other couple. I was very, very impressed with the staff at this hotel, from the moment we arrived until they kindly helped us get into our cab to the airport. Every person was smiling, happy and interested in our plans for the day. You can tell the team there is proud of their beautiful hotel and that they enjoy being genuinely hospitable. The room was perfect and we loved the outdoor terrace with comfortable soft seating and quick service. The location is perfect, right on the park - with entertainment, bars and restaurants overlooking the green.
