Very close to Times Square, Rockefeller center and the Empire State building just to name a few attractions you can see in walking distance. I would stay here again and would recommend it to anyone looking for a nice hotel in NYC!

hotel_name: Park Terrace Hotel on Bryant Park
review_body: The staff at this property are exceptional, friendly and professional. The location is centrally located and you have the beautiful Bryant Park at your doorstep. Rooms are on the smaller side by well designed and clean. We will stay here again.

hotel_name: Park Terrace Hotel on Bryant Park
review_body: This hotel was built from a demolished parking garage in 2018, and the rooms are very clean, although small. However, this is expected for NYC. Service was excellent. The breakfast and outdoor rooftop seating area are very good. Pillows weren’t very comfortable - too soft and squishy for me, but this is a matter of personal preference. Overall, had a very enjoyable stay. Would highly recommend.

hotel_name: Park Terrace Hotel on Bryant Park
review_body: We stayed at Park Terrace for one night my wife and I we went to see a Broadway play very convenient location very clean nice rooms beautiful shower five star bedding with expensive linens. excellent complemtary breakfast Greek yogurt fresh fruit bagels delicious breads Cappuccino better than Starbucks The carrot ginger juice was out of this world. When the weather is nice they have a beautiful outdoor terrace you can eat your breakfast if you prefer not to eat inside very comfortable sofas and chairs outside. They also provide free filtered water with plastic bottles that you fill yourself right across from the elevators and did I mention the Staff the most courteous and helpful wonderful professional people. Forget about those big name hotels this is a hidden gem right across the street from lovely Bryant Park. We will definitely return.

hotel_name: Park Terrace Hotel on Bryant Park
review_body: Fantastic location, across the street from Bryant Park. Rooms and the staff are nice. We enjoyed the Terrace for drinks at night and breakfast in the morning. Downside to the hotel are small rooms and the elevators seemed very slow.

hotel_name: Park Terrace Hotel on Bryant Park
review_body: Travelling for business, there are a few things that are always a must: a spotless bathroom, a comfy bed, good shower pressure, low noise pollution from hallways and outside, and decent room service. The Park Terrace Hotel met almost all of these musts and threw in a few extra perks along the way. The room was comfortable, clean, and a decent size by NYC standards. I could also tell that it was fairly new/updated and that whoever was cleaning each day was being very thorough in their efforts. My bathroom was SPOTLESS and, unlike many larger chain hotels in NYC - and especially in this neighborhood, the furnishings, carpet and shower were bright and cheery, not worn and tired. Free breakfast each morning was also a welcome surprise, with coffee, juice, and tea available alongside bagels, toast, donuts from Doughnut Plant, and charcuterie. So, why isn't this a five star review? There are a few - very small! - things that the Park Terrace can do to better cater to business travelers like myself in the future. The first is room service - I routinely end up working in my room after hours quite late and love having the option to call down to the kitchen for a bite to eat and a glass of wine. Yes, I know it's NYC and there are a million delivery options. But sometimes, surfing Caviar for a type of food, placing an order, and then running out to grab a drink (alcoholic or otherwise) is too much. Room service will take this place from good to great. The other small change I would make is providing reusable and clearly sterilized glass bottles in each room that guests can refill at the water stations located on each floor. I LOVE the idea of free water stations from an environmental perspective, but all that good will goes away once you realize that you're filling up a million different plastic bottles to take back to your room.

hotel_name: Park Terrace Hotel on Bryant Park
review_body: Amazing boutique hotel on quiet side street but easy walk to everything! Comfy bed, great service and facilities. Breakfast was the best!! Will definitely stay here again. Great value, and amenities and ambiance

hotel_name: Park Terrace Hotel on Bryant Park
review_body: Convenient and quiet location next to Bryant Park so easy to get around throughout Manhattan. A metro station is located outside the hotel. The hotel and room was very clean. Our room had fun touches like flavored popcorn and sparkling water. We also enjoyed the water stations on each floor to refill water bottles. We had a delicious and fulfilling complimentary breakfast on the balcony basking in the morning sun and enjoying views of the park.

hotel_name: Park Terrace Hotel on Bryant Park
review_body: Love this hotel! We had a great view of the Empire State building. The room was perfect with a small coach, place for your suitcase, closet and great bathroom. Shower with great pressure. The staff were really friendly and helpful. The room was spotless. It was quiet.There is also a fantastic terrace with a beautiful view of the park, library and Empire State building and great breakfast too. Perfect!

hotel_name: Park Terrace Hotel on Bryant Park
review_body: Just back from a week-long stay at the Park Terrace hotel. I really enjoyed my stay at the hotel and would consider returning. We stayed in a deluxe room which was fine for size. The only thing that would have improved the room was more storage space. This probably wouldn't be an issue for a short break but for two guests staying for a week we struggled to store everything and some of our things remained in our suitcases for the duration. The location of the hotel was great - you're in Midtown but not right in the thick of Times Sq which was what we wanted. That said it's only a short walk away. Due to its central location, The Park Terrace hotel is a great base from which to explore Manhattan. My only piece of constructive feedback to the hotel would be to try to improve the breakfast offering. The continental breakfast options were very nice but at times the restaurant was overrun with guests and there were not enough tables available to accommodate everyone at peak times. I also experienced quite a long wait for speciality coffees as there only seemed to be one barista during this time. This wasn't the barista's fault - he was severely backed up with orders and I had to wait over 15 minutes for a coffee. Had I not been tight on time to get to work this wouldn't have been so much of an issue. All in all, we had a good stay at the hotel and I would consider returning.

hotel_name: Park Terrace Hotel on Bryant Park
review_body: A great hotel in a very convenient spot across from Bryant Park and the New York Public Library. Extremely welcoming staff and a wonderful breakfast which is included. Rooms are on the small side but that’s typical of NYC. A lovely outdoor lounge and breakfast room were available. The staff was young and very willing to accommodate special requests.

hotel_name: Park Terrace Hotel on Bryant Park
review_body: A nice boutique hotel in the middle of the City, room well designed and tidy, with all the service you may need, I found it so confrotable. Employees always ready to satisfy my requestes, I will coming back for sure.

hotel_name: Park Terrace Hotel on Bryant Park
review_body: I love it. The location is fantastic. Good design interior for a great Chipperfield Building. Very good room (studio park view), amenities and nice bath products. Breakfast bar is excellent with beautiful terrace

hotel_name: Park Terrace Hotel on Bryant Park
review_body: Arrived late at night to a friendly greeting and a great bed! Rooms were spotless with a contemporary feel and excellent Bose sound system. Fantastic location, great gym and an amazing breakfast of artisan french bread and local bagels. Will definitely be back!
user_name:
Cruiser06552590053
Newcastle upon Tyne, United Kingdom

hotel_name: Park Terrace Hotel on Bryant Park
review_body: My husband and I originally booked a classic room (one bed, no frills) thinking we would have two beds (based on photos we looked at before booking). Our plan changed and we came to NYC with our two small children as well. The classic room was extremely small and had no couch or extra place for our kids to sleep. It would be perfect for a single or couple, however. We upgraded to a suite and took an air mattress for one child while the other slept on the couch. The room itself, even for a suite, was quite compact, but it served us just fine for our 4 day stay. Overall, we were extremely happy with this hotel. The location was perfect, we had no noise issues (from inside or outside), the rooms are brand new and very modern and clean. The 6th floor terrace was beautiful and elegant. Most importantly, the staff was *excellent*. Friendly, helpful, always available, and even made the elevator rides fun for us and our kids. Special hello to Lobsang, who was the friendliest employee we met there!

hotel_name: Park Terrace Hotel on Bryant Park
review_body: Friendly and attentive service, comfortable room with modern appointments, 6th floor terrace with Empire State Building view perfect for small plates and a drink at the end of the day. Good buffet breakfast was included in my room rate.Even though it was a corner room, the view was still limited to directly across into the neighboring buildings.
user_name:
NicholaJD
Washington DC, District of Columbia

hotel_name: Park Terrace Hotel on Bryant Park
review_body: I'll be back! The room was large and clean and thoughtfully decorated. Attention to little details was appreciated - like having a filtered water station with empty plastic bottles on each floor so you could get water any time. Although there's no restaurant right now guests are treated to a delicious breakfast buffet. The best thing is the staff who really want you to have a good stay. And, as a single woman traveling alone, I like that staff are in the elevators.

hotel_name: Park Terrace Hotel on Bryant Park
review_body: The location is really great next to Bryant Park and the staff at the hotel is very friendly and helpful. Rooms were clean and cosy and breakfast had a good selection of food and coffee. We will definitely come back!

hotel_name: Park Terrace Hotel on Bryant Park
review_body: Clean and well presented hotel with friendly staff who could not do enough for you. Good selection of food at breakfast which all tasted amazing! Very comfy eating areas and bar/terrace with beautiful views! Perfect central location with subway stations close by.We will definitely come back!

hotel_name: Park Terrace Hotel on Bryant Park
review_body: We had been staying at The Sanctuary New York Times Square and couldn’t extend our stay there, so we switched to (the superior and far more expensive) Park Terrace which we had walked past earlier during our New York trip and which had excellent Trip Advisor reviews. Park Terrace was very nice. Excellent staff, comfortable, bright, well organised room. Terrace on 6th floor excellent for small plates and innovative cocktails. It’s a madhouse in the streets around Bryant Park so I was surprised how quiet our 4th floor room was (that had an angled view of Bryant Park). There was a gym downstairs and useful free washer / dryer that we took advantage of having accumulated a lot of laundry during our trip. One elevator wasn’t working for part of our stay leading to lengthy delays but the hotel positioned staff in the working elevator like the old days which was a charming old school touch. Rooms are tastefully done. Great place but more than double the price of the place we were staying at Times Square. I guess you get what you pay for. This new Park Terrace Hotel on Bryant Park should secure many positive reviews

hotel_name: Park Terrace Hotel on Bryant Park
review_body: Make sure to completely close shower door. There is no late check out what so ever. Close to Penn Station. Free hydration stations On every floor. Chrome cast not the greatest and little difficult to use.

hotel_name: Park Terrace Hotel on Bryant Park
review_body: Enjoyed staying at the Park Terrace and will return.Well appointed at this price point, thoughtful staffGood places for breakfast nearby.Small but comfortable room and bed with simple well thought out amenities in room.

hotel_name: Park Terrace Hotel on Bryant Park
review_body: Hotel was new clean and really nice. The staff were welcoming and friendly. The breakfast was delicious and loads of it. The breakfast room did get a bit crowded at weekends. The location was great. Filling recommend this hotel. Will be back

hotel_name: Park Terrace Hotel on Bryant Park
review_body: My room was quiet and clean. The staff were all very helpful and charming. Breakfast was included and was good. I liked the hydration station on each floor.The hotel is very well located close - I love Bryant Park.

hotel_name: Park Terrace Hotel on Bryant Park
review_body: The Terrace was an excellent overall choice and we look forward to a return visit.The hotel 's stylish contemporary furnishings, young friendly and competent staff and excellent location made our visit so much better

hotel_name: Park Terrace Hotel on Bryant Park
review_body: Very good location in Manhattan, NYC.Xtra points to notice:1. acoustic problems between rooms.2.consider asking reception for rooms with windows that can be opened due to very low air conditioning.3. Breakfast - not enough space for everyone. Take 15 mnts extra for waiting to a table.

hotel_name: Park Terrace Hotel on Bryant Park
review_body: Great location; new property; tasteful appointments; great breakfast; nice bar; staff congenial and welcoming; and helpful. Overall, a very comfortable stay, in a good location, with a quiet room. Would return.

hotel_name: Park Terrace Hotel on Bryant Park
review_body: Stayed at this hotel for three nights as a family of four. Online booking was challenging as I booked two rooms but received confirmation for just one room. Called booking (...a bit of a challenge when calling from Europe as you cannot call 1-800-numbers from outside US and direct number was well hidden) and was told that apparently there were no two rooms in this booking category available anymore...they fixed that issue. I also asked for rooms nearby so we'd be close to our children. Upon arrival we were given two rooms but on different levels...well, kids are teens so it wasn't too much of an issue.Rooms were small but it's NYC and though they were small they were functional, nice and clean. The hotel is fairly new and there was still a lot of commotion with handymen being around all the time. Elevator wait times were ridiculous as they were also in use for construction/repair crews and had to be manually operated by staff members. Our rooms were on rather low levels so we used stairs most of the time. Had to leave one kid behind during the day bc not feeling well...received a panicky phone call from her as there was an unannounced fire drill, which was not declared as a drill immediately. That was a major fail and more so a very scary moment for the child. To top it off this was followed by another drill with sirens and lights flashing. Room service was lacking behind as we came to an unmade room after a long day out. Called, nothing happened for 45 mins, called again and room was quickly fixed minutes later.Location was absolutely great and convenient. Breakfast was very good. Artisan bagels and donuts, very good spreads and yummy fresh fruit. Lots of healthy choices. Nothing to complain about. Staff was absolutely lovely. They were young and beautiful people and super helpful. Everybody -including work crews- were very polite and friendly. Conclusion was that this was a great hotel with lovely staff in a great location. It will need a bit more time to run smoothly. Besides the hiccups, we would book again. I am sure we will come back and hopefully then be able to give five stars. (Front desk deserves five stars already!!)

hotel_name: Park Terrace Hotel on Bryant Park
review_body: Great location, amazing breakfast, fabulous bedroom, quality bathroom products, handy water stations and really helpful and friendly staff. Big shout out to Charlie the concierge in reception for going above and beyond! A perfect stay!

hotel_name: Park Terrace Hotel on Bryant Park
review_body: The room was small but beautiful and efficient. The bed was comfortable and the location was perfect for walking to see broadway shows. It is right across the street from a beautiful park and the NY Public Library. Highly recommend.

hotel_name: Park Terrace Hotel on Bryant Park
review_body: We had a fantastic stay at Park Terrace - the location was unbeatable and the free breakfast and water stations were nice touches. Finally, all the staff were so helpful - on my next visit to NYC, I would definitely stay again!

hotel_name: Park Terrace Hotel on Bryant Park
review_body: The position is ideal if you want to stay in midtown, close to 5th Avenue and near Times Square.The Hotel is very clean and offers a very godd breakfast in a beautiful room and terrace.The staff is very kind. The price is adeguate.We'll come again.

hotel_name: Park Terrace Hotel on Bryant Park
review_body: Park Terrace is conveniently located in the Bryant Park area which is right around the corner from Times Square, etc...I highly recommend this gem of a place! Wonderful warm staff, clean rooms, great location and top notch service. I'll definitely be listing this as my preference for business trips to NYC

hotel_name: Park Terrace Hotel on Bryant Park
review_body: Great value for money.Very friendly and competent staff.Delicious breakfast.Convenient locations, particularly for those who want to explore the east side of Manhattan.Quick boh check in and check-out.

hotel_name: Park Terrace Hotel on Bryant Park
review_body: The staff at Park Terrance Hotel are excellent. The room is very clean, new, and comfortable. The complimentary breakfast is very delicious. Hotel in a very central location, close to lots of the attractions. Highly recommended

hotel_name: Park Terrace Hotel on Bryant Park
review_body: I travel to New York City for work every other week and have for the past year. I’ve tried a number of hotels and none has been better than the Park Terrace. The hotel is brand new, the rooms are sparklingly clean and the staff is the most friendly and accommodating I’ve ever encountered in any city. A special thanks to Charlie Reopel and Gabriela Leonardo at the front and Rama Gurung and Catalina Gomez in housekeeping for making my stays a home away from home!

hotel_name: Park Terrace Hotel on Bryant Park
review_body: I am fond of both Bryant park and New York’s public library. This special place gives you both, poignant historical experience and the city’s vibrance. The warmth and charm of the service is outstanding. The whole concept is eco-oriented. They got me at -Water -refills -on every floor!

hotel_name: Park Terrace Hotel on Bryant Park
review_body: Excellent front desk concierge service. Nice housekeeping closet to refresh supplies in hallHousekeeping service otherwise iffy. Location excellent. Bed comfortable, and fairly quiet at night. Smart tv an extra bonus. Lighting very pleasant.

hotel_name: Park Terrace Hotel on Bryant Park
review_body: The Hotel is looking very new inside! The Service is amazing!Doesn't matter what you need, they will help you. Elevator Service, free umbrellas if it rains and the reception will bring parts you give them to your room.One of the best Hotels I ever visited.

hotel_name: Park Terrace Hotel on Bryant Park
review_body: A very modern, comfortable hotel in a great mid town location. Friendly, attentive, helpful staff. Delicious breakfast buffet and evening cocktails. Our double room, overlooking Bryant Park and the NYPL was very comfortable and well equipped (large TV, Nespresso machine, Bose Bluetooth speaker etc).

hotel_name: Park Terrace Hotel on Bryant Park
review_body: Staid for 4 days during the holidays and everything was perfect! Excellent service, clean rooms (and spacious for New York standards), delicious breakfast, great location, friendly staff. Would definitely stay again next time in the city.

hotel_name: Park Terrace Hotel on Bryant Park
review_body: We were referred to this hotel by family visiting from California. We were very pleasantly surprised by the quality of our lodging, the courtesy of all the staff we encountered. The location was terrific. The small size of the hotel gave off a very cozy feel. We would heartily recommend this hotel to our friends!

hotel_name: Park Terrace Hotel on Bryant Park
review_body: Loved our stay. Very comfortable room. Great staff. Clean. Great popcorn. They had umbrellas for us to use. The bar on the 6th floor is lovely. It has a great view. We drank and ate more popcorn. We had a wonderful time.

hotel_name: Park Terrace Hotel on Bryant Park
review_body: We stayed here for a week, and it was just perfect. The hotel is in an ideal location, right next to Bryant Park, the staff are super friendly (girl with curly hair on reception always smiling and the lovely guys in the elevators too!), and the facilities are great (rooftop bar and gym). Best bits of the hotel: - There are multiple subway stops within a 5 minute walk. - The free breakfast which includes bagels from a local bakery and amazing donuts, fresh fruit and yoghurt. - The views of the surrounding buildings and park. - The bedding was insanely comfortable and soft. - Sliding 'Juliet Balcony' is amazing and was a huge positive on the hot days to get some fresh air in the room. - The shower had great water pressure and the bathroom was modern and spacious. - Gym has a Peloton bike which is cool!- Chilled water available on every floor with re-usuable bottles too. My only 2 negatives were the size of the bed (only Queen-size, and we prefer King), and the lifts were a little slow at busy times. Overall I would 100% recommend. This is our new favourite hotel in the city, and we wouldn't hesitate to book again. It was wonderful.

hotel_name: Park Terrace Hotel on Bryant Park
review_body: Great location next to Bryant Park, good facilities, and warm & kind staff — all made me want to extend my stay and hurry back for another visit. You are next to Bryant Park, with all the great amenities such as Whole Foods, coffeehouses, bake shops, and CorePower yoga. And Times Square a 5 minute walk. The hotel gym is good along with its sauna. Great conference area. Each floor offerers convenient filtered water filling stations. Free self-service laundry. Awesome breakfast with organic berries and cappuccinos. The reception area is welcoming, with Leaon at the front desk along with his co-workers.

hotel_name: Park Terrace Hotel on Bryant Park
review_body: Great location. Helpful staff. Breakfast area a little small and busy most mornings. Great choices at breakfast good quality food. Outside terrace is lovely. Nice sized rooms for NY we had a delux with view.

hotel_name: Park Terrace Hotel on Bryant Park
review_body: Spent 5 nights at this modern new hotel near Bryant Park. It’s in a very central location with easy access to the subway to see all the sights in New York, many of which are in walking distance. Room was on the 5th floor with a view of the park with modern conveniences such as unlimited free filtered bottled water, free WiFi, free continental breakfast.

hotel_name: Park Terrace Hotel on Bryant Park
review_body: We stayed for almost a week and it was excellent. Location is always subjective but for us was a real plus (close to Times Sq but away of the most hectic parts while meters away from the subway). The hotel is almost new, design is clean and functional. The room was not so ample (room size was not informed at hotels.com) but it was very comfortable and well thought through. Breakfast is for free and although is low on proteins is above just "good". The dining room (which also serves as a bar / business center) space at the 6th floor provides good breathing with high ceilings and the sight of the park in front. But the aspect that makes the main difference is service: they are recruiting great people and seem to train them very well. From Katchiana, Gabriela and Charlie at the reception, through EVERYONE at the elevators and the breakfast area, they are all full of energy and genuinely willing to help you enjoy your stay. Only points to continue improving would be:- early check-in times- sizing of Team / counter at breakfast time may get limited - some park rooms have a less than partial view / some rooms on the 5th floor are probably noisy because of the bathrooms located in the aisleIn summary: we stayed at probably more than a dozen hotels in the wide Times Sq area, this is clearly the best we tried.

hotel_name: Park Terrace Hotel on Bryant Park
review_body: Great hotel with brilliant staff and in a prime location. Free breakfast staff could not do any more for you.reception staff always there with directions and even printing map to places that we wanted to visit
user_name:
wilmadouglas
Perth and Kinross, United Kingdom

hotel_name: Park Terrace Hotel on Bryant Park
review_body: We arrived early morning after a red eye. We were not in the best mood but the staff at Park Terrace turned things right around for us. The lady checking us in (I wish I could remember her name) was fantastic and seemed to genuinely care. They made sure that we could refresh at the complimentary breakfast (which is great) even though we were 8 hours early of check-in. They said that they would do what they could to get us a room earlier, which I have heard many times and find it rarely happens, but they actually called us only 2 hours later saying they had a room ready for us. The same lady was checking us in and again was extremely friendly and efficient but also went out of her way to make things as easy and comfortable for us any way she could. Beyond check in, the entire staff was very friendly and the overall service was the best I've had anywhere. Would definitely recommend this hotel to anyone.

hotel_name: Park Terrace Hotel on Bryant Park
review_body: I did not like. The room small and 300 dollars a day.The Breakfast goog but the restaurant too very small.Positive things: Lovely reception staff and water and ice on all floors. The situation very nice too.

hotel_name: Park Terrace Hotel on Bryant Park
review_body: Clean, spacious (for NY), very cordial and helpful staff, easy to get anywhere In the city. Beautiful Bryant part right across the street as well as the beautiful library. Breakfast included a great deal and if weather permits, enjoying breakfast on the Terrace a must!.

hotel_name: Park Terrace Hotel on Bryant Park
review_body: The staff was wonderful--very pleasant and helpful. Excellent breakfast and if you need gluten free, let them know in advance and they will provide you with a baked item you can eat (while others are eating donuts etc.)Room was small but very well designed. Lots of attention to details.

hotel_name: Park Terrace Hotel on Bryant Park
review_body: I booked a last minute night at this hotel after my flight back home was cancelled and the hotel I originally stayed at was fully booked. Harrinson and Noah were great. They turned a very stressful experience into a fantastic one. I look forward to staying here in the future. Thank you Harrinson and Noah!!!

hotel_name: Park Terrace Hotel on Bryant Park
review_body: The location is excellent! Near 5th Avenue, grand central station, Times Square, across from Bryant Park, near a subway station, etc. the staff went out of their way to please guests! The rooms were very comfortable and techie! Very clean and modern. The breakfast included Greek yogurt, pastries, fresh fruit, made to order coffee drinks, etc. the terrace was lovely. I will definitely go there again!

hotel_name: Park Terrace Hotel on Bryant Park
review_body: What a lovely hotel. Everything about was perfect. The location, the staff, the terrace overlooking Bryant park with comfy couches and chairs, the amazing breakfast spread, the lovely room and comfortable bed. Everyone was so nice.

hotel_name: Park Terrace Hotel on Bryant Park
review_body: The Park Terrace Hotel is in a great location and is a great value for the high level of service provided. The staff is very friendly and helpful and the rooms are very comfortable. I will definitely be booking here for my next visit to NYC.

hotel_name: Park Terrace Hotel on Bryant Park
review_body: We were very happy with the location of the hotel, and the staff were extremely nice. Clean room and bathroom, but very small for such an expensive price. We ended up having to pay extra for a slightly larger room because two people would not fit with luggage in the classic. Great donuts in the morning!

hotel_name: Park Terrace Hotel on Bryant Park
review_body: This was the best hotel I have stayed at in NYC. It was clean, super friendly staff, the breakfast was such a nice touch and just right. Our room had everything we needed. The location was perfect as it’s across from beautiful Bryant Park, a short walk to Times Square and the subway at the corner. Next trip to NYC this is my only hotel choice. Thank you Park Terrace Hotel for a fabulous stay.

hotel_name: Park Terrace Hotel on Bryant Park
review_body: Well designed, great view of Bryant Park, extremely friendly and professional employees, fantastic morning breakfast buffet. Has to be one of, if not the best value in manhattan. My new favorite “go to” hotel in NYC!

hotel_name: Park Terrace Hotel on Bryant Park
review_body: Everything was great. close to restaurants. Staff very friendly and helpful. complementary breackfast and lunch was fantastic. value for money. very clean . beds were great. Nice gym and pool. Thank you

hotel_name: Park Terrace Hotel on Bryant Park
review_body: The Park Terrace not only has an excellent location - right across from Bryant Park, walking distance to your broadway show - it also has attentive service and a modern elegance. The room we had with a partial park view was small but well-designed, the breakfast/bar area is gorgeous with soaring ceilings, views of the park and library and a well-stocked breakfast bar (no omelettes but you can ask for cappuccinos). Young men man the elevators, they delivered cupcakes as a gift for my birthday, they are attentive. We had a truly wonderful weekend.

hotel_name: Park Terrace Hotel on Bryant Park
review_body: From the courteous reception to the polite elevator operators to the delectable healthy breakfast the Park Terrace Hotel exceeded our expectations. The location is perfect right beside the animated Bryant Park and NY Public Library. We found the nearby Whole Foods to be a great place to grab dinner to eat at a table in the park at a fraction of the cost of dining al fresco at a restaurant. The room and bathroom are NYC small but immaculate with excellent toiletries. The breakfast was marvelous with real chewy bagels, perfectly curated fresh fruit, aged cheddar cheese and decadent donuts. Highly recommend this hotel!

hotel_name: Park Terrace Hotel on Bryant Park
review_body: My husband and I stayed here for 3 nights. We were really happy with the location as there was so much within easy walking distance, and it wasn’t far from the subway station. Our room was clean, comfortable and had everything we needed. The water refill stations were a nice touch. The staff were all friendly and happy to help. Breakfast was fine (lots of bagels, doughnuts, fruit and granola) but there seemed to be a shortage of indoor seating which meant it was sometimes tricky to find a spot to eat. Overall though, a nice new hotel in the centre of NYC and great value for money. Would definitely stay here again.

hotel_name: Park Terrace Hotel on Bryant Park
review_body: My partner and I were beyond satisfied with our stay. Check-in was very easy, we got exactly the room we reserved, and the staff was extremely helpful and friendly and accommodating in every way possible. My next time through, I'm going to go out of my way to stay here again.

hotel_name: Park Terrace Hotel on Bryant Park
review_body: Loved everything about this hotel. Brand new with exceptional service, great location, amazing breakfast buffet, fitness center, etc. I plan on coming back again and again!Extra bonus: I mistakenly left my AirPods in the room and they found them and Fedexed them to me the next day. I'm forever grateful!

hotel_name: Park Terrace Hotel on Bryant Park
review_body: I had to change hotel and I found this one which was absolutely great ! Midtown Manhattan, on Bryant Park is the perfect location. The hotel opened in November 2018. Rooms are great, personnel is very kind and helpful, the bar terrace gives an astonishing vue. Good price quality ratio.

hotel_name: Park Terrace Hotel on Bryant Park
review_body: Our experience at this hotel was without question exceptional. We were upgraded to a deluxe room with a view upon arrival. All the personnel in this hotel were friendly, welcoming & helpful always with a smile. Charlie stood out as the very best. He never failed to greet us with a smile & a question about our day & if we needed anything. We ordered a pizza & he personally it brought to our room. The room was awesome, the beds comfortable, the hotel very quiet, and the amenities were awesome. Unlimited bottles of water, complimentary bag of kettlecorn and a fancy soft drink were welcome gifts in the room. There is a closet on every floor with free personal care items like toothbrush, razor, etc. The 24 hour workout room has great equipment & a sauna. Two washer & dryers are free to guests to use, including detergent. The free breakfast (almost unheard of in hotels in New York City) is unreal.....locally sourced items like breads, cheeses, muffins, croissants, bagels, donuts, fresh fruits, yogurt, boiled eggs, several fresh juices, teas, coffee, cappuccinos, etc. and service with a smile. The terrace is lovely with view of Bryant Park & Empire State Building. Bar service in the evening with a menu of small plates. Perfect location with a subway station at the end of the block. Kudos to the owners and staff of this hotel as it made our visit in New York City the best!!

hotel_name: Park Terrace Hotel on Bryant Park
review_body: What a wonderful stay. The Park Terrace Hotel will definitely be my go-to hotel for all future visits to NYC. Not only is the location great and rooms clean/modern, but the staff is top notch. Every single employee at the hotel was extremely friendly, accommodating and 100% service oriented. Charlie in particular was wonderful from check-in until check-out. Met us with a smile every time we walked into the hotel, and showed genuine interest in our days and how we could help make our stay perfect. The included breakfast spread was incredible and full of local tasty items. I did not want to leave!

hotel_name: Park Terrace Hotel on Bryant Park
review_body: First time to NYC. The staff was incredibly friendly and happily provided restaurant recommendations every time we asked. The hotel was just a short walk to a subway station which was a must for us planning to use public transportation. Our room was clean, comfortable and quiet. We could walk to Times Square and the Empire State Building.

hotel_name: Park Terrace Hotel on Bryant Park
review_body: Had a very enjoyable stay at the Park Terrace. Great to be on the edge of Bryant Park as spring was blooming in NYC. Well appointed room, beautiful breakfast room/lounge, tasty and unique NYC treats for breakfast and friendly staff. I could not ask for more.

hotel_name: Park Terrace Hotel on Bryant Park
review_body: I travel to NYC for business frequently and am from there, currently living in CA. I typically stay downtown in Soho b/c that's where my business needs are usually based. This go-around I needed to be in mid-town/ 5th ave area. Stumbled upon this gem in my research and based on website and reviews decided to book to check it out being it's a new hotel for the area and perfectly located to Bryant Park and 5th Ave. Wow, what a darling hotel experience! Bed & pillow were so comfy, slept great...all the in-room amenities were fantastic and the room was super clean. The gym is great, has all the things you need, is so clean and new. The terrace bar area is beautiful. The hotel staff and Management were nothing short of accommodating, warm & welcoming. I will certainly be back and will recommend to co-workers! Excellent value.

hotel_name: Park Terrace Hotel on Bryant Park
review_body: This is a very good hotel, one which I would recommend. The staff, on the whole, tried their very best to please and assist wherever they could. The rooms are newly decorated and are tasteful, clean and a good size (we had a king with a sofa bed for three of us to share). They have a "hydration station" on each floor where you can go and fill up your reusable water bottle and get ice if you need (absolutely brilliant - European hotels should take this on board instead of charging people to stay alive). Due to refurbishment, the breakfast was a bit haphazard at times but offered everything you need to start your busy day on the NY streets. The location of the hotel is perfect as it puts you right in the centre of Manhattan, so you can easily go uptown, downtown or across town (either walking, public transport or taxi) and it overlooks Bryant Park which is a lovely little green area with loads of tables and chairs - free wifi too. Remember you pay tax on top of the published cost, so everything costs a little more than you thought and NYC is a very expensive place to visit. The best bit for me was the MET where you can buy a ticket on one day and use for the next two consecutive days, which is brilliant because it's huge and is packed full of loads that would be a shame to miss or try to cram into one day. I recommend the highline walk (an old disused raliway line, converted to a pleasurable walkway that avoids the traffic and runs for about 15 blocks). Take earplugs if you're not a sound sleeper as, even though the location of the hotel is not in Times Square, the all night construction and sirens can take their toll on a good night's sleep. All in all a fabulous five nights.

hotel_name: Park Terrace Hotel on Bryant Park
review_body: What an amazing hotel!! The staff are so nice and helpful, rooms are new, well furnished and decorated to make you feel comfortable and relaxed. They pay attention to every small detail!, breakfast are delicious and of course the location! . Will definitely come back again in my next visit to the city!, thank you so much.

hotel_name: Park Terrace Hotel on Bryant Park
review_body: All the staff was extremely cordial and attentive. Very helpful in making our stay a great one! I would recommend this hotel to anybody. The location, close to important attractions plus free breakfast was great but more important than that was the attention of all the staff

hotel_name: Park Terrace Hotel on Bryant Park
review_body: Stayed for two weeks for work. Excellent experience in every way.Great atmosphere. Staff is very welcoming, easy going and helpful - every single one.So different than other Manhattan hotels.Breakfast is on point. The quality is evident. Beautiful setting. Was a bit concerned the room may be small but it is perfectly sized and very convenient. Smart design, very clean and comfortable.I should also mentioned we arrived on a red-eye and we could enjoy breakfast and a room on 7am in our morning of arrival. Made a huge difference.Location is great as well.This is definitely my new go to hotel in Manhattan for both work and leisure.

hotel_name: Park Terrace Hotel on Bryant Park
review_body: Very friendly and hospitable staff. Fantastic location in the middle of New York, oppositie of the New Public Library. Very, very nice rooms and a wonderful breakfest. Next time when i will be in New York, i wil certainly book Park Terrace Hotel

hotel_name: Park Terrace Hotel on Bryant Park
review_body: And the room was quite cosy as well. You can sense it‘s all new. Staff is friendly. Best part it the wonderful, high quality breakfast. Negative: the shower was „leeking“ - after taking a shower, the bathroom floor was completely wet.

hotel_name: Park Terrace Hotel on Bryant Park
review_body: New hotel with all the luxury item You can need, a high quality breakfast and a perfect location.A Nespresso machine is ready to brew a perfec caffè as you need.Bryant Park just outside the hotel is a nice place to stroll or simply to sit and relax.

hotel_name: Park Terrace Hotel on Bryant Park
review_body: Great location in Midtown, easy walking to theater district, plenty of food choices and shopping. Chic rooms, newly renovated, nice breakfast included, bar on 6th floor is a lot of fun. Staff very responsive and polite.

hotel_name: Park Terrace Hotel on Bryant Park
review_body: The staff and service was outstanding. I didn't think people that friendly still exited in the hospitality industry. Great rooftop bar, great rooms and perfect location. So nice to get out of Mid-town. I'll be back!

hotel_name: Park Terrace Hotel on Bryant Park
review_body: We were here on business and a bit of pleasure during our stay in Manhattan. I was pleasantly surprised by how close we were to everything we needed to get to, how kind and helpful and attentive the staff were, and the healthy traveller offerings (everything was brand new in the gym, 5 cardio machines, kettle bells, weights, machines, stability balls, mats, sauna...really everything!). In-room yoga was a treat too, we did the relax video before bed. Highly recommend and cannot wait to return for our next visit in NYC.

hotel_name: Park Terrace Hotel on Bryant Park
review_body: Fabulous Stay! I am SO particular when it comes to hotel stays. The Park Terrace hit every mark~ Beyond super clean, amazing amenities, excellent customer service and a fabulous location! Not to mention the complimentary breakfast was above & beyond with so many choices to be had!!We will be returning to the Park Terrace Hotel on our next visit to NYC!!

hotel_name: Park Terrace Hotel on Bryant Park
review_body: Fabulous! I am very skeptical when staying some place that is not a reccomendation, however, this hotel did not disappoint. All staff members, from check in to check out, were wonderful and extremely friendly. The rooms were small, but to be expected of a hotel in the city that never sleeps. Rooms were well maintained and extremely clean. Bed, very comfortable! It is the little things that I rave about- including the umbrella provided for the rain on Friday, was just a nice little touch. I can’t say enough and will definitely be staying here again!

hotel_name: Park Terrace Hotel on Bryant Park
review_body: Park Terrace Hotel on Bryant Park is absolutely beautiful and charming boutique hotel with excellent service and attentive staff, perfectly located in midtown Manhattan, only a few steps from 5th Ave. Delicious breakfast at the landscaped terrace with the view of Bryant Park and the landmark 42nd street New York Public Library in the front, and Empire State Building in the back, was a special treat every morning during my stay. Their fresh pressed juices and Lavazza lattes are the best. I give Park Terrace Hotel five stars for location, architecture and interior design, cleanliness, sophisticated and relaxed vibe and impeccable service!

hotel_name: Park Terrace Hotel on Bryant Park
review_body: Before booking, we debated whether to book “Park Terrace Hotel on Bryant Park” or “The Bryant Park Hotel”. We finally decided to book “Park Terrace Hotel on Bryant Park” because of the picture for the “premier room with view” even if it was ranked 240th approximately at the time. From Expedia and the hotel website, the “premier room with view” appeared to be a corner room that has four floor-to-ceiling windows.However, we were disappointed as we were given a room on 5th floor and the room did not have four floor-to-ceiling windows. There was only one window. The layout of the room was like “deluxe room with view”. It was not a corner room, but it was the last room on the corridor.So we asked Randy when he brought us our luggage whether this room is a “premier room with view”.This reminded me of some comments on Expedia saying they were given “cheapest room” because they booked thought Expedia.We know we booked the room via Expedia with a discounted rate as it was non-refundable option. Which we would have lost almost £1,800 for a cancellation.After looking around the room we found a piece of broken glass on bathroom. So we looked closer and we found more shards of broken glass on one corner of the bathroom floor. We went to ask for someone to sweep these broken glass up. We were lucky that we did not take our shoes off when going in the bathroom. Imagine if we step on broken glass, our holiday would be cut short.Charlie was alarmed saying it was unacceptable and kindly offered us to move to another room which was the corner room on 8th floor that has four floor-to-ceiling windows.The room looked clean at the first glance. But we took no chance having saw broken glass on the floor of the previous room. So we inspected the room properly. There was no broken glass but there were thick layers of dust on many places such as on cabinet where the ice container was and in some corners of the wardrobe. There was a piece of plastic on the carpet which we assumed was part of a price tag on the floor from the previous guest. Which was not been picked up throughout our whole stay. We are now wondering whether it is still there now and if the room was ever vacuumed.The bathroom also looked clean but again we noticed the corner of shower cubicle had grime on despite the hotel supposed to be opened for just five months. There were some hairs on the floor and toilet too.We did not want to start our holidays being fussy or complaining, so we just wiped the bathroom floor by ourselves.We must be unlucky as we read the reviews from majority of customers saying their rooms were spotlessly clean.This is the reason we gave the hotel only 3 stars. Because everything else was perfect. Good room size. Good powered shower. Good quality bedding even the bed linen did not get changed throughout our seven nights stay. Good breakfast. Location of the hotel is great too. And the soundproofing between rooms works. We never heard our neighbouring rooms at all. We only occasionally heard sounds on corridors as there was quite a large gap at the bottom of the door. Majority of staff are friendly and helpful such as Charlie, Randy and the other we did not get their names. But if there is a spotlight award we would nominate Bronson from the restaurant who is multilingual with a great service-minded attitude. We watched him interact with hotel guests every morning which brightened our day. He is an asset of this hotel. We mentioned to him about our 19th anniversary and later cupcakes was left for us in our room. We thanked everyone. However we must not spoke clearly, we ended up having more cakes from Charlie a couple days later, which was a lovely touch.
user_name:
Pook G
Newcastle upon Tyne, United Kingdom

hotel_name: Park Terrace Hotel on Bryant Park
review_body: I have stayed at the park terrace while in NYC for a business trip. The location of the hotel is good. It’s a walking distance from most of the attractions. The cost per night is slightly high for the size of the room and the quality of breakfast. The breakfast was disappointing as they only had bagels, cheese spreads and boiled eggs. The staff were friendly.
user_name:
Alsuwaidi12345
Abu Dhabi, United Arab Emirates

hotel_name: Park Terrace Hotel on Bryant Park
review_body: The service was fantastic. My room was modern, tastefully decorated, and very clean. I love having a nespresso in my room as well. Fantastic location surrounded by so many nice cafes, restaurants, and theater.

hotel_name: Park Terrace Hotel on Bryant Park
review_body: · The welcoming nature and efficiency of the staff were exceptionnel.· Bed made for a blissful sleep· Excellent breakfast· The little touches including elevator attendant and the "water stations"· Very interesting corner of NY.

hotel_name: Park Terrace Hotel on Bryant Park
review_body: This hotel excels in location, customer service, and amenities. Located across from Bryant Park, this hotel is within easy walking distance to major tourist attractions without the hustle and bustle of these attractions. Also located close to both bus and subway transportation systems. We recommend purchasing a MetroPass to get you around Manhattan. Perhaps the most amazing feature of this hotel are the staff who go out of their way to ensure your needs are met. You are always greet with a smile and engaged conversation. A bonus to this amazing hotel is the breakfast buffet that would easily satisfy any dietary need. Food is varied and plentiful and there is always a barista ready to make your perfect cup of coffee to get your day started. This is now our favorite hotel in Manhattan!

hotel_name: Park Terrace Hotel on Bryant Park
review_body: I travel to NY for business regularly and have stayed at every 4+ star hotel in the area. Park Terrace is officially my favorite. The staff is incredibly friendly; the lobby is nice and smells great; the rooms are super clean; and they have a great lounge on the 6th floor, where they serve a fabulous (free) breakfast. I also met colleagues in the lounge for cocktails, and it was the perfect atmosphere for a private meeting.

hotel_name: Park Terrace Hotel on Bryant Park
review_body: What's most important to start with, is that I have never met a friendlier staff than the people at Park Terrace! Everybody seemed genuinely thrilled to have us at their hotel, and did everything they could to make us feel welcomed.While the Wifi was a little shotty and the view wasn't spectacular, the room was absolutely beautiful, especially for a NYC midtown hotel! The amenities were all so modern and felt like a true 21st century hotel.Lastly, and most importantly, the breakfast at this hotel was second to none. The quality of the food was unlike anything I've ever experienced at hotel's continental breakfast, and the food they provided (notably the charcuterie selection) was so refreshing and a different take on how to start my day! I loved this hotel and I would absolutely return in a heartbeat!

hotel_name: Park Terrace Hotel on Bryant Park
review_body: Fabulous, healthy breakfast. Juices, fresh fruit, breads and jams, meats, cheeses and a barista ready to make your perfect cup of coffee. Outdoor patio overlooking Bryant Park. Complimentary snacks in room. Filtered water available 24/7. Great amenities and friendly customer service.

hotel_name: Park Terrace Hotel on Bryant Park
review_body: Great location on Bryant park, central for pretty much everywhere. Lovely modern hotel with attentive and friendly staff. Really nothing to find fault with at this hotel. I will certainly stay here again on any future trip to NYC.

hotel_name: Park Terrace Hotel on Bryant Park
review_body: We highly enjoyed our stay at the Park Terrace. Our room was comfortable, the breakfast was delicious and the staff very friendly and helpful. The location is very convenient - on a quieter street across from a nice park but close to Time Square with a Subway stop right on the block.

hotel_name: Park Terrace Hotel on Bryant Park
review_body: From being greeted at the door, to the front desk staff, the breakfast staff and anyone we ran into with the hotel very friendly and always helpful to the max. The options for breakfast are extensive and delicious. But if you are an eggs, potatoes and bacon person, you won't find it here. Wonderful breads, bagels, spreads, cheeses, fruit, yogurt, coffees, teas, juices, pastries, and other great things. No problem finding something to get you going in the morning. Great location right on Bryant Park and we walked everywhere, Central Park, down town, no worries just flow with the masses on the sidewalk. Room was very clean and while not spacious, has everything you need for a great nights sleep, comfortable bed, blackout window covering, easy air quality control. The small closet to hang things and a single drawer, in room safe are nice features. The robs are also a nice touch. We had a fantastic stay and are already planning to go back.

hotel_name: Park Terrace Hotel on Bryant Park
review_body: I stayed st the hote for 3 nights and it was overall a great place..Location is close to 5th Avenue and Times Square..Complementary breakfast with a beautiful view of Bryant Park..Nice staff and Charlie has helped a lot..

hotel_name: Park Terrace Hotel on Bryant Park
review_body: Great visit to New York with great accommodations. We really enjoyed the location of the hotel. It was close to many things and the Metro was just steps away. The room was clean. The refreshment area was a good perk. Breakfast was simple but very enjoyable.

hotel_name: Park Terrace Hotel on Bryant Park
review_body: Had a great stay at the hotel. This is by by far the best place I stayed in New York (usually stay at Sofitel). Great service, great breakfast, friendly staff and chic room. We left the hotel feeling happy.

hotel_name: Park Terrace Hotel on Bryant Park
review_body: staff fabulous,hotel location very good, the hotel is new and very clean, beds very comfortable, breakfast is fine, has a very pleasant balcony , there are many places to eat and shop around I would definitely go again

hotel_name: Park Terrace Hotel on Bryant Park
review_body: My SO and I came up sight unseen to this hotel for a weekend getaway to see a show on Broadway. We are not “city” folk. We were pleasantly surprised by the easy access to everything we had planned was in walking distance from the hotel. From getting off the train, to great restaurants, to broadway and everything in between. Then the hotel itself is beautiful. The rooms are spacious for NYC, clean and nicely decorated. The gym is well setup. There is a beautiful terrace overlooking Bryant Park and a lovely breakfast served there. It was great. I will be telling my friends about it. I also will hopefully be talking him in to going back. If not I definitely can talk my friends to go with me!

hotel_name: Park Terrace Hotel on Bryant Park
review_body: I really enjoy the location of this hotel, the hotel amenities and the ambiance of the room. I have started making this hotel my go-to when I travel to New York for business. I am also surprised that the hotel is a bit quieter than other properties nearby,

hotel_name: Park Terrace Hotel on Bryant Park
review_body: The room was very nice and clean the service was excellent everyone was so friendly. Hotel was close to attractions all within walking distance. The bathroom was very clean, wish all the rooms had king size beds. I would definitely stay there again.

hotel_name: Park Terrace Hotel on Bryant Park
review_body: Review on page one of this review.Lovely hotel in every way.The staff is a breath of fresh air and made our stay eager to return asap.Gabriella,Noah,Bronson and Jose great people who make this hidden gem what it is. 10 plus Wonderful .

hotel_name: Park Terrace Hotel on Bryant Park
review_body: The Hotel was clean & the Staff was excellent. The location at Bryant Park was perfect for a visit to NYC; Close to a great park, Broadway, & Times Square. Would Recommend this location for couples looking for a getaway for any occasion

hotel_name: Park Terrace Hotel on Bryant Park
review_body: Amazing breakfast with fresh fruit, yogurt, granola and a selection of pastries. Coffee made to order. Quiet rooms, comfortable beds, pleasant and helpful staff, yoga mat in each room, water station on every floor. My new go-to hotel for business in mid-town.

hotel_name: Park Terrace Hotel on Bryant Park
review_body: Park Terrace has a perfect location on Bryant Park in Midtown, right next to 5th Avenue and minutes from Times Square. Subway entrance on the corner. Rooms are clean, beds are comfortable and the breakfast is really good. Staff is very helpful and friendly. Warmly recommended, we’ll be back!

hotel_name: Park Terrace Hotel on Bryant Park
review_body: Absolutely loved this hotel and will be staying here again for annual NYC trip. This staff was incredibly friendly. There are amenities here that aren’t too common with a lot of NYC hotels in this price range such as a continental breakfast and coffee in the rooms. It’s actually a Nespresso maker, but it doesn’t matter. It’s hot and it’s strong caffiene that you can drink as soon as you wake up. Our room had a sliding door that opened. I could not hear any street noise when the door was closed. I read some reviews about the rooms being small. Uh, duh, it’s New York City. Unless you can afford a sprawling suite overlooking Central Park, you’re going to have a small hotel room. It’s part of the experience. However, the layout and furniture at this hotel were definitely smart choices. I did not feel like I was crammed into a shoebox like I have felt at other hotels. We did not utilize the 6th floor lounge on this trip except for one morning at breakfast, but it would be a great place for happy hour. The hotel is also super clean with a friendly housekeeping staff. Can’t wait to go back!

hotel_name: Park Terrace Hotel on Bryant Park
review_body: The atmosphere is so comfortable but high end! The staff is truly what makes the stay so extraordinary! They heard it was my husbands birthday and sent up 2 Magnolia bakery cupcakes with a card! Breakfast is amazing too!

hotel_name: Park Terrace Hotel on Bryant Park
review_body: I am frequently in NY to visit my ad agency, and a longtime Westin customer - frequently staying at the Times Square Westin. As the Westin did not have rooms available for an early AM check-in, I found the Park Terrace hotel, as it is only 1.5 blocks from the agency. I figured it would be OK for a one-time stay, though was pleasantly surprised and will definitely stay again! It was all in the details for me:- The room was only slightly smaller than the Westin rooms - though was far more modern: modern, lighting wall pads- controlling all lights from next to the bed, Bose phone speaker/clock, Flat screen TV on wall- Free WIFI and Breakfast at the Terrace Bar. Also has a Gym!- Nespresso Coffee Maker, Nespresso Coffee Selection and Ceramic Expresso Cups- Beautiful Bathroom and shower w/Robes and nice products- "Mini Bar" selection- My Deluxe room on the 3rd floor overlooked a "walking path" with NO street traffic - so quiet!Overall, based on the room amenities, Terrace Bar, Free Breakfast and Outdoor terrace - I will stay again!

hotel_name: Park Terrace Hotel on Bryant Park
review_body: We stayed here for our anniversary, and I returned for a business overnight. Super friendly staff, rooms that feel spacious even if they are "Manhattan" sized, and delicious breakfast. This hotel is a great find!

hotel_name: Park Terrace Hotel on Bryant Park
review_body: So happy we chose to stay here!! The whole staff were really nice, the complimentary breakfast far exceeded expectations, the room was perfect - comfy bed and nice sheets, and the location was great just across the street from the NY public library and subway of course.We’ll definitely be staying here again! Special thanks to the sweet ladies at the front desk and on the most excellent 6th floor.

hotel_name: Park Terrace Hotel on Bryant Park
review_body: Great location on Bryant Park. Very quiet, never heard any street noise. Very friendly staff, including the Terrace Bar. Updated amenities. Room was very clean and serviced nicely each day. Would recommend to anyone looking for this central location in NYC.

hotel_name: Park Terrace Hotel on Bryant Park
review_body: First time here- double room was small, OK for one, not sure where the second person’s luggage would have gone! Lovely sheets, nice new shower room, coffee maker in room but no fridge.Breakfast was excellent, fresh fruit, yoghurt, choice of artisanal breads and coffees , staff young and friendly, good for a short work or tourist trip.

hotel_name: Park Terrace Hotel on Bryant Park
review_body: Stayed a week at this hotel due to location and bigger rooms than average in New York. It is close to all the sites, and close to several subway lines in case you want to travel to other neighbourhoods. Rooms are nice, beds are comfy and staff are super friendly. I think they have yet to complete the whole hotel, as not all floors were open yet. I did not notice any construction sound though in the week I was there. Breakfast was included in the stay. Although i really liked the bagels, the cream cheese and the really nice bread and croissants, not to mention the fresh fruits. But the breakfast stayed the same for the whole week, so it got boring. (Nothing hot for example).More variety in the breakfast and it would be 5 stars for me.

hotel_name: Park Terrace Hotel on Bryant Park
review_body: the hotel is ideally located, the staff is kind, rooms are clean and comfortable and the breakfast is excellent ! Gym very convenient and well maintained. The only thing to improve would be to make the lobby more welcoming.

hotel_name: Park Terrace Hotel on Bryant Park
review_body: The hotel is located at a great location. Everything is very clean and brand new. Breakfast is very tastefull and from very good quality. The staf LF is really really friendly and will help you with everything. We will highly recommending this hotel and we will definetly return to this hotel.

hotel_name: Park Terrace Hotel on Bryant Park
review_body: Myself and my wife stayed here early in March and we had an amazing time. The staff are superb - friendly, approachable and their customer service is of THE highest standard. Rooms were spotless and modern, breakfast was always fantastic - the doughnuts were unreal.Special call out for Charlie who was fantastic on the day we were leaving and subsequently on a related enquiry. Absolutely top-notch .We cannot wait to come back - hopefully we can stay here again !

hotel_name: Park Terrace Hotel on Bryant Park
review_body: We had a very warm welcome at the hotel when we arrived, all of the staff were so friendly and they made us feel welcome from the very first, until the very last minute of our stay. The rooms were always very clean, very quiet and, for New York conditions, pretty spacious! (The little Bose soundbox inside of the room was a very cool extra!) The breakfast came always with a wide variety to choose from, always fresh and delicious. And again the staff was amazing by fulfiling all of our wishes. We definitely recommend this hotel and hopefully, we can be your guest sometime soon again!

hotel_name: Park Terrace Hotel on Bryant Park
review_body: Definitely exactly as pictured and described by other guests. For the price we found great employees terrific breakfast and emaculate surroundings Great location for walking up and down town. A happy hour would be a plus but will definitely stay again.

hotel_name: Park Terrace Hotel on Bryant Park
review_body: Was very satisfied with my stay at the Park Terrace. As close you can get to the subway and close to pretty much everything (Times Square an 8 minute walk). Great coffee next door. Beds were very comfy and they had a water station outside of every floor (with free bottles)! Staff was extremely nice and welcoming and helped with all questions we had. Highly recommend

hotel_name: Park Terrace Hotel on Bryant Park
review_body: This is the best service that I experienced! It’s really fantastic! The moment i checked in until i stepped in to my room was amazing. All my packages are inside already. Randy was very helpful and accomodating. But the person put this place a 5 stars is Gabriela! She is the best!!! Very helpful, very accomodating and always smiling. Thank you guys see you soon :)

hotel_name: Park Terrace Hotel on Bryant Park
review_body: The service here is unmatched! From the moment you walk in the front lobby you are greeted and all staff were extreamly accommodating & friendly! The complimentary breakfast is by far the best I’ve ever had! Great expirence overall, we will be back!

hotel_name: Park Terrace Hotel on Bryant Park
review_body: If you think by paying more to get a "Room with Park View" from a hotel named "Park Terrance Hotel on Bryant Park", you will be disappointed like I was. All I got was a view of the building across the street. The front desk told me that the view of the building across the street was considered "Park View" from their interpretation. They did offer me a second move after my first move. I declined it after realizing the location of the hotel is not facing directly to the park. I wish they could change the misleading title of the room. To summarize my experience with this hotel:Pros: great location (near the subway station and Bryant Park), friendly staff, good breakfastCons: Even though it was a new hotel, not all facilities working properly (the drain wasn't working properly which flooded my floor. the door of the cabinet in the gym fell out but the staff put it back without securing it). Because this hotel was still under construction and obviously there was no service elevator, the guests had to share the ride with laundry, service carts... Be patient, it would take more time to get up and down so plan ahead if you are in a hurry. The billing system did not work properly. Check your bill carefully when you check out. If you check out in the evening, you may not be able to fix the mistakes in the bill (if any) because there was no manager on duty during that time. Just avoid checking out in the evening if you don't want to get into hassles as I did.

hotel_name: Park Terrace Hotel on Bryant Park
review_body: My daughter and I stayed at Park Terrace for 3 nights/4 days and we loved this hotel. It’s truly a hotel focused on quality. Everyone that worked at the hotel was incredibly professional and friendly. A special note to Gabriela at the receptionist desk for being super sweet to us. Park Terrace is a boutique hotel so the lobby is quaint but clean and welcoming. I booked a Deluxe Park View and thought the room was a very decent size for me and my daughter. Even compared to similar 4-Star hotels I’ve stayed at previously in Manhattan. Our room had a queen size bed and a small living room area with a sofa and table. The lighting, decor, and furniture are all very sleek and modern - equipped with a Nespresso machine, Bose speaker, and plenty of USB ports for charging. The bed and linens were extremely comfortable and though the bathroom is compact (normal for NYC), the rainfall shower was superb! I appreciated the in-room yoga mat and especially the hydration station on each floor - they provide empty water bottles that you can continually refill and take along with you which was convenient, saved me money, and reduced the waste of having to utilize multiple plastic bottles. We were provided with complimentary kettle corn and an orange soda in our room. The breakfast buffet was delicious with local pastry offerings but again quaint - no cooked meats, waffles, or pancakes. The hotel is in a fantastic location next to the Library and Bryant Park so an easy walk around Midtown, Times Square, Broadway, Central Park, and the subway (on the corner of 6th & 40th). We stayed in room 414 so a lower floor but also away from the elevators and it was quiet with only the occasional street noise. The elevators were a bit slow but not annoyingly so and the WIFI worked fine. This is my new go-to hotel in Manhattan and we will definitely stay again for our future visits. Do yourself a favor and try a slice of cake from Lady M a few doors down.

hotel_name: Park Terrace Hotel on Bryant Park
review_body: Excellent location for visiting the Morgan Library, Garment District, and taking in a couple of Broadway shows. Front desk staff are helpful and friendly. Rooms are elegantly designed, quiet and no smaller than usual for NYC. Tasty and varied complementary breakfast.

hotel_name: Park Terrace Hotel on Bryant Park
review_body: I truly enjoyed my stay, from beginning to end. Everyone was extremely friendly and showed genuine concerns for my needs as a guest. Breakfast was awesome and clearly a highlight of my stay in the city. Location is great: the hotel is very central and yet the room was very quiet. I can't wait to go back. In fact, I just booked another stay in May.

hotel_name: Park Terrace Hotel on Bryant Park
review_body: It's rare that a hotel feels a bit like visiting with fun younger nieces and nephews, but that's the vibe of the new Park Terrace, and it's lovely. Opened late last year, the hotel is intimate, sleek and modern, and has a wonderfully young, very helpful and enthusiastic staff from all over the world, which is definitely a part of its appeal. All of them are friendly and helpful to a fault, whether it's printing documents or making sure you have the perfect cup of tea in your own pot at breakfast. The buffet breakfast, by the way, is wonderful, arrayed in a brightly lit 6th floor space that also has a nice terrace for warmer weather. Rooms are small but very cozy, hip and spotless, with wonderful touches like your own yoga mat for use while you're there --and pre-recorded yoga lessons to go with it. I have a new favorite place to stay in NY!

hotel_name: Park Terrace Hotel on Bryant Park
review_body: Kudos to the manager of this hotel Mark Briskin. I had an issue with the room I booked for my daughter’s 25th Birthday which he personally resolved. Amazing for NYC. My daughter loved the hotel - room was beautiful clean great. She said staff was amazing. Thank you Park Terrace for making her 25th Birthday memorable.

hotel_name: Park Terrace Hotel on Bryant Park
review_body: We loved our recent 3 night stay at this hotel. It’s perfectly situated adjacent to Bryant Park. Our 7th floor room had a lovely park view. The rooms are modern and clean with a clever decorative soundproofing panel that makes sleeping a dream! Love the nespresso machine! The front desk staff is very friendly and accomodating. Beautiful bar with terrace on the 6 floor. Inventive cocktails:) We’ll definitely return on our next NYC visit.

hotel_name: Park Terrace Hotel on Bryant Park
review_body: Everyone was friendly...room and bed were comfortable...a great view...leisurely (and included) breakfasts on the sixth floor a definite plus...wholeheartedly recommend the hotel. Would like to return when it is a bit warmer to enjoy the sixth floor terrace.

hotel_name: Park Terrace Hotel on Bryant Park
review_body: This hotel is completely renovated and is clean, the location is great, and have many magazines, market, restaurants nearby...The breakfast is perfect, the breakfast room is charming The lobby is beautiful and they are the best staff members I recommend to everyone

hotel_name: Park Terrace Hotel on Bryant Park
review_body: It’s a nice hotel i just wished they told us they were renovating the restaurant. The employees there were very polite and always greated us with smiles. I was just unhappy about the view from my room, i didnt get a glimpse of the park on the 8th floor room 814 at all

hotel_name: Park Terrace Hotel on Bryant Park
review_body: If you like Bryant Park, want to be in the heart of the City and want a great breakfast experience then this hotel could be for you. The room for breakfast, which is on the 6th floor, is used as a lounge in the afternoon, and a place to buy a drink in the evening. But the rooms are not large.

hotel_name: Park Terrace Hotel on Bryant Park
review_body: Love the location, staff, beds, shower, breakfast. Everything is top-notch at this comfortable, clean hotel. The services is just excellent. And the breakfast is extensive, substantial, high quality and just fun.

hotel_name: Park Terrace Hotel on Bryant Park
review_body: Perfect location. You can walk to Times Square, Central Park, Rockefeller Center, Broadway shows, Chrysler building, Grand Central Station, Empire State building, subway stations nearby, easy Uber pickup. 100% friendly staff, EVERYONE went out of their way to greet and assist. High quality linens. Healthy, tasty breakfast bar.

hotel_name: Park Terrace Hotel on Bryant Park
review_body: Quiet hotel with comfortable beds, great showers and can’t-be-beat breakfast. But it’s the staff that sets this hotel apart. They are always happy to accommodate. It’s easy to see they enjoy their work.

hotel_name: Park Terrace Hotel on Bryant Park
review_body: Wonderful staff. Great location. Rooms were clean and updated and showers were lovely. Enjoyed being in the middle of the city but off the beaten path and quietly off of 5th Ave. Looking forward to going back!

hotel_name: Park Terrace Hotel on Bryant Park
review_body: Some friends and I stayed at the Park Terrace hotel this past weekend and it was PERFECT. From the moment i checked in I was made to feel super welcome, informed about the amenities, etc. This continued a moment later when I stepped on the elevator and was greeted by the amazing and friendly elevator attendant. Seriously, everyone at this hotel is so incredibly friendly and helpful. Every time we were in the lobby someone would ask if we wanted a bottle of water. Just little touches like that. A few of the other notable things:1) perfect central location that is close to everything:2) delicious breakfast included with food from top local spots, fresh fruit, juices, etc.; 3) super super super friendly staff who made you feel at home and weren’t at all pretentious;4) cozy and comfortable room with a great bed, shower, and toiletries;5) see number 3. Seriously, if you’re going to NYC stay here. No need to look further. I’ve stayed at the Ritz and JW Marriott there and the Park Terrace is way better.

hotel_name: Park Terrace Hotel on Bryant Park
review_body: Park Terrace hotel was excellent. From the moment of first contact they took great care and interest in us as customers and nothing was too much trouble. My wife requires a gluten free diet which was no problem and the hotel staff went to great lengths to ensure that she was really well catered for at breakfast. In fact the breakfast spread was excellent, there was a really good selection of tasty and high quality items to eat. The staff were all really friendly and helpful and could not have done more to make us feel welcome. Our room was spotless with a really comfy bed and gorgeous pillows with very good quality linen. The shower was spacious and had very good pressure. I would highly recommend this hotel to anyone wanting a stay in central New York. It is an excellent location on Bryant Park from which to explore N Y.

hotel_name: Park Terrace Hotel on Bryant Park
review_body: I stayed at The Park Terrace Hotel for the NYC Half Marathon and it was such an amazing experience. Every single employee was so kind and made an effort to make connections with me and the other guests. The room was perfect for my stay, I loved every thought out detail. The best part was the breakfast. My number one tip is to never skip breakfast at this hotel!!!

hotel_name: Park Terrace Hotel on Bryant Park
review_body: The staff was friendly and went out of their way to make us happy! The rooms were modern, comfortable, and clean. The complimentary soda and kettle corn was a “sweet” touch! The breakfast which included Zucker’s Bagels, fresh fruits, and donuts from Donut Plant was delicious! I highly recommend staying here if visiting NYC...it is a diamond in the rough! I know we’ll be back for our next trip to NYC!

hotel_name: Park Terrace Hotel on Bryant Park
review_body: We really enjoyed our stay! Hotel and location were perfect. Staff was friendly and accommodating. Breakfast was great (and it was nice that it was included). The bar area was pretty dead- maybe when weather warms up, the outside terrace will get some (much-deserved) use.

hotel_name: Park Terrace Hotel on Bryant Park
review_body: Hotel wasn't fully opened yet. My room was small and there isn't much surface area in the bathroom. However, the room was clean, and the bed, pillows and bedding in general are of amazing quality.Every single member of staff I met was polite and friendly. Would return for sure.

hotel_name: Park Terrace Hotel on Bryant Park
review_body: Our corner deluxe room overlooking a segment of the park and the historical NYC Public Library had four floor to ceiling windows so was light and airy, well sealed too so was quiet. Very comfortable queen bed with superior linen. Nice amount of counter space with a small table in front of a comfy couch as well as the Keurig coffee counter, fridge and drawers. Also a rectangular ottoman to sit or place stuff on. The bathroom was also beautifully designed with a floor to ceiling window, airy walk-in shower and well lit large mirror and counter space. The speciality soaps and moisturiser were excellent quality as well. Towels were fluffy plumpers too -- so nice to sink into. Appreciated there was a small dual bin for regular and recycled waste and that the lighting system was so well designed. I hope management will be able to continue the high standards this Hotel has begun with.

hotel_name: Park Terrace Hotel on Bryant Park
review_body: Very very small rooms. Not as shown on picture. Dark and small narrow bed. Only place to be in is the breakfast room that in the evening is turned into a bar. Not very nice and not what you expect from a new york hotel. The service was good and very friendly. I can not recomend this hotel
user_name:
Gustav48
New York City, New York

hotel_name: Park Terrace Hotel on Bryant Park
review_body: The staff was friendly and the hotel was impeccable. Would definitely recommend it to anyone going to New York City. From the moment you walk in you are greeted by caring and friendly staff. They give you all the information about the hotel/stay and they also provide excellent recommendations of where to eat and cool spots around the city.

hotel_name: Park Terrace Hotel on Bryant Park
review_body: overall good experience. good breakfast. extremely pleasant staff. very small room with little storage space. no in room dining. website did not mention there was construction in front of hotel. tons of eateries and bakeries around. Maison Kayser was excellent. try croque madame, unbelievable.

hotel_name: Park Terrace Hotel on Bryant Park
review_body: Park Terrace is literally right across the street from the magnificent Bryant Park. Once I arrived at the hotel i was greeted by a very kind gentleman named Randy, Randy Cruz I believe he said his name was. He helped me and my boyfriend with our bags all the way up to our room! The check in process was smooth and once we got up to the room we were amazed! It was beautiful with a nice view over the library and park at the same time. We had forgotten a few toiletries and had to call the front desk for some. The items were sent up in the matter of five minutes by the one and only Randy! We came across him a few times around the front desk area when he then referred us to a great Lobster & Burger restaurant which ended up being great! I would definitely recommend this place for anybody trying to stay in the NYC Midtown area!

hotel_name: Park Terrace Hotel on Bryant Park
