review_body: One of the best hotels I've stayed in in NY. Excellent location, across from the park & Library. The room was very comfortable and the bed was super comfortable. The Nespresso coffee machine in the room was perfection for early risers! The lounge on 6 was staffed with friendly, helpful people and the breakfast was a great assortment - I highly recommend the doughnuts!! Everyone was friendly. I've already booked my next stay.

hotel_name: Park Terrace Hotel on Bryant Park
review_body: This was the best hotel i stayed ever! The location is perfect, in the middle of Manhattan. The service of the people who work their is outstanding. The really care you have a great time, and they think in advance what you mind need, which was terrific! It cost me 200 euro per night, which is a lot of money, but compared to other hotels this is by far the best price quality I think you’ll find. Oh and the breakfast is really nice. A lot of variety of healthy and delicious food. Regards, Joost

hotel_name: Park Terrace Hotel on Bryant Park
review_body: Great hotel, clean, excellent customer service.... a knockout breakfast. Location is fantastic; close to Broadway, Grand Central Station, New York Public Library, Empire State Building. Great views of Bryant Park also...

hotel_name: Park Terrace Hotel on Bryant Park
review_body: The hotel was undergoing renovations and the restaurant hadn't opened yet, but for the price and location to where I was working was perfect. The room was small, but perfectly suited to my needs. Clean, Modern, and Comfortable.

hotel_name: Park Terrace Hotel on Bryant Park
review_body: My daughter & I stayed here as a belated Christmas/Birthday treat. What a great time we had. This hotel was fantastic. It is in the perfect location for exploring so many of New York's highlights. The room was beautiful - very spacious for two people, breakfast was complimentary and delicious. Finally, the staff could not have been nicer. I would return any time! Thank you for a wonderful stay!

hotel_name: Park Terrace Hotel on Bryant Park
review_body: Room is small, but typical of NY hotels. The Bryant Park location is great, near subway stops and walking distance to shows on Broadway. Included breakfast is terrific and some minor trouble with the TV and a light was taken care of right away.

hotel_name: Park Terrace Hotel on Bryant Park
review_body: Lovely size room from the reviews of other hotels they suggested that rooms in NY are small so we were pleased with the room and the balcony. Continental breakfast with lots of choice. Staff were friendly and helpful. The location of the hotel was perfect close to Times Square.

hotel_name: Park Terrace Hotel on Bryant Park
review_body: I stayed there for two nights last week. It’s my first time at Park Terrace, and it won’t be my last! The location is great. It’s less than 10 minutes’ walk to Times Square, Grand Central Station and more shopping on Fifth Avenue. Complimentary breakfast must not be missed. Artisan bagels, breads and pastries, cheeses and fresh fruits.Staff was courteous and helpful. Like having the filtered water stations on each floor where you can refill your own bottles. Really helps to reduce the use of plastic bottles. Also like the Guest Request Closet, where you can find razors and bandaids. No need to bother housekeeping for little things you needed.

hotel_name: Park Terrace Hotel on Bryant Park
review_body: Superb hotel! Really enjoyed the amenities, excellent service, beautiful and clean and modern hotel, delicious breakfast, and in an ideal location. I highly recommend! Everyone was so nice and our stay was incredible.

hotel_name: Park Terrace Hotel on Bryant Park
review_body: I would stay here again in a heartbeat. The room Was perfect, quiet and clean. The only time we heard anyone else was out in the hall. We never heard anyone through the walls. Great showers in the bathroom. The breakfast and coffee included with the room was delicious. The staff is very friendly and helpful.

hotel_name: Park Terrace Hotel on Bryant Park
review_body: Location was perfect for us : walking distance to Broadway theatres , short drive uptown or downtown. Rooms are small but very nicely decorated and if you chose the room with street view, the size of the room becomes irrelevant. Very comfortable bedding and good quality sheets. Room has everything one need, including Nespresso coffee machine. Minor disappointment was that room cleaning was not perfect on 2 occasions : cups and saucers weren't washed, our close were left on the coffee table. More control over the room's cleaning definitely needed.Breakfast is very diverse and healthy ,produce are fresh and tasty.Great choice of fresh juices ,coffees and teas.The only other improvement we could think about is lobby: decor is a little bit sad and just by adding some green plants or nice bouquet of flowers can lighten the mood.

hotel_name: Park Terrace Hotel on Bryant Park
review_body: We recently stayed at the Park Terrace Hotel during a holiday to New York. While we were there, myself and my partner got engaged in a snowy Central Park! The staff at the hotel did everything they could to make our stay extra special, which was very much appreciated. Unbeknownst to me, after my boyfriend had told the hotel staff of his plan, the hotel had arranged a room upgrade for us before we came, giving us a fantastic view over the park. All of the staff were so pleasant to us while we were there. Every member of staff we saw was so incredibly helpful and polite, and all of their congratulations and well wishes were very much appreciated! The hotel was in a perfect spot, a great central location for so many of the attractions of the city. Walking distance to the buzz of Times Square, or a short walk to the ferry stop towards trendy Brooklyn- everything was close by! The complimentary breakfast was delicious every morning. So much choice and great to try the locally sourced foods. We hunted high and low for a Breads Bakery store to buy the granola- delicious!! The hotel had many touches which made it even more welcoming. The bar overlooking Bryant Park was a perfect place for a cocktail. The take away coffee available at breakfast each day, takeaway boxes for breakfast and the complimentary water bottles for you to take with you as we set off to explore the city. Thank you to all at the hotel for a great stay. We would definitely recommend this hotel to anyone thinking of visiting New York- we hope you enjoy it as much as we did!

hotel_name: Park Terrace Hotel on Bryant Park
review_body: Stayed for five nights with my Husband. Room and amenities are new, modern and spacious (we booked the Premier Room). We loved the hydration stations - good for us to top up our own water bottles without constantly using new bottles. Sufficient tv channels, Netflix, Bluetooth connection to Bose, a strong WiFi connection, yummy kettle corn upon check-in and a Nespresso machine. There’s also breakfast, self-service laundry and a 24 hour gym - complimentary amenities that we appreciate. However, take note that they do not provide shower gel, only bar soap.Location in midtown was very ideal - within walking distance to Fifth Avenue for shopping; broadway for theater and it is also just steps away from the Subway station. Service by staff was great without being overly-intrusive; we enjoyed the little elevator conversations with the team. We heard that more amenities and rooms will be opened progressively as they complete the works; which we believe will make this hotel even more attractive! Thank you Park Terrace team for giving us a great “home away from home” experience in New York City.

hotel_name: Park Terrace Hotel on Bryant Park
review_body: Didn't love my stay. Bed was short. My "deluxe room with park view" was 2nd floor looking out at scaffolding. Breakfast had lots of "run out of". Elevators didn't work as I was trying to leave. But the room itself is nice, lighting is great, location great. So hopefully they'll work out their kinks. Not sure I'd stay there again until they do...

hotel_name: Park Terrace Hotel on Bryant Park
review_body: Birthday Weekend at the park in New York City, was an absolute delight! We were able to walk to the theatre, to Rockefeller Center, and restaurants at night! And the park view from my balcony was extraordinary!!

hotel_name: Park Terrace Hotel on Bryant Park
review_body: This property did not disappoint. Fresh and modern but not overdone. Attentive service was the hallmark, great breakfast, clean rooms, hydration stations, compact but comfortable.Nespresso machine was great to have.

hotel_name: Park Terrace Hotel on Bryant Park
review_body: Great location on Bryant Park, and excellent customer service,...the best we've experienced in NYC ! Complimentary breakfast was good quality, but not many tables/seats, so watch your timing ! Overall very impressed....especially with the staff. We will definitely be back !

hotel_name: Park Terrace Hotel on Bryant Park
review_body: A beautiful and discreet hotel that feels pretty much more like a club. If you’re looking for something that is beautifully understated and yet completely thoughtful then this is the place for you. Try it!!

hotel_name: Park Terrace Hotel on Bryant Park
review_body: The usual suspects all populated my apps....ugh... so boring!! And then, by holding out (since one of my go to independent hotels was sold out)....voila!! Park Terrace popped up and was the perfect, clean, simple yet elegant modern design that I was looking for...and the staff was the tops. Kudos to running an establishment that allowed me to focus, relax and work hard... I will be back.

hotel_name: Park Terrace Hotel on Bryant Park
review_body: The hotel is so nice, the rooms are new, pretty and comfortable. The location is nice and convenient. The attention is excellent an they help you with every request. The breakfast is delicious and complete.

hotel_name: Park Terrace Hotel on Bryant Park
review_body: We recently spent 5 days in nyc and used the hotel as a base. As a regular traveller to nyc, we tend to stay near Times Square, but never again. The location is quiet, good places to eat and the staff always make time to talk to you.At the front desk, Gabriella was wonderful and made us feel at ease. You were great!As a summaryPositives- excellence staff - positive and liked working at the hotel- everything works- excellent location next to Bryant Park - good breakfast (continental so don’t get excited)- nice touches regarding well being - yoga mat in room and exercise channel - eco friendly touches- refillable bottles, in room products Negatives- slow elevators ( but this is New York so expect it!)- noisy air con in room- that needs fixing- carpets looked a little worn- rooms are on the small side ( but it is New York so not a big issue for us)I am already planning to visit again with my children and will definitely book again at this hotel.

hotel_name: Park Terrace Hotel on Bryant Park
review_body: Good location across Bryant Park with view only of on upper floors, new hotel, modern, reasonable priced and good service. But rooms are small, bathroom too small and not more than one sink, so will not work with a couple.

hotel_name: Park Terrace Hotel on Bryant Park
review_body: Nice location, modern facilities, excellent treatment to customers . Reasonable fare. Just two areas of improvement : lifts could go faster and food at the terrace needs to diversify further. But I m fully satisfied

hotel_name: Park Terrace Hotel on Bryant Park
review_body: The staff members are really nice. The hotel facilities are very clean and new. The location is very convenient. They serve great breakfast and give us free water. I enjoyed my stay and want to come back again.

hotel_name: Park Terrace Hotel on Bryant Park
review_body: Basic but lovely room, clean hotel, great value for the price considering the area.My only complaint is a minor one - slow elevators. Where this hotel really excels is service, the staff here is wonderful. From Front Desk to Housekeeping to Bar and food service staff, everyone is so genuinely nice, courteous, enthusiastic, very professional but warm and friendly too, and so helpful. Great people!

hotel_name: Park Terrace Hotel on Bryant Park
review_body: Perfect location across from Bryant Park and New York Public library! Everyone that works there was very kind, hospitable and helpful. Brand new hotel so everything was new and modern. Morning buffet breakfast was great. (Half and half or cream would have been nice for coffee but they didn't carry it:) No negatives other than this very minor request.

hotel_name: Park Terrace Hotel on Bryant Park
review_body: A great hotel!. I loved the location, modern style, and the friendly staff. However, I stayed there for 14 days and I didn’t get any spacial offer or any privileges. Also, the total price of my stay was a little bit high compared to other hotels (4stars) on the midtown. I love the healthy options on the breakfast bar, but I missed the protein options and the menu was the same everyday that made me skipped the breakfast on some days. finally thank you for my wonderful stay and I have already recommended this hotel to my friends and please work on the loyalty membership.

hotel_name: Park Terrace Hotel on Bryant Park
review_body: Great hotel in the heart of NYC.. The staff was very friendly and most helpful.. Rooms were extra clean.. Great size for a New York hotel.. Complimentary breakfast was also a A+.. I will return again this summer

hotel_name: Park Terrace Hotel on Bryant Park
review_body: This is a beautiful hotel in a wonderful location right in front of Bryant Park. Breakfast is delicious and it's included, rooms are tiny but no need for more. We booked a corner suite and it had everything we needed and the view was beautiful from the 10th floor. The staff was super helpful and made us feel welcome all the time during our stay. We highly recommend this hotel and we look forward to staying again in the future.

hotel_name: Park Terrace Hotel on Bryant Park
review_body: New hotel, value priced. Rooms are small but workable. Very nice amenities include a European style breakfast buffet, hydration stations on each floor for free filtered water and a very friendly, young and efficient staff. Will definitely return next time.

hotel_name: Park Terrace Hotel on Bryant Park
review_body: Great location, new and spotless, amazing staff, great amenities. Regular room a bit tight but served a purpose. Great lounge and adequate fitness facility. A wonderful new gem in the Big Apple! Highly recommend. Will use again.

hotel_name: Park Terrace Hotel on Bryant Park
review_body: From start to finish we had a great stay in this well-located hotel. The staff were welcoming and attentive without being overbearing. Nothing was too much trouble. They made us feel welcome on our arrival and answered all our touristy questions in a good humoured fashion.The rooms are small, but big enough. They are well appointed and beautifully clean. The temperature was just right and the rooms really are sound proofed so a good night’s sleep is guaranteed.The breakfast is truly amazing. The food is of a really-high quality from local delis. The staff were really welcoming and loved to chat about our trip - again not intrusive but very friendly.When the snow came in, the staff offered support and advice on our travel plans and they were genuinely concerned about our journey.A hotel with high spec facilities combined with a family atmosphere.

hotel_name: Park Terrace Hotel on Bryant Park
review_body: We are New Yorkers who needed a hotel for a theater night getaway. Park Terrace was perfect. Centrally located right next to Bryant Park, about a ten-minute walk to the theater area. We stayed in a classic room, which is the smallest, but quiet, clean, and has all the necessities. The bed was very comfortable, the room well lit, the shower small but with great water pressure, strong WiFi, and the complementary package of kettle popcorn very tasty. The breakfast was another pleasant surprise. Bagels, croissants, rye bread, a selection of spreads, preserves, cheeses, yogurt with fresh berries, made to order cappuccinos, and yummy specialty doughnuts made for a very tasty start to the day. And a word about the staff: some of the friendliest staff people we’ve ever encountered at hotels (shout out to Leon and Noah at front desk). All in all a wonderful experience.
user_name:
Kolobok
New York City, New York

hotel_name: Park Terrace Hotel on Bryant Park
review_body: The rooms in this hotel are fantastic, a decent size for NYC with amazingly comfortable beds! The rooms and bathrooms were immaculately clean and tidy. The breakfast is wonderful - everything is so fresh and there is plenty of choice! The location is perfect, very central and great for sight seeing. Our stay at this hotel was made by the wonderful staff, they were so helpful and friendly and really went above and beyond to make our stay special (especially Charlie). We would highly recommend this hotel to anyone and will be returning!!

hotel_name: Park Terrace Hotel on Bryant Park
review_body: We enjoyed four nights at this excellent hotel. Everything about it was great; the central location right next to the New York public library, the friendly and helpful staff, the delicious breakfast of bagels, fresh fruit and doughnuts, and the cleanliness and standard of the room. Compared to other hotels in the area it's very good value and we would definitely stay here again.

hotel_name: Park Terrace Hotel on Bryant Park
review_body: i go up to New York numerous times a year and generally stay in the same 3 hotels. This time, I decided to go for a change, and boy was I glad. From the moment I got out of the cab, I was greeted by the most friendly, delightful staff I have ever encountered. It is obvious that this is a new property and occasional kinks present (e.g. elevator issues) but who cares about that when people treat you like you are their favorite guest. The rooms were clean and had some wonderful tech advantages, like a cool lighting panel next to your bed so you never have to get up and look for the switches. The bed was also one of the most comfortable beds i have ever slept in. Finally, what a lovely way to start my day with a delicious above average breakfast. Two of the days I ate in the dining area but the last morning, I treated myself and brought breakfast back to my room to have a relaxing morning off. I lucked out with the rates for the hotel this past weekend and don't know if the rates will be in my budget range in the future, but I know i will always look to try to stay here as the staff, amenities, and location make it a new hotel that New York should be proud of!

hotel_name: Park Terrace Hotel on Bryant Park
review_body: The staff is great - everyone friendly and helpful. The breakfast room is wonderful - spacious, high ceilings, big windows letting in lots of sunlight, and overlooking the NY public library. The breakfast itself has high quality, fresh items, including excellent fruit choices - blueberries, blackberries, rasberries, mango, and more, fresh bagels and breads, fresh juices including carrot-ginger, coffee, tea, donuts, and jams. The location is great, close to Grand Central, the NY public library, Bryant Park, etc.

hotel_name: Park Terrace Hotel on Bryant Park
review_body: My wife and I had a 24 hour layover on our way back from the Virgin Islands and decided to pick here based on midtown location. Next time we are in New York, we will definitely stay here. First off, the staff is amazingly nice and truly seemed concerned about us and our stay. Were upgraded to a corner room from the already premium room we had booked. The hotel is very clean and the ammenities are abundant. We didn't make the happy hour on the 6th floor terrace due to dinner resevations, but we did make it there in the morning for their breakfast. For a complimentary breakfast, they really had it all. Not your usual powdered eggs and microwave bacon. They have bagels and coffee yes, but so much more you don't usually find at most hotels (Carrot/Ginger Juice, artisan cheeses and meats, Espresso bar, etc.). Andnot to be weird, but in addition to the staff being very polite and truly nice, I'd swear they were hired from a professional modeling agency as everyone looked as though they should be in the pages of a GQ or Elle magazine.

hotel_name: Park Terrace Hotel on Bryant Park
review_body: Excellent location in Midtown. Very helpful and courteous staff. In particular I would like to commend Gabriela. Gabriela was amazing and made my trip truly rewarding. Gabriela is an asset to the Hotel. The rooms are excellent and the toilets are very good. On the whole it is the most central place to stay in Manhattan.

hotel_name: Park Terrace Hotel on Bryant Park
review_body: Pricey but worth every penny. Great service, clean room and comfortable bed. Breakfast was included and I was lucky enough to get a free upgraded room which was exciting! Highly recommend staying at this hotel.

hotel_name: Park Terrace Hotel on Bryant Park
review_body: Everything was so clean and comfortable! The rooms were on the smaller side but the bed was so cozy I didn’t even notice. Would definitely stay here again on my next NYC trip. Definitely would recommend as well

hotel_name: Park Terrace Hotel on Bryant Park
review_body: This new property was perfect for a weekend of theater. Far enough away to avoid the crowds but close enough to enjoy The Time Square vibe. Very clean and fresh. Helpful, friendly staff. Loved the app with helpful info.

hotel_name: Park Terrace Hotel on Bryant Park
review_body: We visited for our anniversary and really were impressed. The deluxe rooms feel spacious for Manhattan, and are pleasant and airy. The staff are incredibly gracious. The location is perfect. We would highly recommend this hotel.

hotel_name: Park Terrace Hotel on Bryant Park
review_body: My friend and I stayed here over Valentines day weekend on a deal from hotels tonight. There was a discount because there was some construction going on but there were no issues whatsoever and it was very quiet. The beds were super comfortable, I haven’t slept that well in a hotel ever. The bathrooms were well stocked and appointed, and there was lots of lightning.They have complementary snacks in the room and a really chic rooftop lounge where they serve breakfast in the morning and had cocktail hour which I highly recommend there. The staff is so amazing, friendly and helpful! This is truly a great hotel and I’ll be staying here next time I’m in New York!

hotel_name: Park Terrace Hotel on Bryant Park
review_body: Everything you could want in a hotel, you find at Park Terrace. Staff are very friendly and helpful which is a big thing when travelling solo - they were always welcoming and up for a chat. Rooms are clean, comfortable and pretty spacious for New York standards. My room was on the 5th floor at the back of the building. There wasn't a view but it was incredibly quiet and allowed a great nights sleep after busy days exploring New York. The hotel is also in a great location, opposite Bryant Park. I was able to walk every where, but the subway is also close. There's a water station on each floor where you can refill water bottles. A great amenity that I didn't know I wanted until I didn't have to buy bottles of water each day. I didn't want to leave, so extended my stay as long as I possibly could. I'm already planning a trip back to New York and there was no question about where I would stay.

hotel_name: Park Terrace Hotel on Bryant Park
review_body: Hotel is in an amazing location. Stayed in a Premier room which was very spacious for NYC and everything was very clean. Free use of water bottles and refilling stations on each floor is also very useful!Breakfast is simple but gives you everything you need - fresh fruit, bagels and doughnuts.Best thing about the hotel are the staff, who went above and and beyond for us on multiple occasions. When we arrived we'd been scammed by a taxi driver wanting to charge us $420 from JFK (we were unaware of the flat rate).A special thank you to Harrison and one of the managers (whose name I cannot remember) for rushing out and helping us deal with the situation!! (Thanks to their help the taxi driver accepted $80)As we were on a late flight home the reception staff arranged for us to use the showers by the fitness centre after we'd checked out, and made sure we had soap and towels etc. - very helpful!!!

hotel_name: Park Terrace Hotel on Bryant Park
review_body: There must be something about hotels in the Bryant Park area. This hotel is a gem. I reserved a room with a view and it did not disappoint.Upon arrival, I was immediately checked in. Since my room was not ready, I was escorted to the terrace area for some coffee and to warm up. The area had large floor to ceiling windows and captivating views of the New York Public Library and Bryant Park. While sipping on my americano, I enjoyed watching the ice skaters in the park.Once my room was ready I was taken to the elevator and given my key. The room was larger than the average NYC hotel room. There was a queen size bed and a couch to sit on. The best touch were the complimentary kettle corn and local soda.Breakfast the next morning was delicious and free. La Colombe coffee, Greek yogurt, fresh fruit and plenty of delicious pastries. Everyone was extremely nice and made sure I had the perfect stay. The friendliest is Arthur who was in charge of the elevator. Keep up the great work!

hotel_name: Park Terrace Hotel on Bryant Park
review_body: There are many good hotels in Midtown Manhattan but what sets the Park Terrace apart from all the others is the amazing Staff. To a person, all were very personable and accommodating. I was truly made to feel that I was a welcomed and valuable guest.The accommodations were very tasteful and modern. Technology is embraced by the hotel to make the guests more informed and entertained via the Hotel app, Bose Radio, and smart TV’sI enjoyed spending time in the lounge having a wonderful breakfast to start the day and some delicious appetizers and cocktails after the day was over. Did i mention the lounge overlooks Bryant Park, another perk.I would most definitely stay here again for my next trip into the city. Actually my wife and I are looking forward to it

hotel_name: Park Terrace Hotel on Bryant Park
review_body: We had a very rare childfree break to NYC and spent a long time choosing a hotel, eventually going for the Park Terrace. It was an excellent choice and we thoroughly enjoyed our stay.Location is great, the winter activities/food at Bryant park are lovely and there are plenty of nice places to eat and drink within walking distance. On check in we were upgraded to a deluxe room which was a good size and well appointed with a view over the park. I had requested a bottle of bubbly in the room and this was provided as a nice surprise for my husband. We found few hotels offering breakfast so this was a great bonus. This was a continental style rather than a hot buffet and we loved the fresh fruit and bagels. The food was a high quality and you were encouraged to take pastries etc out with you for the day. Having breakfast at the hotel each morning saved us a fortune and gave us a good start to the day. The bar is very welcoming in the evening with nice cocktails and drinks and a limited food menu. There is an outdoor terrace with lovely views of the Empire State Building but it was a bit chilly to sit out there during our stay. Free water and bottles is provided which is also a good cost saving not to mention the environmental benefits. My husband liked the fitness facilities, particularly the peloton which he did most mornings. The gym was small but never busy. Staff were welcoming and friendly and we immediately felt relaxed and comfortable. I’d highly recommend if you are looking for a hotel in midtown.

hotel_name: Park Terrace Hotel on Bryant Park
review_body: The front desk staff at the Park Terrace were unbelievably (and authentically) friendly. Great room—nothing in NYC at a reasonable price is going to be huge, but it was comfortable, well designed, and clean. Malin + Goetz bath products, solid food on their Terrace level. Would absolutely stay here again, and probably will on my next work trip. One of the friendliest stays I’ve ever had at a hotel.

hotel_name: Park Terrace Hotel on Bryant Park
review_body: The staff gives this hotel the edge over other hotels I have used in the past in NYC. Always kind, helpful, and courteous service. Arranged car service, recommended restaurants and just pleasant people! I felt they really went “the extra mile” for great service. Breakfast offerings were very good. The fruit at breakfast was above average. Deluxe room was a good size for a weeekend for two females. Bryant Park location is so convenient to 5th ave shopping and theater district/Times Square. Subway entrance at the end of the block to get around easily. Across the street from the beautiful main branch of the NYC library. 8th floor. No noise issues at all. Great choice !

hotel_name: Park Terrace Hotel on Bryant Park
review_body: Bar far, one of the best hotel experiences I have ever had. The most kind and accommodating staff, an extremely clean room and overall environment, and the perfect location-close to everything!!! Definitely will be back and definitely recommend this brand new beautiful hotel!!!

hotel_name: Park Terrace Hotel on Bryant Park
review_body: THIS hotel is incredible truly. I’ve been traveling for two weeks and this was my third stop and they are the first hotel to truly make me feel at home while still having an upscale custom experience. What is so unique about this hotel is that each staff is truly empowered to make you experience impeccable and they will all go above and beyond to show that- to name a few: Emmanuel, Arthur and Justin? (he has glasses lighter colored hair) the hotels amenities are fabulous, breakfast is quite a treat and not the usual hotel continental spread. The service in the restaurant were quick kind and so lovely to help. Everything is perfectly clean the style of the hotel is simple and beautiful. I will be returning I was sad to leave such a fabulous experience can’t express it enough - so much so I created a trip advisor account to write this.

hotel_name: Park Terrace Hotel on Bryant Park
review_body: The room was great and spacious. it was well kept through out my stay. However, the TV had some problems and I had to call lobby to get it fixed. I also find that it is important to have restaurant inside hotel for days you just want to dine in hotel or get room service. Limited.

hotel_name: Park Terrace Hotel on Bryant Park
review_body: My wife and I stayed at this hotel for a birthday weekend. It was an all-around great experience from check in to check out with a warm welcoming staff. Clean room and a great lounge/breakfast. Great location right in the heart of the city. Many thanks to Charlie, Shanna and Dory for making it a great experience.

hotel_name: Park Terrace Hotel on Bryant Park
review_body: I had booked for my partner's 30th birthday so booked a Deluxe Park View room at just under $400 a night. The view from such a room is okay but a little underwhelming from the fourth floor. Perhaps when the rest of the hotel opens higher rooms will enjoy better views.At the start of the trip, arriving at the hotel after a seven hour flight, the colleague checking us in took a phone call while speaking with us. Further disappointment on getting to our room did we discover there was construction work still taking place on our floor - hammering and banging in a room just three doors away. The hotel does not mention this on their website. No one mentioned this in emails or even as a courtesy at the front desk when checking in. In fact, when I mentioned this to the front desk, they claimed to be completely oblivious to the work going on.Annoyingly, I had passed over The Parker (overlooking Central Park) which was available at a cheaper price at the time due to their open admission that their hotel is being refurbished. Had I known I was in for a half-finished hotel anyway, I may have chosen the cheaper option with a more iconic view.Staff, admittedly, tried to relocate us with an upgrade at a reduced cost ($50 a night). Views from the rooms available for the extra cost had a worse view.With the birthday in mind, I had emailed the hotel well in advance to try and set up something special. Initially, response was positive and, when chasing up was told "it" was with guest services. With this, I had expected something to be arranged - I had been prepared to pay. As it turns out, nothing was organised. Having seen quite how unfinished the hotel was - they do not yet provide room service - I had assumed this was not something they were yet offering so I was gutted to then find out on check out that the hotel offers a full menu of services for such occasions - floral decorations and more...in fact, a member of staff was wrapping gifts for another room at the desk at the time I was complaining.I had also, in my initial emailing and when checking in, specifically requested to pay in cash at the end of the stay rather than by the credit card I had supplied for security. I was told this was fine. A full two days prior to checking out, my card was charged. This charge was reversed but added another thing to have to sort out after having requested this multiple times.On checking out and in subsequent emailing I was offered a discounted upgrade the next time I stay with the hotel - which feels a little like a hollow gesture and one I don't think will be taken up. On the positive side, the hotel is in a great location and the quality of the rooms is acceptable. If you are looking in the area and at a similar price, for now I would recommend The Archer or The Refinery instead.At present, I would argue this hotel is not worth the price it is currently aiming for and it should focus more on nailing its customer service - having registered my disappointment at the start of and during the stay, it felt like no one really did anything to make sure things got better or to even proactively speak to us about how we were doing.Thankfully, we had a fantastic stay in spite of our experience at the hotel but a few simple courtesies could have made such a big difference.

hotel_name: Park Terrace Hotel on Bryant Park
review_body: Friendly staff. Clean rooms. Doesn't try and fail to be the Ritz-Carlton, like most downtown hotels these days. Rooms on the inside have no view but zero noise. I didn't try the restaurant/bar but may next time. Location and price can't be beat for Manhattan.

hotel_name: Park Terrace Hotel on Bryant Park
review_body: I was looking for a safe, affordable, clean room for one night on a quick trip to NYC. I'm not familiar with NYC but needed to be by Penn Station. This new hotel was wonderful! The staff was very attentive and efficient and their 5* service was much appreciated. They knew me by name, were respectful and helpful, and Charlie especially took care of every need and referral I asked for. My room was well designed and met my needs perfectly. The gym, breakfast area, and amenities like re-fillable water station were ideal. I highly recommend this hotel for its staff, amenities, and location. Well done, Park Terrace!

hotel_name: Park Terrace Hotel on Bryant Park
review_body: We traveled to the city for a weekend with our infant. Hotel staff was extremely accommodating, always very pleasant and helpful. Quick response to requests. Solid breakfast with good service. Would stay again.

hotel_name: Park Terrace Hotel on Bryant Park
review_body: What a lovely modern and upmarket hotel, super location (Bryant Park is fantastic and you are only a few blocks from Times Sq and theatre row) and great amenities and services. The breakfast on the 6th floor terrace was absolutely fantastic and the hotel staff there were extremely helpful and keen for us to drink lattes and take food away for the day. Last tip - get a room that does not face onto 40th ave as it can be very noisy.

hotel_name: Park Terrace Hotel on Bryant Park
review_body: Excellent hotel in great location across from Bryant Park. Restaurants, coffee shops etc in watching distance. Staff was exceptionally accommodating. My room, while not large, was perfectly laid out and had everything you need. Modern Euro feel. Would definitely stay there again.

hotel_name: Park Terrace Hotel on Bryant Park
review_body: The basic rooms here are teeny-tiny, even by NYC standards. (You feel like you're in one of those "tiny house" TV shows -- the end of the bed was literally a foot from the wall.) Even so, this quickly became our new favorite NYC hotel. The relatively quiet location just a couple blocks off Times Square and adjacent to the library and Bryant Park is fantastic. Everything is brand new and clean, and the staff is remarkably friendly and helpful. They went out of their way to find us a last-minute dinner reservation on a Saturday and didn't mind us bringing takeout pizza into the lounge on a frigid winter night. The included breakfast is the best I've ever had, on par with a luxury hotel. The outdoor terrace, which has great views, would be fun in warmer weather. We got loads of value for the price. My only caveat: You'll want to share a room with someone you know well. The glass bathroom doors aren't at all soundproof, and the bathrooms don't even have a fan, so everyone hears everything! :0

hotel_name: Park Terrace Hotel on Bryant Park
review_body: It is a wonderful hotel, advertising on line what it delivers - crisp, clean lines to rooms and quiet, beautiful space adjacent to Bryant Park. The staff is delightful, with a friendly and helpful demeanor - from front desk to the Terrazzo - and the breakfasts are worth the trip. Beds comfortable, towels plush. A great location to go anywhere in NYC. I had a lovely stay.

hotel_name: Park Terrace Hotel on Bryant Park
review_body: This is a really nice hotel and the team is wonderful They also have a very good breakfast. The one you could find in a nice hotel in Paris , so very much European style with fresh products, very good bread and pastriesThanks to all the staff , I ll for sure come back !

hotel_name: Park Terrace Hotel on Bryant Park
review_body: We state here on a quick one night trip to NYC. The staff could not have been more polite or friendly. We arrived early in the morning and expected only to be able to have our bags held at the desk, to our surprise our room was ready and the staff checked us in. Everything about the hotel is neat and clean, we couldn't find anything wrong with our room. Breakfast was great and unexpected to find a complimentary breakfast in NYC. We will definitely be staying here again the next time we come to the city.

hotel_name: Park Terrace Hotel on Bryant Park
review_body: My wife and I spent the weekend here to celebrate her birthday and have a short staycation. Park Terrace was perfect. The staff were so friendly and attentive. They ever gave my wife a little gift of chocolates for her birthday. Location is close to so many things and our view of the skating rink and library were beautiful.Room was beautiful and efficient with a luxurious bathroom and comfy bed. Gym was excellent. Everything was new and top caliber.The best feature of the hotel is the guest lounge on the 6th floor. Beautiful space and the daily breakfasts were excellent. We will definitely come back here next time in NYC

hotel_name: Park Terrace Hotel on Bryant Park
review_body: If I could give this place ten stars I would. I have stayed at all types of luxury hotels and the service at those places is always great. What I noticed the entire weekend at Park Terrace is the personal pride every single employee has in this new property. It’s a newer hotel and they are still working out the kinks. But the little touches they put into our stay were very nice and above the luxury brands. From a personal tour of the hotel, to free laundry, water and late check out....they are trying to do all things above and beyond. We had a delayed check in and not only did they come a few bar drinks, they called ahead to Parker and Quinn (where we ate the first night) and had dessert sent to our table. This place is like very special and I hope they do very well because the employees care about their customers.

hotel_name: Park Terrace Hotel on Bryant Park
review_body: One of the best hotels i have stayed in, within NY. The rooms are very new and large for NY, staff are amazing and we absolutely loved the breakfast - would highly recommend. We will definitely be back...

hotel_name: Park Terrace Hotel on Bryant Park
review_body: I was very much hoping to enjoy this hotel. It just opened (Nov '18) and is a great location if you want to be near Bryant Park. (However, there are 15+ alternatives in a 5 block radius.) The noise was the biggest factor - there was street drilling going on well past midnight, it stopped right before 1am, and the windows are barely single pane (you can also feel the wind draft...having worked in the flat glass and fabrication space, they used among the lowest cost glass). Sleep was ruined for me, #1 factor in choosing a hotel (noise impacted several others - it was a big topic of conversation in the breakfast room the following morning). Also my room, 714, was by the elevator, and you hear constant dinging and other hallway noise. The rooms are very small, the classic is 200 SQ ft and the deluxe 235. The deluxe has no desk, no bath tub, just enough room to walk around. It's not a room you want to be in. The bathroom is also cheap - no shaving/makeup mirror, basic shower stall, no body wash (only bar soap). The room is very similar to the new hostel+ brand of Marriott, Moxy, and AC Hotels (European-inspired Courtyards). The problem is Park Terrace charges a luxury hotel rate. Overall it was incredibly frustrating given sleep was near impossible. Even if it were quiet, the room is small and not particularly nice IMO, especially given the luxury hotel price. Please don't be deceived by the fancy website with nice photos and reviews. (If you're fine with noise and get a rate of $200, then I suppose it wouldn't be a poor choice given location and smiling staff.)The towels and linens are nice, and the staff was social. The 6th floor lounge is nice, the breakfast selection is robust for a continental breakfast, and the breakfast staff is very helpful. The drinks at the bar are higher than some of the trendiest locations - an Old Fashioned was $21 and a small cup of nuts is an additional $9 even when ordering multiple drinks at the bar. I very much question the sustainability of the hotel as it currently prices and markets itself. Not sure whether they're the type to leave reviews, but there were several other unhappy guests as well. Hoping with feedback the owner better tunes product-market fit.There are several glowing reviews so maybe it's a great place for some. I wish I examined them more closely beforehand as several seem to be new TripAdvisor users with only 1 review so not sure what they are comparing to.

hotel_name: Park Terrace Hotel on Bryant Park
review_body: It was perfect, great service, staff, new hotel, great bar. bed are very comfortable.If traveling with kids you can get 2 rooms that connect in private hallway. 3 kids slept in one room, couch is great extra bed for 10 years and under.
user_name:
Guide33480123660
New York City, New York

hotel_name: Park Terrace Hotel on Bryant Park
review_body: Stayed here over the holiday season with my family of 8. Easily one of the best hotel experiences I’ve ever had period. I actually made a TripAdvisor account just so I’d be able to share how happy my family and I were with our stay here. Breakfast was fantastic, rooms were new, comfortable, and designed very well with excellent views. Loved the guest service closet concept. Location was the best part; the hotel is a stone’s throw away from almost everything in Manhattan. We were able to walk nearly everywhere with relative ease. Plus, Bryant Park and the NY Public Library are bang across the road, which was awesome especially with the decorations, ice skating, and Winter Wonderland set up. Staff service was exceptional; they really made our stay. Special shout out to Bronson, Gabriella, and every member of staff at the hotel that we interacted with while there - you guys are awesome! Highly recommended; I’ll definitely be staying here again on my next visit to NYC.

hotel_name: Park Terrace Hotel on Bryant Park
review_body: Beautiful new hotel in prime location. Breakfast provided was delicious. Room was really nice, quiet, and bed was comfy. Friendliest staff in the city from our greeting at the door to the breakfast host and barista at breakfast! Will definitely come back and recommend!

hotel_name: Park Terrace Hotel on Bryant Park
review_body: Don't hesitate to stay at the Park Terrace in NYStaff was wonderful, location was perfect, Right across from Bryant Park. A lot of city activity at your fingertips. Valet Parking was very convenient. The rooms were very clean , bed sheets were very soft.

hotel_name: Park Terrace Hotel on Bryant Park
review_body: We could only stay for the night but, the experience was so special nonetheless. We stayed in the room with the view. It was so amazing! The room was clean and they make the most of the space so you feel comfortable. The breakfast had a variety of quality items to choose from that were delicious, especially the fresh juices. The attendants were all so friendly and helpful. I loved everything and look forward to staying again.

hotel_name: Park Terrace Hotel on Bryant Park
review_body: I loved my stay at the Park Terrace hotel, although the hotel is newly renovated with some unfinished areas and stayed in a classic room with a bad view, I still rate it very good.Why? It is because of the staff! They were very nice. The breakfast was simple, fresh and delicious; the staff at the Terrace Lounge was very attentive, Excellent! NOTE: There was only one staff at the reception who helped with the check-in, who did a poor job in welcoming me after a long flight. He looked like he wanted to go home and didn’t care, meanwhile the other staff was attending another guest with excellent hospitality and explain the hotel’s facilities. This guy who helped me, didn’t explain anything, asked for the the credit card, gave my key and only said: ‘enjoy your stay’. I asked what is my room number? He said, “it’s in the back of the card” ??? Dahh. The next day I noticed that I have been charged with full 4 nights on my credit card, which I actually had pre-paid. If only this guy paid a little attention. I didn’t check his name, I should have. The concierge was kind enough to help, they are fixing it and it will be returned hopefully SOON. I almost wanted to leave hotel because of this one staff, but the rest of the staff were attentive, so I decided to stay.I will come back, but I would like to have a better welcoming next time. And that particular staff should receive some hospitality training by then.DDavas

hotel_name: Park Terrace Hotel on Bryant Park
review_body: My husband and I spent a few days here during the holidays. The location is great — right on Bryant Park and within easy walking distance of theater district, Times Square, 30 Rock, etc. The hotel is newly renovated. Our room was a bit tight, but quiet, clean, pleasant and clearly designed to make the most of a small space. The staff was very friendly and eager to go the extra mile. The lobby is not one for lingering — but there’s room to hang out on an upper floor where breakfast is served. There’s also a bar with an outdoor terrace that looks out on the park. I’ve heard it’s popular but the weather wasn’t right for it when we visited. I would stay here again. We had a lovely time.
user_name:
sd1042015
Washington DC, District of Columbia

hotel_name: Park Terrace Hotel on Bryant Park
review_body: Hotel staff, ( I wish I could name everyone bc I would, including Charlie, Gabriella, Hannah, and everyone working the lounge) were personable, attentive, intimate setting but friendly and casual as well. My favorite was the continental breakfast every morning, the BEST ever!!! Not at all what u would expect, fresh fruit, granola, Greek yogurt, legit fresh bagels and spreads, and doughnuts that I’ve considered having shipped to Phoenix, yes they are that good! The location is perfect with views of the park and library and of course downtown. Close to all the shopping. I felt very safe, being by myself, but never felt alone because people at Terrace were so friendly! Everything was pristine and I loved the color palate in the room, so relaxing, oh and enjoyed the mini Bose soundlink and expresso machine. Anytime I called for something they were up immediately or helpful in every possible way! I will definitely be back! Rates are amazing for what you get! No tub but shower had great pressure/shower head and hot water, which is super important to me. Oh another delight was the water machines in the hallways and refillable bottles complimentary! You don’t have to pay $5 for a bottle of water. Loved this idea.The lounge has a beautiful patio w view of the Empire State Building, when weather permits it would be a real treat

hotel_name: Park Terrace Hotel on Bryant Park
review_body: Keep it simple:Pros:- new and clean- decent gym for HIIT, Cardio and light weights training- conveniently located- exceptional service and polite staff- reusable water bottles and free water on every level- access to free DIY laundryCons:- rooms are small, And we paid for a mid range room (can’t Inage what the cheapest room looks like)- gym needs water fountain, clock and scales - really hot in winter- we had construction right outside our window #views? (See below)- lifts very slow, sometimes a three minute wait because construction was occurring.Easy fix for 3 of the 4 items.

hotel_name: Park Terrace Hotel on Bryant Park
review_body: Very nice hotel with a great location, centrally located near lots of things, including Broadway and Times Square. Staff was very friendly at front desk and breakfast buffet. Room was large, clean, elegantly styled with nice artwork and a comfortable bed. Bathroom was large and luxurious. Breakfast buffet is currently free and was very good.
user_name:
ryanelectra225
Washington DC, District of Columbia

hotel_name: Park Terrace Hotel on Bryant Park
review_body: Our very first impression was wow! We were struggling with our bags at the entry and Gabriela at the front desk helped us with the door. All of the staff was extremely friendly. The standard room was just the right size for the two of us. Beautiful artwork on the walls, updated thermostat, large flatscreen, comfy bed, lights everywhere that you can control from the bed, complimentary water and coffee, lighted closet (with safe), and updated luxury bathroom. Complimentary breakfast on the 6th floor where you can also hang out for happy hour. There was also a sauna on the 2nd floor which we didn't get the chance to use. The only downside is that there wasn't a fridge in the room.

hotel_name: Park Terrace Hotel on Bryant Park
review_body: We stayed for three nights the week of Christmas and Loved this newly opened hotel right across from Bryant Park & walking distance to Theaters, Times Square And shopping. The rooms are very well done with nice decor, great bathroom shower and extremely comfortable bed with plush linen. Daily Breakfast and evening cocktails on the 6th floor Terrace room was very enjoyable and relaxing with good food and service. Have a very well equipped gym on the lower level with a sauna and life fitness equipment and weight machines. The cleanliness and decor of the hotel was equally matched by a very attentive and super friendly staff. So welcoming and well trained. Shout out to our housekeeper Eva who did a great job servicing our room and Gabriela, Charlie, Leon, and Noah at reception who were hospitality champions and gave great recommendations for restaurants, shops,etc. and were always there with a smile and warm greeting. They all were so proud of their new hotel and eager to assist with any request.Thank you for an awesome stay, we will be back for sure !
user_name:
JoeyD1966
New York City, New York

hotel_name: Park Terrace Hotel on Bryant Park
review_body: I have a wonderful time staying at the Park Terrace. The staff was super nice and very helpful. The room was all new and has stellar amenities, even the thermostat was fancy :) It gave weather updates. The hotel is right next to Bryant Park, which was great for my Christmas shopping and people watching. I would definitely stay here again!

hotel_name: Park Terrace Hotel on Bryant Park
review_body: Amazing location with a great staff. The gentlemen Harrinson at the front desk particularly went out of his way to ensure our stay went smoothly. Parking in New York is already crazy but they took care of everything without any issue. The breakfast is also very good with a variety of good selections. The hotel is right across from Bryant park and is very convenient when you want to walk rather than drive or use the subway. Amazing stay.

hotel_name: Park Terrace Hotel on Bryant Park
review_body: The Unique Loving Touches of this Hotel, sets it apart from anything I have experienced as a frequent traveler and hopefully it becomes the new standard for all Hotels to Come. I truly feel this Hotel was designed by a person who travels and actually Stays in Hotels. I travel extensively and do not stay in anything under a 4-star rated Hotel. This has ALL the basics and maintains them as you will find in ANY 4-star or higher Hotel to include Robe, Coffee Machine, Gym, Conference/Business Suite, Variety of Pillows, Centrally located and in walking distance to desired locations such as Broadway, Rockefeller Center, and Time Square...All the basics.I stayed in a Suite, there was a nice Couch with waste-level table for quick Conference calls - no work Desk but it didn't take away from my stay. The conference center was available for anything I needed. What sets this Hotel apart from anything I have experienced are the little things a frequent traveler would enjoy. There is a filtered water machine with individual water bottles for your personal use on every floor. FREE filtered Water! Not just one bottle - it's unlimited FREE filtered water.A Taste of New York. There are complementary treats from local vendors in your room. Along with a very creative and unique Provisions Bar with Local Vendor Favorites. The Complementary Breakfast includes famous New York Zucker's Bagels w/ smear - brought in FRESH every morning. I made a plate and cozied up at a table by the fire while looking down at the Christmas Market on Bryant Park. It was perfect. The Breakfast staff are very attentive and maintain the bar continuously during opening hours. They also supply take-away containers which is extremely thoughtful and I was grateful as I was enjoying Christmas in New York and not much was open on Christmas Day for Lunch.Electronic Charging Stations: There are a total of 8 charging options by the bed (4 on each side) for your electronic devices. I was just in a hotel last week, climbing under the bed trying to find a place for my charger. The Park Terrace also caters to overseas guest w/ USB outlet ports! Brilliant - this designer did their homework w/ this remodel! BRAVO! Easy Exercise - My room included a Yoga Mat in the Closet - Yep, No more throwing a Bathroom Towel on the floor to do Yoga and stretch in the morning. THANK YOU! The Gym is on point and has a Sauna. There are also FULL sized soap/shampoo essentials in the bathroom. If you're looking for that fresh homey feel while being COMPLETELY supported on your stay in NYC - the Park Terrace Hotel on Bryant Park is it! Book Now and Truly Enjoy being served during your Stay in the City.

hotel_name: Park Terrace Hotel on Bryant Park
review_body: I usually prefer to stay in the Bryant Park area and saw this hotel under construction. When it opened a month ago, I thought I'd give it a try and stayed there for 2 nights. This was a last minute trip and the prices were very reasonable especially during the Christmas high season.1. Staff - Everyone I met was extremely friendly and helpful. You can tell they were all excited about being part of this new hotel.2. Rooms - It has that "new car" smell. :) The room i stayed in was a little small but not unusually small versus other well known NY hotels. The layout was great and it had higher than normal ceilings which made the room cosy. I also had a view of the NYC Library and Bryant Park and the room got a lot of light. It also had a sliding door that allowed you to look out the window and here the hustle and bustle and all the unique smells of the City!What was unique about the hotel (which I like - others might now) is that on every floor, there's a filtered water and ice machine with empty bottles for you to drink as much water to your hearts content. There's also an "amenities closet" so if you forgot your toothbrush, toothpaste, shaver, even a nail clipper, they got you covered.I didn't have a chance to check out restaurant or guest-only lounge / terrace.Although I'm sure they are stick working out some kinks, I'm pleased with my first stay and will make a return visit.

hotel_name: Park Terrace Hotel on Bryant Park
review_body: The hotel was in a great location for us. The room was very clean, comfortable, and modern. The room was a decent size for NYC. The staff at the Park Terrace were very friendly and looking out for the comfort of their guests. Harrison at the front desk was the best! Thank you Harrison! The breakfast in the morning was also very good. An upscale continental breakfast with a great staff to help with your food, seating, and overall comfort. The donut I had that morning was one of the best I’ve ever had. Our next trip we will be booking at the Park Terrace again.

hotel_name: Park Terrace Hotel on Bryant Park
review_body: This is an amazing experience to stay at this place, the location of the place is a great asset. The staff at the front desk and the housekeeping gives you an amazing and personalized experience which none of the hotels in New York provide you.the small detains and the hotel cleanliness is not something good you see in New York hotels. The housekeeping staff was amazing since some areas were still being worked upon but that did not impact the cleanliness of the guest floors and rooms Great staff, great experience.

hotel_name: Park Terrace Hotel on Bryant Park
review_body: Our stay at the Park Terrace Hotel was amazing! Our room was custom appointed by the check in staff and had a wonderful view of Bryant Park. The staff were more than awesome and accomodated our every need! They were always welcoming, suited us with umbrellas for the rain, and even helped with my wardrobe! The complimentary breakfast was delicious as well. I can’t say enough great things about our stay. We will definitely be back!

hotel_name: Park Terrace Hotel on Bryant Park
review_body: The boutique hotel is really great - modern rooms with comfortable beds, a water station on every floor to refill your bottles, friendly staff, and a 5 star breakfast bar featuring NY favorites! The breakfast room overlooks the NYC library and Bryant Park, which is especially magical during the holidays. I've already booked my next stay!

hotel_name: Park Terrace Hotel on Bryant Park
review_body: Very friendly and helpful staff - front desk, breakfast room, maintenance, everyone. Very nice, but small, rooms. Great location at Public Library and Bryant Park.Only downside - if you're looking for a bar/lounge at midnight you'll have to go for a walk. None on site.

hotel_name: Park Terrace Hotel on Bryant Park
review_body: Park Terrace Hotel is a new, very modern yet comfortable hotel conveniently located directly across from the NY Public Library on 40th St. Our room on the 4th floor was small but very clean and served our purpose well. All facilities were fresh and new, the bed comfortable, and the free continental breakfast tasty (enjoyed all the more for the views of the Library and Bryant Park from the 6th floor lounge.) All of Midtown Manhattan, from Macy's to Rockefeller Center and the Broadway District was an easy walk, as was Grand Central Terminal. The only thing better than the location was the staff, who to a person were friendly, outgoing and always ready to do whatever was required to make our stay perfect.We've found a new home-away-from-home for our trips to the City. I highly recommend this hotel for NYC stays

hotel_name: Park Terrace Hotel on Bryant Park
review_body: Began our 7 day holiday in NY in a so called beautique hotel on 38 st West. Turned out to be the the most expensive shoe box in Manhattan. Next morning began our search for something much bigger and better value and stumbled across this master price. The staff were fantastic and showed us a sample room before we booked. We arrived back later with our bags and the hotel took care of everything. Sadly we had to depart early than expected and the staff once again were exceptional.Would definitely go back and I can’t end without mentioning the fantastic breakfast. Don’t miss out on this hotel it’s the finest in mid town.

hotel_name: Park Terrace Hotel on Bryant Park
review_body: I loved this hotel. The location is perfect. Close to everything. The staff are friendly and helpful. They let us check in early and gave us an upgrade. There is unlimited filtered water on each floor. There is a Nespresso coffee machine in the room. The mini bar has a good variety of snacks from dean and deluca. The bath products in the bathroom are really good. I was thinking that I need to get that shampoo:) The breakfast has really yummy bagels,donuts, a selection of fresh juices and fruit. The rooms are exceptionally clean. The sheets are soft and comforting. The tv has cable and you also have streaming apps like Netflix/Prime. My problem with NYC hotels is usually the sound but in our room it was quite despite being on a busy street. I also loved the fact that the decor is quite understated and pleasant. The rooms feel inviting. Like they were designed to make you relax. The only thing that I wasn’t a big fan of was the size of the room. It’s tiny for $400 a night but then maybe that’s just NYC hotel rooms

hotel_name: Park Terrace Hotel on Bryant Park
review_body: Our stay was perfect. Our room was nicely appointed, staff was wonderful, the complimentary breakfast buffet was amazing, food and cocktails were awesome, and the gym was great. Highly recommend the Park Terrace.

hotel_name: Park Terrace Hotel on Bryant Park
review_body: We enjoyed our recent stay at the Park Terrace Hotel very much. The location was perfect as we could walk everywhere (although the subway was nearby). The hotel is brand new. The room decor is fabulous and the staff couldn't have done more to ensure our comfort. The breakfast room on the 6th. floor is beautifully furnished and doubles as a bar in the evening, although we didn't go.

hotel_name: Park Terrace Hotel on Bryant Park
review_body: This brand new hotel knows how to make an impression. A fantastic location with great ammenities and staff who are accomodating and polite. I had some difficulties with their app (attempted to use their mobile key) but the front desk came up to assist and got me a key very quickly. The room was modern yet charming and they seemed to make the most out of the size of the rooms. I didnt make it to the bar or complimentary breakfast but a coworker only had great things to say. I’ll be back for sure!

hotel_name: Park Terrace Hotel on Bryant Park
review_body: We stayed here for the weekend and it was perfect. The rooms were clean, the front desk was very welcoming, and the bartenders were awesome. They made me a special drink that i loved. The location is very convenient to everything. I loved the holiday trees in the lobby!

hotel_name: Park Terrace Hotel on Bryant Park
review_body: I travel to NYC 6-8 times a year for work and every December I intentionally book across from Bryant Park. My favorite room at Bryant Park Hotel was n/a so I took a chance and booked a Premiere room at Park Terrace. I was able to check in an hour early and from the moment I walked in I had five star treatment. I was a bit disappointed that I did not have a view of the park ( thought I had booked a park view) but my room was spotless, and amenities nice. Complimentary bottled water and popcorn were a nice touch. The location is fabulous. I visited the sixth floor for a cocktail and appetizer ( they were out of the mushroom flatbread) and again the service was excellent. The best part of my stay was the breakfast.... the two gentlemen and woman working both days were outstanding. You can tell that even at 7am they love their job and take it seriously. The breakfast foods ( you will feel like you are in Europe) were fresh, delicious and healthy ( ok... maybe not the decadent coconut square doughnut) but it was worth every calorie! I’ll be back and will tell my friends.

hotel_name: Park Terrace Hotel on Bryant Park
review_body: Staff is wonderful. Room was super quiet, and the weekend breakfast was perfect before we headed out walking for the day. Very clean. Hotel was located right outside the Bryant Park market and NYC public library. Alex Colombo was a super nice staff member, but they all were wonderful. Wish I got more names to give a positive shout out. Managers, whoever was working Dec 7 and 8, they were ALL great.

hotel_name: Park Terrace Hotel on Bryant Park
review_body: We stayed one night at this brand new hotel and loved it! The service was fabulous from the minute we checked in to the minute we checked out. Everyone - especially the concierge (Harrinson Estrella) - wanted to make our stay was perfect. The room was small (we stayed in a "Classic Room"), but well appointed and made good use of every inch of space. I'm fairly sure that someone was in the neighboring room, but there was no noise. The hotel appears to have installed good sound proofing. The breakfast was amazing -- perfect NYC bagels, specialty donuts, yogurt with granola and berries -- and was served in a beautiful room overlooking the park and NY Public Library. After breakfast, the amazing housekeeping manager packed up bagels for my daughter to take back to college. Such a nice touch!! From the hotel, it's a quick walk to Times Square and the train stations (Penn Station and Grand Central), and plenty of shopping along the way. For anyone traveling during the holidays, be sure to check out the Christmas markets and ice skating at Bryant Park - right across the street from the hotel!

hotel_name: Park Terrace Hotel on Bryant Park
review_body: I was originally going to give 5 stars—the hotel is brand new, clean, in a good location, has friendly staff, etc. This was until i realized that they charged me an extra $105, 5 days after our check-out. When I called to ask what the charge was, the lady said we had taken bottles of shampoo, hair conditioner, and body lotion, which cost a total of $105. We did not take anything from the hotel, so I said there must have been some confusion. I was on hold for a while, and she got back to me and said that they would refund me, but there was no explanation and no apology for the wrong charge at all. I got an impression that she still seemed to believe that we took them but was only giving us a refund out of courtesy...Even though they will refund me for the wrong charge, I am upset because I was suspected for something I didn’t do. They should’ve trained their housekeeping staff better to not make this kind of mistake in the first place, and they should’ve trained their receptionist better to handle this kind of situation smoothly. I wanted to go back to their hotel next time, but now I don’t want to.

hotel_name: Park Terrace Hotel on Bryant Park
review_body: Loved this hotel. Such a treat staying in a new hotel! Location is fantastic, across the street from Bryant Park and quick walk to Flatiron, 5th avenue shops, or the subway. The hotel is lovely, a cool place to stay without the over the top party vibe that many newer hotels push for. I enjoyed the breakfast and also came back for afternoon coffee/treats, on a cold day it was so relaxing to sit in the lovely terrace room with the fireplace and read my book. The room I booked was classic, which was tiny but comfy - nice linens, good water pressure in shower etc. And clean! No view, but super quiet. All of the employees were so friendly and I felt like I made new friends by the end of my trip. Thanks to all for the comfy and lovely stay!

hotel_name: Park Terrace Hotel on Bryant Park
review_body: Stayed here one night because of the November snowstorm. Much nicer than most places in the area. Very modern, breand new and chich. The hotel offers some nice stuff, but do to time, I was unable to take advantage of them. It is located on 40th street facing Bryant Park. The room was a little small, but it was done very nice. The staff at the hotel were all very friendly.

hotel_name: Park Terrace Hotel on Bryant Park
review_body: Had the best experience at this new hotel! From the moment we checked in to the time we left the staff went above and beyond to help us have a great stay! The rooms were beautiful as well! The terrace has stunning views and the breakfast was more than anything you could ask for and the staff was eager to serve us! We mentioned wanting to get brunch and when we came back to the hotel they gave us a handwritten list of places they thought we would enjoy! They even accompanied us with a late check out and held our bags too! The outgoing and personable staff definitely made this an outstanding experience and we will definitely be staying at this hotel again!

hotel_name: Park Terrace Hotel on Bryant Park
review_body: This hotel has just opened and I give it two thumbs up! Rooms are comfy with lots of little amenities and treats... and the service was wonderful. Plus, the location right across from Bryant Park is excellent.

hotel_name: Park Terrace Hotel on Bryant Park
review_body: This was a wonderful hotel! Perfect location, clean and comfortable rooms, beyond accommodating and friendly staff, delicious breakfast, cocktails and mini bites by the fireplace in the lounge was perfect, great view of the city from the deck! Grateful for our stay here!

hotel_name: Park Terrace Hotel on Bryant Park
review_body: Great views, brand new. Lovely lounge/breakfast room on 6th floor. Very friendly staff. Opened November 2018. Views of service side of NY Public Library (meh), Bryant Park and midtown skyline. In room Nespresso machine.

hotel_name: Park Terrace Hotel on Bryant Park
review_body: The hotel is on floors 2-14 of a high rise building with residences above. It’s in a soft opening stage with only 40 rooms now available. The lounge area with breakfast bar & evening cocktails & small bites is a great place to convene and relax. There is a gym with a sauna although the sauna was not operational during my stay. Rooms are nicely appointed but quite small.
